Description

Do what you love. Love what you do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About the Team

You will be working with the Workday team who will focus on the future vision for the Workday Product. We will be partnering closely with UX Research, Product Management and Engineering. The team you'll work most closely with are co-located in our Dublin office. You will also work cross-time zones with our partners in Colorado, Victoria and California.

This is a great opportunity for a senior designer to make their mark on the future direction of our product.

About the Role

Why Join Workday’s UX Design Team?

  • Workday was founded on a disruptive idea: to put people at the center of enterprise software. To deliver on this desire we are expanding our UX team in Dublin. We have a design team of 50+ in Dublin, and over 160 worldwide, made up of UX Researchers, Interaction Designers, Product Designers and Visual Designers.

  • We are looking for a Senior Visual Designer to join us and work alongside our product teams. 

  • If you have a passion for creating great user experiences, a deep understanding of UI design, strong design principles and an eye for detail, then read on…

What to Expect

  • Design at scale for millions of users around the world.

  • An organisation that puts the customer first (98% customer satisfaction).

  • The ability to grow in your career.

  • A continuous learning environment, with opportunities for mentoring and coaching.

  • Product managers and developers who value excellent user experience.

  • Industry-leading research and workshop facilities.

  • A relaxed but driven working environment.

  • A talented team with a growth mindset and a passion for designing the right thing.

  • A fun, social working environment where you are encouraged to be your true self.

  • Competitive salary and benefits, including a supportive environment for parents that includes flexible scheduling and maternity / parental / bonding leave.

About You

  •  A passion for all types of visual design including User Interface, Graphic Design, Illustrations, Typography and Iconography.

  • Ability to explore multiple creative design directions to create engaging and effective visual designs.

  • Applies the best user interface design ideas of the consumer web to business applications. 

  • Uses creativity, design systems, visual communication and follows a user centered design process. 

  • Can distill complex problems into simple and elegant user experiences for a range of target users and platforms.

  • Follows a systematic approach to how your designs work with and elevate the UI in Workday. 

  • Deep understanding of interface design paradigms and best practices across a variety of platforms including web, responsive web, and native mobile. Experienced creating highly detailed design specifications.

  •  Ability to add to and utilise existing design systems when creating flows. Experienced with the creation of a design system is a plus.

  • Experienced with inclusive design best practices, Accessibility Design and Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). 

  • Ability to create detailed prototypes in tools like Figma, Principle, or Framer.

  • Strong motion graphics and animation skills are a plus.

  • Ability to rationalize UI design decisions and their ramifications at a global scale.

  • Proven ability to take a leadership role in projects that span multiple teams. 

  • Ability to deliver on time to a high quality, working in a fast paced agile environment.

  • Extremely detail-oriented and organized. Has a desire for pushing the boundaries of enterprise software design with modern, emerging UI patterns and implementation technologies.

  • Desire to train and mentor others in visual design best practices.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5+ years industry experience (relevant experience will also be considered if other requirements are met)  

  • BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial, etc), Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

  • A portfolio demonstrating a mastery of interface design, visual design, prototyping, articulation of design rationale, strong communication and storytelling skills.

Other Qualifications: 

  • Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch or similar design tools.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

Description

Description


Ready to join one of the most successful fashion brands on the high street? Do you have a passion for fashion? Driven to achieve? United to win? If your answers are yes, we think you’ll love it here on the Island…
 
From our first shop in the remains of a North London bombsite in the 1940s, to now over 250 stores across the UK, Ireland and internationally. We are known for our stylish, affordable fashion and we like to shout-it loud.
 
Our Island community is everything and we are stronger together. Every Islander counts in making fashion a force for good and we value individuality and difference. Exceptional people have made River Island a success for over 70 years. Together we will continue to do so in the years ahead.
 
We are one team. We are the difference. We are River Island.
 
Our Senior Sales Advisors are responsible for leading the team by setting an example of what fantastic customer service looks like.  You will be responsible for converting customers in to sales and ensuring your store looks visually exciting!

New team members and those less experienced will look to your for support and coaching on areas like the cash desk and fitting rooms processes.

In this role we are looking for someone who can manage the cash desk operation, including returns, the cashiers and ensuring the cash desk procedures are adhered to. You must also be able to implement the Deployment Plan and deploy staff effectively on the sales floor.

The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate a positive, ‘can do’ approach to activities in store and communicate in a positive way to customers and colleagues. The ability to work productively within a fast paced environment is essential as well as the enthusiasm to learn and take on more responsibility.

Fancy joining the Island?  We can't wait to hear from you....

Please Note - To protect the health of all River Island employees, our policy is every employee must wear face coverings unless they are exempt for medical reasons. River Island have an obligation to provide a safe work environment for employees, and general legal duty of care towards our teams. 

Shift Pattern


Total Hours =  37.5 hrs per week
  • Monday - 8.30-5.50
  • Tuesday - none
  • Wednesday - 9.30-6.30  
  • Thursday - none
  • Friday -  12.30-9.30
  • Saturday - 9-6
  • Sunday - 10-6.30 

Safeguarding


At River Island we are committed to the safeguarding of all of our employees regardless of age or job role. We will fulfil our obligation under the Prevent duty which seeks to stop extremism and extremist views from materialising in our business. We promote and encourage the belief in British Values- including democracy, the rule of law, individual liberty and mutual respect and tolerance of different faiths and beliefs. To find out more, please visit www.gov.uk

Description

Description



BDO Ireland is seeking a skilled Audit Senior Manager to join our successful and expanding Audit Department as part of our growth plans for the next five years.


BDO Ireland has an ambitious strategy which envisages significant future business growth across existing and new services. This growth will be underpinned by a people strategy which will establish BDO as a home for top talent and create an environment where our people can develop and grow.


We are looking for an ambitious, forward thinking high-achiever seeking a new challenge in a progressive and forward-thinking firm. In addition to a competitive package, this position offers opportunities for progression, challenging projects, and learning and development in a collaborative environment. At BDO you can be yourself - we value you as an individual and want you to realise your aspirations. You have a voice and your opinion counts. We give you the challenge and support you need, and you can shape your own career according to your strengths, skills and personality.


As a part of the fifth largest global professional services firm, BDO is one of the Ireland’s leading accountancy, tax, advisory and consulting organisations. Working at BDO enhances your professional development at all stages of your career. Few firms offer the same breadth and quality of work, responsibility and experience. We recognise and reward your high performance and you have the opportunity to excel, progress and share in our success. We are clear on what we expect from you and what you can expect in return.


We are currently seeking a Senior Manager (permanent position) to join our Audit Team. You will be working as part of an experienced management team, working within a team of 25. Our large portfolio of clients cover a large industry base and we specialise in both international and domestic clients across a wide range of industries to include Retail, Professional Services, Sporting and Membership Bodies, Not for profit and Education.  

Key Responsibilities


·        Will be managing the team and coordinating a number of audits i.e. multi-project management

·        Will be responsible for audits from planning through to completion and sign off 

·        Will report directly to partner on engagements 

·        Will be bringing solutions to table and resolving issues with clients including fee negotiation and cash collection

·        Time management, work in progress management, delegation, use of initiative, excellent communication and assertiveness are skills required for this level of management

·        Will be involved in delivery of technical training

·        Will be working towards departments strategic goals and objectives

Relationships:
·        Will be the main point of contact for a range of clients

·        Internal relationships are key; requiring a good understanding of the firm’s objectives/strategies, how they impact on the department and the part the job holder and the team plays in achieving them

·        Will be involved in selling other services of the firm, looking for opportunities and developing them

·        Will be sharing knowledge and experience with others including on the job training of junior team members 

·        Assisting Partner with preparation of clients’ presentations including preparation of tender documents 


Skills Knowledge and Expertise


·        Minimum 5 years PQE

·        Will be expected to have competent management skills and behaviours

·        Will be technically and professionally qualified including knowledge of FRS100 to FRS102 and IFRS 

·        Will have strong commercial awareness

·        Knowledge of the Irish or UK market




Benefits


  • Competitive salary
  • Enhanced benefit allowance
  • Personal Health Insurance
  • Annual bonus scheme
  • Pension scheme
  • Mobile phone
  • Car parking/ travel allowance
  • Free breakfast every day
  • Early finish Fridays
  • Group health schemes
  • Life assurance
  • Coverage of professional subscription
  • Centrally located office 
  • Employee referral scheme
  • Career progression
  • BDO Learning & Development programme
  • Taxsaver scheme
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
  • CSR, Sports and Social and Wellness Committees

 Ready to join one of the most successful fashion brands on the high street? Do you have a passion for fashion? Driven to achieve? United to win? If your answers are yes, we think you’ll love it here on the Island…
 
From our first shop in the remains of a North London bombsite in the 1940s, to now over 250 stores across the UK, Ireland and internationally. We are known for our stylish, affordable fashion and we like to shout-it loud.
 
Our Island community is everything and we are stronger together. Every Islander counts in making fashion a force for good and we value individuality and difference. Exceptional people have made River Island a success for over 70 years. Together we will continue to do so in the years ahead.
 
We are one team. We are the difference. We are River Island.
 
Our Senior Sales Advisors are responsible for leading the team by setting an example of what fantastic customer service looks like.  You will be responsible for converting customers in to sales and ensuring your store looks visually exciting!

New team members and those less experienced will look to your for support and coaching on areas like the cash desk and fitting rooms processes.

In this role we are looking for someone who can manage the cash desk operation, including returns, the cashiers and ensuring the cash desk procedures are adhered to. You must also be able to implement the Deployment Plan and deploy staff effectively on the sales floor.

The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate a positive, ‘can do’ approach to activities in store and communicate in a positive way to customers and colleagues. The ability to work productively within a fast paced environment is essential as well as the enthusiasm to learn and take on more responsibility.

Fancy joining the Island?  We can't wait to hear from you....

Please Note - To protect the health of all River Island employees, our policy is every employee must wear face coverings unless they are exempt for medical reasons. River Island have an obligation to provide a safe work environment for employees, and general legal duty of care towards our teams. 

Key Responsibilities


Positions is Men’s floor based

Focus
  • Drive omni- channel sales and data capture through delivering the best service on the high street
  • Increase conversion through customer engagement and spreading the joy of fashion
  • Inspire customers using both verbal and visual engagement with the product
  • Achieve and enhance brand standards including strong visuals
  • Support achieving targets and drive key results through implementing strategic actions
  • Use reports to make commercial and financial decisions that will increase profit
  • Be aware of cost control, how to drive and protect profit
  • Be fully responsible for all areas of retail risk and health & safety
Leadership /Teamwork
  • Coach and develop talent driving succession, creating strong teams
  • Support the management team and take accountability in their absence
  • Lead a team by motivating and encouraging teamwork to achieve goals
  • Manage performance and give in the moment feedback
  • Implement and delegate tasks with close follow up, but lead by example with a hands-on approach
Agile working
  • Ability to operate within different roles
  • Recognise and adjust to change
  • Ability to learn quickly, thoroughly and deliver the detail
  • Able to manage challenges and pressure, to adjust quickly to changing circumstances and find solutions supported by management

Decision Making
  • Deliver 100% compliance inline to all Company policies and processes
  • Implement company decisions and take responsibility
  • Seek advice from line Manager /expert and utilise team input when required

We’re looking for…
  • Previous experience at Supervisor/ Team Leader level 
  • Have a good understanding of the latest trends and our competitors
  • Have good leadership skills
  • Be able to work on your own initiative
  • Be a great communicator and be able to engage your team
  • Be passionate about delivering a world class experience to our customers
  • Ability to make decisions, problem solve and take accountability with good planning skills


And wait, Did we mention the perks?..



  • Discount – Generous 50% staff discount so you can treat yourself!
  • Uniform - 100% Uniform allowance 
  • RI Rewards – More discounts and vouchers with Perks at Work
  • Health Benefits –  Childcare vouchers, eye vouchers, ride to work scheme, EAP and more…
  • Training on the job – Support with upskilling skills through on the job training and qualifications

  • Holiday - 28 days paid holiday

Description

Description


Our sales advisors are the key to delivering the best possible service to our customers in a responsive and fast moving environment. We are passionate and driven to provide the very best experience to our customers. Whether you are on the shop floor, in the stock room or serving on our tills you play an important part in the overall success of our stores.

Key Responsibilities


  • Providing excellent customer service 
  • Working the tills in an efficient manner
  • Making sure the shop floor is always of the highest standards
  • Handling customer enquiries/complaints 
  • Working as part of a team and upselling shop product 
  • Representing the company in following the latest fashion trends


Skills Knowledge and Expertise


Our Senior Sales Advisors are responsible for leading the team by setting an example of what fantastic customer service looks like.  You will be responsible for converting customers in to sales and ensuring your store looks visually exciting!

New team members and those less experienced will look to your for support and coaching on areas like the cash desk and fitting rooms processes.

In this role we are looking for someone who can manage the cash desk operation, including returns, the cashiers and ensuring the cash desk procedures are adhered to. You must also be able to implement the Deployment Plan and deploy staff effectively on the sales floor.

The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate a positive, ‘can do’ approach to activities in store and communicate in a positive way to customers and colleagues. The ability to work productively within a fast paced environment is essential as well as the enthusiasm to learn and take on more responsibility.

Fancy joining the Island?  We can't wait to hear from you....

Please Note - To protect the health of all River Island employees, our policy is every employee must wear face coverings unless they are exempt for medical reasons. River Island have an obligation to provide a safe work environment for employees, and general legal duty of care towards our teams. 



Benefits


  • Discount – Generous 40% staff discount so you can treat yourself!
  • Uniform - 100% Uniform allowance 
  • RI Rewards – More discounts and vouchers with Perks at Work
  • Health Benefits –  Childcare vouchers, eye vouchers, ride to work scheme, EAP and more…
  • Giver Island – Give as you earn scheme, a ‘Giver Island’ day each year and matched funding
  • Training on the job – Support with upskilling skills through on the job training and qualifications
  • Pension - A contributory private pension scheme
  • Holiday - 29 days paid holiday

HR Generalist – Permanent – West Dublin

Multinational Tech Organisation

Seeking a HR generalist to join an exciting growing global organisation (Infosys) in West Dublin. The HR generalist will support the HR function in delivering a best-in-class HR service. The role will support the HR needs of the business, by offering day to day administrative support on recruitment Co-ordination, inductions, Training and Development and contract creation. The HR generalist role will also handle implementation of corporate policies and initiatives in Ireland. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain experience as part of a fast moving and dynamic organisation.

Role Responsibilities
  • Prepare or maintain employment records related to events such as hiring, termination, leaves, transfers, or promotions
  • Interpret and explain human resources policies, procedures, laws, standards, or regulations
  • Prepare the payroll advise for the Finance team to process the salaries
  • Hire employees and process hiring-related paperwork.
  • Inform job applicants of details such as duties and responsibilities, compensation, benefits, schedules, working conditions, or promotion opportunities
  • Address employee relations issues, such as grievance handling, work complaints, or other employee concerns
  • Schedule and conduct new employee orientations
  • Maintain and update human resources documents
  • Confer with corporate to develop or implement personnel policies or procedures
  • Support in implementation of corporate initiatives like ESAT(employee satisfaction survey)
Role Requirements
  • 3rd Level Qualification in HR or related discipline
  • Excellent time management, ability to prioritise own tasks
  • Strong interpersonal & communication skills
  • Excellent concentration and attention to detail
  • Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Word
  • Highly motivated with ability to manage workload and achieve targets within deadlines
  • Ability to deal with sensitive issues and dealing with confidential information
  • Enthusiastic with a strong work ethic
All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence

To apply or for further information please forward your CV to Leanne Davis on Leanne.davis@cpl.ie

We have a full-time position for an experienced Excavator/Digger Driver to join our team based in Offlay

Farrans Construction is a long-established UK Building and Civil Engineering company operating in various sectors within the UK and wider Europe. The Company strives to develop excellence and continuous improvement in all aspects of building and civil engineering. We feel that this is successfully achieved through our Core Values and our commitment to the continuous professional development of our team.

As an employer, Farrans Construction provides its employees with an engaging working environment to enable them to develop their technical and professional skills and achieve their personal potential.

If you want to be part of a great team, this is the job for you.

Essential
  • Full drivers licence and Safe Pass/CSCS required; all other training can be provided as required
  • Excellent customer service attitude
  • Experience of operating excavators from 3-35 tonnes
Desired
  • Mechanically minded
  • Experience of maintaining/repairing Plant a distinct advantage.
Daily Responsibilities
  • Check machinery for damages and complete daily check sheets
  • Operate 360 machinery and keep in good condition
  • Keeping plant internals and externals clean and tidy.
  • To work as part of a team
  • To be able to Work on your own initiative
  • Adhering to health and safety standards
Job Types: Full-time fixed term to project completion date (approx. 2 years)

Schedule
  • Monday to Friday 07:30 -18:00 overtime available
COVID-19 Precaution(s)
  • Temperature screenings
  • Sanitisation, disinfection, or cleaning procedures in place
  • Healthshield
What Farrans can offer you

We provide you with the opportunity to work on high profile, complex projects and join the permanent team we have across the UK & Ireland. Our people are at the core of everything we do. Our culture is one which fuels innovation, transparency and inclusivity.

We ensure that your career at Farrans is built around you by offering bespoke career toolkits & pathways, mentor schemes and a route to chartership.

Coupled with this we offer competitive salaries with a comprehensive benefits package, 34 days annual leave, pension plan, health cash plan enrolment, enhanced maternity, family friendly policies, access to discounts, cycle to work scheme.

In addition to all the above we offer 24/7 counselling and support health line, GP anytime, Wellbeing App, Company Occupational Health, Annual Health and Well Being Events

New Product Development (NPD) Manager role in a large FMCG Company based in South Tipperary. Reporting to the MD , the overall purpose of this key management role is The role of the New Product Development Manager is to facilitate the continuing development and growth of 2 company entities identifying, managing and efficiently developing new products from concept through to launch in the retail, food service, B2B and manufacturing sectors.

Key Responsibilities:-
  • To manage and progress the Innovation strategy in line with business development plans
  • To manage structured development process throughout the companies to ensure the successful launch of new products into the marketplace. Working closely with customers and the commercial team in delivering on new product and existing product development strategy which brings’ a competitive advantage to the business.
  • To manage and lead the Innovation team in delivering project results and timely launches on all development projects
  • To relay the project reports and results to the Senior Management team as required.
  • To work with the team to develop new innovative food products & processes from concept through to launch. To facilitate and deliver on cost saving and efficiency projects throughout the business.
  • *Steer sign off on concept products through the development process from initiation to launch including carrying out recipe trials, taste panelling, customer consultation & presentation and first production.
  • Ensure that products are launched in compliance with food safety legislation and each company’s quality management systems, both on time and on budget. Management of customer on line specification systems and manage the internal generation of new product specifications.
  • Work closely with customers in delivering innovative solutions that are in line with customer expectations and operational/commercial restraints.
  • Understanding the marketplace and change/evolve the product offering to meet consumer trends. To facilitate and manage brainstorming and synectics sessions to generate & manage a pipeline of new product ideas and blue skies concepts which is continuously on going. Drive benchmarking sessions on competitor products.
  • Liaise with all functions including Business Development, Sales, Production, Maintenance, Purchasing and Technical as appropriate in order to progress live projects in line with the Innovation strategy.
  • Provide relevant information to the finance department to enable calculation of product costing and ensure accurate records are documented with regard to all project work.
  • To participate in the completion of all State agency grant applications.
  • To manage the C&I budget and monitor KPI’s and report on any variances
  • To train and develop the innovation Team in line with training requirements and career development plans identified for them.
  • To manage identified members of the Innovations department and provide support to them wherever necessary. To facilitate holidays, manage sick leave and manage any HR issues that may arise.
Required Experience
  • A minimum of 8 years industry experience in a product development related role in the Food and Drinks category, Project & people management experience essential.
Skills/Attributes
  • High energy, team player with strong record of meeting aggressive goals and objectives
  • Strong product development & organisational skills
  • Strong people & project management skills
  • Strong attention to detail skills required
  • Good communication skills, self-starter, work under own initiative, good listener, assertive and highly motivated. Clear demonstration of an ability to provide guidance and motivation to others.
  • Excellent PC skills are essential

Company Description

Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.

Job Description

Department Description:

The Supply Chain Specialist Team in Microchip supports Clients and the Sales Team in EMEA. The Supply Chain Specialist Team is responsible for ensuring customer support requirements are met. Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success.

Reporting to the Inside Sales Manager, you will work directly with clients to understand their requirements and deliver in conjunction with the external sales team.

The successful candidate will have excellent communication skills and innate curiosity, be passionate about internal and external customer and show willingness to succeed in a team environment. Responsibilities will include supporting multiple large accounts on any post-order requirement, acting as main point of escalation between client buyers and factory. Ability to run reports and understand and utilize data within reports is critical. Industry knowledge is important and developing partnerships with field, factory and clients will be the key to success.

This Position Will Expose You To

What’s attractive about this opportunity.
  • Understanding customer support requirements, define an agreed service level in accordance with the external sales team and Management, and deliver it.
  • Understanding Microchip revenue goals and drive actions aimed at meeting or exceeding them, including shipping optimization and turns business.
  • Understanding Microchip End Equipment and Key Client strategy and apply the most relevant level of support for each customer. Initiate and drive actions leading to the best possible alignment between client’s service requirements and Microchip possibilities.
Key Job Responsibilities/duties Include
  • With a deep understanding of client’s WW demand both direct and through subcontractors, regularly analyse and anticipate future trends.
  • Maintain open backlog to avoid customers supply issues.
  • Work in team with Client Engagement Managers to become knowledgeable of client’s end market, competitive situation, and growth drivers to co-create the best possible alignment between client’s needs and Microchip capabilities. This will include setting the right expectations regarding process improvements, logistic services, or any other requirements.
  • Be the main interface for the development and maintenance of logistic programs.
  • Load new orders and action amendments to meet customers’ requirements. Be the customer/factory liaison- dealing with progress enquiries.
  • Keep close contact with the customer’s purchasing office to meet and exceed service level expectations.
  • Overview EDI transactions and check that order entries and change orders are successfully supported.
  • Keep closely in contact with other Microchip offices in Europe, Asia, or US to ensure efficient communication and successful teamwork.
  • Run, review, and distribute periodic reports as requested.
  • Support Client Engagement managers in preparing annual price agreements.
  • Keep Customer Database updated
  • Order samples as required to support future opportunities.
  • Support Accounts Receivable in Ireland when necessary to resolve overdue payment issues.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Demonstrate and adhere to the Microchip values.
Job Requirements

Qualifications/Skills/Attributes
  • Degree holder in Business administration or related discipline.
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office programs specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.
  • Excellent organization skills.
  • Must be service oriented.
  • Ability and willingness to work in a dynamic international environment, to interact and communicate with different cultures.
  • Ability to work pro-actively, anticipating and resolving customer issues.
  • Detailed oriented and precise.
  • Sound business sense and ability to judge when to escalate by formulating a business case for Business Unit or Sales Management evaluation.
Desirable Experience
  • Experience in Supply Chain and Customer Service role would be advantageous
  • Experience in working within the Semiconductor industry would be advantageous.
  • Knowledge of Model N price quote system would be advantageous.
Special Requirements
  • Native or business proficient English language required.
  • Willingness to travel occasionally in Europe or US for training purposes or customer meetings.

Description

Overview:

PM Group is a leading International engineering, architecture, project and construction management firm.   With a network of offices in Europe, Asia and the US and a multi-discipline team of 3,200 people, we deliver complex, capital projects in the life sciences, food and beverages, mission critical/ICT, advanced manufacturing, energy and environmental sectors.

 

Are you a talented and enthusiastic Finance student?

Do you want to work on exciting, leading-edge international finance projects? Would you like to be part of an expert multi-discipline team, with opportunities to travel and work abroad? PM Group's  Next  Graduate Programme is your ideal next step.

PM Group will help you to reach your full potential, guiding you through the transition from graduate to experienced professional.

 

At PM Group, we work hard to make your career satisfying and rewarding.   Across Europe, the USA and Asia, our teams design and deliver some of the most interesting and challenging projects for world leading organisations.

With a 46 year track record, we are world leaders in the pharmaceutical, food, mission critical, medtech, advanced manufacturing and energy sectors. Our reputation and values are built on great people with a flexible can do attitude.  

 

Due to the continued growth of our business, we are launching our Finance Graduate programme for 2021.   The successful candidates will be welcomed along with our expansive engineering graduate programme and will have the opportunity to experience working across  our extensive national and international network of offices.

Responsibilities:

As a Graduate Finance professional at PM Group, your first two years will bring opportunities to develop your knowledge and experience across a multitude of areas, with a rich variety of new challenges. You will gain a wide breadth of commercial experience whilst studying for your professional accountancy examinations, setting you up for a successful career in finance. The Finance Graduate Scheme offers exposure to all aspects of accounting including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, General Accounting, Taxation, Treasury and Financial Reporting.

 

What you can expect from the PM Groups Finance Graduate Programme:

  • Experience across our Finance functions where you will work with a highly skilled teams to deliver financial reports and influence commercial decisions.
  • Experience working closely with our Global business assisting with management of projects from a financial perspective from commencement to cessation, gaining further understanding and experience of accounting in different locations.    You will also work closely with our Regulatory and Analytical teams understanding the critical value they bring to our business.

Your role will include:

  • Contributing to the Group monthly account closing process, including GL population, accounts analysis and reconciliations and assist with the preparation of monthly management reporting packs
  • Working across the Finance Department supporting daily and monthly transaction processing activities when required using PM Groupâ€™s ERP Software
  • Supporting our team of Client Project Managers with the commercial analysis of projects
  • Working with various teams in the preparation of legal entitiesâ€™ financial statements across the Group
  • Assisting the Group Tax team with the preparation of Corporation tax, VAT/GST filings for various entities
  • Supporting the completion of internal review and audits  
  • Assisting with a number of high profile process and system improvement projects in the Finance Area
  • Supporting the Group internal treasury team in cash management and forecasting
Qualifications:
  • Good Interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work in a team environment
  • Strong collaboration skills, highly organised, takes initiative and ownership of responsibilities assigned
  • Detail oriented, takes great pride in delivering quality work within predetermined deadlines
  • Excellent Microsoft Office experience (particularly Excel)
  • Experience in working to tight deadlines with good attention to details and focused on getting the task done
  • Degree qualified in Finance, Business, Commerce or Economics
  • Experience in a professional financial environment is an advantage
  • An understanding of basic accounting processes
  • Desire to pursue a professional accounting qualification

Description

Overview:

At SolarWinds, weâ€™re a people-first company. Our purpose is to enrich the lives of the people we serveâ€”including our employees, customers, shareholders, Partners, and communities. Join us in our mission to help customers accelerate business transformation with simple, powerful, and secure solutions. The ideal candidate thrives in an innovative, fast-paced environment and is collaborative, accountable, ready, and empathetic. Weâ€™re looking for individuals who believe they can accomplish more as a team and create lasting growth for themselves and others. We hire based on attitude, competency, and commitment. Solarians are ready to advance our world-class solutions in a fast-paced environment and accept the challenge to lead with purpose. If youâ€™re looking to build your career with an exceptional team, youâ€™ve come to the right place. Join SolarWinds and grow with us!

 

As the Inside Sales Representative you will be responsible for growing business in a defined region/territory by way of prospecting, qualifying and closing sales.

Responsibilities:
  • Follow up on inbound leads from customers who have downloaded product trials, qualify and close opportunities.
  • Carry out non-technical product demos.
  • Liaise with pre-sales engineers to ensure technical aspects are fully covered.
  • Support channel partners in prospecting and closing.
  • Provide superior customer service in assisting potential and existing customers during every stage of the sales cycle.
  • Maintain accurate lead and opportunity records.
  • Provide accurate sales outlook and forecasts
Qualifications:
  • Min 2 years sales experience in a fast-paced quota carrying role; IT sales background preferred.
  • Proven track record in converting prospects, closing deals, and achieving sales targets.
  • CRM experience; Ideally Salesforce
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Channel experience highly desirable
  • Languages; English and Italian

What awaits you, besides great coworkers?

We offer many benefits, such as growth opportunities and bonuses. The main one, though, is people and a great team from which you can learn.
We provide VHI medical insurance for you, your partner, and your children, Life and disability insurance, and a Pension plan.
You can also join our Employee Stock Purchase Program.
You can bike to work, visit our on-site gym, and enjoy annual leave, which is increasing with tenure (1 day a year up to 25 days). We also offer two days per year for volunteering

Position: Android Developer

Reports to: Mobile Lead Engineer

Location: San Diego/Carlsbad, CA USA OR Dublin, Ireland (relocation is not available)

About the Position:
SleepScore Labs is currently seeking an experienced an experienced Android Developer to help contribute to the design, development and testing of our cutting-edge sleep technology platform.

In this role, you will work to build out and improve our suite of mobile applications for our users as they seek better sleep. We are looking for the right individual who will bring passion and enthusiasm to the task.

Core Responsibilities

Work closely with our product and design team to develop and maintain Android apps.
Develop, maintain and document mobile SDKs to be consumed by SleepScore’s partners.
Integrate with our backend APIs and 3rd party services.
Work on interesting research ideas that push the boundaries of what is possible in our app.

Ideal Candidate must have the following:
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
3+ years developing Android apps full-time.
Expert knowledge of Android application development using Kotlin and Java.
Experience working with the latest Android tools and App Bundles.
Developed a mobile SDK.
Integrated third party frameworks.
An app available on the Play Store that can be demonstrated during the interview process.
Experience with RESTful API design, implementation and integration.
Working knowledge of GIT for version control.
Worked within an Agile Scrum develop environment.
Experience using JIRA or other agile task management tools.

Nice to Have:
Experience writing and running unit tests for Android applications.
Experience with test driven development.
Experience with Jenkins, Gradle and/or other build tools.
Experience with Fastlane.
Experience integrating Bluetooth accessories

About SleepScore Labs:
We are sleep experts from institutions like ResMed, Philips, Apple, Samsung, Harvard, and the American Association of Sleep Medicine driven by a shared mission to unlock the human potential through healthier lives through the power of sleep.

After studying over 70 million hours of objective and contextual sleep data, we’ve applied what we learned to the most accurate sleep monitoring technology (which is also non-contact), advanced sleep improvement system, and a store of sleep solutions that are backed by science through the validation studies we conduct. We also developed the world’s most accurate sleep app which measures your sleep and offers personalized advice and product recommendations.

In 2020, our app was selected by the New York Times’ Wirecutter as the “Best Sleep Tracking App” multiple times and was called out as “the most intuitive and convenient app and the only one that gives detailed recommendations for improving sleep.”

SleepScore Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking to fill the position of Global Finance Director, Order to Cash Operations to lead a global team of highly motivated and skilled Revenue Finance Operations Professionals. The successful candidate will be a thought leader with a proven record of leading a global team and delivering scalable, financial operations processes. This is a high impact role with significant leadership accountability reporting directly to the Global Director of Revenue Operations. The successful candidate will have responsibility for the regional Revenue Operations leaders & their teams who are based in the US, Singapore, Ireland, Brazil, Hong Kong, India & Japan. Success in this role involves an ability to motivate, support & lead a high performing diverse team of professionals. You will be someone who is excited about solving large scale financial operations scaling challenges with cutting edge technology while continuing to deliver effectively in a very fast-paced organization. This role involves significant interaction with the broader global finance group, engineering, legal, policy teams, sales leadership, as well as plenty of engagement with external partners. The candidate needs to be comfortable and highly effective in a rapidly changing environment, providing guidance, analysis and helping make decisions.

Responsibilities
  • People leadership, lead a team of global executives & their region teams ensuring that we continue to grow & develop talent & capabilities across the organization
  • Ensure continued excellent delivery of financial operations for Facebook's fast growing $100BN+ Revenue, ensuring compliance with local tax, regulatory, SOX and other jurisdictional requirements in every country in which we operate
  • Manage credit exposure & customer cash collections performance across the organization
  • Develop strong stakeholder relationships with global sales, policy & other teams, implement effective communication programs
  • Grow the existing global team and oversee continuous evaluation of our outsourcing partners, vendor talent location and technology investments
  • Accelerate scale through automation and the introduction of advanced finance technologies, continuous monitoring and quality assurance in partnership with Enterprise Engineering (IT) teams
Minimum Qualification
  • 15+ years of multi-disciplinary, global experience in multi-national, high-growth public companies including financial operations, credit, collections, shared services, outsourcing, vendor management, controllership &/or FP&A
  • Experience operating and scaling financial operations transformation, shared services, project management, systems implementation, acquisition integration and demonstrated deployment of advanced digital finance technologies such as analytics, machine learning, robotic process automation, etc.
  • Experience working and collaborating in a cross-functional global environment
  • Leadership experience aligning visions, goals and resources and delivering results
  • Communication experience and experience in iterative process and technology development and project deployment
  • Broad business understanding including sales and marketing, particularly in the internet/advertising space
Preferred Qualification
  • MBA from a leading academic institution preferred or comparable Accounting Qualification

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Facebook seeks a highly motivated, team player to serve as Associate General Counsel for the EMEA region. You will manage significant and complex litigation matters and advise internal teams on legal risks. The role requires good judgment, a strong work ethic, and a keen interest in learning about new technologies and areas of the law. This is a great opportunity to join a growing legal team and to work on novel issues in fast-paced, fun environment.Facebook welcomes applications from the widest range of individuals eligible to apply and particularly encourages applications from those who would increase the diversity of the company.

Responsibilities
  • Supervise and direct outside counsel on multiple litigation matters
  • Guide and execute litigation strategy in relation to high-profile, precedent setting matters pending before national and European courts
  • Work with cross-functional teams on data protection, public policy, platform/partnership, product, privacy, IP, and commercial issues
  • Develop creative approaches to managing legal risks and resolving disputes
  • Ensure work product of the highest quality that furthers Facebook’s strategic goals
Minimum Qualification
  • Qualified lawyer with 8+ years PQE in a law firm or in-house in at least one European jurisdiction
  • 8+ years litigation experience, including extensive experience dealing with matters before higher and/or appellate courts, ideally across multiple jurisdictions
  • Familiarity with Internet laws and issues, including understanding of the E-Commerce Directive and its application to online platforms
  • Good working knowledge and understanding of data protection law – with high-quality data protection litigation experience a strong plus
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and make sound judgments under tight deadlines
  • Candidates must be flexible and willing to work on projects in other areas
Preferred Qualification
  • Passion for and understanding of technology
  • Prior experience working with internet or technology companies.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Production Engineers at Facebook are hybrid software/systems engineers who ensure that Facebook's services run smoothly and have the capacity for future growth. We are embedded in every one of Facebook's product and infrastructure teams and are core participants in every significant engineering effort underway in the company. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from university grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering and we are always learning. Internship positions are located in our Dublin and London offices.

Responsibilities
  • Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcached infrastructure, and everything in between
  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
  • Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world
Minimum Qualification
  • Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS or MS (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
  • Experience coding in at least one language (even if it is not one that Facebook uses)
  • Ability to rapidly learn new development languages (Python, PHP, C++, and Java are all in heavy use)
  • Ability to pick up new software, frameworks and APIs quickly
  • Ability to perform 'guerrilla capacity planning' for internet service architectures
  • Knowledge of basic large-scale internet service architectures (such as load balancing, LAMP, CDN's), even if you haven't worked on one
  • Configuration and maintenance of common applications such as Apache, memcached, Squid, MySQL, NFS, DHCP, NTP, SSH, DNS, and SNMP
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Scopely is seeking an experienced Director, People (HR) Business Partner to join the Global People Team! Your primary client group in this role will be Scopely's global Massive Multiplayer Online (“MMO”) Strategy Division. You will be a trusted, valued member of the management team of this Division partnering closely with the Division President and the entire Senior Management team including multiple General Managers, Executive Producers, and Development and Operational Leaders of 3+ Franchises based across Dublin, Ireland and Los Angeles, USA. You will also be a key member of our Global People Business Partner Team and as such a key voice within our Global People Team partnering closely with all People functions (Rewards, DEI&B, Recruiting, etc.). As an experienced global leader and teambuilder you will be a strategist, coach and core to designing and delivering incredible impact directly and through others.

 

What you will do:


  • Game Team Talent Strategy and strategy implementation: 

In partnership with the leaders, ensure we have a clear and effective talent strategy for each franchise across the portfolio. This means you have been a thought partner to the leaders, you understand the talent on the teams, you are able to effectively leverage Scopely-wide programs and processes, and have put in place the Division specific tools and practices to surface and solve opportunities related to leadership, management, performance, and team composition and sentiment overall with business performance outcomes at the center of your thinking (organizational design, an optimal mix of skill-set and mindset, cost structure). You develop ways to have the data needed, leveraging data available to you, to ensure an analytical lens is supporting strategy development and measurement of risks and results. 

 

  • Scopely Talent Management & Development:

As a key member of the Business Partner team, you will influence aspects of Scopely’s global approach to Talent Management & Development, potentially leading specific projects, through a deep understanding of the Games organization’s talent, challenges, needs, culture and operations. You will lead, for your Division, processes like the Level Up Check-in, People Review, DEI&B Business Action Planning and additional training and development initiatives as they arise.

 

  • Games Organization Leadership Team Evolution: 

Play a leadership role in codifying how our Games leaders can solve business and talent challenges. Ensure we have both strong team-based operating cultures and have the right portfolio-wide practices around leadership communication and talent decision making.  

 

  • Coaching & Conflict Resolution: 

Establish credibility and reliability as an efficient driver of issue resolution -- through facilitation, coaching others on how to solve their challenges, and through a partnership with other Business Partners (HRBPs) across Scopely. Solve Employee Relations issues in your client groups by working with the DEI&B function and managers, employees and People Operations to respond to all issues in ways consistent with Scopely’s values and standards. 

 

  • Change Management: 

Coach team leaders on effective change management. Help others explain connections between changes in the business, the organization, and individual roles. Support teams on change strategies, communications and post-implementation assessment. 

 

  • Cross-functional Partner: 

As a Business Partner, work closely with People Team functions across Recruiting, Rewards, DEI&B, Facilities, and functions outside of the People Team, such as Communications, Finance, IT, etc. to ensure One Scopely alignment while also sharing the unique perspective you bring given your depth with the MMO/Strategy Division. Be the indispensable bridge enabling understanding, appreciation and aligned efforts toward target outcomes working with any functions relevant to the mission. Be the local escalation point and support for local People Team members across all functions, creating a sense of team with any solid, dotted or not formally connected roles in Dublin. Be a model of teamwork and collaboration, ensuring we work as a high performing team in all we do as a Global People Team that touches MMO/Strategy. 

 

Who you are:

  • Deeply experienced working in a global organization, identifying and driving alignment with stakeholders inside and outside of the People team 
  • A global leader who has direct experience managing and coaching around global, matrixed team design and high performance teamwork in that context 
  • Someone with strong integrity, professionalism, and judgement about confidentiality
  • Committed to understanding the business, the operational challenges, debates and strategies and contributing people strategies that move the business forward
  • Highly analytical, adept at using data to develop insights and proposals that solve root cause issues 
  • Ability to maintain objectivity and perspective in a dynamic, complex fast moving organization, to help others gain perspective and to solve problems together, building culture as you work across the company
  • Ability to prioritize and leverage others through delegation or mobilizing partnership so your time can be spent optimally on driving outcomes related to your client group specifically or the global project teams you become part of 
  • Someone who loves challenge, is persistent in chasing results and continually helps others elevate their thinking to strategic, outcome oriented views
  • Humble, excited to keep learning and growing, able to take and give feedback effectively  

 

What you will need:

  • A minimum of 10-12 years of Business Partner or other relevant HR management experience preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
  • Knowledge of Irish employment law and regulations. Knowledge of US federal, state, and European employment laws and regulations is a bonus.
  • Leadership acumen - to lead in your role and develop leaders
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English 
  • Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail



About Scopely:

Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Scrabble® GO, MARVEL Strike Force, Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. Scopely has global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona, Boulder, Dublin (DIGIT game studio), London and Tokyo, with additional studios in seven countries across four continents. For more information, visit scopely.com. 

 

Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status. 

 

Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

Job description

Applications are invited for the position of General Manager at Wrights of Howth Group. We are recruiting an experienced GM, a highly motivated and organised individual with a hands-on approach; this role will suit an individual with a strong work ethic who will report directly to the Board of Management.

The GM will manage and lead all aspects of the day-to-day operations across the Group in an efficient and effective manner, consistent with the expectations, values and mission of our company.

The ideal candidate will have excellent management, leadership and communication skills and will be committed to strong staff relations and have experience in mentoring and coaching a large team. The role also requires an individual with business development skills, the reviewing of financial and non financial reports to devise performance solutions and improvements,

A key emphasis of this role is ensuring the management of both our retail and online business and expanding same across the digital arena; knowledge of the fish business is an added bonus, but not essential. This role is the ideal opportunity for a highly motivated and ambitious individual to lead our team and manage the growth of the established Wrights of Howth brand. This is a strategic senior appointment and the successful candidate will work very closely with the Board of Management.

Sales

Job Details

Director Job Spec, UKI BDR
Job Details

A fantastic opportunity exists within our UK and Ireland Business Development organisation for a 2nd-line leader looking to further their career in a hyper-growth, fast-paced and dynamic environment. The role is based in Dublin.

The Business Development organisation is a talent and revenue engine for Salesforce. You will take overall responsibility for inspiring, mentoring and continuously forming a team of business development representatives (BDR’s) and their managers who generate sales pipeline in support of our closing sales organisation (Account Executives).

You will take ownership of pipeline generation and you will monitor its progression through the sales cycle, your ability to partner at the Area Vice President level and the supporting functions, incl. Marketing, Sales Strategy, Enablement, Recruitment and Sales Programs, will define your success. You will be responsible for coaching your managers to forecast and run their business effectively. You’ll be a critical contributor to longer-term sales strategies as well as monthly results, providing the definition and implementation of the plan for Sales to achieve key objectives.

The sales development business operates using four key pillars which contribute to our success, these are talent, Culture, Operational Excellence and alignment, your role across these pillars is as follows:

Talent
Lead a team of 3-5 managers and circa 30-45 BDRs
Work closely with recruitment and BDR managers to ensure we’re on track to meet our hiring needs.
Forecast upcoming BDR promotions and align with future hiring managers
Mentor and develop the BDR managers who have varying degrees of people management experience.
Monitor and lead team performance to ensure consistent delivery of monthly, quarterly and yearly targets

Culture
Set the tone within your organisation with specific attention to virtual, in-person and hyrbid working environments
Promote values of trust, personal growth, diversity and innovation.
Celebrate the success of the individual contributors and managers that are in your organisation.
Find time to give back and ensure your team find time to switch off both individually and together

Operational Excellence
Drive weekly execution on key input metrics i.e. outbound prospecting activity
Observe and act on output metrics i.e. early sales opportunity creation that converts to sales pipeline
Forecast weekly and build sales incentives to get results above and beyond standard performance.
Identify and build solutions to areas of risk that could impact team performance
As you become more tenured take part in and initiate projects that innovate and drive the business forward

Alignment
Champion your team across the organisation, what will your team be famous for?
Work alongside senior sales leadership to align with and delivering on business objectives
Collaborate with Marketing and Sales programs teams on demands generation plans
Work closely with recruitment to hit hiring targets
Build and deliver executive presentations for internal partners and external customers

Your previous experience:
Second-line leadership experience and you will have successfully led Sales/Sales development teams with a track record of hitting performance goals and driving growth, preferably (but not exclusively) in the tech industry.
Experience managing and leading teams at scale with a focus on coaching, mentoring and diversity.
Experience successfully leading cross-functional relationships which contribute to team performance and business goals
Demonstrable leadership capabilities that show you can operate in a fast-paced, high growth environment
Driven to achieve results
Experience in outbound prospecting and new business generation i.e. cold calling, social selling, video prospecting
Outstanding communication, organisational and time leadership skills
Excellent presentation and listening skills
A trusted advisor to cross-functional partners
Strong intuition for business and understanding of consultative selling

The team:
High performing business development team who are delivering strong double-digit growth in new sales pipeline and revenue for salesforce, a team who, due to consistently promoting individual contributors are always hiring. You will work alongside senior leaders who have been at Salesforce for 6+ years and these leaders will be key contributors to your onboarding.

What do BDRs do in more detail?
As a Business Development Representative, you are the first person to speak with our future customers. Working in our team, you will develop a deep knowledge of your territory and our solutions, and use this to hold insightful conversations to discover if a company’s needs and our offerings overlap. You will become adept at helping companies pinpoint their challenges, and then paint a picture of the wide-ranging business value that Salesforce can deliver.

In the BDR role, you’ll do well if you are curious about business, organised, tenacious, and like to see the fruits of your efforts. You’ll work closely with senior sales people in your territory, planning thoughtful outreaches, and consulting prospects on how their companies can best implement our technology. Once you have reached a level of proficiency, you will have freedom in how you run your business.

We are looking for people who share our four core values - trust, customer success, innovation and equality. Why? It’s important you feel you belong here. Right from the beginning, we want people of excellent character, who keep their promises and display a brilliant demeanour to their teammates, prospects, and the wider Salesforce Ohana. We look for people, who can understand others, communicate effectively, and get things done. The icing on the cake is the energy you bring to the team and the job: Positive, helpful, enterprising. You view team success as highly as you do personal success.

The Day-to-Day

  • Plan and implement tailored campaigns around solutions or events to entice prospective clients to speak with you
  • Use your follow-up plan on these campaigns to hit monthly call-connect targets
  • Use strong qualification skills on those calls to uncover need and hit your monthly targets
  • Align with the Account Executives you support, discussing and refining your prospecting strategy
  • Utilise the Salesforce platform to gather intelligence on your accounts, and record all activity and actions
  • Attend dedicated product and sales-acumen trainings each week
  • Help drive innovation, knowledge sharing and, most importantly, craic in our team meetings and discussions
Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .

Salesforce welcomes all.

Reporting to:   Sales Manager for Britvic Ireland

 

 

The Purpose of the Role:

 

To raise the awareness and heighten the profile of the client’s brands within a given territory, by the achievement of Client key result areas and targets.

 

This will be achieved through stock and order, auditing and merchandising, therefore increasing product availability, promotional compliance and point of sale accuracy and compliance. 

Responsibilities

  • Adhering to a defined multiple retail call file.
  • Monitoring product availability.
  • To increase distribution and availability within store by implementing national and locally agreed planograms and promotions.
  • To record data and submit on a daily basis in an accurate and timely manner.
  • To understand and identify the needs of the customer.
  • To communicate effectively both in store and with colleagues.
  • To present a professional appearance and attitude at all times.
  • To follow the agreed call sequence and period activity brief and make a change in every outlet.
  • To recognise objectives and to tailor activity in store to achieve these objectives.
  • To establish priorities, plan, organise and manage time efficiently & effectively.
  • To take responsibility for own self-development and improvement.                        
  • To plan how to achieve personal targets and how to contribute to the success of the rest of the team.
  • To develop a plan to achieve Client targets and KPIs.
  • To manage the territory call file and journey plan efficiently.                  
  • To feedback competitor information.
  • To generate new ideas and ways of working.
  • To consistently strive to reach highest standards of performance for customers.
  • To ensure at all times that you operate in an effective and efficient manner to complete all tasks.
  • To undertake any other duties and responsibilities as instructed by your line manager.

Qualifications

  • Full clean driving licence.
  • A good understanding of the grocery market and a keen interest in consumer activities.
  • An ability to build rapport and trust with clients and customers.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication skills with a particular emphasis on listening skills.
  • Pro-active approach to work situations and the ability to demonstrate initiative.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Computer Literacy – competent in word-processing, spreadsheet applications and Internet.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Focus on completion of task.
  • Interest in, and ability to promote and sell the client’s products.
  • Target driven.

My Client 4* Hotel in Dublin, part of the exquisite hotel Collection, are currently recruiting for a Human Resources Assistant to join their team. The HR Assistant will support the Area Human Resources Executive in the day-to-day operation of the Human Resources department. This is a full-time position, however, there may be some room for flexibility depending on the candidates requirements. The HR Assistant will report to the Area HR Executive, the General Manager and the Group HR Manager.

Main Duties
  • To oversee the administrative aspect of recruitment to include, advertising the vacancy, screening, interview scheduling, reference checking and job offer;
  • To ensure that all new employees are furnished with all necessary documentation and training prior to their commencement, making sure that all new team members have a positive, informed and professional onboarding experience;
  • Ensure all employee files are uploaded, maintained and kept up-to-date, making certain that we are compliant, endeavouring to have a paperless HR department;
  • Be the HR point of contact for the team, operating an accessible open-door policy at all times;
  • Manage and respond to all employee queries in a timely manner;
  • Take part in the interview process for entry level positions, and as and when required;
  • Support the HOD’s and management team in managing their team in line with company policies;
  • To maintain open, regular, transparent and positive communication with the HOD team, the Area HR Executive, the Group HR Manager and the GM;
  • To ensure that the hotel is compliant with all statutory training requirements, arranging refresher training as necessary;
  • To schedule and coordinate ad hoc and developmental training as required;
  • To support the Area HR Executive and the HOD team in managing the disciplinary process, ensuring that all requirements are met with regards, to fair process, separation of process and time frames;
  • To support the Area HR Executive and the HOD team in ensuring employee grievances are managed appropriately and as per company procedures;
  • To work with the Area HR Executive, GM and HOD team to encourage a culture of employee engagement through effective and transparent communication; effective people management and the implementation of ad hoc initiatives aimed at improving the working environment;
  • Carry out any ad hoc projects or HR initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and wellbeing;
  • Manage the weekly purchasing process;
  • Assist in drafting any documentation or email communication necessary to be issued to the team;
  • Ensure the HR department submit the weekly payroll submission to the payroll department each Monday.
  • Assist the Area HR Executive and the Group HR Manager with adhoc projects and support as and when required;
Requirements
  • Minimum of 18 months’ HR administrative experience;
  • Be organised and have excellent attention to detail;
  • Possess excellent interpersonal skills and have the ability to build effective professional relationships;
  • Be capable of prioritising and managing multiple projects at one time;
  • Previous experience within the hospitality industry would be an advantage but not compulsory;
  • Have a HR qualification or be studying to pursue same;
  • Proficient in the English language, both written and verbal;
  • Proficient in the Microsoft Office package and Outlook;
Salary on offer up to €30k + excellent company benefits.
