Salary: €33,000.00-€35,000.00 per year

My Client The 4* Hotel in Co. Galway is currently looking for a Junior Duty manager to join their team.

This is an exciting opportunity to join an innovative and progressive company, and work with their experienced Management Team. The main purpose of the role is to assist in the delivery of hotel revenue and profit growth by maximising sales opportunities and ensuring that all areas within the property are running smoothly and that the presentation, cleanliness and security of the property is to the highest standards at all times.

Main Duties
  • Ensure that you receive a handover briefing at the beginning of your shift to ensure that you are aware of any events or special requirements.
  • Maintain a visible presence in the Front of House areas and be the primary point of contact for all customers.
  • Carry out a checks on each department so that they are aware that you are the Manager on Duty.
  • Ensure that staffing is adequate in all areas.
  • Deal with all VIP customers and make sure that their rooms are checked and that they have all the requirements requested.
  • Ensure that liquor licensing legislation are followed according to Company policy and procedures.
  • Carry out security / fire walk and complete relevant records as required.
  • Act as Fire Marshall while on duty and be thoroughly familiar with emergency procedures and alarms.
  • Ensure that all checklists and reports are completed by the relevant person before the end of the shift.
  • Ensure that you complete a handover to the next Manager at the end of your shift to ensure awareness of any issues overnight that need to be followed up.
  • Ensure a good working environment exists within the property and promote good team relations ensuring fairness and consistency in dealing with all team members.
  • Adhere to all Human Resources Management best practice and Company procedures and update the General Manager and Human Resources Department on any issues arising, seeking advice where necessary.
  • You must ensure that the staff costs are kept in-line with the budget constraints and eliminate waste from the payroll cost within your revenue centre.
  • Assist with staff training appropriate to business needs in consultation with the Management team.
  • Comprehensive training records must be maintained and we must be sure that all employees receive any supplementary training necessary to assist them in performing to our stated standards.
  • Seek opportunities to develop yourself in relation to technical training and professional development and attend any training courses as required by the company.
Salary on offer is €28k – €30k DOE.

Looking for a fun, festive temporary seasonal role?

In the approach to the festive season, brands across the Estée Lauder Companies portfolio are looking for enthusiastic and experienced retail and customer service professionals to join the team on a temporary basis, with most contracts leading up to Christmas Eve and a few roles working into the New Year.

As a Christmas Team Member, you will be responsible for supporting the store team in seeking opportunities to maximise sales and profitability over the retail peak trading calendar.

You will be accountable for achieving this by
  • reflecting a credible and professional Brand image to all internal and external consumers at all times
  • maximising sales through selling, providing excellent service and retail standards
Sales and Consumer Service
  • Consistently deliver Brand service and sales expectations at all times
  • Process till transactions effectively, accurately and efficiently; manage queues, as necessary
  • Answer the phone in the correct manner and deal with consumer queries accurately
  • Tailor make experience to meet consumer needs providing alternatives and additional items and online, where appropriate
  • Engage and communicate effectively with consumers providing accurate advice
  • Become familiar with daily and weekly store targets; contribute towards meeting these
Product Knowledge & Retail Standards
  • Identify features and benefits of products providing consumers with relevant information
  • Adhere to all store/company retail standards
  • Maintain housekeeping standards
  • Support the management team with visual merchandising changes and adhere to the visual merchandising guidelines where appropriate
  • Identify faulty stock where appropriate, and take appropriate action
Store Operations
  • Follow Brand/store procedures when receiving, checking and unpacking deliveries and actioning stock movements
  • Store stock as per guidelines and procedures
  • Effectively follow the replenishment process
  • Adhere to daily/weekly deployment rota
  • Keep abreast of company/store information by means of workplace, team briefs, newsletters or any other forums the Brand utilises
  • Adhere to all communicated company standards, Policies and Procedures
Teamwork
  • Offer support and assistance to colleagues where appropriate whilst ensuring own responsibilities are fulfilled
  • Treat colleagues as consumers and provide them with the best service possible
  • Display a high standard of conduct, performance and behaviour at all times, in line with company guidelines, policy and procedure
Security and Health & Safety
  • Adhere to store/company security Policy and Procedures
  • Adhere to store/company Health & Safety Policy and Procedures ensuring compliance to legal responsibilities and obligations
  • Report observed hazards/maintenance issues to management
  • Follow fire safety procedures and understand how to use associated equipment safely
  • Follow and help to organise evacuation/emergency procedures where appropriate
Ideal Profile
  • Previous experience in a sales or customer service role
  • A positive outlook and accommodating, can-do attitude
  • Flexibility to work overtime and weekends in the six weeks leading up to Christmas day.
Qualifications
  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview

Job Number 2116909

• Quality Check product as per standard operating standard
  • Cleaning & maintaining food packing area’s & goods outwards
  • Recording critical control points and daily/weekly checks on our online HACCP management system.
  • Responsible for supporting for goods outwards products loaded onto fleet in the correct order.
  • Well organised and have a professional attitude towards required duties.
  • Responsible for ensuring final product meets the quality standard
  • Complete daily checks and reporting any defects to your line manager.
  • Comply with Company policy and procedure in wearing PPE and following required health and Safety protocols.
  • Comply with required policy and procedure in reporting sickness, requesting annual leave and any other relevant process.
  • Participate in the Performance Management process to ensure delivery of own, and the wider team"s goals.
Main Responsibilities

To quality check and pack individual portioned & bulk meals in order as per production planner in line with Quality Standard Operating procedure. To maintain hygiene standards in a packing & goods outwards area. Providing a high quality delivery service to customers and clients in line health & safety requirements

Ideal Candidate

It doesn’t matter if you’ve never worked as a Packer before. What does matter to us the most, is taking pride in what you do and a willingness to learn.

  • Ability to work in a fast paced kitchen, listening and carrying out instructions pro actively & also on an ad hoc basis
  • Taking reasonable care for your own health and safety and that of others who may be affected by what you do or what they fail to do.
  • Correctly use work equipment, personal protective equipment in accordance with training and instructions provided.
  • Not interfere with or mis-use anything provided for HSE purposes
  • Is competent to be able to complete tasks in line with the agreed standards required
  • Acts in line with guidelines and procedures, maximum potential of Quality Control Packer
  • Has a proven desire for the delivery of the highest quality of hygiene
  • Has the drive to ensure that all results are attained in the most professional and honest manner
  • Is passionate and enthusiastic and wants to deliver excellent service & standards
  • Good numerical, written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to build relationships with customers and team members
  • Is committed to an injury incident free culture, with excellent personal behaviours
  • Has a proactive and practical approach and is able to promote best practice in an operational environment
  • Ability to adapt and respond to changing priorities with the ability to work in a fast-paced organisation

Job Description

Retail Project Manager – Engineering

Reporting to the Senior Manager Real Estate (Operations Engineering), the Retail Project Manager (Engineering) is a full time, permanent role based in Circle K Support Office, Clonskeagh, Dublin.

Responsibilities:
Managing/Leading multiple real estate and engineering projects to support the growth of the Circle K retail business in Ireland.

Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the smooth execution of all projects in Circle K real estate.

Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget , while me asur ing project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques .

Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility .

Ensure resource availability and allocation with the ability to flex between priorities at short notice.

Develop a detailed project plan to track progress , provide business updates and create and maintain comprehensive project documentation .

Communicate confidently across all levels of the organisation with the ability to r eport and escalate as needed , to ensure timelines are achieved.

Manage relationships respectfully and assertively to achieve agreed project goals and objectives.

Meets financial objectives by forecasting requirements; scheduling expenditures; analysing variances and initiating corrective actions .

Excellent ability to present to project teams across the organisation and work confidently under own initiative.

Person:
Degree level education in Engineering or Construction.

Experience of executing project management methodology, ideally with academic qualification in this area.

Retail experience would be beneficial , however if not, a need to understand multiple project execution is essential.

Project management in the area of sustainability is a distinct advantage.

Full clean drivers licence is essential as there will be significant travel across Ireland in this role.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

The Head of GPS Operational Excellence will lead Operational Excellence (OpEx) for BMS Global Product Development and Supply (GPS), which includes internal and external manufacturing, quality, supply chain, product development, engineering and facilities, and strategy and business excellence. This role reports into GPS Strategy & Business Excellence (SBE) which is the engine that propels GPS performance. SBE also includes GPS Strategy, Business Development, Operational Excellence and Learning teams.

The Head of OpEx will drive the GPS evolution from a process centric OpEx model to an enterprise business system; built on the legacy process improvement, lean thinking and six sigma capability; and championing a culture of excellence and agile ways of working. Key to this role is the development of the GPS OpEx strategy, the strengthening GPS OpEx culture, the building of lean, six sigma and agile capabilitites, and the successful execution of cross-functional initiatives to drive continuous, sustainable execution and measurable performance improvement. In order to achieve this, it will be critical that this position works closely with GPS leaders and unifies OpEx central and distributed leaders and teams to make the greatest impact. The Head of GPS OpEx will deliver excellence in safety, environment, quality, productivity and cost for the business and our patients.

Major Duties And Responsibilities
  • Translating the role of GPS in Bristol Myers Squibb’s success into the Operational Excellence vision and strategy; translating that strategy into execution of cross-functional initiatives applying common principles, systems and tools to achieve sustainable improvement of key performance metrics
  • Acting as a thought leader and architect who will advocate and align GPS leadership and the GPS organization around OPEX top-down; evaluate enterprise business performance horizontally across functions and sites globally; and execute performance change bottom-up
  • Developing business improvement planning processes that aligns with business strategy and with business planning at corporate and operational levels
  • Driving change management to promote a culture of operational excellence and continuous improvement and embedding it into our daily work; partnering with Global Quality and cross-functional leadership in developing and rolling out a culture of excellence
  • Developing internal change leaders capable of leading and facilitating cross-functional transformation
  • Developing new tools and change management techniques, driving the evaluation of existing processes, and developing plans to improve processes across GPS.
  • Assessing, analyzing and implementing solutions across the division to identify and eliminate waste
  • Building, maintaining and leveraging relationships across the matrix to identify opportunities for process improvement, facilitate the implementation of process improvement, and continuously monitor processes and outcomes
  • Collaborating with cross-functional leadership to ensure effective execution of improvement projects through understanding of business objectives, P&L scope and resources needs; partnering with leadership to eliminate barriers and raise awareness
  • Driving the priorities and resource model across the organization with periodic (annual/semi annual) adjustments in alignment with the GPS strategy and priorities; supporting cost management by making implementation choices consistent with financial goals
  • Staying up to date on developments in OpEx methodologies and best practices
  • Coaching / mentoring stakeholders at all levels to support them through the adoption of OpEx principles and practices
Management Responsibility
  • Direct line management of central GPS Operational Excellence team
  • Matrixed leadership of GPS OpEX network
  • Oversight of contingent OpEx resources as needed.
Travel
  • Up to 30%
Required Knowledge/Skills/Qualifications

Education
  • Minimum BS/BA with preference for Scientific or Engineering focus
  • Advanced degree preferred (MBA, PhD, or other graduate experience)
Experience/Knowledge
  • 12+ years leadership experience in Operations /Operational Excellence roles in Chemical/Life science/Biotech industry or other highly regulated environment
  • Lean Six Sigma expertise; black belt prefered
  • Able to identify improvement opportunities, translate into tangible initiatives and drive execution of projects.
  • Able to build relationships/networks, able to negotiate & influence, manage change in matrix environment and lead change through others to achieve operational excellence.
  • Track record of success in the rigorous planning, execution and timely delivery of enterprise level projects and programs; demonstrated proficiency in managing a large, complex portfolio of projects
  • Proven innovation & opportunity identification translated into tangible initiatives and successful execution.
  • Demonstrated proficiency and passion for lean methodology, tools and manufacturing process improvement. Demonstrated understanding of Agile methodology a plus
  • Exceptional skills in leadership, coaching, analytical problem solving and strong business acumen.
  • Exceptional builder and leader of high performance teams.
  • Superior written and verbal communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficient in related software.
Skills/Competencies
  • Enterprise Mindset The ability to make decisions, set priorities and share resources based on what will benefit the whole. Capable of building and maintaining networks within and outside of the organization to both strengthen the understanding of the big picture and leverage diverse perspectives, experiences and expertise to maximize performance.
  • Change Agility Capable of constantly thinking ahead and scanning the environment for opportunities. The ability to navigate ambiguity for themselves by demonstrating smart risk taking and personal resilience. Lead others through change by continuously creating the context and engaging individuals.
  • Authentic Leadership Capable of building legitimacy through cultivating honest relationships. Ability to generate trust by demonstrating the highest level of consistency between their words and their actions and maintaining integrity, especially under pressure. They role model and promote an environment of openness.
  • Talent Development Capable of maintaining a current and strategic view of talent management, aligned with the organization’s priorities. This includes an understanding of the needs and diversity of the organization’s current and future talent. Ability to proactively develop talent across the organization and engage external talent.
Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, or any part of the recruitment process direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Job Description & Summary
A career within Financial Markets Business Advisory services, will provide you with the opportunity to contribute to a variety of audit, regulatory, valuation, and financial analyses services to design solutions that address our clients’ complex accounting and financial reporting challenges, as well as their broader business issues.
You would be joining a collaborative team of professionals to operate as a Manager in the FS Risk & Regulatory Practice of PwC.


Remuneration and Benefits:
In addition to a highly competitive remuneration package, PwC employees have access to a wide range of benefits including:
  • Flexible working hours and work from home options
  • Flexible Friday – 3pm finish on bank holiday and summer Fridays
  • New parent leave, wedding leave and gratuity
  • PwC pension plan (market leading)
  • Subsidised healthcare insurance
  • Professional exam support
  • On-site gym, fitness classes and wellbeing services
  • On-site restaurant, café, shop and dry cleaning service
  • Paid maternity leave

Our team helps financial organisations navigate risk & regulatory complexity while strengthening trust and transparency in their business. Our clients cover industries within banking and capital markets, payment services and electronic money, insurance, and consumer finance. We work with our clients in areas such as risk management, new market entry, governance & internal control and prudential & conduct regulation. You’ll work alongside senior members of our team to help us build our growing practice.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
  • Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.
  • Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.
  • Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.
  • Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.
  • Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.
  • Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.
  • Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.
  • Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.
  • Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.
  • Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.


Qualifications:
  • Degree qualified or equivalent with relevant professional qualifications e.g Professional Diploma in Compliance, PRMIA.
  • Minimum of 5 years in a similar consultancy environment or in a financial services company with a strong experience in risk or regulatory compliance;
  • Experience of the regulatory framework and working in a compliance/risk department of an authorised firm.


Your Knowledge and Skills:
  • Knowledge of the financial services industry. Cross financial sector experience is an advantage;

Job Description

+75 is the number of countries that Lean Digital Core (LDC) program will be rolled out across all units in Novartis Group affiliates

This role is can be staffed in any location worldwide; due to system limitations only one country is displayed in BrassRing.

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Design and be responsible for the largest and most complex Data Migration in Novartis history!
  • Lead the Lean Digital Core Data Team in covering the domains in the Lean Digital Scope (LDC)
  • With an enterprise mind-set, implement the data principles, rules and tools to ensure key integration topics and dependencies are aligned across functions and programs
  • Collaborate with IT to design, build and validate data migration solutions, with a focus on state-of-the -art and AI/ML powered Data Migration tools (Palantir Foundry, SAP Syniti, TAMR)
  • Drive, shape, represent and communicate the LDC data migration strategy to senior partners


Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:
  • >12 years’ experience in the space of data
  • At least 7 years of experience in data migration, with at least 5 years of ERP/SAP transformation and data migrations
  • At least 5 years of people and/or project management experience in global development projects & rollouts, leading data workstreams in large scale ERP, systems implementations and/or large scale global business transformations
  • Demonstrated people management skills and cultural transformation in a data driven attitude (motivation, leadership and development)


Desirable requirements:
  • Result-driven, inclusive leader and phenomenal teammate with strong communications skills
  • Curiosity, open to new and different ideas and solutions
  • Inspirational leadership, Unboss attitude, providing the right amount of challenge and autonomy


You’ll receive:

Competitive salary, Annual bonus, Pension scheme, Share scheme, Health insurance, 25 days annual leave, Flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, Employee recognition scheme, learning and development opportunities.

Why consider Novartis?

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, adventurous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to seek the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Description

Your Role:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, results-oriented individual to join our finance and accounting organization. A successful candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess the ability to creatively solve problems and think on their feet. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a growing organization that really invests in its people.

Your Opportunity:
Manage the international accounting process for our global operations, including coordinating with internal accounting and legal teams, and local accounting/audit firms as well as global coordinators
Coordinate international accounting compliance, including analysis of US GAAP to local accounting differences and the timely required filings required in each country
Manage transfer pricing invoicing
Manage intercompany notes and other intercompany activity, including settling intercompany balances
Work with equity team to understand parent company equity plans and coordinate with local accounting firms to understand local accounting treatment
Onboard and integrate newly acquired or established entities, research applicable statutory adjustments and build relationships with local accounting and audit firms
Mentor and educate accounting team as needed with regard to international accounting standards
Implement and manage technology to improve the international accounting processes
Manage identification requirements for global bank accounts
Ensure documentation of and compliance with proper internal controls and SOX compliance

What You'll Need:
Candidates must possess a bachelor degree in Accounting from an accredited university/college
5+ years of experience required in accounting department or public accounting
Ideally have knowledge and exposure to global accounting standards
CPA
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Highly motivated and detail-oriented individual who works well in a fast paced, time-sensitive environment
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with employees at all levels of the organization
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple and changing priorities
Good analytical skills
Deadline oriented, strong leadership skills and the ability to complete tasks independently

If you’ve reached this point in the job description and feel you’re still not sure if you should apply…Just do it! We know there are no perfect applicants. You may not have 100% of all those bullets listed above - and that’s okay. If you’re feeling like you’re not going to fit in with our teams - that’s not ok. We're One Tenable which means however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, we encourage you to submit an application if it’s a role you can be passionate about doing every day.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.

Overview

Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities and we are always looking for bright new talent to join our team! Our Finance team currently has a full-time opportunity for a Financial Analyst, Operations based out of our office in Langford, BC, Calgary, AB, or Mississauga, ON.

Job Description

Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities and we are always looking for bright new talent to join our team! Our Finance team currently has a full-time opportunity for a Financial Analyst, Operations based out of our office in Langford, BC, Calgary, AB, or Mississauga, ON.

The Financial Analyst, Operations will provide financial analysis and business decision support to the Manager Finance, Operations and/or Director Finance, Operations, District Operators and Store Operators/Franchisees.
  • Perform moderately complex analysis in a specific area such as capital spending and budget
  • Put forward suggestions to improve functional area processes
  • Provide excellent level of customer service to all levels of the business
  • Assist in forecasting, targeting, and budgeting process
  • Assist in development of performance analysis
  • Prepare various ad-hoc reporting requests
  • Prepare various analytical reports
  • Communicate effectively with functional area managers and employees
  • Analyze capital investment opportunities as required
  • Perform required administrative tasks which may include running SAP reports, participating in meetings, and responding to phone and e-mail messages
  • Maintain various reporting requirements
  • Perform account reconciliations and account analysis
  • Work with the Business Process Optimization (BPO) and Continuous Improvement Teams to identify opportunities to reduce costs
  • Adhere to GAAP and CEO/ CFO Certification
  • Develop and manage various reports in various systems including SAP, Longview, BMR, and BW
  • Communication with District Operator and team
  • Special projects as assigned
Job Requirements
  • Proficient use of the Microsoft Office Suite
  • SAP, Khalix, and other ad-hoc systems
  • Strong communication skills (both written and oral)
  • Strong analytical skills
  • An Undergraduate Degree and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience or a DEC and a minimum of 4 years relevant experience
  • Working towards accounting designation (CMA or CGA)
  • Previous experience working in Retail environment
This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading Canadian company with a clear vision and focus. If you feel that thisdescribes the kind of work you want to do, and you are excited about what Sobeys has to offer, then we look forward to reviewing your application. Please ensure that you take the time to ensure your profile shows us why you're the most qualified applicant for the role.

Job Ref: 17804
We have a great opportunity for an experienced HR Manager to join a highly successful Irish-owned retail operation with outlets in both Cork and Killarney. In this varied role, you will be responsible for the day-to-day HR operations of both sites (approx. 200 employees). The ideal candidate will be CIPD qualified and have HR Managerial experience in a fast-paced environment, ideally within retail. Reporting to the MD this will be a highly visible role where you will work closely with the senior management team. Positive work environment, along with an attractive package on offer.

If you are a confident, customer-orientated HR professional that enjoys working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment this job would be perfect for you. Travel will be required between both locations on a weekly basis.

Overview of main responsibilities:
You will be the first point of contact for all HR-related queries and provide support to the Senior Retail Team in processes including the complete life cycle of employees, such as recruitment, grievances, disciplinary, contract queries and onboarding new starters.
Implement group-wide HR initiatives in the store and update any relevant HR documentation as required.
Manage and maintain all HR policies and promote consistency and fairness throughout each location.
Assisting with staff investigations, disciplinary and grievance meetings and ensure all paperwork is documented.
Ensure company policies are updated with relevant legislative changes including disciplinary, maternity leave, parental leave etc.
Time and Attendance experience, (Timepoint) clock-in systems and payroll experience preferred.
Work closely with the Managing Directors and senior management teams relating to HR-wide initiatives including engagement, training and development, salary review and bonus processes.

﻿What the ideal candidate looks like:
Notable HR Manager level experience and a proven track record in retail or some customer facing HR environment.
Relevant HR Qualifications such as a related Degree or CIPD Qualification
Have a proficient background in MS Office tools (MS Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel & Word)
Excellent communication skills and detail orientated
High level of understanding of employment law, recruitment, appraisals, and staff training
Payroll, roster and holiday planning experience is desirable

For a confidential discussion and more information on the role, please contact Michael O’Brien.

021-4809118

michael.obrien@collinsmcnicholas.ie

+ High execution skills with ability to prioritize and multi-task

More than the opportunity of a lifetime......the opportunity to improve lives

For more than 30 years, Boston Scientific has advanced the practice of less-invasive medicine. The Company's products help physicians and other medical professionals improve their patients' quality of life by providing alternatives to surgery. Since 1994, employees in Galway have been at the forefront of some of these truly innovative medical device designs and manufacturing.

Due to continued expansion of our operations, we are seeking applications from a suitably qualified and experienced Equipment Software Engineer I/II.

Job Purpose

To assist the Equipment Engineering department to develop new manufacturing and test equipment and systems used in the development and production of medical devices. Independently or as member of a team; develops specifications, designs, plans and develops complex manufacturing and test equipment.

Responsibilities

Develop robust, flexible, reusable, efficient and scalable manufacturing applications.

Database design, development, monitoring and SQL Server script authoring to retrieve manufacturing process data and populate process critical tables as required.

Commission, test, troubleshoot and support existing and new manufacturing equipment.

Work closely with customers in defining system requirements and propose creative and cost effective solutions.

Work closely with both internal and external specialists and vendors to complete equipment related projects in a laboratory and manufacturing setting.

Write detailed functional design requirements.

Contribute to all phases of software development including design, implementation, unit test, integration, release and validation support.

Generates quotations, concepts and business cases for new and upgrade equipment.

Develop detailed project plans and manage projects to completion.

Provide software input on design changes for new and existing systems aligning machine functionality to customer requirements.

Build Quality into all aspects of work by maintaining compliance to all quality requirements.

Actively participate in departmental and plant Continuous Improvement through participation in Value Improvement Projects and Lean Business Process Projects as well as departmental standards.

Ensure equipment solutions are delivered within planned schedules and within budget.

Providing technical leadership on equipment related product and process issues.

Proactively drive innovation and integration of new technologies into development strategies for the software team.

Qualifications

BSc/MSc degree or equivalent in Computer Engineering or related discipline.

Minimum 3 years in a similar software development role.

Experience and thorough knowledge in the following:
VB.NET

C#

VB 6

SQL Server

Software testing

Version and change management software

Working knowledge of Team Foundation server beneficial.

Experience in a regulated environment with 21CFR Part 11 experience an advantage.

Machine or device control design experience.

Good working knowledge on the use of vision systems and associated tools desirable.

SQL Server Reporting Services, web application development, HTML, JavaScript, WPF desirable.

Excellent communication skills combined with an imaginative and creative approach to problem-solving.

Experience in labelling software and printing software solutions.

Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with good multitasking and prioritization skills.

At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Who We Are Looking For

The candidate will be expected to ensure that the team executes client and internal deliverables to the highest quality and that SLA provisions and relevant KPIs are met, along with compliance with regulatory requirements and with the relevant short, medium and long-term goals, objectives and values of State Street.

Why this role is important to us

The team you will be joining is a part of State Street Global Services (SSGS). SSGS gives asset owners and managers access to the essential financial tools they need to deliver effective investment solutions. From core custody, accounting, fund administration and shareholder recordkeeping, to complete operations solutions and servicing for alternative assets like OTC derivatives, private equity and real estate, SSGS’ tools help our clients make better investment choices and act on growth opportunities.

Join us if making your mark in the financial services industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.

What You Will Be Responsible For

As Trustee Administrator Specialist, Associate 2 you will:

Job Duties And Responsibilities
  • Assist with review of fund documentation and completing of review programmes in order to ensure appropriate monitoring of funds
  • Review of funds to ensure compliance with regulatory investment restriction and borrowing power limits
  • Ensuring breaches are rectified in a timely manner and preparing fund impact statements upon rectification
  • Maintain company’s breaches register
  • Assist with testing of compliance monitoring system
  • Assist with review of distributions paid by funds
  • Assist with review of the operational departments in order to ensure funds are being administered in accordance with fund documentation/regulations
What We Value

 Core Competencies
  • Accurate and Precise
  • Team Oriented
  • Organised
  • Flexible
  • Self-reliant
  • Enthusiastic
  • Excellent communications skills
Education & Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required
  • Excellent administrative, organisational and business support skills, with the ability to multi-task and to work calmly under pressure.
  • Excellent working knowledge of MS Office suite including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills
  • Possess excellent organisational, planning and co-ordination skills.
  • Ability to work accurately to tight deadlines
  • Proactive and able to work independently and as part of a team
  • Honours Degree in relevant discipline
  • Relevant industry / professional qualifications an advantage
About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

  • Host product demonstrations and guided tours for customers and prospects
  • Demonstrate clear understanding of Coupa’s sales processes and product and service value propositions
  • Customer event attendance

Requirements:
  • Consistent track record for meeting and exceeding opportunity generation and sales objectives
  • 2+ years inside sales software or similar experience
  • Experience calling into enterprise-level companies at CXO level
  • Proven track record with new account development
  • Highly motivated professional with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Fluent in Business English
  • High level of energy, drive, enthusiasm, initiative, commitment and professionalism
  • Self-starter with solid organizational and planning skills
  • Working knowledge of Salesforce.com or a similar CRM system required

Coupa continues to grow at a phenomenal rate and with that comes significant career opportunities for consistent performers.

Our client is one of Ireland's top 30 leading Construction Contractors, and they provide construction solutions to the commercial, pharmaceutical, energy, healthcare and industrial sectors.

To liase with design teams and MEP sub-contractors.

Organise and chair weekly co-ordination meetings with the MEP sub-contractors and design teams.

Ensure MEP sub-contractors produce the following documents: Coordinated MEP drawings/ Procurement schedules/ Program Progress reports/ Requests for information.

Track the progress of the MEP sub-contractors against the main programme and report any variances to the Contracts Manager.

Liaise with the utility suppliers to arrange for power, gas and telco connections.

Provide project team with up to date information on current MEP developments.

Carry out site inspections of the MEP works to ensure the installation conforms to the relevant standards.

Regularly check the installation against the MEP specification and drawings.

Report any non-conformity to the project team and MEP contractors.

Coordinate the production of the following documents at practical completion: As built drawings & O&M manuals.

Coordinate training for the client with the MEP contractors at practical completion.

Be aware of their legal, practical and regulatory responsibilities, and have a detailed understanding of Health and Safety.

In conjunction with the Health & Safety Department, ensure that MEP sub-contractors submit a safety statement and site specific method statement before works commence.

Check and confirm adequacy of provisions within the site specific method statements relating to MEP works on site i.e., working with live electrical services, site deliveries etc and co-ordinate these works on site.

Assist the Health & Safety Department in the collation of the project's safety file.


Requirements

Qualification in Building Services, Mechanical Engineering or related discipline

5+ years proven experience as an M&E Co-ordinator or Building Services Coordinator

Previous experience on commercial and industrial projects is desirable

Excellent communication, presentation and people management skills

Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word & Project and knowledge of AutoCad


Package

€45K - €65K dependent on level of relevant experience and negotiable for the right candidates

Permanent staff role with long term career prospects

Our client is a leading Mechanical and Electrical engineering contractor working on large scale commerical, pharma/biotech and datacentre projects in Ireland and mainland Europe

They are seeking to appoint a Group Quality Manager to be based in the Dublin area with travel to various sites and other office locations as required

The role will direct the Group wide team of Quality Managers (Company, Division & Project based) to achieve quality management system targets

Develop and sustain the Quality Management System (QMS) in line with the required industry standards, accreditation requirements and business requirements across the Group through existing and new procedures.

Ensure that all quality-focused activities operate in accordance with local health, safety and environmental policies and procedures to ensure the safety and wellbeing of staff, craft labour and visitors.

Conduct risk assessments of quality processes in conjunction with Group EHS.

Regulate, control and improve the quality of all processes (administrative & craft) throughout the business. This includes auditing to ensure compliance by a third party accredited body where appropriate.

Manage the audit schedule of all group activities (administrative & craft). Ensure that all nonconformities raised via internal/external audits are rectified, verified and control measures put in place. Produce quarterly findings report for all Directors across the Group to ensure continual improvement and compliance.

Encourage and embed a culture of continuous improvement throughout the Group.

Manage all quality based certification requirements. Liaise directly with external bodies on all matters relating to registration; while maintaining and improving them, in line with business needs.

Description

--COVID-19 Hiring Update--

As the health and safety of our candidates and our employees come first, we're excited to provide virtual experiences for interviews and new hire on-boarding.

Who we are: 

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold. 

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for ‘Most Innovative Use of AI’ from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards. 

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You’ll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it! 

Team Lead, Data Analytics 

Location: Dublin, IRE

Type: Full time 

Who we are:

We are Dataminr. We are a mission-driven company committed to the power of AI, public data, and real-time information as a force for good in the world. Over the last decade, our team has established and refined the leading AI platform for real-time event and risk detection. We surface the earliest signals of unfolding events and emerging risks within an increasingly diverse and complex landscape of publicly available information, enabling more effective risk mitigation strategies, faster response, and better crisis management. Dataminr serves thousands of professionals in 70+ countries by delivering timely, relevant, and actionable alerts to public and private sector organizations around the world.

We’ve grown to over 500 talented employees across seven global offices and raised $392 million in funding in our most recent investment round. Our culture promotes cross-team interaction, work-life balance and the sharing of information and ideas because it enables us to do our best work together, make a meaningful contribution, and have fun. Join us and help the world manage risk in real time.

Who you are: 

You are a highly motivated self-starter and problem solver interested in the intersection of data, current events, business, and technology. You are innovative, adaptable, and can balance multiple projects at the same time. You are passionate about working with data, have experience developing data ingests and are familiar with web technologies. You take the initiative to own projects and deliver results with the goal to make the organization more successful. You will lead a team of data analysts and work with a cross-functional team of product managers, data scientists, engineers - to solve challenging problems.

Responsibilities: 

General

  • Execute high priority cross-functional projects: Lead/mentor a team of data analysts and oversee successful end-to-end execution of data ingest, automation, & analytics initiatives
  • Drive insights through analytics, reporting, and visualization: Conduct data analytics & modeling, define business metrics, and develop dashboards to drive both day-to-day decision-making and long-term strategic-setting
  • Contribute to automation and process improvement initiatives: Work with management and operations teams across the company to develop reporting systems, automation workflows, and data-driven operational workflows that support business needs

Data Ingest, Automation, & Analytics 

  • Conduct data exploration and build data ingests utilizing APIs and other methods
  • Develop automation scripts for data extraction, transformation, and QA in consultation with subject matter experts
  • Build, maintain, and update visualization dashboards and tools to monitor data health
  • Perform quality assurance and routine diagnostics on data and data feeds
  • Develop and maintain protocols to systematize processes for future work

Desired Skills & Experience: 

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Strong knowledge of Java, Python and SQL (plus knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS preferred)
  • Professional experience with Web-scraping, ingesting data from external APIs, and working with raw data in various data formats
  • 3-5 years of hands on experience, preferably working in cross-functional teams with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience leading, supervising, or managing data analysts
  • Familiarity with regular expressions
  • Professional experience with data visualization using BI Tools such as Looker, Tableau or PowerBI
  • Hands on experience or familiarity of Machine Learning concepts is a plus
  • Excellent attention to detail and highly organized with ability to work on multiple projects
  • Ability to work both independently & collaboratively within a team
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

Our offering of competitive benefits and perks include:

  • Company paid benefits for employees and their dependants, such as medical, dental, vision, disability and life
  • Generous leave
  • Professional development fund
  • Daily catered lunch and snack area with refrigerated beverages
  • Bi-monthly company outings
  • Dataminr Yoga

…and this is just to name a few!

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

Dataminr will collect and process your personal data. All personal data will be processed in accordance with Dataminir's data privacy notice available here:https://www.dataminr.com/privacy-policyand applicable data protection laws. By providing your details and applying via our careers website, you acknowledge that you have read our data privacy notice. If you have any queries, please contact the People Team at hr@dataminr.com or our Legal department at  legal@dataminr.com.

About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Want to expand your leadership capabilities? We offer that.
Ready to drive innovation? We offer that too.
Welcome to AbbVie!

At AbbVie, we offer you the resources and a global reach to empower your innovative mindset. From day one, we’ve known it takes teamwork and collaboration to develop the scientific breakthroughs, innovative pipelines, and therapies that change millions of patients’ lives around the world. In short, we know it takes “you” to make those ground-breaking advancements happen. We take pride in serving and supporting our communities and protecting the environment, making a lasting impact that's felt within healthcare and beyond.

We are now recruiting an Engineering Services Manager to be part of our extended leadership team in our Ballytivnan site in Sligo. Reporting directly to the Engineering Manager, you will be lead, and coach your team and be responsible for, delivering high-performance on-site projects, black utility equipment, facilities management and maintaining a best-in-class compliant facility to meet the stringent demands of a modern Biologics and Medical Device manufacturing facility adhering to both MEP and Calibration programs.

Are you ready to lead such a team? Then read on…. In this role, you will

  • Develop and coach your engineering team; building their technical capability and areas of expertise
  • Have responsibility for maintaining ISO 50001 Registration through strategic long range planning, project identification and execution, management of Energy Team, Quarterly Reviews, energy monitoring and analysis.
  • Preparation and accuracy of utility maintenance expense and capital budgets for Financial Plan, LBE (Latest Best Estimate) and LRP (Long Range Plan)
  • Maintenance of live tracking database of all committed expenditure to ensure accuracy of budget status for Financial LBE’s (Latest Best Estimate)
  • Design, Maintenance and Delivery of the Electrical, Mechanical, Security, Fire Protection, Building Regulation, Environmental and Alarm Site Strategic Plans to ensure optimal performance of site operations
  • Foster a culture of Engineering Excellence in Utility and Facility management.
  • Drawing management through Meridian while identification of Key Metrics, creation of Dashboard for monthly reporting, set meaningful and relevant targets
  • Thorough incident investigation and delivery of CAPA’s on time and supporting site in product, process and equipment validation where required.
  • Implement Maintenance Excellence Programme, including Reliability Engineering, within department areas of responsibilities, driving continuous improvement and achieving all relevant KPI’s.
  • Responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the building, internal and external.
  • Selection, approval, coordination, continual monitoring and assessment of all external utility and facility contractors
  • Ensure contractor compliance with all relevant legislative and company requirements/procedures
  • Responsible for ensuring energy life cycle analysis is considered for equipment LRP
  • Responsible for optimum performance of the infrastructure supporting the sites EPA Licence
Qualifications

So, what education and experience do you need to be this leader?
  • You will have a Honours Degree in Engineering or equivalent with a minimum 7 year’s work experience
  • At least 3 year’s work experience in a cGMP environment
  • Demonstrated ability to lead, coach and mentor your team
  • Ability to influence, lead and be clear and decisive
Does this all sound like the right role for you? Then come join AbbVie!

Summary
Every single day, people do amazing things at Apple. What will you do? At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish! As an SDM Planning Manager, you will lead a dynamic team within the EMEiA Supply Demand Management (SDM) function in Cork. EMEIA SDM are responsible for analysing sales and maintaining supply to meet product demand within the EMEIA region (Europe, Middle East, India and Africa). We are looking for an ambitious, highly motivated professional to join the SDM team as a manager to work towards achieving Apple’s goals by maximising sales with optimal inventory. This role will report to one of the SDM LOB (Line of Business) leads across one of Apple's products - iPhone, iPad, Mac, Watch or Accessories.


Key Qualifications
Significant years of relevant management experience in fast moving product industry

Strong analytical skills, meticulous with a keen eye for business and passionate about consumer focus.

Demonstrate initiative, adaptability and problem-solving skills in a changing and dynamic environment

Experience in leadership roles, including leading teams within a supply chain environment

Known to work in setting direction for process and/or tool improvements to support team objectives

Excellent prioritisation skills

Detail oriented


Description
- Lead, mentor and develop a team of highly qualified professionals.

- Analyse forecasted demand, inventory, and sell through to develop and run weekly and quarterly supply plans. Results should meet Apple’s quarterly financial revenue goals, whilst also achieving order cycle time goals and minimising finished goods' liability.

- Evaluate risks to the plan and implement contingency plans to mitigate.

- Analyse product order bookings, backlog, and billings.

- Identify problem areas, and drive appropriate functional groups to correct.

- Handle any critical issues related to production or country allocation.

- Own communication of supply available for weekly shipments to sales, finance, logistics and world-wide SDM.

- Ensure supply plans support the direct channels (online & retail stores) and reseller channel weekly sell through, while maintaining appropriate inventory levels.

- Coordinate with multiple internal teams to set launch quantities and ensure smooth product transitions to ensuring minimal “Excess and obsolete” (E&O) and appropriate inventory balance across countries.

- Improve product planning processes. Identify improvement opportunities, allocate resources and drive projects to completion to achieve targeted measurable benefits.

- Critical focus on the customer experience around supply planning for each of the channels of business (Reseller, Online and Stores).

- Specific focus around timely response to critical issues and taking corrective action on any route causes.

- Building strong partnerships with Reseller Operations and Retail Fulfilment Operations to understand the “Voice of the Customer”


Education & Experience
- Bachelor’s degree - 3rd level degree essential in IT, Business Analytics, Business Information Systems, Accounting, Maths or similar discipline

- Post graduate qualification would be an advantage. However, if you feel you have relevant experience, you are encouraged to apply

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

We do so via:

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Manufacturing Operator role will make an impact:

Key responsibilities for this role include:

  • Ensure that the manufacturing equipment and area is cleaned to GMP standards.
  • Ensure that BMR is correctly filled out according to SOP's.
  • Responsible for the correct running of granulation equipment.
  • Ensure that granulation is carried our according to relevant SOP's in accordance with the manufacturing schedule.
  • Ensure that other granulation processes are carried out i.e. drying, milling and blending in absence of fellow operatives.
  • Complete OEE sheets as required.
  • Report directly to Manufacturing Supervisor or Manager, if any problems or damage occurs.
  • Ensure that raw materials / excipients have been checked.
  • Operate granulating equipment, including Colette Gral, Fluid Bed Drier, tray ovens, Mill and discharge units in accordance with SOP's and as directed by the Manufacturing Supervisor / Manager.
  • Ensure that all safety standards are met while operating machines and handling product.
  • Responsible for a high standard of GMP and good housekeeping.
  • Carry out dispensing duties on the request of the Manufacturing Supervisor.
  • To adhere to all company and legislative health, safety and environmental requirements

The minimum qualifications for this role are:

  • The ability to work on Shift Rotation: Days: 07:00 – 15:15 (Mon -Thurs) 07:00 – 14:15 (Fri); Evenings: 15:00 – 24:00 (Mon -Thurs) 14:00-19:15 (Fri); Nights: 23:30 - 07:30 (Sun - Thurs).
  • Leaving Certificate or equivalent.
  • Candidates should ideally have experience in any of the following areas of pharmaceutical manufacturing; Dispensing, Granulation, Compression, Coating.
  • Good understanding of the requirements of Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Demonstrated strong team-working skills
  • Proficiency in speaking, comprehending, reading and writing English is required.

This Job is based in Australia

Facilitator and Quality Medical Practice Element Convenor

UNSW Medicine Program

The Office of Medical Education is an administrative unit within UNSW Medicine responsible for curriculum development, evaluation, professional development, and research in medical education. The Office is staffed by academics with expertise in medical education and appoints casual and part-time academic staff to support teaching in the faculty.

About The Role
  • 3-Year Fixed Term, Part-Time (0.5 FTE/17 hours a week) contract
  • $110K - $130K base prorated plus 17% Superannuation & leave loading
  • Sydney, Australia based.
  • You will require full working rights for the duration of the contract.
During Phase 1 of the Medicine program, scenario group sessions are delivered, with each session content and activities determined by the course design groups. Part-time facilitators are employed by the Office of Medicine Education with sessions held in tutorial rooms at the University’s Kensington campus.

The role of Facilitator is responsible for assisting with medical students with their learning and development in scenario group sessions, which is an integral component of the learning activities in Phase 1 of the Medicine program. The role will involve maintaining and developing learning activities, including online/ blended resources, to support the learning of Quality of Medical Practice (QMP) across Phases 1, 2 & 3 of the BMed/MD program.

The role of Facilitator reports to the Senior Vice Dean (Education) and has no direct reports.

To Be Successful In This Role You Will

About the successful applicant
  • A tertiary qualification in Medicine, Medical Science or equivalent.
  • Demonstrated experience in facilitating small group teaching sessions with evidence of quality or innovative teaching for small groups.
  • Experience in teaching Evidence-Based Medicine and Quality & Safety, which are components of the Quality Medical Practice element of the Medicine program.
  • Experience in the use of adult education technologies.
  • Demonstrated ability to teach, develop and mark curriculum for undergraduate medical students.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to liaise with and build and maintain effective collaborative professional relationships.
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and collaborative with a diverse team.
  • Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.
  • An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines.
  • Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.
Please see the attached position description for full details. You should address the main selection criteria listed within the position description in your application. PPD - Facilitator and Quality Medical Practice Element Convenor.docx

Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

Professor Gary Velan - Senior Vice Dean of Education

E: g.velan@unsw.edu.au

Provides outsourced pension administration services to occupational pension funds. Manages queries and data requests from members and client queries, ensuring good client relations are maintained and complaints and managed. Performs manual calculations, quotations and data processing in accordance with regulatory requirements. Manages annual projects such as pension increases and benefits statements and other ad hoc project work. Description

Who we are: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud (https://aws.amazon.com/ec2). Amazon EC2 Core Platform Services team owns the foundational services that enable our customers to launch millions of EC2 instances every day. The team is focused on software development for various aspects of the EC2 core platform engineering including provisioning systems, business intelligence, and region planning. At Amazon, it is all about working hard, having fun and making history. If you are ready to make history, we want to hear from you!

What you will do: You will make a tremendous impact on Amazon’s business by enhancing and building tools and services for the EC2 core platform. You will have the opportunity to leverage Amazon Web Services and a wide variety of technologies and frameworks.
  • We're building web services in Ruby, Scala, Java, and back-end infrastructure built on top of Amazon Web Services. Our full stack currently includes (but not limited to), DynamoDB, RDS, CloudWatch, SNS, SQS, Lambda and S3.
  • We're building scalable high-throughput provisioning services, used to provide capacity for building EC2 and AWS itself!
  • We are responsible end-to-end for all products we design and launch, and your team will support the full lifecycle of what you own.
Why it matters: Amazon and AWS are growing at an incredible rate. To keep up with that growth, we continually innovate with new processes and automation that simplify our operations at massive scale. Your work will impact thousands of engineers and teams. You’ll help us rapidly launch and scale our services while continuing to improve utilization. Every customer who uses Amazon’s products and services is supported by the computing infrastructure we provide!

Why you’ll love it: You will see all aspects of the Amazon business. You’ll work with massive data sets. You’ll improve the agility of our technical teams. You’ll be part of a growing, fast paced, and fun team. You’ll have ownership, not just responsibility; and you’ll define and execute processes to deliver both savings and productivity for AWS and Amazon. Above all, our people matter – you will be part of a diverse, highly committed and collaborative team!


Basic Qualifications
  • 5+ years of software development industry experience.
  • Demonstrated strong design and coding skills in Ruby, Java, Scala, C/C++
  • Web development expertise (Proficiency in Rails, JavaScript, React.js, Bootstrap, MVC frameworks).
  • Experience building high-performance, highly-available and scalable systems.
  • Experience analyzing data while developing solutions to problems.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Masters degree in Computer Science
  • Must be able to analyze problems and solve them creatively.
  • Be highly innovative, flexible and self-directed..
  • Familiarity with SQL and relational databases.
  • Experience in data analysis using statistical methods.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


Company - Amazon Dev Centre Ireland Ltd

Job ID: A1720257

Description

We're a company of pioneers. It's our job to make bold bets and we get our energy from inventing on behalf of customers. Success is measured against the possible, not the probable. For today’s pioneers, that’s exactly why there’s no place on Earth they’d rather build than Amazon.

We are seeking a pioneer to help build a world class support infrastructure for our fulfillment and transportation teams. Does providing creative support for complex technology problems motivate you? Amazon is looking for a Network Development Engineer with deep understanding of local area, wide area and wireless networking, scripting, multiple networking protocols, packet capture, security and monitoring to support the Infrastructure Operations team.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively. The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and automation. They will have experience participating in proactive engineering, network optimization and operational network support for a large-scale service provider or enterprise environment. The successful candidate will be expected to provide high quality top-tier network escalation support for complex issues and drive the innovation for simplicity and sustainability of the Amazon’s Fulfilment Center Network worldwide. As a technical leader he/she will manage complex stakeholder relationships with both technical team and management. A passion for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is required. High level of ownership and bias-for-action is required to be successful in this role.

Roles and Responsibilities
  • Provide on-shift network escalation support for critical and complex network issues
  • Dive Deep on the high severity incidents and participate in root cause analysis
  • Automate select network administration tasks through creation and maintenance of scripts and tools
  • Work closely with our Network Engineering teams to ensure fast, smooth roll-out of new designs and products
  • Partner with our broader Technical operations organization to reduce operational burden
  • Support in organizational transformation from reactive to proactive with focus on predictiveness
  • Deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes
  • Drive and support innovation for operational excellence. Identify and implement operational efficiency through tools and process optimization
  • Drive standards across the network and ensure that we are fully compliant to those standards and policies
  • Monitor and manage technical communications during large-scale events
  • Identify and dive deep on recurring issues and recommend preventative solutions
  • Create and review documentation and process regarding issues, new standard operating procedures, knowledge transfer material, etc.
  • Troubleshoot networking, routing and interconnectivity issues, including troubleshooting of network device configuration and low level application interaction
  • Complete customer requests via trouble ticketing system
  • Participate in hiring and developing the best
  • Follow the existing change policies and create, review and execute complex changes. Develop and maintain change templates
  • Be a part of Global support organization that provides 7X24 escalation support on shift rotation basis. Some night and week end support may be required

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years professional experience for every 1 year of education
  • 8+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments
  • Knowledge and experience with LAN/WAN infrastructure
  • Knowledge and experience with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, MPLS
  • Knowledge and experience with network security and various secured VPN technologies
  • Knowledge and experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos
  • Experience working in a Linux/Unix environment, DNS and DHCP
  • Experience in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming
  • Knowledge in various end user devices and their network interactions
Preferred Qualifications
  • Masters in CS or related degree (Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.)
  • CCIE (lab) or equivalent certifications
  • Knowledge of network analysis fundamentals and robust troubleshooting skills; specifically, network performance analysis
  • Thorough understanding of TCP/IP networking, IP routing, Server Load Balancing, Network Security architecture and core technologies such as IP, TCP, OSPF/IS-IS, BGP, MPLS, Server Load Balancers, Firewalls, ACLs, DNS, DHCP, IPAM, LDAP, NFS, etc.
  • Experience with one or more of the following: router, server load balancer, and firewall vendor platforms: Cisco or Juniper.
  • Knowledge of network hardware and packet forwarding architectures.
  • Must be comfortable working in a Linux/Unix environment. Possess Scripting skills or have desire to learn them; specifically Python, Perl, or Shell.
  • Software development/programming experience
