Crossover is the world's #1 source of remote full-time jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Do you picture yourself working remotely on the Finance & Accounting team of one of the largest private software companies in the world? Are you smart, ambitious, and eager to learn international finance practices?

What You Will Be Doing

You will work directly in Oracle Netsuite, completing transactions, preparing reports, and interacting with internal and external partners and customers. Building quotes and invoices, purchase orders, applying incoming payments, managing cash positions, paying suppliers will be core to your role.

Accountant Key Responsibilities
  • Expertly handle the accounting of all transactions for Trilogy's vast number of entities and their respective end customers
  • Reconcile accounts, resolving discrepancies and collaborating across various Finance and non-Finance functions effectively
  • Analyze and post journals, produce data analysis and reports and assist with variance analysis
  • Review month-end close reports and call out problems you detect
  • Assemble the annual audit information for external auditors
  • As a key player in the accounting process, recommend how to improve efficiency using automation
Basic Requirements
  • Accounting, Finance, Economics or Math/Science degree.
  • 3+ years of experience in finance in a company with international operations in one or more of the following financial areas: Accounts Payable (or PTP), Accounts Receivable (or OTC), Accounting (or RTR), Banks, Controlling, Statutory Reporting, Management Reporting, Financial Systems
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication and interpersonal skills
Nice-to-have Requirements
  • ERP software experience, Oracle NetSuite or similar
  • US GAAP or IFRS knowledge
About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

What to expect next:
  • You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
  • Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
  • First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
  • Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
  • Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
  • If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Brown Bag Films, Dublin Studio is currently looking for an experienced Character Department Technical Director!


Who are we?

  • One of the top-performing animation studios operating worldwide

  • Creators of well-loved cartoons for kids and grownups in a fast-paced & energised environment

  • Award-winning dog lovers, artists, charity activists, amateur boxers (!), tech gurus, and extraordinary teammates

  • Pencil wielding, spreadsheet loving, people-focused do-ers who are passioned about their work

From go-karting to charity boxing matches, to haunted house tours, charity cycles across the country, enjoying JustEat vouchers - from sushi to pizza, competing with our fellow colleagues in growing our own sunflower to walking the Great Wall of China - loving animation means loving our crew!

    About the role:

    As a Character Department TD, you will develop and maintain tools that ensure the current and future capabilities of the designated department. Your day will include crafting bespoke rigs that add to the rig builder library, rigging, modeling tools to support the work of the character department, and producing documentation describing the functionality and workflow for tools.

    Key Responsibilities

    Responsibilities will include:

  • Developing tools for use by the riggers and character modelers that facilitate workflow

  • Documenting the tool functions and workflows, as well as supporting the rollout and feedback cycles for in-house and overseas studios

  • Creating new modules for the rig builder to support archetype and bespoke assets

  • Collaborating with pipeline on character workflow and integration of tools

  • Proactively problem solving; crafting the IT and pipeline tickets to address any technical problems in relation to the tools and workflows for the department

  • Collaborating with production on project achievements that relate to the closing out of tools and dictate development cycles

  • Ensuring that tools/workflows are user-friendly and efficient

    • Key Requirements

    Knowledge, skills, and experience:

  • Good knowledge of the pipeline of CG and a strong sense of anatomy as practical for rigging

  • Thorough understanding of the requirements of motion control and deformation for animation

  • Experience in the pipeline and in scripting (Python) for tool development, as well as groundbreaking problem-solving skills

  • Shown experience of developing tools successfully used in production

  • Highly proficient in Maya and its rigging toolset, including an excellent shown understanding of developing Maya tools

  • Extensive & broad experience working as a character rigger, supporting tools to in-house and external teams, and experience with asset tracking systems is desirable


    • Please submit your latest portfolio/reel and highlight all equivalent experience in your Cover letter.

The Air Logistics Pricing Specialist will work with the commercial team and will help win new business and retain existing customers through tender proposals process.


Your Role

You will be responsible for collating accurate Airfreight tender requests originating from sales, account management and operations. You will produce high quality tender responses to ‘Request for Quotations’ and ‘Request for Proposals’ from both existing and/or new clients.


Your Responsibilities
  • Primary responsibility for managing the responses relating to client ‘Request for Quotations’ / Proposals (RFQs & RFPs) and to support with ‘Request for Information’ (RFIs) when required
  • Proactively generating pricing solutions that differentiates KN in the marketplace

Job Description:


The Marketing Executive is responsible for supporting the team in delivering effective multi-country campaigns including creative/messaging approval, performance monitoring and optimization in order to hit our targets for new customer growth. Through highly relevant and engaging programs, the Marketing Executive will support the team and work with agencies to implement creatives across display, programmatic, social and search to drive awareness and conversion across the marketing funnel. They’ll also be given specific projects to own where they can manage delivery of an end to end campaign.


We're looking for an enthusiastic individual with lots of drive and passion to work in a fast-paced environment involving managing lots of different stakeholders and projects. Working in the small business team across different regions, they’ll need to be able to effectively manage delivery of campaigns right from campaign creative to booking media and review. Requires excellent collaboration skills to manage multiple stakeholders across several marketing, service, sales, central teams and agencies. Ability to plan, measure, track and analyse performance and be forthcoming with ideas to continuously improve results. Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment, managing multiple campaigns, stakeholders, channels and agencies at once whilst delivering against targets.


Key Responsibilities:


Key accountabilities and decision ownership:


Key accountabilities and decision ownership:


• Develop and execute ATL and demand gen multi-media marketing campaigns, ensuring revenue is maximised by driving cloud adoption in Ireland.

• Drive demand through development of end to end acquisition programmes.

• Deliver hard-hitting campaigns with messaging tailored to audiences that resonate within the Ireland market.

• On occasion, co-ordination of marketing campaigns across all channels of the marketing mix and with any involved stakeholders.

• Raising budget requests for the team.

• Monitor Irish campaigns and review results to understand campaign ROI and possible improvements.

• Deliver effective nurture programmes working with content teams to target key audiences with relevant messaging.

• Focus on driving customer advocacy and influence in the market by bringing campaigns to life with customers.

• Work in close collaboration with key internal and external stakeholders to deliver key strategic business objectives, including the delivery of successful digital programs.

• Agency and project management, ensuring cost and time effective delivery of campaigns.

• Excellent English skills in order to review and proof communications.

Skills, know-how and experience:

• Experience in B2B or B2C marketing. Any experience in a SaaS or subscription-based company creating and executing new customer acquisition digital demand generation campaigns is a plus.

• Driven individual with proven delivery of multi-touch, multi-media marketing programs, creation and implementation with the vision to go beyond the brief.

• Experience of working with multiple stakeholders and excellent communication & influencing skills to ensure delivery of aligned and effective campaigns.

• Strong organisational skills for campaign orchestration.

• Proven track record of delivering B2B and/or B2C Marketing plans.

• Demonstrate commerciality and ability to deliver on budget, KPIs, revenue and ROI – including proven lead generation.

• Mindset for optimisation and testing, with a track record of continuously improving marketing programmes and testing new media technology and execution.

• Good project and agency management experience as well as upward management to gain acceptance for plans and budgets.

• Strong customer experience with the ability to gain a strong understanding of key audiences.

• Excellent writing, proofing and editing skills across all forms of communication with a clear understanding of audiences and how to tailor effective communications to customer type.

• Knowledge of using marketing systems such CRM and marketing automation systems e.g. Salesforce, Eloqua and Workfront is a plus but not essential.

The Company
My Client, The White Hag is an Independent Craft brewery based in Ballymote, Sligo, brewing innovative and unique modern beers with a nod to ancient beers of our region.
Created by a young team of Irish entrepreneurs The White Hag exploded on the Irish brewing scene in 2014. The brewery has won a plethora of awards, including Rate Beer Best New Irish Brewery, Dublin Craft Beer Cup & Beoir Brewery and Beer of the year. We run a 35HL brew house, 14 x FV’s and all packaging in house. We are also home to an innovative crowd funded barrel programme of almost 200 barrels.
Our products are available in all great pubs, beer shops and hospitality venues across Ireland, as well as in Italy, the UK, France, Netherlands, Denmark and Germany. As we grow our committed and skilled team, we are now seeking a professional Brewmaster / Production Manager to join us here in Sligo.
The Role – Brewmaster/ Production Manager
You’ll be reporting to and working alongside the Managing Director, working in a fast paced environment, with a huge amount of autonomy & responsibility. Your primary focus will be on quality – ensuring a quality product and delivering streamlined operating procedures. Included in this will be overseeing the installation and commissioning of our new 4 vessel 35HL automated brewhouse.
You will work with all other functions in the business to ensure that you and your team coordinate production in conjunction with the company’s growth plans. You will have a continuous improvement mindset constantly seeking and identifying ways we can improve, be more efficient and ensure that a standardised, quality product is created every time.
You will be responsible for coordinating production employees from our Brewers to the cellar and packaging teams, ensuring they deliver our beer to the highest standards.
What the Role Involves

Production Operations: oversee daily production operations; assign employees to tasks, as appropriate; ensure a clean, orderly and safe production facility; raw material inventory management.
Brewing: Create and refine world class beers from wort production to final packaging.
Quality Compliance: develop, implement, and ensure compliance against standard operating procedures (SOPs).
Employee management and leadership: manage shift patterns; employee daily assignments; employee relations matters; performance reviews and assignment of team goals.
Health and Safety: ensure and work to improve, where needed, the health and safety of all employees on the production floor.
Continuous improvement: log areas of concern and work with team to devise and implement solutions.
Equipment: ensure maintenance of all production facility equipment and suggest upgrades and alternative items.
R&D: Oversee and deliver new product development with the team and develop/manage our barrel age program.

This is a summary of the role and as it evolves is likely to change.
About you

Previous working experience in a similar role within a mid to large sized Brewery.
Degree qualification or higher in Brewing, Business Management, Engineering or Food Sciences.
Additional qualifications in Quality Control and Health and Safety an advantage.
Previous experience of managing teams of employees. It would be an advantage if you have managed them through change and growth.
Excellent IT skills with particular focus on Microsoft Word, Excel, Slack, Orchestrated Beer, or similar brew software.
Demonstrable ability to work as a team and on own initiative.
Excellent organisational skills.
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrable experience of delivering continuous improvement initiatives.
Open to learning new ways of working.
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s success.
Excellent interpersonal and communication, both written and verbal, skills.

What you get
There is a huge opportunity to grow in this role alongside our business, gaining experience in FMCG industry.
Salary is c €50k plus bonus, which is negotiable commensurate with experience and skill set. You will also avail of the company pension plan and free on-site gym classes and cycle to work scheme as appropriate.
How to apply
When applying, tell us what you have done, can do and what you would like to achieve. Give us some insight into your great experiences. We prefer stories to lists.
If you’d love to apply but aren’t sure about something, or feel you don't meet all the requirements, get in touch at work@thewhitehag.com and we can discuss whether this role might be the right fit for you.
Thanks for taking time to consider working with us.

Description

Company Overview:


Innovation. Relationships. Passion. Caring. It’s who we are. It’s personal.

Edwards thrive on discovery and expand the boundaries of medical technology. We are passionate about providing innovative solutions for people fighting cardiovascular disease. It's our Credo. It takes integrity, collaboration, innovation, and focus.


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world’s leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives.


Edwards Lifesciences have been established in Ireland since 2018. With the opening of our state-of-the-art facility in Castletroy, Edwards are now going through a period of significant growth.


This position will be based in our Limerick facility.


The Position :


The Quality Inspector assesses devices in-process and upon completion, reviews accompanying documentation, and conducts audits to ensure all comply with regulatory and company guidelines, and that devices meet operational standards as designed.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


+ Perform visual, dimensional, and functional inspection of across all components, processes, and/or finished medical device products using all applicable tools and equipment such as magnifying lamp, microscope, vision inspection system.

+ Conduct operational audits and documentation reviews to ensure compliance with applicable procedures and documentation standards.

+ Must be able to work in a team environment and with minimum supervision by following detailed work instructions.

+ Perform verification of manufacturing documents with component and device drawings, which may include Geometric Dimensioning and tolerancing methodologies.


Key Competencies:


+ Good communication skills

+ Able to read, comprehend and speak English, and elementary-level understanding of numerical functions.

+ Adhere to Edwards Environmental Health and Safety and Quality guidelines as they relate to department clean room medical device manufacturing.

+ Must be able to work with minimum supervision by following detailed manufacturing instructions.

+ Work in a Team environment

+ Flexibility to work overtime to ensure smooth and continuous manufacturing processes.

+ Proven ability to complete, retain, and incorporate training coursework in the performance of new and advanced work procedures.


Requirements:


+ Leaving certificate or equivalent

+ 2+ years’ experience in a similar role


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 15,000 individuals worldwide.


For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

You're the brains behind our work.
You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom, and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it’s honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can’t come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team, and establish a long-term career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when.
Citi’s Institutional Clients Group (ICG) is looking for Graduate Software Engineer’s to join it’s Technology teams in Dublin. Our ICG Technologists support and enable the success of our trading businesses— and by utilising a broad range of technologies, our team is at the forefront of innovation. We seek to drive our systems and processes toward scalable, low-latency, high-frequency enterprise systems to support Citi and our aggressive growth strategy. Graduate Software Engineer’s participate in an intensive training program, where they receive in-depth education to learn the fundamentals of the application development engineering role, including the Capital Markets, multiple programming languages, as well as the nuances of Citi’s culture.

Our Citi Dublin Technology team builds, owns and supports many front-end, middle-tier and back-end applications that are used on Citi trading floors around the world. Numerous applications handle millions of transactions per day and have billions of dollars in trade-flow. Many teams operate on a "follow-the-sun" model and are required to have their applications running 24/7.

Function background/context:
This is an exciting opportunity to work on complex and challenging projects within Treasury and Trade Solutions Technology, collaborating with technology SMEs and business owners managing systems and business groups across the bank to develop this franchise-critical strategic platform. The core focus of this position is the enhancement and development of an application to support the bank’s treasury funding process, managed by the Treasury Funding Group based in Budapest, Hungary.

Job Purpose:
Are you an innovative thinker who can help develop creative solutions to complex business problems?

This position is as a technical business analyst within the Treasury and Trade Solutions Technology team, tasked with enhancing the banks treasury funding process for improvements in scalability and reduction of risk.

You will participate in the full agile project lifecycle of strategic technology initiatives, working with the project team, including business analysts, developers, test engineers, operational teams and other project partners within Citi.

Key Responsibilities:
You will partner with operational users, business analysts and developers to understand user and system requirements
You will work within an agile framework (scrum) to deliver results
You will write and maintain documentation, including user stories, requirements, user guides
You will take ownership of the backlog, proactively managing it
You are expected to assist the development team in understanding requirements, and user stories to more effectively implement the business needs
You are expected to assist the testing engineers in generating and executing scenarios for effective and thorough testing.

Person Specification

Essential Requirements:
Minimum of five years relevant experience as a Technology Product Owner using Agile methodologies.

Technical Skills:
We need you to have excellent technical writing skills, capable of producing high quality documents
You will have substantial experience owning and proactively managing a project backlog for a large scale project.
We expect you to display good stakeholder management skills and an ability to understand and explain technical requirements in a clear and concise manner
You will have had previous exposure to SDLC methodologies, agile (scrum) preferred
You have the ability to understand/articulate technology architectures and design and the skillset to distil complex processes into clear work flow diagrams and/or user interface wireframes
Some knowledge of an agile management tool, e.g. JIRA a benefit
You are proficient in Microsoft Office - Excel, Word, Project, Visio
Basic SQL and/or programming skills (Java/.NET) knowledge a benefit.

Business Skills:
An understanding of the Treasury Funding domain and knowledge of financial services industry is a benefit
Should be dedicated and demonstrate skills in communication, problem solving and collaboration.

Organisational:
You should be able to work in a team environment, provide status updates, identify and escalate risks and present solutions to peers and business groups.
You must be able to work with a virtual (geographically dispersed) technical scrum team
You should have good organisational and prioritisation skills
You are self-motivated, independent and take the initiative

-

Technology

:

Are you a Database Administrator looking for a new challenge?

We want to appoint a Database Administrator to manage our databases. Based in any office, it is a key role in our Digital Team and will help us deliver on our Business and Digital Strategy.

As a highly motivated and experienced Database Administrator (DBA), you will help with our growing database environment. This role is key to help maintain the high reliability and performance of our applications. We have many shared databases and an environment which is constantly growing.

:

Working within the Digital Group, the role will include the development, management and enhancement of the following key areas:

Working as a part of the database team that designs, installs, tests, maintains and controls production and non-production databases.
Apply security updates and service packs in a timely manner, making best efforts to ensure that performance, reliability, and integrity are not compromised as a result.
Database administration responsibilities include upgrades and optimization, setup and management of database resilience and backup strategies.
Perform disaster recovery planning, documentation and testing.
Manage, refine and automate regular database support activities & processes plus discover automation opportunities to replace manual processes
Investigate and resolve technical database issues. Support and assist/lead Root Cause Analysis reviews when applicable.
Ability to modify and create views, queries, stored procedures and SSIS jobs to facilitate consumption of data by multiple groups.

Key requirements

Proven expertise in DBMS (SQL and/or Oracle) and OS technologies.
Proven experience of database optimization and monitoring
Requires experience in file structures, design, retrieval and access methods and related tasks.
Proven ability in the diagnoses and troubleshooting of database errors
Proven experience creating stored procedures, views and functions
Good working knowledge of multiple database types / providers
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Broad knowledge of peripheral technologies
Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills
:
Ideally a Degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems and 4 years of Information Systems and Database Administration experience
Candidates must have an expert understanding of databases
Previous experience leveraging various toolsets for Database Administration, Performance, Reporting, Backups and monitoring
Candidates should have a strong understanding of technology and experience in applications, operating systems, networks & cloud platforms.
Strong technical aptitude and ability to research and solve complex issues independently.
Excellent numerical & analytical skills to include excellent computer literacy & comprehensive experience in system interoperability.
Excellent collaborative and people skills
Excellent written and verbal communication.

About PM Group

We are a leading International engineering, architecture, project and construction management firm. With a network of offices in Europe, Asia and the US and a multi-discipline team of over 3,300 people, we deliver complex, capital projects in the life sciences, food and beverages, mission critical/ICT, advanced manufacturing, energy and environmental sectors.

Our Vision is to be a highly valued and creative delivery partner, building a more sustainable world with our clients. To do this our people are key and is where you can play a part.

Employee-owned company, we are inclusive, committed and driven. Corporate Responsibility and Sustainability are the heart of our new 2025 business strategy. To read more in our Corporate Responsibility & Health and Safety Report 2020 click on this link Corporate Responsibility 2020

Inclusion and Diversity are core to our culture and values. Wherever we work, we commit to a culture of mutual respect and belonging by building a truly inclusive workplace rich in diverse people, talents and ideas. Valuing the contributions of all our people and respecting individual differences will sustain our growth into the future.

PM Group is committed to ensuring our hiring process is fair and accessible to all and will provide candidates with disabilities with reasonable accommodations required to participate in the recruitment process. If you require any assistance in this regard, please let us know.

JOB SUMMARY:


To perform duties as associated with the specific SOP’s for the purpose of manufacturing, inspection or packaging of Medical Devices at Lake Region Medical Limited, New Ross.


ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Employees are expected to support the quality concepts inherent in the business philosophies of Lake Region Medical Limited, including a variety of job related tasks which may not be specific to this position profile. Be an active member of the Lake Region Medical Limited team and work with all employees to develop a world class lean manufacturing system.


Accountabilities include:


+ Perform all duties as assigned by Supervisor.

+ Adhere to relevant Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Job Breakdown Sheets (JBSs).

+ Complete and comply with all documentation as required in the documentation process.

+ Carry out asset care on equipment and set up machines in job specific areas.

+ Be involved in Continuous Improvement projects

+ Comply with quality standards and GMP pertaining to production (Cleanroom Areas).

+ Comply with gowning procedure.

+ Help maintain a clean and safe working environment, ensuring high standards of housekeeping, and control of chemicals (5S).

+ Comply with the Lake Region Medical Limited behavioural standards. SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:


+ Must be able to communicate and work with people inside and outside the Department while at all times using excellent interpersonal skills and presenting a professional, friendly and courteous image of Lake Region Medical

+ Be conscientious with strong attention to detail.

+ Be quality focused with the ability to follow SOPs, and job breakdown sheets and have a diligent approach to documentation.


MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:


+ Leaving Certificate or equivalent Standard

+ Good communication skills (Oral and Written)

+ Basic P.C. skills an advantage.

+ Good timekeeping, attendance and performance record.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS:


+ Minimal as per operator role. MENTAL DEMANDS:

+ Must be a well organised individual with good interpersonal skills WORKING CONDITIONS:


+ N/A


Integer Holdings Corporation (NYSE:ITGR) is the largest medical device outsource (MDO) manufacturer in the world serving the cardiac, neuromodulation, orthopedics, vascular, advanced surgical and power solution markets. The company provides innovative, high quality medical technologies that enhance the lives of patients worldwide. In addition, it develops batteries for high-end niche applications in energy, military, and environmental markets. The company’s brands include Greatbatch Medical, Lake Region Medical and Electrochem. Additional information is available at https://integer.net .

JOB SUMMARY:


The primary purpose of this position is to facilitate the creation and implementation of a continuous improvement culture of Operational Excellence for the New Ross Site. The successful candidate will lead and support significant projects, provide coaching and lean training across the site.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


+ Develop best practice methods, workplace layout and workplace organization to gain improved Value streams, Process Flow Improvements & identify cost saving opportunities

+ To take part in and give guidance to cross-functional teams rolling out the Lean Operational Excellence initiatives throughout the Lake Region New Ross facility.

+ Coaching employees in Lean Techniques and Principles in order to develop an organization wide culture of change.

+ Deliver and teach Scientific Problem Solving Training (8 steps).


SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:


+ A thorough understanding of Lean Manufacturing Principles, Systems and Tools.

+ Strong written and oral communication skills; demonstrated ability to lead team activities; excellent problem solving skills; strong computer and presentation skills.

+ Knowledge of manufacturing operations, systems and project management.


+ Knowledge of engineering theories, methods and work measurement techniques.

+ Excellent problem solving skills with an innovative approach


MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:


+ Third level/ Master’s Degree or Diploma Lean/Industrial Engineering or Green belt in Lean or Six Sigma.

+ Experience in implementation of Lean Techniques/improvements is an advantage

Job Summary:


The primary purpose of this job is to lead the Cost Accounting function for numerous locations. This role requires strong collaboration, responsibility to follow-through with limited guidance, and the ability to assist and advise Plant management on financial and operational issues.


Accountabilities & Responsibilities:


+ Adheres to Integer’s Values and all safety, environmental, security and quality requirements including, but not limited to: Quality Management Systems (QMS), Safety, Environmental and Security Management Systems, U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, company policies and operating procedures, and other regulatory requirements.


+ Performs all cost accounting functions for specific manufacturing sites (NRO, GLL, PEN) as directed by the Director of Cost Accounting.

+ Responsible for maintenance and accuracy of inventory standards, revaluation reporting, and adjustments.

+ Coordinates and ensures that all significant production variances are properly analyzed and accounted for.

+ Prepares monthly closing entries and schedules supporting the monthly operating and inventory statements.

+ Addresses inventory discrepancies or variances and advises plant management.

+ Coordinates quarterly slow moving and discrepant inventory analysis with sites.

+ Reviews gross profits for trends and/or costing problems.

+ Leads weekly reviews of key metrics with sites

+ Liaises with AP to ensure accuracy of raw materials/subcontract portion of Accounts Payable and related Inventory transactions.

+ Analyzes cycle count adjustments and highlights concerns

+ Provides reports, schedules and other documents as required for external auditor’s year-end inventory observation and other audit procedures.

+ Supports forecasting and budgeting processes

+ Learns the Oracle ERP system to be identified as the subject matter expert for Cost Accounting

+ Ensures timely completion of responsibilities

+ Prepares documentation of task procedures and update as necessary.

+ Supports SOX compliance and ensure compliance with established internal controls.

+ Performs other duties as required.


Education & Experience:


+ Minimum Education: BS Accounting or Finance. Higher level degree or profession certification preferred

+ Minimum Experience: Must have 5 + years’ experience in an accounting or finance role with a preference for experience within and ERP manufacturing environment.


Knowledge & Skills:


+ Special Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills.


+ Specialized Knowledge: Strong working knowledge of GAAP. Oracle 12R. Advanced Excel.

Description

Document Controller

IE–Offaly–Tullamore, Vacancy ID2021-39267


Career Home › Job Search Results ›Document Controller


Changing lives. Building careers.


Integra LifeSciences, a world leader in medical technology, is dedicated to limiting uncertainty for surgeons, so they can concentrate on providing the best patient care. Integra offers innovative solutions in orthopedic extremity surgery, neurosurgery, reconstructive and general surgery, and regenerative wound care.


Founded in 1989 Integra is headquartered in Plainsboro, New Jersey and has more than 4,000 employees worldwide. Integra’s common stock is listed on The NASDAQ Stock Market under the symbol “IART.”


RESPONSIBILITIES


Responsibilities


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:


+ Documentation management, including processing, distribution and filing of all documents associated with medical devices using the Integra Document Management System

+ Initiation of change requests for new and amended documents.

+ Routing of controlled documents through the approval and implementation process.

+ Issue and maintenance of controlled documentation.

+ Report to Management on document Control metrics as required.

+ Carry out other tasks or responsibilities as directed by the QA Compliance Supervisor


QUALIFICATIONS


What are we looking for?


Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE


+ Minimum of Level 6 qualification (Business Studies or Administration), or relevant experience in a similar administrative type role in a regulated Industry a distinct advantage.

+ Working with electronic documentation (filing, tracking etc.)

+ Have an understanding of archiving systems and methodology and electronic document managing systems.

+ Demonstrated understanding of criticality of attention to detail, data accuracy and document control and ability to meet deadlines

+ Must have the ability to communicate effectively with management and fellow peers

+ Experience with Oracle / Agile a distinct advantage


PERSONAL COMPETENCIES


+ Good planning and organizational skills

+ Good interpersonal and communication skills

+ Ability to work independently with moderate supervision

+ Ability to work in a team environment

+ Experience with Microsoft Office – Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, and Outlook


OUR PRODUCTS


We are proud of our 25 year heritage as a leader in regenerative medicine. Today, our scientific innovation and diverse product portfolio continue to help patients and surgeons around the world.


OUR CULTURE


We have an entrepreneurial, small company feel, yet deliver big company results. Your ideas – big and small – are welcome here. We embrace change and reward our people who are committed to making Integra a stronger company.


OUR VALUES


We believe how we do things is as important as what we do. Our Values guide how we work and how we act towards our customers, patients and each other every day. We value Our People, Integrity, Excellence, Embracing Change, Decisiveness and Teamwork.

Our busy Contact Centre Office in our Galway office are looking for a confident engaging Customer Service & Sales Advisor to join our team, on a permanent basis.

We are looking for highly motivated, resilient individuals. Those who are willing to understand the individual needs of our customers, with an ability to get to the real reason for the call and help us deliver excellent service to every customer.

You will receive 4 weeks initial training to learn about our products and our customers as well as ongoing and continued support, with regular 1-2-1s with management to encourage your growth and development in the role.

Are you ready to join a world-renowned business and a highly energised Team with flexible working arrangements?

We do have part time roles available, please tell us what hours YOU want to work but you need be available for 4 weeks full time training when you start.

As Customer Service & Sales Advisor, you will:

  • Handle a variety of inbound calls regarding Motor & Home queries while following a script

  • Build rapport with each customer by understanding their needs

  • Take ownership and resolve each situation to the customer’s satisfaction.

  • Make follow up calls to customers and connect with internal departments

  • Deal with customer complaints and log appropriately

  • Ensure all systems and regulatory procedures are compliantly followed

  • Protect our customers and Aviva by asking appropriate questions and escalating when appropriate

Skills & Experienced Required

  • Experience of working in a customer service environment (face to face or telephone) with an excellent telephone manner

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

  • Ability to multi-task

  • Ability to handle challenging conversations

  • Positive attitude and strong desire to meet customer’s needs

  • Good attention to detail

  • Flexible approach towards change

  • A desire to develop and progress within the role and company

  • Experience within the insurance industry would be advantageous

  • An APA or CIP qualification would be a bonus!

What will you get for this role?

  • Competitive salary depending on skills, experience and qualifications

  • Smart-working and flexi time

  • Weekends to spend with your family and friends as this role is Monday – Friday

  • Paid holiday allowance of 25 days plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

  • Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products through “My Aviva Extras” plus discounts for Friends and Family (some exclusions apply)

  • An active sports and social club

  • Generous defined contribution pension scheme

  • Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme, Dental care schemes

  • A full training programme to support you in your journey to learn about our products and customers

  • Extensive learning opportunities through our online learning portal "Aviva University"

  • In house learning opportunities

  • Career Progression Pathways

Additional Information

This role is within the scope of the Central Bank of Ireland's Minimum Competency Code.

One of Aviva’s core values is Care More, and this is brought to life through the flexible ways we like to work. This may include working from home some of the time, or flexible work schedules to accommodate parent and carer responsibilities, further studies and hobbies.

Our diversity and inclusion policies and initiatives are shaping an environment where everyone feels welcome regardless of age, disability, race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, religion, culture, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, pregnancy, maternity or those with other caring responsibilities. Our approach helps to ensure that Aviva is a place which values difference and provides equal opportunities for all.

We prefer all applications to be submitted online, however if you require an alternative method of applying please contact Manisha Dinesh in the Resourcing team on +44 07393 803498 and manisha.dinesh@aviva.com

Job Details


Who we are
With TCS you will be exposed to the future of technology, work with some of the brightest global minds in the industry, and support many of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. Recognized as an employer of choice, having won numerous awards in the UK and Ireland, TCS is a fast-growing global IT powerhouse at the forefront of innovation and transformation.

What we need
We are looking for an Incident Manager in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Purpose and primary objectives:
Manage overall IT operations and support.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Accountable for all incidents (including major incidents), ensuring end-to-end ownership and accountability throughout the life of the incident in coordination with MIM team in London.
  • Driving investigations to identify the root cause of Problems, mitigating actions, and service improvement initiatives.
  • Engagement with application/Infrastructure/3rd party supports teams to ensure all problems have been addressed and progressed.
  • Send regular/periodic communication on major/high-priority incidents to the senior management team.
  • Owning the Ops Bridge/Command Centre teams and ensure there are no operational issues and escalations
  • Accountable and responsible to resolve the service desk or EUC escalations.
  • Acting as an escalation manager to expedite incident resolution & consult with Executive Leadership for decision guidance, as necessary.
  • Excellent analytical and trend analysis skills.
  • Understanding of service design and service transition processes.
  • Produce and publishing daily, weekly and monthly incident/problem reports & metrics based on the requirement.
  • Continually improve service quality & process to ensure customer service levels are met.
  • Expected to work with offshore teams in managing day-to-day operations.

Key Skills/Knowledge:
  • Proven experience in IT in a large corporate environment.
  • In-depth working knowledge of service management processes (Incident, Problem and Change Management).
  • IT skills to understand and articulate infrastructure and application problems to stakeholders as appropriate.
  • Certified in ITIL (Foundation) - V3/4.
  • Excellent interpersonal, Negotiating, client-facing, communication, assertive, and team-leading/team-member skills.
Experience Required:
  • Airline Domain knowledge or relevant industry experience
  • Good Knowledge of monitoring tools such as Nagios, BES, Tivoli, Splunk, Dynatrace, Datadog, Cloud watch.
  • Ability to deliver in a high-pressure, dynamic environment working to tight SLAs
  • Good Knowledge on ServiceNow ITSM tool & Reporting module.
  • Possess CompTIA Network+ CompTIA CySA+ & foundation certification in Linux or certified in IT operations & infrastructure technology toolset.

Special Working Conditions: Travel to London and India may be required.

What you get
TCS is one of the fastest-growing companies in the UK & Ireland. Joining TCS at this pivotal time will expose you to numerous domains and projects. We are consistently voted number one in customer satisfaction and Top Employer in the UK and globally.
We provide competitive salaries which include pension, health care, life insurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources, and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Our internal volunteering and social network allowing you to take at least one paid volunteering day per year, as well as take part in social networks, health, and wellness initiatives such as fit4life and purpose4life internal sports events, we also sponsor marathons internationally, initiatives in mental health, LGBTQ among other diversity and inclusion awareness and support.

Explore more about Tata Consultancy Services - who we are, what we do for our customers, our people, and our communities.

Description

Description

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet.

Who we are?

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than one billion views and downloads and two million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Data Developer with experience in business intelligence and analytics development to join our Data Architecture and Engineering team.

You will work on design and development of analytics and reporting services.

To be successful in this role, you need to have strong SQL skills, good knowledge of data systems, experience of developing data queries, comfort dealing with complex technical problems, and the desire and ability to learn and get things done in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Job Functions

  • Create reliable and optimised data queries to collect, transform, analyse, and visualise data.
  • Create comprehensive data procedures for enterprise-level data analytics.
  • Design and develop scalable data processes to consume and analyse complex data from different data sources.
  • Take part in designing, building, and supporting enterprise analytics solutions.
  • Collaborate with all technology and business functions to understand requirements and produce clear specification and documentation.
  • Resolve data issues, troubleshoot system problems, and as needed, help clients and colleagues with accessing, understanding, and analysing data.
  • Adhere to and take part in enhancement of data management standards, guidelines, and policies.
  • Work in a collaborative environment—meetings, planning and review sessions, and iterative development.

Desired Skills and Experience

Knowledge and Technical Skills

  • Solid understanding of relational, non-relational, and multi-dimensional data models and systems.
  • Strong experience in querying, transforming, integrating, and analysing complex data sources using T-SQL, emphasising accuracy, efficiency, and performance.
  • Experience in design and development of data analytics and reporting solutions, using Microsoft SQL Server Tools and Services.
  • Experience with data development tools and environments, Visual Studio and SQL Server Data Tools.
  • Experience with data manipulation and analysis, using Excel and Power Query.
  • Experience with analytics and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, and SSRS.
  • Experience with source control and repository systems, TFVC and/or Git.
  • Familiarity with .NET Framework and programming in C# and/or Visual Basic .NET—having experience is a plus.
  • A minimum of two years of experience in a similar role.

General Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to solve problems using a balance of technical competence, creativity, and pragmatism.
  • Highly detail-oriented, prioritising quality and accuracy.
  • Ability to work independently and within a team, and effectively collaborate with development, operations, and business teams.
  • Highly motivated, self-directed, and able to handle multiple tasks or projects simultaneously.
  • Experience working with Agile methodologies in small development teams as well as ability to multitask while working independently or on a team with shifting priorities and deadlines.
  • Well-developed time-management skills.
  • Out-of-the-box thinking and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good command of the English language.

Benefits

  • 25 days' vacation per year and 4 well-being days (pro rata and expiring each year on 31st of December).
  • Participation into the company's annual bonus scheme.
  • Access to the latest equipment and international working environment.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Remote working options available

How to apply

Please submit your application in English.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Job Description

Technical Writer

What you will do


The Information Developer II is an entry level technical documentation position. Working under the direct supervision of more senior technical writing staff the Information Developer II develops simple standalone documents, or portions of more complex documents.


How you will do it

  • Impact : Routine creation of technical documentation or sections of technical documentation including installation instructions, operators manuals, or service manuals.
  • Knowledge: Good writing skills and proficient command of the English language.
  • Problem Solving: Can work through simple issues. Knows when to escalate and get help.
  • Supervision Received: Direct supervision by more senior technical documentation staff and technical communications management.
  • Customer Focus: Must be able to take clear direction. Able to read specifications and, with guidance, transform them into effective technical publications
  • Interpersonal Skills: Ability to interact with senior staff as well as engineers from around the world. Adapts readily to changing work demands; maintains composure under pressure. Works effectively with others, shares information, demonstrates integrity and honors commitments.

What we look for
Required Qualifications ndash; Education, Skills amp; Experience

  • 0-2 years of writing experience.
  • Educational background in English, Journalism, Technical Communications, Languages, Software amp; Hardware Engineering, Multimedia or Science.
  • Ability to create and modify technical documentation
  • Under the direct supervision of more senior staff create simple publications or modify existing publications
  • Understand the operation of security and fire products and document their operation
  • Document formatting and layout
  • Work with a variety of media, including written documentation, web pages, help files, and digital media
  • Basic technical illustration

Preferred Qualifications ndash; Education, Skills amp; Experience

  • Technical Writing - Ability to create readable technical documentation under the direction of senior staff
  • Documentation software - Understands how to use documentation software (minimally Microsoft Word, ideally more sophisticated packages, including DITA, Arbortext, Framemaker, MadCap flare, etc.) to create well formatted documentation
  • Document management - Entry level understanding of document and revision control
  • Technical Illustration - Ability to create readable technical illustrations under the direction of senior staff using Corel Draw, Adobe Photoshop and Visio (or equivalents)

Job Description

Employee Relations Advisor

What will you do


This position is part of the EMEA HR Shared Services team which provides direct support to company employees, other HR groups and company management by handling a variety of HR-related duties across our EMEA region. We are looking for an experienced HR professional to join our team to operate as an Employee Relations advisor to the UKamp; Ireland businesses, delivering consistent advice and coaching regarding HR practices to ensure business leaders receive a best in class HR service.


How will you do it

  • Provide the first line employee relations advisory service to all UKamp;I management and employees
  • Proactively build the reliance of the ERA roles to ensure activities are removed from the ER Partners and resolved in the SSC
  • Provide advice and guidance on the management of disciplinary cases, expected outcome up to and including final written warning (attendance in hearings where complexity or lack of competence exists)
  • Provide guidance and attend, where required, grievance meetings assist with the outcome letters if needed
  • Assist the ER Partners with the required actions around restructuring to ensure achievement with timelines, this may include attendance in some meetings.
  • Assist the ER Partners where necessary in preparing ET Bundles, HR1 forms, COT3 submissions.
  • Provide advice and interpret HR policies as appropriate. Flag to ER Partners where policies require updating for best practice purposes
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the business, HR trends and employment legislation and pro-actively use knowledge to provide excellent customer focused, value add, service provision.
  • Regular liaison with the wider HR team to share ideas, best practice and ensure team is working towards common HR and business goals.
  • Undertake due diligence actions in acquisitions and TUPE processes where requested by the ER Partners.
  • Develop and implement a case management log which works alongside the ER tracker document, providing statistics in line with agreed timings


Qualifications

What we look for

  • ExtensiveER/HR experience (preferably ER oriented experience) and knowledge of UK Employment legislation required. Ireland Labour law knowledge also desirable.
  • Roles requiring interaction with management at various levels
  • Experience in a similar large multi-site, complex commercial environment.
  • Understanding of how to work in a unionized environment
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Able to develop good levels of commercial awareness
  • Self-motivated and enthusiastic
  • Flexible, accommodating and positive approach
  • Takes full accountability for own performance and development
  • Demonstrates competence in a constantly evolving environment
  • Demonstrates a structured and organsied approach
  • Degree in Human Resources Management preferable

Who weare
Johnson Controls is powered by your talent. We are the power behind the customer mission. Together we are building a world thatrsquo;s safe, comfortable and sustainable. Our diverse global team creates innovative, integrated solutions to make cities more connected, buildings more intelligent and environments more comfortable and secure. We are all about improving outcomes for our partners. Tomorrow needs your talent. Tomorrow needs you.Soletrsquo;s talk today.

Description

• 5+ years of experience directly mission critical facilities, including but not limited to data center infrastructure.
• Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or relevant discipline.
• 3+ years of commissioning experience.
• Certification or training specific to Electrical Testing Agency, Regional mechanical industry leader, or Commissioning specific education courses.
Job summary
The CCE works alongside Colocation stakeholders globally to drive standards, resilience, quality control, and improvements in our Colocation facilities. They collaborate with AWS global design engineering, field engineering, construction, controls, procurement, and product teams to set clear, consistent standards for Colocation commissioning. For program contribution, the CCE defines, evaluates, and manages the Colocation quality in accordance with AWS design and implementation standards. During commissioning execution, the CCE supports vendors, contractors, and other teams involved in the commissioning of systems such as:
· Medium voltage (MV) and low voltage (LV) power systems
· Generators
· Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS)
· HVAC Systems
· Chilled Water Systems
· Building Management Systems (BMS)
· Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS)
· Testing, Adjusting, Balancing (TAB)
· Pumps and Hydronic systems
· Fire Alarm/Fire Suppression Systems

The CCE provides multi-discipline input into designing, test script development, and project planning. They successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously, which includes attending Factory Witness Testing (FWT), overseeing equipment and system testing, and properly reporting and escalating issues. To continuously improve the quality of the Colocation program, the CCE continuously ensures compliance with AWS standards, provides project status updates, and communicates lessons learned to appropriate stakeholders.


Key job responsibilities
• Work with our global partners to standardize Colocation commissioning processes.
• Review and provide feedback on mechanical, electrical, and plumbing (MEP), and fire systems design and operations documents.
• Collaborate with engineering, delivery, and operations teams to validate installation and operation of electrical/mechanical/fire suppression/controls systems.
• Review and audit Colocation provider design and operations plans when applicable.
• Work with regional Colocation engineering stakeholders to review and accept proposed changes to site-specific infrastructure in accordance with our AWS standards.
• Drive key global Colocation initiatives.
• Document and manage project activities and program standards.


A day in the life

Description

· A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution

· Excellent design, implementation, and skills combined with a proven documentation methodology.

· 2+ years’ experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks

· 3+ years of experience with major routing protocols

· 3+ years of experience with routing and switching hardware from major vendors including Juniper and Cisco

· 2+ years of experience building solutions using AWS technologies

· 2+ years of experience in a high level programming language

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Ability to work shifts - 10 hours a day for 4 days per week, including one weekend day (Saturday or Sunday)

· Ability to work oncall - during the normal business hours and/or outside of business hours.
Job summary
Amazon OpsTech Engineering is looking for a highly motivated Development Manager for our Wireless Reliability team. The Reliability Engineering team owns ensuring our wireless products and designs are highly available and reliable for our customers. We identify, mitigate, and ultimately resolve risks within our network, validate solutions and operational readiness, and partner to deliver scalable software solutions that reduce TOIL or enable greater use of human effort. The Develop Manager develops the networks for all of Amazon’s fulfillment business supporting retail operations. If you are passionate to help build next generation networks that Robotics and IoT in retail space, this is the role.

As Engineering manager you will be responsible for leading a team of experienced development engineers and have ultimate responsibility for global, end-to-end delivery of one of the key areas, including architecture, capacity management, implementation, operational standards, process management, and At Amazon, we expect our technical leaders to be strong engineers who can dive deep and get involved in addition to being strong managers.

As a manager within the Networking team you will be expected to drive operational excellence in everything we do. This includes creating sane processes, procedures and to improve efficiency in our day-to-day tasks and projects. You will work closely on supporting our internal customers and ensuring that their needs and issues are being addressed.

Network Development
As an engineering manager you are responsible to deliver highly scalable network architectures that are globally deploy-able

Network Measurement
As a Network Engineering manager you will be expected to drive quality into the metrics we report to assist us in focusing on the areas that give us the best ROI. This includes measurement of our project plans, build schedules, issues, and cycle times.

Performance Management/Team Health
You will own all facets of performance and career management for the team. Regular one-on-one meetings with all team members are required. You will be expected to provide both technical and soft skill mentoring in order to maintain a well-rounded, truly innovative organization. This includes project management, quality audits and coordination of training sessions with senior-level engineers.

Incident/Change Management
You will be integral to developing and improving incident and change management within the Networking space. Responsibilities include driving initiatives regarding improvements to existing tools & processes and providing feedback on new practices & procedures in order to scale with the rapid expansion of the Amazon platform and customer base.

Recruiting and Hiring
You will take the lead in hiring quality personnel who not only fit the needs of the current organization but also will allow the team to scale with platform and service growth. You will coordinate with Amazon and external recruiting staff to evaluate potential candidates, participate in initial phone screens and provide relevant guidance and feedback during on-site interview loops. You will also be responsible for ensuring that proper training takes place for all new hires.

This is an amazing opportunity in terms of responsibility, interesting challenges and high visibility. We truly are looking for the highest quality candidates, so you should expect a rigorous interview process.

Description

· BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent related field
· 3 years or more of demonstrated experience with a focus in areas such as systems, network, and/or application security
· 2 plus years experience on a Security team, especially experience coordinating responses to security incidents.
· Proficiency with one high-level programming or scripting languageAmazon is looking for a passionate Security Incident Response Engineer who can respond to security issues across the largest cloud provider in the world. You thrive in high-pressure situations, and think like both an attacker and defender, while working through the entire incident response lifecycle. You’ll be working in a global team environment where clear and accurate communication and collaboration on security issues is critical.

In this role you’ll be conducting security monitoring and response activities for the Amazon internal network. We value broad and deep technical knowledge, specifically in the fields of operating system security, network security, cryptography, software security, malware analysis, forensics, security operations, incident response, and emergent security intelligence. We don’t expect you to be an expert in all of the domains mentioned above, but we do expect you to be excited to learn about them!

You’ll apply your creative and critical problem solving skills to quickly design and build tooling that enables programmatic automation at a massive scale. You must have a passion for engineering solutions to complex security challenges, and recognize and fill gaps in capabilities. Above all, you should be passionate about information security, the threat landscape and security automation and tooling.

About us

Inclusive Team Culture
We embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentor ship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

Description

5+ years of experience in leading systems development and/or software
teams
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills and an ability to interact efficiently with peers and customers
· Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software
development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Preferred qualifications
Job summary
The Infrastructure Engineering team is looking for a talented and motivated
Systems Development Engineering Manager. AWS has fundamentally
changed the concept of servers and how they’re created and managed. We
are building the next generation of managed edge compute based on Linux
OS distributions and AWS services for use in Amazon Fulfillment and Logistic
businesses. The edge compute team provides a predictable operating
environment and consulting for software teams so they can focus on their
application rather than on the device on which it runs. If you enjoy
developing people, meeting with internal customers and developing products
that exceed their expectations, and understand how your efforts directly
contribute to global company-wide initiatives, this is the position for you.
We have a team culture that encourages innovation and we expect team
members and management alike to take high degree of ownership for their
program vision and execution of ideas. You will do much more than lead a
team of Systems and Software Development Engineers in writing code,
launching new features, introducing new hardware and triaging problems.
You will set the standard for automation and working at scale, dive deep into
technical issues, and work diligently to improve the customer experience.
You are happiest when you are working with empowered, world-class
engineers to meet world-class challenges. Finally, with your strong
ownership bias, you have an infectious desire to continually improve how
things are done.
In this role you will have the opportunity to:
· Lead a team of experienced System and Software Development Engineers.
· Meet with stakeholders regularly to ensure your solutions are meeting the
needs of the business.
· Participate in strategic planning, brainstorm improvements, and work to
uphold the quality bar across the organization.
· Define and drive projects and report on their progress
· Drive continual improvement in systems operations through tool building
and automation
· Work in an environment where operational excellence is the first priority,
and where automation of every manual process is imperative

Description

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
• Excellent design, implementation, and skills combined with a proven documentation methodology.
• 3+ years’ experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks
• 3+ years of experience with major routing protocols, specifically and OSPF
• 3+ years of experience with routing and switching hardware from major vendors including Juniper and Cisco
• In addition to providing top-tier management and support of Amazons vast infrastructure, Engineers are expected to build or enhance tools, develop best practices, refine operational procedure and constantly think pro-actively and with innovation
• Ability to work on a diverse team with a diverse range of coworkers
Job summary
Come join a creative team of Operations Technology Engineers that builds the wired and wireless networks that power Amazon fulfillment centers and transportation sites worldwide. These networks are used by hundreds of thousands of associates, relied upon by operators of industry-leading fulfillment and transportation systems, and play a critical role in the delivery of shipments to Amazon retail customers.
We are looking for a Network Development Engineers to provide technical thought leadership in the design of our next-generation networks. As we look to the future, our networks will support an ecosystem of robotics, industrial IoT, sensors, drones, and mobile devices. You are comfortable with making data motivated decisions, and iterating on designs that may fail at the outset to ultimately deliver robust systems that elegantly scale. Information security and network reliability are at the core of your thought processes, and you are respected as an influencer.
In this role you will also operate the largest fulfillment network in the world, and provide guidance to and mentoring to network support teams to develop their skills and reinforce best practices. Network reliability is critical to Amazon Operations, and your responsibilities will include driving root cause resolution of network events most impact-full to the business.
The OpsTech NetEng team has broad scope supporting multiple business units globally, from the smallest delivery stations in emerging markets, to the most advanced automated fulfillment centers in North America, Japan, and Europe. As a result, this group enjoys variety in both short-term innovation and long-term strategic projects. This is a unique opportunity that will enable you to grow your skills as an engineer, have a lasting impact on Amazon’s fulfillment networks for years to come.

Description

· Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
· A minimum of 5 years of Technical Program Management experience.
· A minimum of 7 years of relevant development and technical design experience.
· Problem-solving skills and the abilities to analyse quantitatively, scope technical requirements and prioritise program deliverables.
· Presentation and written communication skills are essential, as is the ability to build partnerships with senior leaders across a variety of groups throughout Amazon.Job summary
People eXperience and Technology seeks a Sr Technical Program Manager (TPM) to own the ongoing development and international deployment of an innovative, customer-obsessed software solution.

You like to get paid, right? Everyone does! Come join our team and drive the building of products that ensure Amazon's hourly employees can focus on delighting our customers and are paid on time and accurately.

You should possess a strong program management background. You will have demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and will have a well-rounded technical background in full-stack technologies. You will be expected to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or conflicting priorities. As a TPM, you will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. Above all, success is predicated on meticulous organisational skills, high attention to detail, spot-on judgement, and ultimately an unbending predisposition that vigorously advocates for the customer. #techleader



Key job responsibilities
You will be responsible for scoping and delivering large, complex projects end-to-end for our new initiatives. Responsibilities include refining business and systems requirements, driving project schedules from design to release, communicating to stakeholders and senior leaders, and managing production launches. You will lead and coordinate design and implementation efforts between teams and develop optimal solutions. You will gain a deep technical understanding of our systems and be able to speak to them and influence their future design. You will be expected to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimise time-to-market. You will clearly communicate goals, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote project teams.

About the team

Time and Attendance (TAA) serves Amazon employees across more than a dozen business lines in 19 countries (and counting). We are an entrepreneurial team tackling complex problems that Amazon has not yet solved at scale. We are creating fundamentally improved ways for employees to record time, automate policy and reduce pay defects. TAA has a balance of start-up vision and operational excellence, technical complexity and clear product definition, and has global scope across almost every Amazon business line.
