ABOUT US

Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:

· Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
· Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
· Interact with leading engineers around the world.
· Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
· Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services.
· Drive customer communication during critical events.
· Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
· Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
· Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.

WHY AWS SUPPORT?

· First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
· On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
· Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives.
· Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
· Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.
We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
· Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
· As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.
· Meet Allan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHJVvrHo8E0

The Cloud Support Security Engineer role supports our services that have a focus on enabling security specialists using AWS Services including Identity Access Management (IAM), GuardDuty, Shield, Key Management Service (KMS), CloudTrail, CloudHSM, Inspector etc. Within AWS, security is job zero, and we believe that solid security practices are the foundation for using the Cloud. We are looking for candidates who are passionate about working with products targeted for security professionals.

Description

· Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years professional experience for every 1 year of education
· 3+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments.
· Experience with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF
· Experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos.
· Experience working in a Linux/Unix environment
· Experience in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.Amazon is the world’s most customer centric company and is looking to hire highly motivated, best-in-class Network Engineers to help deploy and automate one of the world’s largest and complex networks. With Amazon Web Services, our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform to the world. Our customers demand the highest quality and reliability for their services. We are expanding at a tremendous rate it is our responsibility to maintain quality and reliability while developing innovative ways to automate the scaling of our network.


The Amazon Direct Connect team delivers solutions that make it easy for customers to establish a dedicated network connection from their premises to the AWS cloud. These connections help to reduce network costs, increase bandwidth throughput, and provide a more consistent network experience than Internet-base. This is increasingly achieved through automation, a 24x7 team, and a deep understanding of multiple fabrics to never leave a packet behind. There is an operational on-call rota in this team.


As a Network Development Engineer working within Amazon Direct Connect team, you will:

-Provide critical on-shift network operations support to Amazon customers to diagnose and respond to large-scale networking events
- Support and maintain our next generation data-center networks
- Deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes
- Partner with our broader Technical Operations organization to reduce operational burden
- Work closely with our Network Engineering & Deployment teams to ensure operational readiness for new deployments
- Drive standards across the network and ensure that we are fully compliant to those standards and policies
- Participate and drive impact mitigation during large-scale events utilizing an established Event Management process
- Drive event deep dives for large-scale events, deliver high-quality documentation for the events and drive corrective actions to completion
- Improve our detection mechanisms by designing and implementing new alerts.
- Identify and troubleshoot recurring platform issues and ability to effectively engage with mid and senior-level engineering teams for full resolution
- Create and review documentation and process regarding recurring issues, new standard operating procedures, knowledge transfer material, etc.
- Troubleshoot networking, routing and interconnectivity issues, including troubleshooting of network device configuration and low level application interaction
- Identify and drive opportunities to automate repeatable networking tasks through creation and maintenance of scripts and tools
- Effectively contribute towards hiring and developing others in the team.
- Provide critical on-shift network operations support to Amazon customers to diagnose and respond to large-scale networking events
- Support and maintain our next generation data-center networks

We expect candidate to be truly innovative, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, strong project management and time management skills and has a successful track record of designing simple, scalable solutions and troubleshooting complex network problems and delivering innovative solutions. The candidate should be committed to creative problem solving, collaborate with team members and focus on getting things done.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Description

A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.
Experience supporting enterprise level network infrastructure.
5+ years managing networking support teams or engineering teams.
7+ years managing technical teams.Job summary
Amazon is looking for a Network Operations Manager to lead a team of highly skilled Engineers in our Infrastructure Operations group. This team is the escalation point of contact for all critical infrastructure related issues in Amazon Fulfillment Centers and Amazon Logistics sites globally. The support provided by this team has global reach and impacts all first, middle and last mile business units.

As a Network Operations Manager, you will be responsible for end-to-end problem management for our IT infrastructure, including coordinating with other engineering and support organizations to drive continuous improvement and root cause. At Amazon, we ask our technical managers to be strong engineers who can dive deep and get involved in addition to being strong managers. We are looking for managers with a builder mentality that will help our team use automation, tooling and other intelligent methods to improve the customer experience.

Responsibilities:
Operational Excellence
As a leader at Amazon you are expected to drive operational excellence in everything we do. This includes leading your team as they find ways to build solutions to problems instead of fixing the same problems over and over. Find ways to use existing tools to better our customers experience or work within your team and with peers to build creative new solutions that improve availability and reduce impact.

Network Measurement
You will be expected to drive quality into the metrics we use to make sure our business is healthy, our team is engaged, and find where we have opportunities to improve our scaling and efficiency. We use data to find the problems affecting our availability and work collaboratively with other teams to fix them for the long term.

Performance Management/Team Health
You will own all facets of performance and career growth for the team. Regular one-on-one meetings with all team members will help you stay connected. Providing technical and ‘soft skill’ mentoring to your team will help you maintain a well-rounded, world-class organization. This also includes project management, quality audits, and coordination of training sessions with senior-level.


This is an amazing opportunity in terms of responsibility, interesting challenges and high visibility.

Description

· Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years professional experience for every 1 year of education
· 8+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments
· Knowledge and experience with LAN/WAN infrastructure
· Knowledge and experience with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, MPLS
· Knowledge and experience with network security and various secured VPN technologies
· Knowledge and experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos
· Experience working in a Linux/Unix environment, DNS and DHCP
· Experience in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming
· Knowledge in various end user devices and their network interactions
We're a company of pioneers. It's our job to make bold bets and we get our energy from inventing on behalf of customers. Success is measured against the possible, not the probable. For today’s pioneers, that’s exactly why there’s no place on Earth they’d rather build than Amazon.

We are seeking a pioneer to help build a world class support infrastructure for our fulfillment and transportation teams. Does providing creative support for complex technology problems motivate you? Amazon is looking for a Network Development Engineer with deep understanding of local area, wide area and wireless networking, scripting, multiple networking protocols, packet capture, security and monitoring to support the Infrastructure Operations team.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively. The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and automation. They will have experience participating in proactive engineering, network optimization and operational network support for a large-scale service provider or enterprise environment. The successful candidate will be expected to provide high quality top-tier network escalation support for complex issues and drive the innovation for simplicity and sustainability of the Amazon’s Fulfilment Center Network worldwide. As a technical leader he/she will manage complex stakeholder relationships with both technical team and management. A passion for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is required. High level of ownership and bias-for-action is required to be successful in this role.

Roles and Responsibilities
· Provide on-shift network escalation support for critical and complex network issues
· Dive Deep on the high severity incidents and participate in root cause analysis
· Automate select network administration tasks through creation and maintenance of scripts and tools
· Work closely with our Network Engineering teams to ensure fast, smooth roll-out of new designs and products
· Partner with our broader Technical operations organization to reduce operational burden
· Support in organizational transformation from reactive to proactive with focus on predictiveness
· Deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes
· Drive and support innovation for operational excellence. Identify and implement operational efficiency through tools and process optimization
· Drive standards across the network and ensure that we are fully compliant to those standards and policies
· Monitor and manage technical communications during large-scale events
· Identify and dive deep on recurring issues and recommend preventative solutions
· Create and review documentation and process regarding issues, new standard operating procedures, knowledge transfer material, etc.
· Troubleshoot networking, routing and interconnectivity issues, including troubleshooting of network device configuration and low level application interaction
· Complete customer requests via trouble ticketing system
· Participate in hiring and developing the best
· Follow the existing change policies and create, review and execute complex changes. Develop and maintain change templates

Description

· 6+ years years of industry experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar design-related role.
· An online portfolio UX work.
· Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Do you want to want to be self-directed? Do you strive to continuously improve your skills at something that matters? Do you yearn to contribute to something larger than yourself? We started in a garage, but we're not there anymore. Success and scale bring broad responsibility.

We want our customers to be productive and efficient, whether they are beginners, generalists, or experts. Mistakes are part of learning, but we adjust quickly and tackle risks upfront. We strive to acquire deeper knowledge of (1) our customers, (2) our data, (3) our business and stakeholders, and (4) our industry.

Your work will impact the customer experience of Amazon Keyspaces, a scalable, highly available, and managed Apache Cassandra–compatible database service. AWS customer can use Amazon Keyspaces to store information about devices for Internet of Things (IoT) applications or player profiles for games. They can also use Amazon Keyspaces to store large volumes of time-series data, such as entries in a log file or the message history for a chat application.

Join a productive, high performing and diverse environment. Are you ready for what's next?

About our design team
We are a highly focused design team, dedicated to the UX design of AWS Databases. Our portfolio includes RDS, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, QLDB, Keyspaces and Timestream. We support the AWS Database initiatives, work on team and personal growth goals and contribute to the AWS UX design organization. The team is a mix of experienced Amazonians and new members with startup and enterprise backgrounds.

About our business
AWS Databases are purpose-built, fully managed, and expand to multiple use cases such us: CRM, high-traffic web apps, gaming, geospatial applications, social networking, IoT applications, industrial telemetry and banking transactions. AWS Services are used by leading businesses like Netflix, Twitch, LinkedIn, Facebook, WarnerMedia, BBC, Baidu, ESPN, Adobe, and Twitter. Learn more about Databases on AWS: https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Our team has members of multiple genders, races, and ethnicities and welcomes diversified ways of thinking and non-traditional approaches to UX design.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. We leverage modern collaboration tools and processes to reduce overhead, streamline communication and increase productivity.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We have a vision for and commitment to your personal success, whether that be at Amazon or elsewhere. Whether your goals are to explore new design concepts, take on bigger opportunities, or get to the next level, we'll help you get there. Our business is growing fast and our people will grow with it.

Description

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
· Degree in related field with a strong technical background (additional years of experience may be considered in lieu of degree)
· 3 years of demonstrated experience in areas such as internal threat (aka insider threat), digital forensics, or internal investigations
· Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy in a global environment
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate security and business risk to a broad range of technical and non-technical audiences
· Scripting skills (e.g., Perl, Python, Bash, PowerShell )Amazon is seeking Security Engineers to join our internal threat reduction team. Join the team responsible for providing developing and executing the insider threat program for Amazon. The team’s mission is to reduce to risk insiders can pose to Amazon, and the primary responsibility of this role will be to lead internal threat investigations across Amazon.

The role provides the opportunity to investigate potential internal threat cases, provide internal threat subject matter expertise, research and recommend technology and process improvements, and build the tools and capabilities to support those efforts. We build tools to match the scale of Amazons environment, pushing the limitations of existing tooling and evolving beyond those limitations. As part of this team, you will participate in building large scale, customized tools that enable you and the team to rapidly investigate, proactively detect, and increase collaboration across partner teams.

Key tasks include:

· Serve as a primary internal threat investigator, using an array to tools and capabilities to investigate internal threat cases
· Provide subject matter expertise in all aspects of internal threat investigations
· Provide analytical and operational support to internal risk investigations, mitigation, and program objectives
· Participate in and lead large-scale incidents requiring parallel investigations, executive communications, reports, and postmortems across a global scale
· Communicating effectively with varying audiences at multiple levels of sensitivity, often including legal, human resources, business leaders, and partner information technology and information security teams
· Evaluating the impact of current security trends, advisories, publications, and academic research to Amazon
· Developing trends and insights based upon data to drive continual improvements

Description


Pharmaceutical Project Coordinator Job

The Company

FRS Recruitment are proud to be collaborating with this International Life Sciences company in the Midlands, Ireland to recruit for a Pharmaceutical Project Coordinator. The Pharmaceutical Project Coordinator will work within their pharmaceutical services division , the role will be responsible for coordinating lab support services for pharmaceutical customers.

Permanent - Days - Attractive Sal & Benefits- Midlands - Pharmaceuticals

This company offers a wonderful opportunity for development and career progression. They seek communicative, enthusiastic and ambitious people to work for them and reward their employees with a diverse and valuable working experience.

The Opportunity

This is a challenging, multi-faceted role for someone with a scientific background where you have experience of QC Lab Analysis/sample management(GMP).

This Pharmaceutical Project CoordinatorJob would ideally suit an experienced QC Lab Analyst with experience of working within a GMP setting

The Pharmaceutical Project Coordinator will :
  • Act as a project coordinator for clients' projects
  • Acts as an advocate to both client and internal laboratory and balances requirements with both to ensure project success ( sample management) and ensure that information is available to all who need it.
  • Coordination with other internal departments as projects require
  • Audits sample paperwork
  • Schedules, coordinates and participates in client conference calls, visits and audits; attends meetings with technical groups as required
  • Documents client interactions into the project log database.
  • Continuous improvement - identification of opportunities for improvement of quality and service with client group, formulation and implementation of action plans for continuous improvement.

About You

The ideal candidate for this role is a current Sample Management Coordinator in a GMP industry, or a science graduate with min 1 year GMP industry experience either in a QA /Lab Technician/ QC role and a strong understanding of the process of sample management within industry.

If you are interested in this role or are looking for a role in the scientific or pharmaceutical industry, please contact Felicity Farrell to discuss this further.

Keywords: Sample Management Job , QC Lab Analyst Job , QC analyst job , Documentation Review job, Lab Job Pharma

Description

Our client, one of the country’s largest software development organisations is looking for a Mobile/Front End Developer to join their team! This is initially a 6-month contract with a strong possibility of contract renewal based in Cork with some remote work option.

 

The successful candidate would be responsible for building the frontend components to a variety enterprise applications. 

 

The developer will report to the Software Project Manager and occasionally to appropriate Development Directors.

  

Responsibilities:

  • Work with React Native or similar technologies on the front end to create Android/iOS Apps.
  • Experience publishing mobile applications to Apple/Google stores.
  • Experience integrating mobile front ends with back-end REST APIs.
  • Lay out an integration pipeline for mobile applications including build/test and publish steps.
  • Designing & building applications using client-side technologies including React.js
  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
  • Build high-level user interfaces using rapid prototyping methodologies.
  • Getting feedback from users and clients, and building solutions for them.
  • Assisting with the analysis of client requirements
  • Research into new mobile and frontend technologies and reporting on suitability and benefits to the organisation.

Required skills:

  • Must have 4+ cumulative years of Mobile / Front End experience in an enterprise environment.
  • Deep understanding of JavaScript and React / React Native ecosystems.
  •  Practical experience of iOS and Android app deployment procedures. (Store deployment, Enterprise deployment, certificates, provisioning profiles).
  • Deep understanding of modern testing methodologies, tools and practices.
  • Understanding of security and performance considerations.
  • Understanding of cross browser issues and how to debug them.
  • Understanding of JSON / RESTful web services
  • Understanding of architectural and design patterns

 

"Nice to have" Skills:

  • Experience across various other frontend technologies, including Node.js, AngularJS and Typescript
  • Experience and working knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores advantageous
  •  Experience working with cloud technologies advantageous, especially AWS and Azure.

 

Personal Profile:

 

  • Ability to work independently as well as part of team.
  • Ability to learn new business areas quickly.
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.
  • Ability to engage with stakeholders, and help them prototype their requirements.
  • Technical degree or equivalent experience.
  • Desire to develop your own knowledge by keeping abreast of testing tools and techniques, attending workshops and reviewing technical publications.
  •  

 * Please note that candidates who apply must be eligible to work in Ireland holding either EU Citizenship or appropriate visa.

Overview

Add an annual turnover of $22.5 billion to a rental and leasing fleet of more than 1.7 million vehicles spread across 9,500 locations worldwide and you get Enterprise Rent-A-Car – a business that’s grown into the largest global mobility provider in the world.

Whether on a year-long placement or a summer internship, our students play an integral role in the success of Enterprise and will have a comprehensive introduction to our Graduate Management Training Programme. For a university student, real world professional business experience can put you above the rest when you enter the job market.

Our interns go at a highly energised pace. From day one of your summer internship or year-long placement at Enterprise, you’ll learn what it takes to run a successful business and acquire the highly marketable skills and experience that you get when you’re helping to run and operate a successful business. But don’t just take our word for it – our interns have twice been voted Best Intern of the Year at the NUE awards.

Our university interns and placement students take on the same challenges on their internship as those that join us on our award-winning Graduate Management Programme. After an initial virtual classroom-based orientation session, you’ll be assigned to a branch office for hands-on business training. It’s learning by doing, not by getting coffee or filing all day. Our promote-from-within culture will do the rest - ensuring that you’ll have a well-rounded training experience and learn skills in management, finance, operations, sales and customer service.

As you are considering a position with Enterprise, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today – and every day – the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response, please visit the Enterprise Rent-A-Car website.


Responsibilities

When you join our Management Placement and Internship Programme, whether on a year-long placement or a summer internship, you’ll soon discover that every day is different because it is filled with so many new, exciting, rewarding, and often unexpected challenges. As well as getting the chance to put into practice all that you’ve learned so far while at university, you’ll also learn more hard and soft skills than you ever thought possible.
Not only is it a paid placement programme, but you may also be eligible for performance incentives and employee referral rewards, in the same way that those that join our Graduate Management Programme do too. The business training you’ll receive will be an amazing launchpad to your career.

Qualifications

  • We accept applications for our Management Placement and Internship Programme from all university students regardless of year, university attended and subjects being studied. Our assessment is based on how you perform against our competencies and will judge you on that alone.
  • You must have a full driving licence, but we do make accommodations for applicants who don’t drive due to a disability.
  • No drug or alcohol related offence on driving record within the last five years is permitted.
Additional Information
  • Please let us know about any accommodations you may need to participate in our recruitment process.
  • Please limit your application to only one job posting based on where you live and/or plan to work. Applying to multiple locations will delay your application being processed.
  • This job posting is for applications within the following locations:Cork.

Description

IT Manager, Business Applications

We are a global Fortune 500 healthcare company employing over 70000 staff worldwide. Our Irish operation in County Clare is growing rapidly, and we are now hiring for the key position of IT Manager, Business Applications This is a newly created role, it’s a full time permanent position and generous salary and full benefits package is on offer to the right person.

 

Role:

The primary function of the Manager Business Support is to support and enhance critical business systems for the Manufacturing sites, and for the Logistics and Distribution business processes, mainly related to Oracle Business and related systems applications such as Oracle EBS. Your remit will also include supporting other key software solutions, project management and improving efficiencies. You will:

 

  • Work in partnership with the business to understand and document clear requirements, prepare functional design documents, monitor project progress, and test solutions prior to release to users
  • Work with Global solutions to Support and implement Oracle manufacturing at our manufacturing sites.
  • Use Oracle Support to research new functionality, troubleshoot problems and escalate into Service Requests as needed.
  • Guide the successful completion of major programs, processes and/or project for the department or function.
  • Meet regulatory requirements and establish policies and procedures where required
  • Create and provide User documentation and training material where required
  • Integrate research, information and trends into solutions to identify and solve complex problems
  • Support and work closely with EMEAI teams to support Oracle EBS projects and users and provide a first class support service
  • Budget preparation and cost management
  • Stakeholder management

 

 

Candidate profile:

You are a senior IT professional (10 - 15 years career level) with a proven track record in managing enterprise scale business applications (preferably Oracle E Business Suite R12 or other similar ERP business solutions). You have related industry experience in Inventory, Warehousing, Logistics or Distribution sectors. You are a team player with strong technical and interpersonal skills and the ability to work on your own initiative.  You have solid stakeholder management experience and you are confident of your ability to engage with the management teams within the sites and facilitate the prioritisation of requests and projects with the Site Leaders, EMEA Directors and Vice Presidents.

 

Current Irish Stamp work authorisation required - sponsorship is not provided!

LiveTiles is an Australian-owned, fast-growing SaaS company with teams across the US, APAC, and EMEA regions.

LiveTiles is the complete intelligent experience platform. We believe that the world is a better place when humans are free to do their best work, we focus on simplifying the complex by designing workplace solutions that increase productivity and collaboration and focus on the human experience.

Culture:
Our awesome culture is built around 3 core values; We are decent human beings, we get Sh!t done, and we create unforgettable experiences. Our employees are spread across the world, we offer flexible work conditions, and we support one another through collaborative practices and social connections.

Your Mission:
We are looking for an amazing team player, who takes ownership and does initiatives, and step-in for the team when it is necessary. As a senior developer, you should be able to make decisions and should not be afraid of trying out things. If you are good at understanding and assessment of user requirements and the creation of simple and intuitive application features and loves to build PoC and present yourself to the Team and wide audience, this role is for you. Being a member of an amazing team, we expect you to be open to feedback and eager to improve personally, motivated, and committed to implement and deliver the best possible quality.

What you'll do:
Build front and backends for our products

Apply object-oriented programming standards to single-page web applications and web services

Collaborate with fellow team members, inside a highly agile environment

Ensure quality through automated functional testing, performance testing, and regular code reviews

Work within a small team, be a team player with a can-do-attitude excited to work in a fast-paced environment

What we're looking for:
Extensive knowledge of C#, .Net, .Net Core and React

Knowledge of databases such as SQL, MongoDB

Open to learning cloud-native technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), distributed/serverless architectures, and microservices with micro-frontends architectures

Potential to quickly develop expertise in any part of our tech stack where you have limited experience

Open-minded in dealing with people

Good written/oral language skills in English

8+ years of experience

Nice to have:
Experience using JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML and CSS

Knowledge of Token-based-Authentication, Azure AD, Azure AD B2C and Azure CosmosDB

Experience with Azure (Functions, Queue, Storage, Service Bus), and SharePoint (CSOM, JSOM, REST)

Experience in Native mobile app (IOS & Android) development

Why should you join LiveTiles?

Total Customer Care – dieses Motto lebt MAX FRANKE. Eine hohe Kundenzufriedenheit zu erreichen, hat für uns die oberste Priorität. 
 Dafür bieten wir unseren Kunden ein Komplettpaket rund um das Thema Licht an: von der Beratung, Konzeptentwicklung und Lichtplanung, bis hin zur Leuchtenproduktion und Just-in-time-Anlieferung sowie After-Sales-Services. 
 Wir entwickeln für jeden unserer Kunden eine individuelle und optimale Licht-Lösung gemäß CI und Marktposition.
 
 Der Firmensitz – Point of Light – liegt in Hamburg. Dort arbeiten ca. 70 Mitarbeiter.
 Unser Gebäude umfasst 5.000 m² und beheimatet sowohl die Lichtplanung und die kaufmännische Abwicklung als auch die Produktentwicklung, Leuchten-Montage, Lager und den Versand sowie weitere kaufmännische Bereiche.
 
 Für unseren After-Sales-Service suchen wir ab sofort einen
 
 
 Elektriker / Elektrohelfer als Servicemitarbeiter (m/w/d)
 
 
 Wir suchen Sie als Unterstützung für vielseitige Aufgaben rund um die Filialen unserer Kunden. Die Filialen liegen in Deutschland, Österreich und Schweiz sowie (im Sonderfall) weiteren angrenzenden Ländern. 
 Die Fahrleistung der Servicemitarbeiter beträgt ca. 60.000 km jährlich. 
 Die Durchführung der Aufgaben wird je nach Routenplanung und Kunde alleine oder im Team durchgeführt.

 Leuchtenausrichtung neu eröffneter Shops

 Fahrleistung mit MAX FRANKE Fahrzeugen gemäß abgestimmter, wöchentlicher Routenplanung 
 
 
 Ihr Profil 
 
 Ausbildung zum Elektriker (m/w/d) wünschenswert 
 Technisches Verständnis für Leuchten und Beleuchtung 
 Service- und Kundenorientierung 
 Hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und Selbstständigkeit 
 Bereitschaft zur Reisetätigkeit 
 
 
 Wenn Sie Spaß daran haben, mit Beleuchtung die Shops unserer Kunden zu inszenieren, die Filialmitarbeiter in die grundlegenden Beleuchtungsregeln einzuweisen sowie immer das beste Ergebnis erzielen zu wollen, dann senden Sie uns bitte Ihre aussagefähige Onlinebewerbung.

Recruiter

Leading to better encompasses all we do at Kerry, it's how we've become the worlds leading taste and nutrition company. Whether it's building and manufacturing sustainable solutions for food, beverage or pharmaceutical consumers, our commitment to lead the world to better nutrition drives us forward. With 25,000+ colleagues across the globe and 15,000+ Kerry products, your opportunities are limitless.

About Kerry

More than 25,000 people have careers with Kerry. From Food Science to Manufacturing, our jobs help nourish and delight consumers around the globe. Kerry is committed to leading to better in everything we do. We strive for better taste and nutrition, better sustainability, better career opportunities and ultimately, a better world.

Everyday millions of people throughout the world consume food or beverage products containing our taste and nutrition solutions.

As the world leader in taste and nutrition, our Purpose is to Inspire Food and Nourish Life.

Our Purpose is central to The Kerry Way and serves as our guiding light on our journey to make it easier and more valuable for customers to do business with us, as we seek to make a greater, more lasting difference in the world by inspiring innovative, natural and sustainable taste and nutrition solutions for consumers, customers, the industry and the world.

Inspiring Food, Nourishing Life puts food, drink and wellbeing front and centre. Food matters. It brings people together; across cultures, countries and generations. Food is heritage, happiness and health. Food is family and friends. Food is life.

About The Role

The role of Business Partnering (Meat EUM) is a position within the Finance team for Europe & Russia, reporting to the Finance Manager Meat - Business Partnering. The key objectives of the Business Partner is to focus on support in the Meat EUM, finance and risk management, margin optimization. This will involve supporting the development of the business market strategy and formulation of plans to deliver the strategy. Ensure commercial plans are in line with the business expectations. The role provides an excellent opportunity for the successful candidate to work alongside the T&N Europe leadership team in delivering against our growth agenda, while ensuring the integrity of the overall financial reporting, insights and team processes.

Key responsibilities
  • Support the delivery of the Europe T&N Business partnering objectives.
  • As an integral member of the Finance Europe Business partnering team, the business partner will work with the T& N Europe team in all areas of:
  • Support/lead on cross functional projects.
  • Pricing – partner with the Pricing team in provision of pricing support for your businesses
  • Decision Making Support – partner the T&N Europe leadership teams in making critical decisions affecting business performance. Understand market trends, internal and external dynamics, price/volume trends and outlooks to recommend actions and challenge preconceptions that lead to the most optimum decision outcome for the businesses
  • Performance Measurement – Responsible for forecasting, budgeting and review and understanding of monthly performance for Meat EUM.
Qualifications And Skills

The Business Partner will be a ‘hands-on’, career minded financial professional, with a strong bias for action and a demonstrable track record in providing excellent service to key stakeholders. The role requires the ability to navigate and create strong relationships across a range of functions, businesses, markets and environments. They will be a qualified accountant with at least 5 years’ experience in financial positions.

    • Technical Skills Competencies
    • Excellent numerical and verbal reasoning
    • Advanced Excel skills with the ability to build and present scenario, fact-based analysis to support decision making
    • Ability to identify critical issues in decision making process demonstrating strong analytical skills
    • Capability to influence decision making
    • Experience in P&L Management (including margin & risk management)
    • Development and utilization of performance-based measurements
    • Ensure accuracy & integrity of financial and statistical information
    • Ability to present information in succinct and clear manner
    • Project Management skills/experience
    • Proficeint in Microsoft Office
    • SAP experience an advantage
    • Fluent in English with other language capability an advantage

This role can be mostly remote with occasional visits to the office. (Can be in Dublin office or another in the West).

Description

“A job where you're in the driving seat.”

Our core purpose is to serve Irish shoppers a little better every day and being a Customer Delivery Driver you are the first face our customers see.

Being a Customer Delivery Driver is hands on, physical and full of variety. No two shifts are ever the same – customer’s look for help in all kinds of different ways.

For most of the day you’ll feel like your own boss, delivering to your customers but with a team of managers and colleagues back at base ready to support you when you need them.

Shift Pattern: Various shifts available 


  • Providing an excellent home shopping experience by putting our customers at the heart of everything we do is our main responsibility.
  • Loading the van where required, and check your van for roadworthines
  • Understanding the schedule and route that has been calculated for you
  • Looking the part in your uniform, ready to help our customers
  • Driving safely, responsibly and within the law
  • To be courteous to all road users
  • Serving your customer with a smile and greet them by name
  • Taking care of your customer’s deliveries as if they were your own

 


  • To have had a full IRISH or EU driving licence (manual or automatic) for at least 2 years with no more than 3 penalty points
  • To be a safe and courteous drivers
  • To enjoy helping others
  • To be personable with a good sense of humour and excellent communication skills
  • The ability to take the initiative and use common sense
  • To care about making a difference for customers and colleagues
  • The ability to stay calm under pressure

Please be aware that as part of our recruitment process, job offers are subject to the Garda Vetting Process and you will need to provide proof of current penalty points on your licence at Assessment Stage. This can be requested from the National Driver Licence Services (NDLS) on 1890 41 61 41. Press Option 4 and quote your driver number.

We are sorry but if you have been disqualified from driving within the last 10 years, we will not be able to accept your application.

Should you be successful in your application, your offer will be subject to and conditional upon you providing your bank account details before your agreed start date.

Company Description

IQ-EQ is a leading Investor Services group which combines global expertise with an unwavering focus on client service delivery. We support fund managers, global companies, family offices and private clients operating worldwide.

Job Description

An opportunity has arisen for the role of an experienced Accountant in our Loan Administration Services Team. Our team provides loan portfolio administration Services to our Private Debt Fund clients.

What will you do?

Responsible for the delivery of high quality service to each of the clients assigned to them.
Active liaison with clients and external auditors, dealing with audit queries on the loan portfolio.
Ensuring agreed client service levels are met.
Ensures Loan portfolios are issued accurately and within defined timeframes.
Communicates effectively with clients and associated parties on loan portfolio activities.
Ensures that operating arrangements are clearly established on inception of a fund in respect of the loan portfolio administration services.
Ensures that documentation, legal and compliance issues are complete.

LOAN PORTFOLIO ADMINISTRATION

Perform the preparation of monthly / quarterly loan portfolio statements for Private Debt Funds including the completion of consolidated loan portfolio statements
Liaise with new clients to determine fund structure and level of detail required to support the loan portfolio administration services.
Manage the collection of relevant information to facilitate production of the loan portfolio.
Ensure the loan portfolios are issued accurately and within defined timeframes.
Active liaison with clients and external auditors, dealing with audit queries on the loan portfolio.
Ensure agreed client service levels are met.

Qualifications

Professional Accounting Qualification with at least 3 years post QE experience.
Detailed knowledge of Irish/UK GAAP/US GAAP and IFRS.
Working knowledge of the Irish regulatory /tax regime as it relates to Fund Accounting and Financial Reporting.
Knowledge of Loan Administration Services.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office – Excel and Word
A track record of excellent attention to detail
A track record in optimising system use and automating processes where possible
Provision of focused quality client service
Demonstrates commitment to producing high quality work and to timeframes required.

Additional Information

At IQ-EQ we want you to reach your full potential. We offer an inclusive and diverse environment to support your career aspirations. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning and a holistic approach to your professional and personal development. We also offer opportunities across our service lines and our international network of offices.

Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

The Launch Readiness Team ensures new products in development are thoroughly validated with an audience of enthusiastic beta testers. Launches range from small feature updates to large product launches spanning: hardware, point of sale, partnerships, and SaaS.

We're looking for a Portuguese-speaking Project Manager! You'll own recruiting efforts and improve participation in each featured programme while collecting essential feedback and escalating issues for resolution. This is a strategic role that will partner with Product, Marketing, Communications, Legal, Compliance, Engineering teams, and more.

You Will:
Partner with Product to design and kick-off successful beta programme
Source and qualify leads for beta programme, with outreach over the phone, email, and social media
Escalate bugs for resolution and ensure speedy set up for all sellers
Uncover customer insights by working with our users
Participate in hardware and software testing
Track, communicate status and monitor all active beta participants
Create the customer experience story and present recommendations to product teams
Work with Communications, Product Marketing, and Marketing teams to highlight sellers to feature in press and clarify the value propositions that are resonating most for your region
Give Exit Criteria recommendations for beta programme.

Qualifications

You Have:
Portuguese bilingual required, additional European language a plus
3+ years relevant experience in sales, project or programme management, other customer-facing experience
Experience conducting first-hand research
Experience with JIRA, Salesforce, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and willingness to learn SQL

Additional Information

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, based solely on the core competencies required of the role at hand, and without regard to any legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.

Perks

Square, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) builds tools to empower businesses and individuals to participate in the economy. Description

Description

MEDTRONIC
At Medtronic, we value what makes you unique. Be part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems, make progress and deliver meaningful innovations. We are a rapidly growing, global medical device manufacturer that is committed to developing innovative medical devices that save lives. Creative, competent people with a passion for enhancing healthcare around the globe have driven our success. Here’s where you come in!


OUR PURPOSE
At our Machined Implantables and Capital Disposables (MICD) Manufacturing Facility, we focus on meeting customer and patient needs every day. Our focus is on delivering the highest levels of quality products to our patients. We do this through the development and operation of manufacturing processes to the highest levels of efficiency and performance. We achieve our aims through our people, our high performing teams. We focus on the development of cutting-edge medical devices in Airway Management but also for other life enhancing applications.


Come for a job, stay for a career!


We are seeking a Senior Engineering Supervisor to manage the activities of the Manufacturing Engineering team to continuously improve the performance of the manufacturing facility through robust processes, engineered solutions and continuous improvement. Develop internal skills and capability and best in class system of process engineering and performance measurement with due consideration for safety, quality, compliance, costs and schedules. The person is responsible for leading and supervising a multi-disciplined manufacturing engineering team supporting continuous improvement in manufacturing including process engineering, automation, validation, material changes, CAPA, design and regulatory changes. Preparing and reporting on projects and performance metrics are also requirements of the role.


You have proven technical and supervisory ability, approachable and collaborate with others with ease. You are curious and questioning and establish risks and pitfalls to ensure surprises are minimized. You are an effective communicator with all levels of the organisation and comfortable with presenting to senior management. You are energised by tough challenges and persevere to achieve the final result yet are objective and escalate issues early. You can identify conflict early and work effectively and professionally in conflict situations.



A DAY IN THE LIFE OF:
Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.
• Plans, directs and implements all aspects of the company's design and development of new medical device products or software systems.
• May develop, evaluate, implement and maintain technical quality assurance and control systems or reliability systems and standards pertaining to materials, techniques, or company products.
• Oversees the investigation and evaluation of existing technologies.
• Guides the conceptualization of new methodologies, materials, machines, processes or products.
• Directs the development of new concepts from initial design to market release.
• Manages feasibility studies of the design to determine if capable of functioning as intended.
• Monitor documentation maintenance throughout all phases of research and development.
• Organizes the coordination of activities with outside suppliers and consultants to ensure timely delivery.
• Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.


PEOPLE MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONAL CAREER STREAM:
• Management and supervisory professionals with one or more employees who are focused on tactical, operational and some strategic activities within a specified area.
• Levels within the management career stream typically have six or more direct reports. The majority of time is spent overseeing their area of responsibility, managing performance, developing talent, engagement and inclusion, communicating business and operational developments, planning, prioritizing and / or directing the responsibilities of direct reports.
• Goal achievement is typically accomplished through performance of direct and / or indirect reports.
• A key responsibility of roles in this career stream is managing people. which includes: accountability for mentoring, developing and coaching staff on meeting/exceeding performance expectations and defined objectives, providing leadership to staff ensuring the prioritization of strategic and department level initiatives to include defining performance goals and targets, conducting performance reviews, and staff 1:1s to guide performance management and employee development efforts and manage toward departmental goals.


DIFFERENTIATING FACTORS
Autonomy: Supervises team members or subordinate supervisors, providing tactical and / or technical leadership.
May perform ongoing operational tasks.
Receives assignments in task-oriented terms and delivers results according to established procedures.
Organizational Impact: Plans and establishes goals and objectives for a team, typically within (1) department.
Decisions impact project or department schedules, customer satisfaction levels, or allocation of time or material resources.
Typically does not have budget or P&L accountability, but may manage day-to-day elements of the budget (e.g., overtime for staff).
Innovation and Complexity: Makes improvements to processes, systems or products.
Problems and issues faced are difficult and may require understanding of broader set of issues, including multiple job areas or specialties.
Communication and Influence: Communicates with internal and external customers and vendors, across various levels of the organization.
Shares and exchanges relevant information to reach solutions and gaining cooperation of other parties.
Leadership and Talent Management: Leads, directs and reviews the work of team members in order to accomplish operational plans and results.
Provides primary input to hiring, dismissal, promotion, performance and rewards decisions for direct reports.
Required Knowledge and Experience: Understands basic management approaches such as work scheduling, prioritizing, coaching and process execution.
Requires advanced knowledge of job area obtained through advanced education combined with experience.


GENERAL
• Pursue the achievement of optimum performance on a continuous basis.
• Be proactive in the development of oneself in the acquisition of higher levels of knowledge, skills and expertise.
• Ensure good time keeping and the effective use of time in planning and prioritising activities.
• Ensure one’s goals, objectives and business activities are aligned with the business objectives of the Medtronic facility.
• Ensure the full understanding and implementation of the company’s Safety and GMP policies at all times.
• Ensure Compliance with relevant Company and Corporate requirements and legislation governing health and safety as principally contained in the ‘Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Act 2005 and the Safety, Health and Welfare at Work (General Application) Regulations 2007.
• Well organised and resourceful and will do what it takes to get the job done on time.
• Energetic, self-driven with a tenacious drive for results and motivated to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery of maintenance operation and continuous improvement projects


Qualifications

KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


• Level 8 or higher qualification in Mechanical, Polymer, Biomedical or related Engineering /Science discipline.
• Requires broad knowledge of manufacturing engineering processes and systems.
• Requires specific and proven experience in Engineering supervision.
• Requires minimum of 5 years of relevant experience and a track record of achievement whilst operating in a position of responsibility within a highly regulated production facility, typically Medtech / Pharma / Plastics processing environments.
• The ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, computer literate, self-motivated and have the ability to lead, empower and motivate staff to ensure KPI's are achieved. Adept with work scheduling, prioritizing, coaching and process execution.
• The candidate should be familiar with Lean Sigma (ideally certified) and OEE systems.


Medtronic offer a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package

EMEA-Ireland-County Westmeath

Description

Description

MEDTRONIC


At Medtronic, we value what makes you unique. Be part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems, make progress and deliver meaningful innovations


OUR PURPOSE


At our Supplier Quality Department in Medtronic, plc, we focus on we partner with Medtronic’s suppliers to deliver the highest quality and most reliable products to our customers within the CVG organization.


The Quality Engineer role works with external suppliers and in a cross-functional Medtronic team on a daily basis to resolve supplier related issues, drive continuous improvement while driving key quality metrics across the Galway Campus. Part of a larger team within supplier quality department, this role would support postmarket quality for components supplied to Galway.


Come for a job, stay for a career!


A DAY IN THE LIFE OF:

  • Work closely with wider supplier quality and operation teams to drive continuous improvement and robust corrective/preventative actions through problem solving techniques at supplier to prevent recurrence of issues, and ultimately deliver high-quality products to customers
  • Ensures that suppliers deliver quality parts, materials, and services
  • Delivering cost-down projects linked directly to Medtronic suppliers
  • Communicate with management and project teams on a regular basis on supplier performance
  • Qualifies suppliers according to company standards and may administer a Certified Supplier Program in receiving inspection to ensure cost effectiveness
  • Lead and provide technical assistance to suppliers/other resources performing qualification/validation testing. Ensure the resolution of all issues raised during testing/qualification.
  • Work with supplier and sub-tier suppliers, as required, to lead and drive systematic approaches and ensure stability related to medical device quality.
  • Develop strong partnerships with cross functional groups and provide quality leadership within these groups
  • Support in the review of supplier introduction and changes, coordinating activities with suppliers and with internal cross-functional support teams to develop and implement appropriate strategies to qualify and support
  • Ensure appropriate controls are in place at supplier, based on risk associated with product or service
  • Develop and drive technical direction input to component qualification strategies and documentation in conjunction with project teams to ensure high standards are in place
  • Develops and prioritizes an auditing schedule to ensure that designated suppliers are audited on a regular basis to ensure good manufacturing practices (GMP) and quality standards are met
  • Define Receiving Inspection requirements as required and associated test method validation for all internal Medtronic Test Methods.


Qualifications

KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • We are looking for a person qualified to Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree (Level 8 NFQ) in a relevant technical discipline (e.g. Engineering, Science or technical field)
  • Minimum of 2 years relevant experience, or less with an advanced degree
  • You are a dynamic team player, can work effectively and proactively on cross-functional teams with good communication and technical writing skills

Nice to Have

  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements and guidelines including 21 CFR parts 210, 211, 21 CFR part 820, ICH requirements and ISO 13485 requirements is an

advantage.

  • Previous experience in Supplier Quality
  • Experience with Process Validations and/or Test Method Validations (For

Example: IQ, OQ, PQ, and/or TMV)

  • ISO 13485 Lead Auditor Certification


Medtronic offer a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package

EMEA-Ireland-County Galway

Company Description

Twitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life's not about a job, it's about purpose. We believe real change starts with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Come as you are and together we'll do what's right (not what's easy) to serve the public conversation.

Job Description

We, the RSOM team, partner with the Regional Business Leaders to help set and execute global and regional strategies. We will build and execute core operational processes such as business planning and reporting, facilitating key decision making, and ongoing business operations management.

You will own core business Operations for the region, your job will include in-depth quantitative analysis of operating metrics with a particular focus on problem-solving and creating scaled systems and processes. You will work closely with senior leaders in the Core Ads business and cross-functional Twitter teams to quickly understand opportunities and implement solutions.

The ideal candidate is self-sufficient, detail-oriented, loves problem-solving, gets stuck into playing with data, willing to roll up their sleeves and capable of structuring problems, and thrives in ambiguity. Our team does not shy away from getting into the details, slicing and dicing data, and developing and implementing solutions to problems that have not been taken on yet. You’re passionate about Twitter and having an impact!

What does success look like?

Deeply embed with the Business Unit and become the local operations leader

You will not just do the work but rather look to consistently improve, scale or even eliminate workflows to make the business and the team even more effective.

Become the go-to person in the Twitter Revenue org if anyone wants to know “what is happening” in your channel

Build strong working relationships throughout the wider EMEA Business and Global Operations teams

Independently identify issues and drive solutions with enthusiasm - people come to you when they have a tough problem that likely has never been seen or solved before.

Be highly proactive in crafting innovative, data informed strategies to enable strategic and operational objectives

Build cross-functional relationships across the Twitter Sales, Product, Engineering, Finance and supporting orgs.

You will develop strong working partnerships with your Global Operations colleagues to share ideas, approaches and solutions that will scale our work and help the business thrive.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
You will very likely have 4+ years of work experience in a similar role (Sales Operations, Planning / Strategy)

Exceptional data manipulation and interpretation skills are critical. (You are an excel whizz and likely have competence with SQL or any other form of database / analytical packages)

Experience and comfort in working with CRM systems critical (e.g. Salesforce)

We operate in an unstructured, fast-moving environment and you must have the ability to filter out noise to address what matters most.

Experience partnering with Senior Stakeholders and you will demonstrate the emotional intelligence to be effective cross-functionally

Clear and detailed communication and presentation skills

Desirable but not essential

Strong business analyst, demonstrating success in uncovering and building business cases for new growth opportunities, as well as recognising threats to a business. Ability to apply effective financial and analytical frameworks.

Excellence in all areas of strategy development, including project management, problem-solving, executive communication, and consensus-building.

Global experience is a plus.

Additional Information

We care about making work happy and productive for everyone, with a permanent option to work remotely or regularly work from home when our offices reopen; a home office expense budget; wellness benefits; regular #NoMeetingFridays; and six months of parental leave.

A few other things we value:
Challenge - We work with Twitter's product and standards teams to solve some of the industry’s hardest content problems. Come to be challenged, learn, and thrive as a curator.
Diversity - Diversity makes us a better organisation and team. We value diverse backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.
Work-Life Balance - We work hard, but we believe with hard work should come balance.We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Restaurant Supervisor - Johnson Controls

Brook Foods are delighted to announce we are currently recruiting for a Full time Restaurant Supervisor for our client Johnson Controls in Cork city. We are seeking a highly talented and driven person with a customer focused personality to assist with managing the day to day operations of this Restaurant. We are looking for someone with excellent organisational skills, the ability to prioritise their workload and someone who posesses the ability to communicate effectively with a range of audiences. Candidates must have strong experience in their desired role and come from a strong catering background with a good knowledge of all aspects of food and beverage preparation and customer service.

Main duties are:

  • To assist as directed with all aspects of preparation and presentation of food to the company’s standard and ensuring adherence of legislation
  • To promote a friendly and welcoming atmosphere and to utilize selling techniques to benefit both the company and the client
  • To carry out cashier duties as required
  • To ensure tables and condiments are kept clean at all times and that condiments are well stocked
  • To assist in setting and replenishing the food service counters and vending machines as and when required
  • To ensure retail stock items are ordered within the purchasing budget
  • To ensure that all food and beverage items are displayed at all times in accordance to site requirements
  • To undertake all necessary cleaning to the company’s standards according to the cleaning Rota
  • To ensure that staff on site are fully knowledgeable of their required duties and carry them out at all times
  • To ensure daily cashing up procedures are adhered to
  • To ensure that staff rosters are signed off weekly along with break sheets before being submitted
  • To ensure lodgments are completed per site requirements
  • To ensure high standards of personal hygiene, cleanliness and neatness ensuring full uniform is worn at all times
  • To comply with statutory and company hygiene regulations in handling storage of food and beverage

An experienced Restaurant Supervisor must have excellent customer service skills, be well presented, a team player and enthusiastic in being part of a large and diverse team.

Fluent English language is essential.

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: €25,000.00-€38,590.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Food allowance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Yes we are adhering to Government Guidelines

Work remotely:

  • No

Enterprise Applications Digital Transformation Consultant

Grant Thornton works with leading organisations in Ireland and internationally. These organisations are looking to derive greater value from technology – both in terms of customer facing solutions and within their operations. It is essential that we are equipped to help our clients seize the opportunities new technology and techniques present, as well as address the challenges they face.

At GT, we are building our Technology Consulting team, investing significantly to offer a wide range of services, from helping create digitally-fit strategies and operating models, to designing and building client facing and operational platforms. As part of this we are seeking to recruit experienced IT consultants to engage in digital transformation with our clients.

We have ambitious plans and are looking for motivated and enthusiastic individuals to enhance the capability within the team. Success will be rewarded with a clear route to progression to senior levels within the firm.

About the role

  • Client delivery: You will work with clients to deliver technology projects that will support their business objectives. We are currently implementing projects in the banking, insurance, property, energy, utilities, retail, wholesale, fast-moving consumer goods and government sectors.
  • Business development: You’ll be responsible for contributing to proposals and client presentations for complex Enterprise Applications related delivery projects.
  • Practice development: you will work with Technology and Consulting leadership to build-out offerings, methodologies, and delivery capabilities (people and tools).
  • Thought Leadership: Drawing on your skills and experience, you’ll create innovative insights for clients looking to develop their solutions to deliver value and improve their operations. You will help raise the profile of the firm in this regard.

Client delivery

As a client-facing Enterprise Applications consultant, you will:

  • Be capable of understanding business processes across multiple sectors and industries, preferably across both manufacturing and service industries and including public and private sector organisations.
  • Be capable of analysing the current technology landscape in a business and see how that maps to the overall strategy of a business.
  • Be able to communicate at all levels of a business right up to board level.
  • Lead user requirements workshops and develop and document the requirements, providing challenge to the users to ensure the requirements meet desired business outcomes.
  • Carry out process mapping and identify areas for process improvement.
  • Develop As-Is, To-Be and Gap Analysis documentation.
  • Develop business case planning including financial management, resource planning, and benefits analysis.
  • Quickly identify possibilities for improvements to the application landscape and the benefits around those improvements.
  • Have experience dealing with potential vendors to help select the appropriate systems to meet the requirements identified. This includes dealing with selection documents (RFIs, RFPs etc.), organisation demonstrations, and creating scoring models.
  • Use the knowledge gained from the initial analysis phase to manage the implementation of a system or systems and solution that takes the clients business forward in line with their overall strategy and objectives.
  • Identify opportunities to improve offerings to customers.
  • Develop close working relationships with our customers in order to get insights which will allow Grant Thornton to offer the best solutions to our clients.
  • Design and tailor those solutions to best fit customer needs.

About you

You will be a self-starter, highly motivated to develop a market leading capability and to progress within the firm. You will have the right blend of hands-on experience, an eye for innovation, and understanding of the markets in which we work. You will use this to excel in client delivery and help develop and build client offerings and go-to-market propositions. You will:

  • have a proven track record of delivery.
  • have strong stakeholder management skills.
  • be a confident and impactful communicator, both written and verbal, able to clearly explain solution design to technical and non-technical audiences, in a way that is accessible to everyone, especially senior stakeholders. You will have significant experience in facilitating effective workshops across all levels of an organisation.
  • have proven experience of supporting business development activities, client relationship management and contribution to winning proposal development.
  • have a willingness to learn and develop new skills. You will work in a collaborative team environment but you must possess the ability to quickly develop expertise in areas where you are less-familiar or experienced. This role requires significant dexterity due to the ever-changing world of technology and the nascent and dynamic nature of GT Technology Consulting.

About your domain knowledge and skills

You will:

  • have experience with project management methodologies (e.g. PMP, Prince2, Scrum etc.) – preferably more than one.
  • Have implementation experience in more than one Enterprise Application. For example, industry recognised standard applications such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Infor, IFS, Workday.
  • Similarly, knowledge of CRM systems would be a plus – e.g. Salesforce, Dynamics CRM.
  • An interest in emerging technology – e.g. AI, RPA, IoT, Blockchain
  • Knowledge of latest cloud computing and data technologies, business drivers, emerging computing trends, and deployment options (and familiarity with enterprise cloud vendors Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform).
  • Have excellent written and oral communications skills. You have significant experience presenting to and developing written documents for executive and leadership levels within an organisation.
  • Have experience of hands on delivery of projects at key clients, either on your own or as part of larger delivery teams. You have a personal track record of delivering impactful results;
  • Have excellent project management, collaboration, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience with Enterprise Application strategy analysis and selection would be preferred.

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education and/or work experience. Some technical background preferred.
  • 5+ years direct work experience in an Enterprise Application implementation capacity, including project management and/or systems selection.
  • Competent and proficient understanding of business solutions, such as ERP, CRM, HR, and Document Management.
