Description

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.


About this role


You'll be joining an Operations team working on one of BT’s major customer accounts, supporting their MPLS core, ISP Services (Including security) and Datacentre IP infrastructure. Your role will also encompass all implementation work carried out on customer network.


In addition, you'll be responsible for supporting real time operational systems, providing leadership and guidance on resolving complex technical issues, owning operational processes and ensuring support is provided to meet service level standards. A key focus of the team is continuous improvement and learning of the existing and new technologies being deployed so you'll be constantly learning and developing.


You'll have the following responsibilities


· Operational support of IP & Security network across all customer datacentres.


· Manage and resolve network faults.


· Liaise with Design team on new technical projects and be responsible for implementation.


· Peer technical reviews of all designs before deployment into service.


· Creation of Operational Manuals for new network implementation and support.


· Cross-skilling of team members on deployed technical solutions.


· Method of Procedure (MOP) creation for Operations lead projects.


· Act as a key contributor and provide expert advice to the team and other groups on technical and operational issues.


You'll have the following skills & experience


· BS in an Engineering discipline.


· CCNA or equivalent.


· Experience troubleshooting network issues.


· Experience working with firewalls and loadbalancers a distinct advantage.


· Display innovative thinking by acting on own initiative to identify & resolve problems.


· Excellent communication skills, both written & verbal.


· Excellent organisational & time-management skills, ability to deliver to tight timescales.


· Ability to work as part of a team and have the capacity of taking on escalated issues from other team members.


Benefits


Here at BT Ireland we feel passionately that a positive working environment enables our people unlock their true potential and deliver great work, that’s why we’re proud of our accreditation as a “Healthy Place to Work” by the Heathy Place to Work Institute. You can also check out our diversity and inclusion pledges in the information section to learn about BT Ireland’s passion and commitment to D&I.


Other great benefits include:


+ Competitive salary and bonus

+ BT Ireland Pension Scheme – 5% BT contributions

+ Life Assurance from 1st day of employment – 4x salary

+ We provide healthcare cover & permanent health insurance (income continuance)

+ You’ll have the opportunity to buy BT shares

+ Discounted BT products – like free broadband if our service is available at your address

+ Access to excellent training tools, programmes and communities to help you connect, learn and grow.

+ Encouragement of Flexible working – locations and hours of work

+ There’s also great support for working parents

+ 22 days annual Leave (rising to 25 days with length of service) bank holidays and an opportunity to buy up to five more days every year

+ Opportunities to do volunteering – we like it when our people do good things and we’re committed to supporting this

+ We also have a subsidised social club


#LI-EL1


About BT


In BT Ireland, we operate globally and deliver locally, serving multinational corporations, indigenous exporters and public sector organisations in every segment of the Irish economy, as well as other major communications providers through our wholesale channel. Our portfolio is a powerful combination of cloud services, global networking, IT integration, carrier voice and data services, contact centre solutions and professional security expertise, enabling customers to solve complex business communications requirements on a global scale.


So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT (https://www.btplc.com/careers)


How to Apply


It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!


Job: _Engineering_


Title: _IP & Security Network Engineer_


Location: _GBR %26 Ireland-Ireland-Dublin-Dublin_


Requisition ID: _160658_

Description

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.


About this role


This is a design role which will suit someone with a passion for researching, testing and implementing new ISP technologies.


You’ll join a team of IP design experts working in on core network technology. Your role is a key design team member contributing to customer’s designs and solutions. You’ll develop the core network and core platforms from their current architecture to the next generation network deployments. You will lead innovation to bring new ideas and products to the market quickly and efficiently and before our competitors.


Want to work in an environment that supports and empowers you to deliver great work? We're proud that BT Ireland has received accreditation as a “Healthy Place to Work” by the Heathy Place to Work Institute.


You'll have the following responsibilities


+ You will own the development of the MPLS Core, ISP Core and all technical documentation.

+ You will act as ‘front door’ for all pre-sales queries for bids on Data/IP networks.

+ You will create innovative solutions to optimize our existing infrastructure and when applicable, collaborate with product to implement new product launches.

+ You will identify projects/designs that are not viable and make sure they do not pass through the design process.

+ You will contribute and own the documentation of core Design solutions.

+ You will be responsible for the evaluation and testing of the equipment.

+ You’ll work with Security Team to ensure that all new solution/equipment introductions comply with Security guidelines.

+ You’ll ensure that new product introductions & solutions are communicated to the Networks community.


You'll have the following skills & experience


+ CCNP Certified

+ Anticipate that you will hold CCDP Certification but not essential

+ NRS1/2 Certfications would be highly desirable but not essential

+ Demonstrable background in design of systems architecture & network systems (especially core)

+ Appetite to research test and implement new technologies


Benefits


Here at BT Ireland we feel passionately that a positive working environment enables our people unlock their true potential and deliver great work, that’s why we’re proud of our accreditation as a “Healthy Place to Work” by the Heathy Place to Work Institute. You can also check out our diversity and inclusion pledges in the information section to learn about BT Ireland’s passion and commitment to D&I.


Other great benefits include:


+ Competitive salary and bonus

+ BT Ireland Pension Scheme – 5% BT contributions

+ Life Assurance from 1st day of employment – 4x salary

+ We provide healthcare cover & permanent health insurance (income continuance)

+ You’ll have the opportunity to buy BT shares

+ Discounted BT products – like free broadband if our service is available at your address

+ Access to excellent training tools, programmes and communities to help you connect, learn and grow.

+ Encouragement of Flexible working – locations and hours of work

+ There’s also great support for working parents

+ 22 days annual Leave (rising to 25 days with length of service) bank holidays and an opportunity to buy up to five more days every year


#LI-EL1


About BT


In BT Ireland, we operate globally and deliver locally, serving multinational corporations, indigenous exporters and public sector organisations in every segment of the Irish economy, as well as other major communications providers through our wholesale channel. Our portfolio is a powerful combination of cloud services, global networking, IT integration, carrier voice and data services, contact centre solutions and professional security expertise, enabling customers to solve complex business communications requirements on a global scale.


We are a global company, operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 130,000 people in over 200 countries, and we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant, our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.


How to Apply


It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Description

Commercial Management Work Placement


Role Profile


We have opportunities for students to join our business and gain valuable experience within a global company. On this placement you’ll get exposure to all the different skills you’ll need to be successful in a corporate environment. We’ll get you working on some of our projects from day one, working on real projects with real business goals and outcomes. You’ll be working with a mix of customers, as well as a whole range of BT colleagues.


You could be placed in any of our commercial teams including: Contract Management, ICT Sales, Strategy and Commercial Practices. Regardless of the team you are in you will have a commercial role that aims to help you develop business skills that are fit for the future.


You’ll learn everything from communication, change management and stakeholder management plus a whole heap more. By the end of your placement, you’ll be a well-rounded professional with the skills you’ll need to really develop your career.


Duration


Our work placements start in January for 6 – 8 months. Don’t worry if your placement starts a little later, we will try to accommodate a later start date if it is before March.


Entry Requirements

You should be in the 2 nd penultimate or penultimate year of a relevant undergraduate degree course and on track to achieve a minimum 2.1


Salary

€20,000 per annum pro rata

Description

We're always on the lookout for brilliant people to join our team here at Covetrus IE . Although we may not have the perfect job for you at the moment, we still want to here from you!

The position of Operations Assistant covers all jobs and work in the warehouse relating to the receipt, locating, replenishing, counting, picking, checking, packing and dispatch of goods; the accurate and timely processing of customer sales orders and returns.

Requirements

Experience is not necessary, as long as you have the passion to learn new skills and are ready to hit the ground running.

Forklift Licence is desierable

Benefits

Who are Covetrus?

Covetrus is a global animal-health technology and services company supporting the companion equine and large animal veterinary markets. We put veterinarians at the centre of everything we do, and work as a trusted extension of their healthcare team.

Our values guide us every day.

Do Good, Be Passionate, Never Settle, Share the Customer Goal and Give Power

For more information about Covetrus please visit our website www.covetrus.co.uk

Covetrus is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting and supporting a diverse community and inclusive culture for all employees. Each of us contributes to inclusion—we all have a role to play. Our culture is the result of our behaviours, our shared values and our personal commitments. We encourage our people to adopt a growth mindset and to bravely share perspectives, empowering all of us to connect, belong, and grow. Our Global Diversity & Inclusion program outlines our Company Commitments to drive real and lasting change – supporting an anti-racist, diverse, inclusive and equitable culture at Covetrus.

Description

Description

Come and join our Team!


The position of Operations Assistant covers all jobs and work in the warehouse relating to the receipt, locating, replenishing, counting, picking, checking, packing and dispatch of goods; the accurate and timely processing of customer sales orders and returns.

Requirements

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Accept deliveries inbound. Record purchase order details onto the daily log.
  • Unpack, check and put received goods to correct warehouse locations
  • Complete stock replenishments as directed. Ensure accurate and timely stock movement reporting to maintain the highest possible levels of location accuracy.
  • Undertake cyclical stock counts as directed
  • Select goods for customer sales orders from their designated 'Fixed' stock locations. Securely pack sales orders in appropriate transit packaging & attach the customer's address label.
  • Carry out 15% QA checks on picked orders
  • Process customer returned goods as per written instructions.
  • To maintain the highest standards of Housekeeping by adhering to cleaning plans as per instruction from your Team Leader.
  • To fully comply with all Health and Safety requirements and instruction given.
  • Cover other duties as may be requested from time to time by any member of the Operations Dept. Management Team

In addition to the essential duties and responsibilities listed above, all positions are also responsible for:

  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures.
  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behaviour in completing job duties and assignments.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience:

The ability to work as a team member within the group and to co-operate with other departments is a necessary requirement for this position.

Flexibility of working hours and the ability to work overtime when required are essential.


Who are Covetrus?

Covetrus is a global animal-health technology and services company supporting the companion, equine and large animal veterinary markets. We put veterinarians at the centre of everything we do, and work as a trusted extension of their healthcare team.

As a global animal-health company with a mission to advance the world of veterinary medicine, we are dedicated to providing ethical and sustainable solutions that improve the lives of our employees, customers, and partners, while positively impacting the communities we serve.

Our values guide us every day.

Do Good, Be Passionate, Never Settle, Share the Customer Goal and Give Power

In addition to the essential duties and responsibilities listed above, all positions are also responsible for:

  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures
  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behaviour in completing job duties and assignments.

Covetrus is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting and supporting a diverse community and inclusive culture for all employees. Each of us contributes to inclusion—we all have a role to play. Our culture is the result of our behaviours, our shared values and our personal commitments. We encourage our people to adopt a growth mindset and to bravely share perspectives, empowering all of us to connect, belong, and grow.Our Global Diversity & Inclusion program outlines our Company Commitments to drive real and lasting change – supporting an anti-racist, diverse, inclusive and equitable culture at Covetrus.

Education:

Basic literacy and numeracy are essential for covering the core duties of the role.

Benefits

In return we offer a competitive salary together with a benefits package.

The Global Supply Planner will be responsible for developing, executing, maintaining and reporting on a supply plan that optimizes the utilization of raw material and manufacturing resources (people, plant, processes) to ensure on-time availability of products to support Sales while meeting Operational targets. The position ensures effective planning, compliance to company policies, and applicable regulatory requirements (ie. cGMP, GAAP). Other key responsibilities include analysing data and making recommendations to manage gaps and opportunities and achieve customer coverage and inventory goals. This position will primarily be based in Grifols Worldwide Operations, Dublin, Ireland with travel expected in line with business needs to other Grifols locations.

RESPONSIBILIITIES
  • Develop, execute, maintain and report on detailed supply and demand inventory balance, and/or supply plan achievements against budget and/or approved revised plans for all products, manufactured or processed through Grifols multiple Bioscience locations.
  • Work closely with factory planners to develop, prioritize, and manage monthly supply plan and production activity levels in support of business forecast and operational targets, including establishing lead times, lot sizes, appropriate product mix, and safety stocks.
  • Proactively manage and track production and releases of assigned product categories, develop dashboards for forward detection of potential gaps and opportunities, remediate and/or escalate for resolution as required.
  • Work closely with Global Demand group to ensure alignment between Supply and Demand.
  • Assure integrity of inventory and inventory levels using analytics to detect issues and risks which may impact ability to supply, operational economics and/or compliance. Review, initiate and execute corrective action including implementing best practices.
  • Provide timely and accurate Supply scenario analyses and inventory reports to management as required.
  • Participate in and support implementation of a singular Grifols global integrated business planning process to deliver seamless supply chain management solutions to the organization in terms of cost, time and service.
  • Develop and report on KPIs including material and product aging, at-risk batches, batch release cycle time; identify and rectify issues, and/or recommend solutions for improvement.
  • Actively participate in the review operational capacity constraints, development and implementation of solutions.
  • Coordinate with factories to maintain data integrity for planning master data in company's ERP system, including material master, info records, Bills of Material, routes, etc.
  • Initiate, organize and lead process / continuous improvement project teams.
  • Maintain a quality presence to ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements.
  • Maintain current knowledge of regulatory and industry standards.
  • Participate in regulatory and internal inspections/audits including providing written responses as applicable for area of responsibility
Requirements
  • Requires an in depth understanding of the fundamentals of planning and inventory control. Lean, Six Sigma, exposure to theory of constraints preferred.
  • Demonstrated strong technical skills in ERP navigation and reports. Specific experience with SAP is preferred.
  • Demonstrated project management skills.
  • Working knowledge and understanding of cGMPs, FDA regulations, and industry guidelines.
  • Self-starter with strong work ethic, common sense, and ability to work effectively with multiple and changing priorities.
  • Demonstrated strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to make structured decisions on a routine basis.
  • Must be proactive, results oriented, and have strong attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with personnel at all levels in a team environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in the English language. Bilingual Spanish a plus.
  • Computer literacy with MS Office with advanced proficiency in Excel required
  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Business, Science, or closely related discipline is required. CPIM certification is preferred. Master's degree in the same fields or closely related discipline is preferred.
  • Minimum of 2 years of manufacturing planning, forecasting, or related experience in supply chain methodologies is required, preferably in a pharmaceutical, GMP, or FDA / EU regulated environment

Reporting to the GDP Quality Manager the GDP Quality Specialist is responsible for ensuring compliance with EU Good Distribution Practice (GDP) Guidelines 2013/C 343/01, operating under the HPRA Wholesale Distribution Authorisation (WDA). In addition, supporting compliance under the Manufacturing Authorisation (MA) for Plasma Operations, Semi- Finished Product Distribution Activities and other activities as assigned by the Quality Manager and / or Technical Director.

The successful candidate will be expected to contribute to the continuous improvement of the Quality Management System.

The successful candidate will have had previous experience in a similar GDP role.

The successful candidate will require flexibility in relation to working hours in order to support Quality Activities related to Plasma Operations.

Responsibilities
  • Assist in the creation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) in relation to the Documentation System for GDP impacting areas.
  • Communicate with cross functional departments to ensure continued support of compliance under the WDA and MA.
  • Communication with the manufacturing and distribution sites of Grifols in relation to QMS activities where appropriate.
  • Support compliance with the general conditions of Wholesale Distribution/Manufacturing Authorisations, guidelines and other legal requirements.
  • Preparation and review of SOPs/documentation in the GDP area and Plasma Area
  • Co-ordination of customer complaints in relation to GDP
  • Manage GDP related KPIs and monthly compliance reporting across GDP operations.
  • Assist in ensuring staff operating in GDP areas, are competent and trained initially and continuously in GDP related activities.
  • Completion of delegated tasks relevant to the site temperature monitoring processes
  • Ensure the GDP Quality Manager or the Technical Director is appraised on all quality related issues relating to GDP
  • Provide support to the GMP area as required.
  • Management of documents on the DCM system as required.
  • Ensure Bona Fides are maintained and periodic review is complete for Suppliers and Customers
  • Completion of Master Data to Support Reception and Storage Process of Plasma from Plasma Donor Centres.
  • Responsible for review and approval of Plasma documentation and information received during Plasma deliveries
  • Responsible for the performance of Quality checks assigned during Plasma Operations
Requirements
  • Excellent people and time management skills
  • Strong technical writing and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication and teamwork
  • Ability to work proactively on own initiative
  • Experience working in distribution/manufacturing and supply chain experience in the pharmaceutical or related industry working under quality management systems in an environment of continuous improvement.
  • Experience in using Microsoft packages.
  • Degree in a science, pharmacy or related discipline.
  • Experience of working in a team environment and participating in Project teams.
  • Experience in Documentum.
  • SAP Pharma Experience.
  • Previous experience as an RP / Deputy RP.

Description

Here at Adare Manor, our vision is to create magical experiences that people will never forget. It's about a heartfelt Irish welcome that creates a sense of belonging. It's about an openness and warmth that's full of natural character. It's about a deeper understanding of every detail from start to finish. Our vision is Beyond Everything. We are always looking for people who want to play their part in helping us write the next chapter of this magical story.

Within one year of reopening the Resort, we were overjoyed to be awarded 'Hotel of the Year' at the Virtuoso Best of the Best Awards ceremony in Las Vegas in 2018. Since then, we have acquired many accolades including AA Ireland: Hotel of the Year 2019, Cond Nast Traveler Readers' Choice Awards 2019: #1 Resort in Europe and #5 in the World, IGTOA: Golf Resort of the Year 2018, Yes Chef: Afternoon Tea of the Year 2018, amongst many more. Our signature restaurant The Oak Room earned a position in the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland 2020 with One Michelin Star and continues to retain it.

We are now recruiting for a Housekeeping Supervisor. You will work as a part of a bigger, Rooms Division Team.

As a Housekeeping Supervisor with Adare Manor you will be responsible for:

  • Ensuring the standards and procedures are implemented consistently across all accommodation outlets on the Resort.
  • Effective supervision and checking of guest rooms, villas/lodges (where appropriate) turn down service, laundry services and relevant back of house areas ensuring that standards are adhered to.
  • Checking and maintaining of all public areas associated with your area to approved standard.
  • Daily/weekly business activities in terms of room occupancy, special requirements, VIP needs and to liaise with reception frequently in order to remain updated with any changes that may arise.
  • Organising the accommodation team allocating duties, key control, etc. so to ensure that all tasks will be completed.
  • Ensuring that all access cards/keys are signed in/out at the beginning/close of each shift.
  • Ensuring that all maintenance work / repairs in bedrooms are rectified prior to returning rooms back to reception.
  • Ensuring that all equipment, trolleys and other equipment are maintained in good condition, taking corrective action when required.

We look forward to speaking to standards and quality driven experiences accommodation supervisors. 5* resort experience would be a distinct advantage.

We offer exceptional working environment, development opportunities that are beyond everything, state of the art equipment as well as very competitive rates of pay & benefits.

Since then, we have acquired many accolades including AA Ireland: Hotel of the Year 2019, Cond Nast Traveler Readers' Choice Awards 2019: #1 Resort in Europe and #5 in the World, IGTOA: Golf Resort of the Year 2018, Yes Chef: Afternoon Tea of the Year 2018, amongst many more. Our signature restaurant The Oak Room earned a position in the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland 2020 with One Michelin Star and continues to retain it.

We are currently recruiting for a full-time Commis Chef to join our Banqueting Team.

As part of the renovation program, Adare Manor has built a ballroom/conference room that will cater for up to 350 guests. This room is beautifully situated overlooking the River Maigue. Our food concept is simple - we cook fine dining food for up to 350 people.

As a Commis Chef at Adare Manor, you can expect to be responsible for the following:

  • Organizing together with the Demi Chef de Partie/Chef de Partie the shift on his/her section regarding mise-en-place production and its service.
  • Taking orders from his/her Demi Chef de Partie/ Chef de Partie and carrying them out in the correct manner.
  • Together with his/her Chef de Partie writing daily wine, dry store, food requisitions and kitchen transfers on the appropriate forms for the approval of the Executive Chef / Sous Chef in order to achieve the high stock rotation desired in his/her section.
  • Having basic knowledge of food preparations.
  • Working to the specifications received by the Demi Chef de Partie/Chef de Partie regarding portion size, quantity, and quality as laid down in the recipe index

The ideal candidate will hold a recognised qualification in culinary arts and/or have at least 6 - 12 months experience in 5-star hotels or quality focused restaurants.

We offer an exceptional working environment, development opportunities that are beyond everything, state of the art equipment as well as competitive rates pay & benefits.

Our signature restaurant The Oak Room earned a position in the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland 2020 with One Michelin Star and continues to retain it.

There has never been a more exciting time to join the team and we are delighted to be recruiting for an Executive Sous Chef to join the team.

As an Executive Sous Chef you will perform within and delegate tasks to a multicultural team to ensure a superior food production and presentation within all of our outlets including 55 seater signature Restaurant, The Oak Room; The Gallery, The Carriage House Restaurant & Bar and Banqueting facility for 350 guests.

As an Executive Sous Chef you will:

  • Have the ability to handle multiple tasks as well busy banqueting, outside catering & volume production with an eye to detail and presentation.
  • Stay up to date with latest culinary trends and create ideas into better and consistent implementations.
  • Be responsible for fully implemented HACCP guidelines as well as general health & safety in the workplace.
  • Create menus, buffets and "specials" which meet the needs of the target market and are in line with the operating concept for the restaurant in conjunction with the Culinary Director
  • Assist with the preparation of the department budget.
  • Ensure that the Outlets Operational budgets are in line and costs are strictly controlled maximising profitability.
  • Assist each Outlet Chef to run their Kitchens at an acceptable food cost.
  • Respond to any changes in the F&B function as dictated by the industry, company or hotel

The ideal candidate must hold a recognised degree in culinary arts and have at least 5 years' experience in 5 star hotels and restaurant quality focused operations with at least 3 of those years at Chef management level. We offer state of art equipment, facilities, magical environment & a very generous package.

Description

Here at Adare Manor, our vision is to create magical experiences that people will never forget. It's about a heartfelt Irish welcome that creates a sense of belonging. It's about an openness and warmth that's full of natural character. It's about a deeper understanding of every detail from start to finish. Our vision is Beyond Everything. We are always looking for people who want to play their part in helping us write the next chapter of this magical story.

Our signature restaurant The Oak Room earned a position in the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland 2020 with One Michelin Star and continues to retain it.

We are currently recruiting for a Chef de Cuisine to join our Banqueting kitchen.

Our banqueting product is one of the 'stand out' offerings that the Adare Manor Resort has to offer the incentive and wedding market and the Chef de Cuisine will work in close partnership with wedding planners and corporate liaisons to ensure a seamless delivery of each event. This role requires the skills of a highly organised and meticulous person who is service driven and has a good eye for detail and style.

As a Chef de Cuisine for Banqueting kitchen you will:

  • Have the ability to handle multiple tasks with attention to detail.
  • Be progressive thinking with cuisine & able to implement such ideas with ease.
  • Property follows 100% HACCP guidelines in the workplace & following these procedures is essential.
  • Maintain good working relationships with colleagues and all other departments.
  • Assume responsibility for increasing departmental sales and profit.
  • Minimize payroll costs by maximizing the productivity and efficient scheduling of employees.
  • Be able to control food cost.
  • Control wastage & proper usage of recipes.

The ideal candidate must hold a recognised degree in culinary arts and have at least 5 years' experience in 5 star hotels with at least 3 of those years at Chef management level.

We offer state of art equipment, facilities & a very generous package.

Description

Metrologist


We are vital links between an idea for a new medicine and the people who need it. We are the people of PPD — thousands of employees in locations worldwide connected by tenacity and passion for our purpose: toimprove health.You will be joining a trulycollaborative and winning cultureas we strive to bend the time and cost curve of deliveringlife-saving therapies to patients.



Envision a workplace where you have a direct impact on improving health, work alongside expert scientists, use newest technologies and collaborate with industry thought leaders and therapeutic experts. Welcome to PPD® Laboratories, where science is our passion, quality is our commitment and people are the cornerstone of our success.



Our team is currently looking to hire a Metrologist to join our GMP laboratory in Athlone.


As a Metrologist you will provideexpertise in laboratory instruments to support qualification, maintenance, repairs and calibration of a range of laboratory testing equipment such as dissolution apparatus, particle counting apparatus, HPLC, UPLC.



Key responsibilities

  • Coordinates and performs calibration and maintenance activities on a range of analytical equipment per PPD procedures.
  • Coordinates and performs equipment qualifications, executing IQ/OQ/PQ activities.
  • Tracks and maintains equipment schedule per PPD procedures.
  • Reviews and updates equipment SOP’s.
  • Troubleshooting equipment repair.
  • Performs work assignments accurately, and in a timely and safe manner.
  • Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.
  • Coordinate and prioritize project activities with internal functional groups analytical labs.



Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in science or engineering.
  • Previous experience that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job (comparable to 3-5+ years) or equivalent combination of education, training, & experience.
  • Experience with equipment maintenance/calibration within a GMP environment


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • GMP knowledge and understanding of FDA, ICH, and USP guidelines
  • Analytical equipment experience is a must.
  • Experience in running/maintaining/calibrating a range of analytical equipment including HPLC/UPLC/Dissolution apparatus/ particle counting apparatus.
  • Experience in cell lab equipment is a plus.
  • Ability to utilize Microsoft Excel and Word to perform tasks
  • Proven ability in technical writing skills
  • Proven problem solving and troubleshooting abilities
  • Time management and project management skills
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to work in a collaborative work environment with a team as well as working off own initiative.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment requiring frequent changes in priorities.
  • Ability to train/mentor junior staff.

At PPD we hire the best, develop ourselves and each other, and recognise the power of being one team.We understand that you will want to grow both professionally and personally throughout your career, and therefore at PPD you will benefit from anaward-winning learning and development programme, ensuring you reach your potential.



As well as being rewarded a competitive salary, we have an extensive benefits package based around the health and well-being of our employees. We haveaflexible working culture, where PPD truly value a work-life balance.We’ve grown sustainably year on year but continue to offer a collaborative environment, with teams of colleagues eager to share expertise and have fun together.We are aglobal organisation but with a local feel.



- We have a strong will to win - We earn our customer’s trust - We are gamechangers - We do the right thing -We are one PPD -



If you resonate with our five principles above, and ultimately wish to accelerate the delivery of safe and effective therapeutics for some of the world’s most urgent health needs, then please submit your application – we’d love to hear from you.

Our GMP laboratory based in Athlone, Ireland offers fully integrated solutions for product development and analytical development, including analytical testing services in method development, method validation, method transfer, release and stability studies. Our highly qualified GMP lab staff work across our 3 laboratory groups: Biopharm, Small Molecule, and Inhalation.



The Senior Project Manager role has direct oversight for a portfolio of designated GMP analytical service projects. Proactively identifies resources, budgets project, prioritises client's portfolio in line with site-wide portfolio of projects and is the primary operational interface between PPD and the client.The Senior Project Manager works closely with laboratory management to ensure that the project deliverables meet customer expectations and meet PPD financial commitments.




Key responsibilities:

  • Provides oversight and coordination of client portfolio. Provides oversight to internal departments and external clients to ensure the project requirements are understood, agreed and followed at all times, this requires negotiating and real-time decision making with the client.
  • Facilitates the flow of information to all stakeholders (Client, Labs, Quality Department, Sample Management and Business Development). Consults and utilizes, where appropriate, the scientific input of laboratory management and technical staff to assist the client with management projects.
  • Acts as a relationship manager between the lab and the client, communicating and escalating client requests, liaising with project teams to provide solutions to meet client needs, while implementing approaches consistent across teams/functional units.
  • Prepare and manage client communication: emails, telecons, face to face meetings, Business review meetings (agendas, metrics, meeting preparation – presentations).
  • Manage Internal communication – Labs, Sample Management, Quality Department, IT.
  • Prepares Documents: specifications, protocols, reports. Assures compliance with all relevant guidelines.
  • Manage forecast of activities – new work / projects and reviews/manages contracts (FTE, fixed price , Unit cost). Responsible for projections and accurate invoicing - coordinates with Finance for all billing and invoicing for the client’s portfolio of projects.
  • Consults with BD and contract staff during initial proposal review on standard services and costs, supporting RFP feasibility assessments, advises on possible solutions if needed.
  • Supports and coaches APM, PM in Operational Project Management: Shipment inspection review, Login authorization, login verification, COA set up, QA submission. Stability Studies– review and set up of stability launches, monitor stability pull reports, organise pull check outs. Sample disposal approvals. Shipment organization. Cumulative stability reports.
  • Maintains and monitors KPI metrics: TATs, workload, Invalids, Data trending, Reference material / control trending. Deviation/Investigation metrics.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


•Strong verbal, written and presentation skills


•Competent with specific computers and enterprise applications, including office productivity, Superior time management, planning, and organisational skills


• Strong negotiation skills


•Proven analytical skills


•Demonstrated compliance with procedures and policies


•Ability to perform multiple tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment


•Strong client relationship management skills


•Ability to work effectively with multi-level teams

 Job Category Sales Job Details What is a Video Creative Role at Salesforce Solution Engineering?

At Salesforce, we’re all about blazing trails with easy-to-learn technology! And how do we show people how easy it is to achieve their potential? Well, that’s where you come in!

2020 forced the world to recognise the importance of video, and in 2021 content creators are crying out to demonstrate that the ways in which audiences consume this content is changing - content must be shorter, more engaging. Audiences must feel relaxed and come away feeling like they’ve learned something. Moreover, the audience is finally in control. They don’t care about big budgets, because the magic is in the skill of the creator.

Our small and medium business (SMB) team looks after thousands of companies across all industries. Many of the big brands and companies you know today started as small customers with this team and we helped them grow. As a video producer and editor, you will work with industry and product professionals to produce content that speaks the language of our small customers. The SMB team at Salesforce is looking for a video producer and digital designer–a talented and highly skilled creative with the ability to turn initial concepts into finished projects. You combine video, animations, graphics and storytelling magic to create remarkable work that inspires customers, attracts prospects, and delivers results. You have a strong understanding of the importance of script and how different audiences digest media.

This is a brand new role with scope for you to really make a mark and help define the evolution of how we engage with our customers and prospects. This isn’t about selling - this is about empowering smaller businesses and start-ups to make well-informed decisions.

In this role
  • You will generate video content by working with industry and product experts and supporting them in producing materials that will educate and engage customers at the top of funnel
  • You will work with a wider project team who will assist with the strategy, internal enablement, innovation and communication that will enable you to do your job
  • You will carefully consider the recorded content that is appropriate to be delivered as part of live webinar, as well as what content is suitable for a choose-your-own-adventure demo tool such as Consensus. You will also identify if there are other appropriate channels that should be taken into account.
  • You will create and communicate a schedule of what content will be created and when, as well as speaking up to propose content you believe may be required next
  • You will investigate the success of the content you produce and use data to inform your next decisions
  • You will also propose to the business what additional support you will need, and how we should build out your team
Candidates must have
  • Strong video editing skills and a portfolio to demonstrate
  • Strong leadership skills and a willingness to build a team to deliver high quality and engaging content
  • A keen sense of how to work smarter and not harder to deliver fast - re-using materials for different customers, generating templates, keeping to time
  • A knowledge of (or appetite for) the sales processes and to make their voice heard on how we can improve the customer experience at the top of the sales funnel
  • An innovative and creative approach that builds upon our corporate branding strategy
  • Strong interpersonal skills in every sense - through video content, in internal presentations, with leadership and peers - someone inspirational in getting their point across
  • Great relationship building skills - curious to understand what motivates a viewer and taking feedback from our sales colleagues who are closest to the customers in their industries
  • Excellent organisational skills
Relevant skills and experience that are desired but not required
  • Screen-capture skills
  • Video editing skills (software agnostic, though Adobe Premier Pro and Camtasia are preferred)
  • Videography skills
  • Script guidance and editing
  • Familiarity with the Consensus platform and Vidyard
  • Familiarity with UX processes
  • Customer facing experience
  • Knowledge of sales processes

Who We Are?

We are the largest independent Irish provider of Logistics, and Sales and Marketing. Our company values represent all our combined views and feelings about who we are and our culture here at Primeline. Our values are Respect, Excellence, Courage, Teamwork and Results, and these values determine how we behave when doing our job, working with our teams and when dealing with our many customers and principles. Our business is diverse and well cultured, with over 50 different nationalities and 5 different generations working side by side every day.

What We Do?

We move 1 million boxes per week, we have over 100,000 square foot of warehousing and we employ over 600 direct employees across the Primeline Group, from warehouse operatives, transport drivers, field sales representatives and many support roles based in our Head Office located in Ashbourne, Co. Meath. Primeline is multifaceted, and we operate across many industries including FMCG, retail, pharmacy, media, automotive, print, ambient food and technology and we provide cutting edge supply chain solutions to companies operating in Ireland. We service over 4500 retailers and have

a fleet of over 200 vehicles.

Where We Are Going?

We continue to develop our leadership teams to ensure that Primeline remains a place where people want to come to work every day, and a place where people can learn and strive towards their future goals. We will continue to create an environment where people can be at their best. Retaining our current customer blue chip companies and multinational brands and growing new business which by providing best brand execution will be key to our success. We will build the best relationships and partnerships with our principles and customers and we continue drive a values-based culture.

What Do We Want?

We are looking for an enthusiastic and positive individual who can meet sales goals while offering personalized customer service and maintaining long-lasting relationships with customers.

What Your Day To Day Will Look Like?

Acknowledge and greet customers and offer friendly, prompt and courteous service.

Interface with existing customer base and following up on all customer enquiries

Inform customers of current promotions, events and services within the store

Meet and exceed your individual sales targets and client goals and support the golas of the team

Track individual weekly and monthly sales, obtain sales goals from the counter and business manager

Conduct make up applications, skin care analysis and product demonstrations with customers.

Commnicate and merchandise any stock needs to the account manager

Ensure that all merchandise, testers and demonstration stations are maintained and set to company standard

Ability to positively and proactively handle customer concerns and prioritise multiple tasks in a fast paced environment

Ability to work as part of a team and independently.

What Skills Do You Need For This Role?

Build and maintain strong customer relationships

Ideally you would have expereince as a counter sales person.

maintain positive relationships in store with Shiseido team and store colleagues

What Behaviours Are Most Important To Us?

Family is in our DNA at Primeline, we are a family run business of over 30 years which has grown into a 350million turnover business today.

We instil a sense of family in how we operate and support each other and our teams.

We feel it is important to respect every person and every role, we understand that all colleagues and every role has an impact on our business. We are all part on one team and all share a common goal.

We seek to give recognition to others and show loyalty and support to our colleagues, our customers and to Primeline.

We were founded on the principle of "making things happen" and we thrive on accomplishing what we set out to achieve.

We continuously strive to improve and increase our capabilities.

We make keeping what we have committed to, the measure of our honour.

 Job Category Sales Job Details Director Job Spec, UKI BDR

Job Details

A fantastic opportunity exists within our UK and Ireland Business Development organisation for a 2nd-line leader looking to further their career in a hyper-growth, fast-paced and dynamic environment. The role is based in Dublin.

The Business Development organisation is a talent and revenue engine for Salesforce. You will take overall responsibility for inspiring, mentoring and continuously forming a team of business development representatives (BDR’s) and their managers who generate sales pipeline in support of our closing sales organisation (Account Executives).

You will take ownership of pipeline generation and you will monitor its progression through the sales cycle, your ability to partner at the Area Vice President level and the supporting functions, incl. Marketing, Sales Strategy, Enablement, Recruitment and Sales Programs, will define your success. You will be responsible for coaching your managers to forecast and run their business effectively. You’ll be a critical contributor to longer-term sales strategies as well as monthly results, providing the definition and implementation of the plan for Sales to achieve key objectives.

Role

The sales development business operates using four key pillars which contribute to our success, these are talent, Culture, Operational Excellence and alignment, your role across these pillars is as follows

Talent

Lead a team of 3-5 managers and circa 30-45 BDRs

Work closely with recruitment and BDR managers to ensure we’re on track to meet our hiring needs.

Forecast upcoming BDR promotions and align with future hiring managers

Mentor and develop the BDR managers who have varying degrees of people management experience.

Monitor and lead team performance to ensure consistent delivery of monthly, quarterly and yearly targets

Culture

Set the tone within your organisation with specific attention to virtual, in-person and hyrbid working environments

Promote values of trust, personal growth, diversity and innovation.

Celebrate the success of the individual contributors and managers that are in your organisation.

Find time to give back and ensure your team find time to switch off both individually and together

Operational Excellence

Drive weekly execution on key input metrics i.e. outbound prospecting activity

Observe and act on output metrics i.e. early sales opportunity creation that converts to sales pipeline

Forecast weekly and build sales incentives to get results above and beyond standard performance.

Identify and build solutions to areas of risk that could impact team performance

As you become more tenured take part in and initiate projects that innovate and drive the business forward

Alignment

Champion your team across the organisation, what will your team be famous for?

Work alongside senior sales leadership to align with and delivering on business objectives

Collaborate with Marketing and Sales programs teams on demands generation plans

Work closely with recruitment to hit hiring targets

Build and deliver executive presentations for internal partners and external customers

Your Previous Experience

Second-line leadership experience and you will have successfully led Sales/Sales development teams with a track record of hitting performance goals and driving growth, preferably (but not exclusively) in the tech industry.

Experience managing and leading teams at scale with a focus on coaching, mentoring and diversity.

Experience successfully leading cross-functional relationships which contribute to team performance and business goals

Demonstrable leadership capabilities that show you can operate in a fast-paced, high growth environment

Driven to achieve results

Experience in outbound prospecting and new business generation i.e. cold calling, social selling, video prospecting

Outstanding communication, organisational and time leadership skills

Excellent presentation and listening skills

A trusted advisor to cross-functional partners

Strong intuition for business and understanding of consultative selling

The Team

High performing business development team who are delivering strong double-digit growth in new sales pipeline and revenue for salesforce, a team who, due to consistently promoting individual contributors are always hiring. You will work alongside senior leaders who have been at Salesforce for 6+ years and these leaders will be key contributors to your onboarding.

What do BDRs do in more detail?

As a Business Development Representative, you are the first person to speak with our future customers. Working in our team, you will develop a deep knowledge of your territory and our solutions, and use this to hold insightful conversations to discover if a company’s needs and our offerings overlap. You will become adept at helping companies pinpoint their challenges, and then paint a picture of the wide-ranging business value that Salesforce can deliver.

In the BDR role, you’ll do well if you are curious about business, organised, tenacious, and like to see the fruits of your efforts. You’ll work closely with senior sales people in your territory, planning thoughtful outreaches, and consulting prospects on how their companies can best implement our technology. Once you have reached a level of proficiency, you will have freedom in how you run your business.

We are looking for people who share our four core values - trust, customer success, innovation and equality. Why? It’s important you feel you belong here. Right from the beginning, we want people of excellent character, who keep their promises and display a brilliant demeanour to their teammates, prospects, and the wider Salesforce Ohana. We look for people, who can understand others, communicate effectively, and get things done. The icing on the cake is the energy you bring to the team and the job: Positive, helpful, enterprising. You view team success as highly as you do personal success.

The Day-to-Day
  • Plan and implement tailored campaigns around solutions or events to entice prospective clients to speak with you
  • Use your follow-up plan on these campaigns to hit monthly call-connect targets
  • Use strong qualification skills on those calls to uncover need and hit your monthly targets
  • Align with the Account Executives you support, discussing and refining your prospecting strategy
  • Utilise the Salesforce platform to gather intelligence on your accounts, and record all activity and actions
  • Attend dedicated product and sales-acumen trainings each week
  • Help drive innovation, knowledge sharing and, most importantly, craic in our team meetings and discussions

Job description

Summary:


We are seeking a highly motivated, dynamic and organised Physiotherapist to join our specialist practice in Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine. This will combine leadership roles in physiotherapy and clinical care with practice management and outreach activities.

This exciting and innovative role offers a fantastic opportunity for the right candidate to further develop their career in sports medicine in an established orthopaedic sports practice while also offering the opportunity for career progression.


Further Information:


Our practice in Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine has become a recognised leader in the provision of care to athletes and all patients with injuries of the knee and shoulder across Ireland. We treat patients and athletes of all levels of activity, from recreational to professional. Our primary practice location is at Sports Surgery Clinic Dublin, with satellite centres at Galway Clinic, Blackrock Clinic, and Trinity College Dublin.


We are focused on delivering the highest possible level of care, as well as excellence in all interactions and communications with physicians, physiotherapists, rehabilitation specialists and others, all of which ensures the best outcomes possible for our patients. In addition to delivering standard medical and surgical treatments, we are also expanding our practice activity in the field of biological treatments and regenerative approaches for pain and injury.


The appointed Physiotherapist will be working in all capacities of patient care in orthopaedics and sports medicine. This will combine leadership roles in both physiotherapy and practice management. While the successful candidate will be supported by our practice administrative team, the responsibility of managing the physiotherapy and post operative patient caseload will remain with the appointed physiotherapist. Primary responsibilities will include managing our post-surgical care pathway, supporting patients with clinical queries, and providing physiotherapy assessments and treatments to both our surgical and non-operative patients.

The successful candidate will also play a lead role in our programmes of outreach, marketing and education, digital media, website activity, patient resources, and video delivered content.


Essential Criteria:


• A demonstrable commitment to developing a career in Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine

• An understanding of the importance of contributing to practice management as well as physiotherapy in the delivery of high-quality patient care.

• BSC in physiotherapy or an equivalent qualification. Current ISCP and CORU registration.

• Preference will be given to candidates who can demonstrate CPD or post graduate experience and education in the area of Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics.

• Candidates ideally will have a minimum of 1-2 years post graduate experience in musculoskeletal, orthopaedics and sports medicine.

• Flexibility in working across our clinical sites located in Dublin and Galway.

• Demonstrate sufficient clinical knowledge and evidence-based practice to carry out duties and responsibilities of the post


Demonstrate ability to plan and deliver care in an effective and resourceful manner within a model of person-centred care.



Personal Attributes Required:


• Highly organised

• Efficient and proactive

• Have a passion for sports-focused orthopaedic care

• Ability to successfully interact with all levels of an organisation, as well as with outside physicians, physiotherapists, industry and academic partners

• Demonstration of enthusiasm for outreach and usage of digital and social media platforms

• Interest in research, patient outcome evaluation, and continued professional development in Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine.


Salary and Conditions will be discussed with applicants shortlisted for interview and will be based on level of experience.


References will be required prior to appointment.


We pride ourselves in maintaining an excellent standard of care for our patients, our athletes and their families.


If you think that you would be a good fit for our practice we would love to hear from you with your CV.


Informal enquiries are also welcomed if you would like to discuss this opportunity and your potential suitability.


Please contact us at

E-mail: info@cathaljmoran.com

Tel: 01 5262352

 Job Category Products and Technology Job Details

Some Of What You Will Do

We’re building the next generation in incident response at Salesforce. We are bringing people, process and data together for smoother and faster collaboration, communication and remediation.
  • Build rich, intuitive and elegant user experience and the backend that supports the GUI with a team of experienced software developers.
  • Commit to your customers’ success by owning the experience end to end; all the way from design, through development, validation, deployment and support in production.
  • Commit to disciplined Software Engineering - tech specs are second nature to you, code reviews are a way of life, and your high quality code is always production ready.
  • Work closely with the open-source community. The community gave to us, it’s only right that you contribute back changes and enhancements.
  • Use your prior experience to make sound design decisions, account for all the abilities of enterprise scale software, resolve complex technical issues and promote innovation. Be an example for engineering excellence!
What You Have Done
  • Acquired at minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related engineering field. Masters degree is a plus.
  • Expertise with programming language and frameworks like Java, Spring, Node.js, etc.
  • Expertise of UI technologies and frameworks such as Javascript, Typescript, HTML, CSS, React.js, D3.js, DC.js, Bootstrap, npm, Grunt, Jasmine.
  • Knowledge of database systems like Oracle, MySQL, Postgres
  • Track record of success in delivering software products with rich GUI features and workflows along with backend code that powers the GUI.
  • Demonstrated leadership in mentoring small teams in the process of conceptualizing, designing, implementing and shipping quality deliverables.
  • Demonstrated passion, ability, a willingness to learn quickly and a mindset to make a difference. You are an effective communicator and work equally well in a team or by yourself. You get stuff done!
  • Any experience with data-driven platforms like Kafka, HBase, etc and distribute systems technologies is a plus
  • Any experience with SaaS and public cloud substrates such as GCP or AWS is a plus.

Main responsibilities include:

·        Ad hoc duties as required

 

What you'll need to succeed:


Success in the role will require the ability to communicate at all levels, superior relationship building skills, the ability to be resourceful, open-minded and thrive working within a dynamic business that has an ambitious growth agenda.



The ideal candidate will poses:

·        Proficient working knowledge of all aspects of human resources, including but not limited to compensation and benefits, employee relations, employment law, leadership and talent management, training and HRM systems.

·        The ability to deal with sensitive information in a confidential manner with unquestionable integrity.

·        Strong attention to detail, the ability to work on own initiative, creative, positive and problem solving outlook.

·        Solid working knowledge of MS Office.

·        SAP Success Factors system working knowledge will be advantageous.

 

What you'll get in return:


You will have the opportunity to join a leading, dynamic and growing global Company whilst developing your HR skills further. The role offers great exposure to change management, within a highly dynamic commercial business.

Do what you love. Love what you do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About the Team
The Engineering Services Frameworks builds common frameworks that are shared across the Workday Application Suite. These products touch every single application and every single customer in Workday. Engineering Services Frameworks consists of the following main areas: Enterprise Frameworks - The Enterprise Framework team focuses on building products that help orchestrate processes between people and systems. Developer Platforms - This team owns the application developer platforms, tools, and languages used by all of our application software engineers: XpressO (XO) and YP.
About the Role

As a Software Development Engineer on the Enterprise Frameworks - Org Engineering team you will be working with a great team of developers across Pleasanton, Munich and Dublin to design and develop features that deliver value to Workdays 3000+ customers .Org Engineering team is responsible for one of the foundational frameworks that enables hiring people, assigning them to various roles, managing headcount and budgets via cost centers and enables workday customers across all applications to effectively run their organisations.

What you'll do:
  • Design components and APIs for cross functional application teams
  • Analyse and assess impacts of our API's & features on Workday's flagship products
  • Be part of a dynamic & fun agile team that is rearchitecting our core organisation framework
  • Use UML tools to design and communicate our framework components
  • Understand Workday Technology Architecture to solve challenging performance and scale problems
  • Work with product management, support, and quality engineers on triaging customer escalations and bugs
  • Contribute to process improvements to the success of the team
  • Institute and adopt best engineering practices.

About You

Your background includes:
  • Passion for software development and analytical thinking
  • Ability to learn fast and fail forward
  • 4+ years experience in OO enterprise software development preferably using Java/C++/C#.
  • Aptitude for coding and designing APIs for performance, scalability and security
  • Exposure to agile development methodologies
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • BS in Computer Science or related fields

 Job Category Sales Job Details

Salesforce is looking for an experienced, dynamic Account Executive to manage some of its most important Commercial Accounts in the Middle East region . This region is part of the Mediterranean, Middle East and Africa (MMEA) group and is seen as the growth engine for the EMEA business unit, in essence a dynamic start up within a larger organisation. Initially working remotely, the Commercial Account Executive will be responsible for growing both a defined number of existing Commercial Business Unit accounts in the existing Finance and Construction/ Real Estate verticals . Experience of the region and/ or knowledge of the defined vertical focus would be preferred.

This role is defined as a Core role within Salesforce, working together with other internal Cloud and Partner AEs to lead and take responsibility for the overall Account Management.

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work for seven years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Your Mission
  • Assigned to Medium/ Large sized, complex, highly visible, Commercial Accounts across the Middle East
  • Manages the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.
  • Engages with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.
  • Successfully interacts at the C-level.
  • Strategically navigates organization.
  • Drives significant coordination amongst groups such as Sales Engineers, Co-Prime, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc. to drive account strategy.
  • Creates and drives strategic emphasis where none previously existed.
  • Accurately forecasts and achieves revenue goals.
Required Experience
  • Quota carrying Software or Technology Sales and Account Management experience selling to Commercial/ Enterprise organisations
  • Must have demonstrable experience selling Business Applications to Medium to High end organisations in their current role.
  • Proven leadership credentials to lead and manage an extensive virtual team, in support of overall Account vision, strategy and goals.
  • Focussed, regional experience is an advantage as is knowledge of the Salesforce ecosystem.
  • Demonstrable track record of success, achieving/exceeding quota in recent sales positions. A minimum of 5 years selling into Commercial accounts and no more than four career moves in the last 10 years.
  • Preference given towards recent and successful experience in the software industry (Cloud experience would be a plus)
  • Evidence of relationship building skills with an ability to grow and nurture relationships.
  • Exhibits characteristics of self-starting, risk taking, and a drive to succeed.
  • Must be proficient in both oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to map out and strategically define account plans for top tier accounts managed.
  • Ability to sell both an application and deployment of a platform.
  • Excellent at leveraging C-level and LOB relationships.
  • Effectively optimizes internal and external networks.
  • Collaborates cross functionally internally to actualize deal strategy.
  • Ability to negotiate complex deals.
  • Ability to travel extensively - Average of 8 days per month
  • Fluent in English a necessity, Arabic is an advantage

 Job Category Sales Job Details

Commercial Account Executive - Middle East

Location - UK, France or Ireland

Salesforce is looking for an experienced, dynamic Account Executive to manage some of its most important Commercial Accounts in the Middle East region . This region is part of the Mediterranean, Middle East and Africa (MMEA) group and is seen as the growth engine for the EMEA business unit, in essence a dynamic start up within a larger organisation. Initially working remotely, the Commercial Account Executive will be responsible for growing both a defined number of existing Commercial Business Unit accounts in the existing Finance and Construction/ Real Estate verticals . Experience of the region and/ or knowledge of the defined vertical focus would be preferred.

This role is defined as a Core role within Salesforce, working together with other internal Cloud and Partner AEs to lead and take responsibility for the overall Account Management.

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work for seven years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Your Mission
  • Assigned to Medium/ Large sized, complex, highly visible, Commercial Accounts across the Middle East
  • Manages the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.
  • Engages with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.
  • Successfully interacts at the C-level.
  • Strategically navigates organization.
  • Drives significant coordination amongst groups such as Sales Engineers, Co-Prime, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc. to drive account strategy.
  • Creates and drives strategic emphasis where none previously existed.
  • Accurately forecasts and achieves revenue goals.
Required Experience
  • Quota carrying Software or Technology Sales and Account Management experience selling to Commercial/ Enterprise organisations
  • Must have demonstrable experience selling Business Applications to Medium to High end organisations in their current role.
  • Proven leadership credentials to lead and manage an extensive virtual team, in support of overall Account vision, strategy and goals.
  • Focussed, regional experience is an advantage as is knowledge of the Salesforce ecosystem.
  • Demonstrable track record of success, achieving/exceeding quota in recent sales positions. A minimum of 5 years selling into Commercial accounts and no more than four career moves in the last 10 years.
  • Preference given towards recent and successful experience in the software industry (Cloud experience would be a plus)
  • Evidence of relationship building skills with an ability to grow and nurture relationships.
  • Exhibits characteristics of self-starting, risk taking, and a drive to succeed.
  • Must be proficient in both oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to map out and strategically define account plans for top tier accounts managed.
  • Ability to sell both an application and deployment of a platform.
  • Excellent at leveraging C-level and LOB relationships.
  • Effectively optimizes internal and external networks.
  • Collaborates cross functionally internally to actualize deal strategy.
  • Ability to negotiate complex deals.
  • Ability to travel extensively - Average of 8 days per month
  • Fluent in English a necessity, Arabic is an advantage
