Job summary
Come join a creative team of Operations Technology Engineers that builds the wired and wireless networks that power Amazon fulfillment centers and transportation sites worldwide. These networks are used by hundreds of thousands of associates, relied upon by operators of industry-leading fulfillment and transportation systems, and play a critical role in the delivery of shipments to Amazon retail customers.
We are looking for a Network Development Engineers to provide technical thought leadership in the design of our next-generation networks. As we look to the future, our networks will support an ecosystem of robotics, industrial IoT, sensors, drones, and mobile devices. You are comfortable with making data motivated decisions, and iterating on designs that may fail at the outset to ultimately deliver robust systems that elegantly scale. Information security and network reliability are at the core of your thought processes, and you are respected as an influencer.
In this role you will also operate the largest fulfillment network in the world, and provide guidance to and mentoring to network support teams to develop their skills and reinforce best practices. Network reliability is critical to Amazon Operations, and your responsibilities will include driving root cause resolution of network events most impact-full to the business.
The OpsTech NetEng team has broad scope supporting multiple business units globally, from the smallest delivery stations in emerging markets, to the most advanced automated fulfillment centers in North America, Japan, and Europe. As a result, this group enjoys variety in both short-term innovation and long-term strategic projects. This is a unique opportunity that will enable you to grow your skills as an engineer, have a lasting impact on Amazon’s fulfillment networks for years to come.

  • Experience in automating administration using , Perl, or other language
  • Development and delivery of large scale designs in data center networks
  • Experience with IPv6 Design and implementations
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficiency in wide area networking (including SDWAN), wireless networking, and industrial Ethernet
  • Expertise in information security for industrial control systems

• A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
  • Excellent design, implementation, and skills combined with a proven documentation methodology.
  • 2+ years’ experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks
  • 3+ years of experience with major routing protocols
  • 3+ years of experience with routing and switching hardware from major vendors including Juniper and Cisco
  • 2+ years of experience building solutions using AWS technologies
  • 2+ years of experience in a high level programming language
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work shifts - 10 hours a day for 4 days per week, including one weekend day (Saturday or Sunday)
  • Ability to work oncall - during the normal business hours and/or outside of business hours.
Job summary
Amazon OpsTech Engineering is looking for a highly motivated Development Manager for our Wireless Reliability team. The Reliability Engineering team owns ensuring our wireless products and designs are highly available and reliable for our customers. We identify, mitigate, and ultimately resolve risks within our network, validate solutions and operational readiness, and partner to deliver scalable software solutions that reduce TOIL or enable greater use of human effort. The Develop Manager develops the networks for all of Amazon’s fulfillment business supporting retail operations. If you are passionate to help build next generation networks that Robotics and IoT in retail space, this is the role.

As Engineering manager you will be responsible for leading a team of experienced development engineers and have ultimate responsibility for global, end-to-end delivery of one of the key areas, including architecture, capacity management, implementation, operational standards, process management, and At Amazon, we expect our technical leaders to be strong engineers who can dive deep and get involved in addition to being strong managers.

As a manager within the Networking team you will be expected to drive operational excellence in everything we do. This includes creating sane processes, procedures and to improve efficiency in our day-to-day tasks and projects. You will work closely on supporting our internal customers and ensuring that their needs and issues are being addressed.

Network Development
As an engineering manager you are responsible to deliver highly scalable network architectures that are globally deploy-able

Network Measurement
As a Network Engineering manager you will be expected to drive quality into the metrics we report to assist us in focusing on the areas that give us the best ROI. This includes measurement of our project plans, build schedules, issues, and cycle times.

Performance Management/Team Health
You will own all facets of performance and career management for the team. Regular one-on-one meetings with all team members are required. You will be expected to provide both technical and soft skill mentoring in order to maintain a well-rounded, truly innovative organization. This includes project management, quality audits and coordination of training sessions with senior-level engineers.

Incident/Change Management
You will be integral to developing and improving incident and change management within the Networking space. Responsibilities include driving initiatives regarding improvements to existing tools & processes and providing feedback on new practices & procedures in order to scale with the rapid expansion of the Amazon platform and customer base.

Recruiting and Hiring
You will take the lead in hiring quality personnel who not only fit the needs of the current organization but also will allow the team to scale with platform and service growth. You will coordinate with Amazon and external recruiting staff to evaluate potential candidates, participate in initial phone screens and provide relevant guidance and feedback during on-site interview loops. You will also be responsible for ensuring that proper training takes place for all new hires.

This is an amazing opportunity in terms of responsibility, interesting challenges and high visibility. We truly are looking for the highest quality candidates, so you should expect a rigorous interview process.

  • Advanced knowledge in automating network deployments
  • Multiple years experience in a networking team with global scale
  • Ability to mentor team members
  • Multiple years experience building solutions using AWS lambda, CFN, EC2, StepFunctions.
  • A genuine passion for building systems that are simple and work well
  • Cisco, Juniper and/or AWS professional level certifications.

A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.
Experience supporting enterprise level network infrastructure.
5+ years managing networking support teams or engineering teams.
7+ years managing technical teams.

Job summary
Amazon is looking for a Network Operations Manager to lead a team of highly skilled Engineers in our Infrastructure Operations group. This team is the escalation point of contact for all critical infrastructure related issues in Amazon Fulfillment Centers and Amazon Logistics sites globally. The support provided by this team has global reach and impacts all first, middle and last mile business units.

As a Network Operations Manager, you will be responsible for end-to-end problem management for our IT infrastructure, including coordinating with other engineering and support organizations to drive continuous improvement and root cause. At Amazon, we ask our technical managers to be strong engineers who can dive deep and get involved in addition to being strong managers. We are looking for managers with a builder mentality that will help our team use automation, tooling and other intelligent methods to improve the customer experience.

Responsibilities:
Operational Excellence
As a leader at Amazon you are expected to drive operational excellence in everything we do. This includes leading your team as they find ways to build solutions to problems instead of fixing the same problems over and over. Find ways to use existing tools to better our customers experience or work within your team and with peers to build creative new solutions that improve availability and reduce impact.

Network Measurement
You will be expected to drive quality into the metrics we use to make sure our business is healthy, our team is engaged, and find where we have opportunities to improve our scaling and efficiency. We use data to find the problems affecting our availability and work collaboratively with other teams to fix them for the long term.

Performance Management/Team Health
You will own all facets of performance and career growth for the team. Regular one-on-one meetings with all team members will help you stay connected. Providing technical and ‘soft skill’ mentoring to your team will help you maintain a well-rounded, world-class organization. This also includes project management, quality audits, and coordination of training sessions with senior-level.

This is an amazing opportunity in terms of responsibility, interesting challenges and high visibility.

Former role as a network engineer.
A history of creating solutions to solve important problems for your customer.
Demonstrated ability to automate basic tasks in any language.
CCNA/CCNP/JNCIA/JNCIS certifications a plus.
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work successfully with teams across the organization, including Engineering, Program Management, Operations, and Senior Leadership.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. The opportunity

This position is project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for voltages at 110kV and 220kV, new 220/400kV GIS and cable replacements and HVDC.

These activities cover all works associated with the development and design phase for individual schemes, through to construction and commissioning of new capital investment works, modifications to existing transmission lines and plant, specialist engineering studies, maintenance works and the development of tender documentation for competitive tendering purposes.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Overseeing the project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for transmission lines at 110kV and 220kV, new 220/400kV GIS and cable replacements and HVDC projects.

  • Developing and deploying project controls and planning strategies, processes, procedures and systems to ensure effective - integrated scope, cost and schedule planning. The development and agreement of project baselines (scope, cost, time). Efficient progress measurement and earned value management reports. Change management and control. Development of reports, KPI’s and dashboards.

  • Directing a team of planning and scheduling engineers.

  • Liaising closely with the commercial and risk functions to ensure an integrated approach to scope, cost, resource and schedule control.

  • Providing periodic project and programme level report.

  • Driving and ensuring compliance with adopted processes and procedures.

  • Training and supporting staff in techniques, system and tools.

About you

You have a proven track record in the delivery of projects in electricity transmission and distribution. You have experience in interface with internal/external customers. You have experience in project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for high-value projects. You have proven ability to work with stakeholders, internal and external parties, e.g., equipment suppliers, manufacturers, service providers, professional bodies, and work within a strong team-working culture. You have a proven ability to communicate complex technical or commercial issues to peers or senior management. You have proven experience in writing clear and concise documentation.

You have a degree qualification or HND/HNC in a technical subject. You are a member of a relevant institute. You are digitally savvy, can build lasting client relationships and provide support to strong, motivated teams. You will have experience in project management and be hungry to grow your career and enjoy the opportunities Mace has to offer.

Description

Company Description

Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands â€“ Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, youâ€™ll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.Job Description

Etsy is an international marketplace with 65M handmade and vintage items from hardworking artists, designers and vintage collectors. In order to keep Etsy a safe and trusted platform, we are building sophisticated and scalable ML/AI technologies as our marketplace continues to grow. We are seeking experienced ML professionals to join us as we establish a team passionate about Content Moderation and Trust and Safety (T&S) under the Applied Machine Learning organization (AML)!

In the AML org, Applied Scientists partner with other teams to develop custom machine-learning models that can drive product vision and customer impact! With the Trust & Safety focus, we are looking for individuals who are product and customer driven as well as passionate about making ML innovations in the area of scalable content moderation to better protect the integrity of our marketplace.

About the Role

Example Projects:

  • Develop multimodal models that classify policy violations, including signal from text, image, user behavior, and graph relationships.
  • Develop a strategy for collecting unbiased (or less biased) training data to ensure our content moderation models have minimal blind spots
  • Implement and compare supervised learning models (LR, GBDT, and DNNs), or ensembles of models, to improve metrics, often with multiple opposing objectives.

What You'll Do:

  • Push the state of the art and apply the latest advances in deep learning and machine learning to improve content moderation on Etsy.
  • Prototype, optimize, and productionize large-scale ML models that help deliver key results.
  • Conduct A/B experiments to validate the effectiveness of ML models and pipelines.
  • Collaborate with product managers, software engineers, designers, and operations teams teams to moderate content for tens of millions of users.
  • Share impactful and innovative work in the wider ML research community, including speaking publicly at credible ML/DS conferences such as: KDD, WSDM, WWW, Recsys, etc.
Qualifications

Basic requirements:

  • A track record of applying machine learning techniques against complex content moderation, risk & fraud, natural language processing, search, or recommender problems.
  • Expertise in any of the following fields: multimodal classification, natural language processing, anomaly detection, reinforcement learning, search, or recommender systems
  • Software development in the Cloud including common open source or cloud native tools (i.e., git, Linux environments, containers or other tools for writing robust, scalable, production-ready code).

Preferred requirements:

  • Completed Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, industrial engineering, applied math, statistics) and 3 years of shown industry experience with production Machine Learning, or a M.S. degree in related fields and 6 years of related experience.
  • Peer reviewed conference publications

Proficient using Public Cloud Computing (especially Google Cloud Platform).



Additional Information

What's Next

If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a cover letter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you've hopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don't want you to be like everyone else -- we want you to be like you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.

Our Promise

At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

Who are Experian?

We unlock the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. At lifeâ€™s big moments â€“ from buying a home or car, to sending a child to university, to growing a business exponentially by connecting it with new customers â€“ we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence so they can maximize every opportunity.

For more than 125 years, weâ€™ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish â€“ and weâ€™re not done.

Job Description

A bit of backgroundâ€¦

Reporting to the Deputy Group Treasurer the Treasury Analyst will execute the daily treasury dealing, manage daily liquidity and exposure positions, maintain a rolling monthly cashflow forecast and coordinate the bi-monthly intragroup settlement process via the in-house bank.

Group Treasury is responsible for funding the group by means of bank debt, commercial paper and bonds and ensuring that cash is available to the group where and when needed.Â  Risk management activities include foreign exchange, interest rate and related external counterparty risk management. The team is based in Dublin consisting of 7 treasury professionals managing the daily front and back office processes as well as accounting, reporting and systems maintenance.

Why should you apply for this role?

This is a fantastic opportunity within the Group Treasury team at the centre of Experian (a FTSE50 company, with its Corporate headquarters located in Dublin), providing valuable process assistance to help Group Treasury team support Experian businesses across the globe. In this role you will gain an overall perspective from the treasury operations in the group, as well as interaction with senior Executives in the Experian Finance organisation.

What youâ€™ll be doingâ€¦

Front Office

  • Analysing the daily cash pool positions across all currencies (USD, GBP, EUR, AUD, DKK, NOK) and establish the cash requirements of the group. Maintain a rolling monthly cashflow forecast to project funding requirements.
  • Managing the funding requirements using the Commercial Paper program and committed bank facilities
  • Investing excess cash (when required, for short term intervals)
  • Reviewing the foreign currency exposure report to identify and consolidate unhedged positions and perform all transactions to clear foreign exchange exposures
  • Execute daily dealing for FX and funding
  • Distributing daily market data summary to Experian Executives
  • Analysing market rate and currency movements and their potential impact for the Group
  • Managing all In-house bank account (IGA) transactions between subsidiaries
  • Liaising with regional Shared Service Centres for their cash requirements and act as focal point for their queries

Reporting

  • Â Review (counterparty, exposure and IGA) limit reports. Resolve any issues by taking all action necessary, proposing limit changes and clearing exposures.
  • Contribute to the preparation of the monthly Tax & Treasury Committee Report

Other

  • Upload daily FX rates into Quantum
  • Work with banks to issue bank guarantees required and maintain a guarantee register
Qualifications

Could this be the role for you? Hereâ€™s what weâ€™re ideally looking for:

Qualifications:

  • Educated at least to degree level
  • Treasury qualification and/or relevant experience preferred

Experience:

  • Understanding of Corporate Cash Management and Treasury Dealing/Settlement
  • Financially/numerically literate
  • Quality focused with attention to detail
  • Able to organise, self-directed Â and self-disciplined
  • Tenacious, to complete tasks within time critical deadlines
  • Critical thinker and evaluator
  • Good communication skills
  • Team player willing to work flexibly in a small department
  • Outstanding moral character

Tech capability:

  • Highly IT literate â€“ able to use many systems, in particular MS Excel
  • Bloomberg experience preferred


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Our colleaguesâ€™ health and wellbeing is a top priority for us, thatâ€™s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether itâ€™s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or planning for the future, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!

At Experian we are committed to building an inclusive culture and to creating an environment where people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. We care about work that works, whether thatâ€™s about where you work or adjusting your hours to fit better with your life. Our flexible working practices, including our hybrid working model where employees can split their working time between the office and their home, support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as our people. So that you can love where you work please discuss what works for you with your recruiter during the hiring process.

Salary: From €15.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Education:

  • Bachelor's (preferred)

Experience:

  • Social Care/Healthcare: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

We are looking for an Accounting and Finance Manager. You will be reporting to the Directors, you will be responsible for the Accounting and Finance Function. You will have the opportunity to create and reshape accounting and control processes in a highly fast-paced and growing business. The role will involve great responsibility from day 1 and an opportunity to see the immediate impact of your actions on the development of the business.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Timely and accurate monthly reporting (Balance Sheet, P&L, Cashflow)
  • Prepare Annual Accounts, periodic Management Accounts and financial reporting as required
  • Contact person for key external stakeholders such as auditors, banks, company registration office, tax authorities
  • Oversee and manage of all day-to-day accounting, processes, payments, invoices, intercompany transactions, salaries
  • Maintain and evaluate records of all services provided to assess sustainability and viability of those services
  • Provide financial analysis and information to non-accounting staff to support decision making.
  • Completion of bank and general ledger reconciliations, and investment strategies
  • Regular cash forecasting and treasury management
  • Regular tax reporting (VAT, corporate income tax)
  • Oversee and maintain documentation required for keeping companies in good standing
  • Oversight of Finance Function
  • Support in execution of the business model including initiating projects to improve the Finance function to align with the business model. This includes project management within the Finance Function


Skills And Experience

  • University degree
  • The role would suit a qualified accountant (ACCA, ACA, CPA or CIMA)
  • At least five years’ active experience of accounting and tax, including experience with the above detailed tasks
  • English language fluent speaker, both verbal and written
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office programs, especially excel



Who are you?

  • A self-starter who is a team player as well as being able to work independently
  • Integrity and good ability to co-operate with a strong focus on solutions rather than problems
  • Able to make decisions and work independently
  • Ability to manage multiple projects, working effectively as part of a team to drive projects and deliverables
  • An eye for detail, ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines
  • Strong analytical and information gathering skills
  • Ability to communicate information and concepts clearly and logically, setting time specific and achievable expectations

Description

Apprentice Toolmaker


MGS Mfg. Group Ltd (Ireland) is a leading global provider of optimized manufacturing solutions for high precision plastics products with services including: engineering and design-for-manufacture; mould-making; sampling & development; injection moulding; value-added contract manufacturing operations; multi-shot technologies; scalable automation and turnkey manufacturing systems.


We are currently seeking an Apprentice Toolmaker, so if you are interested in developing a career within a progressive company in an exciting and dynamic industry, we want to speak to you!


Overview:


The successful Apprentice will gain extensive experience working closely with our highly skilled and experienced Toolmaking team on site, learning to produce and maintain precision tools used in the manufacture and production of high-precision plastic, etc.


The work of a toolmaker involves interpreting drawings and technical data to machine and assemble with great accuracy jigs, fixtures, moulding tools, dies and punches.


Candidates should have a keen interest therefore in a career working in manufacturing.


The Toolmaker Apprenticeship is governed by SOLAS and is Standards Based. During your apprenticeship, you will be required to follow a specific course of training and undergo a series of assessments to confirm that you've reached the required standard. The apprenticeship consists of 7 phases: 3 off-the-job and 4 on-the-job.


SOLAS and the Department of Education and Science have responsibility for providing the off-the-job training, whilst your on-the job training will take place on site with MGS Mfg. Group Ltd (Ireland). We are accepting applications from both Pre-Registered and Registered apprentices.


Selection Criteria / Person Specification:

You must meet the minimum entry requirements specified by SOLAS. See Generation Apprenticeship for further information. 


You should also have a good attitude, willingness and ability to learn, along with a genuine interest in in becoming a skilled craftworker.


If this exciting opportunity interests you – APPLY NOW!


MGS Mfg. Group Ltd (Ireland) is an equal opportunities employer.

Description

Customer Success Manager - Ireland


Flipdish allows restaurants to take orders online in an instant. Our technology powers millions of transactions across thousands of restaurants worldwide. With a branded website, mobile app, or self-service kiosk powered by Flipdish’s world-class technology, hospitality brands can directly accept digital orders without having to list on marketplace platforms.


You’ll join us in an incredibly exciting phase of transition and growth, as we rapidly expand our development and product teams in Ireland, UK, and internationally.


Flipdish Mission Statement: “To be the market leader for white-label online ordering globally, with a focus on customer and employee success.”


Role

Due to our continued growth, Flipdish is seeking an experienced Customer Success Manager.

This person will join the Success & Sales team in Ireland with the opportunity to build meaningful relationships with Flipdish customers and help the Irish hospitality industry thrive!

The successful candidate for this role will be looking for an exciting new challenge in a hyper-growth environment. You should have a passion for building and developing business relationships and be willing to take on new challenges and input to the company’s growth.


What You’ll Do:

  • Proactively help our customers succeed online through the Flipdish platform 
  • Build meaningful relationships with Flipdish customers through engaging emails and phone calls
  • Manage key metrics that feed into team based goals around retention, growth, and advocacy
  • Partner with customers to develop meaningful success plans that feed their long term goals. This may include webinars, customer email nurture campaigns and other knowledge materials to help our customers succeed online 
  • Work with internal teams like customer support and menu to provide a seamless and positive experience for customers 


About you:

  • Familiarity or awareness of the Flipdish product 
  • Prior experience in Customer Success, account management, or customer service
  • Will understand how a SaaS business operates
  • Must be results focused with a can-do-attitude
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills - you will be talking to our customers after all! 
  • Desire to work in a high growth, dynamic startup environment. Your progression is limited only by your own abilities 


Incentives:

  • Attractive base salary (DOE) & commission OTE
  • Equity/Shares
  • Unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance within the company
  • 23 days holidays
  • Flexible working
  • Bike to work
  • Taxsaver Scheme
  • Employee referral programme
  • Access to a PRSA
  • Collaborative work environment with a dynamic and multicultural team
  • Team-building activities and social events


We also have

  • Access to training and certification
  • Collaborative work environment with a dynamic and diverse team — and we do actually mean this and invest in it
  • Team-building activities and social events
  • Unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance within the company


We are primarily located in Ireland, but we are a remote team and we will consider highly-qualified applicants from other nearby locations.


No business embodies diversity like the food business. And at Flipdish, we're all about empowering those diverse, local, independent businesses - all over the planet.


For us,diversity isn't a checkbox. It's embedded in how we work. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills - all working together in an open, honest and transparent culture. Because our strength comes from embracing our differences: differences that reflect the diverse customers we serve.


Please note that for this role we only accept applications from candidates directly. No recruitment agency assistance is needed.


About Flipdish

Flipdish is a hyper growth technology company (3rd in the 2020 Deloitte Fast 50) who puts hospitality brands of all sizes in control of their business growth with a digital ordering and marketing system that builds brands, grows profits and turns customers into regulars.

With a branded website, app or self-service kiosk, powered by Flipdish’s world-class technology, hospitality brands can directly accept digital orders without having to list on aggregator platforms, at a lower cost and with more control over the customer experience.

Started in 2015 by technology entrepreneurs James and Conor McCarthy, Flipdish is headquartered in Dublin with a team of 200+ digital food retailing enthusiasts, 5000 active clients across 12 countries with teams in Ireland, UK, Spain, France, Germany and the US.

Description

Motor Distributors Limited, the exclusive importer and distributor of Mercedes-Benz in Ireland wishes to recruit an Administrator to join our Training Department. This role works within the Mercedes-Benz MDL Training Academy and is based at our Head Office on the Naas Road, Dublin 12.


The Mercedes-Benz MDL Training Academy is responsible for delivering all Mercedes-Benz certified training and development programmes across Sales, Management, Product, Process and Systems. Training is delivered via a mix of virtual, e-learning and face to face delivery at the MDL Training Academy. 


We are currently investing in a new learner management platform and management of the new learner management system will be the main component for the Administrator role.


Key duties and responsibilities to include:


• Key role in implementation and management of the new learning management system.

• Key point of contact for the dealer network on the learner management system and training administration.

• Creating course templates, courses, learning paths and enrolment forms for delegates.

• Using the Learner Management System to create certificates, test questions and feedback forms.

• Generating, handling, and distributing reports to various stakeholders and departments. 

• Providing functional support to internal stakeholders and dealer network (usage and handling issues, administrative tasks, general guidance, etc.).

• Providing training support and assisting in training delivery to the dealer network.

• Responsible for new starters set up and induction training.

 

The successful candidate will ideally:


• Good Administration and systems experience.

• Possess good I.T. skills - Word, PowerPoint, and Excel 

• Display excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 

• Excellent planning and organisation skills with a high level of attention to detail.

• Be self-motivated, with the ability to work on own initiative.

• Have a positive attitude toward achieving results and meeting deadlines.

• Work well as part of a team.

• Have a full, valid driving licence.

• Be willing to travel to Dealer Branches and Mercedes-Benz Germany, on occasion.


Source: Motor Distributors Limited

Description

We would like to invite the applications for the following 12 month fixed term contract position.

 

Programme Assistant with Admin Duties

Tuam


Please note this position requires that you have received at least one dose of a Covid19 vaccine and be willing to receive the second dose.

As a Programme Assistant you will be expected to develop and implement programmes, projects and individualised supports to members engaging in the Resource and Outreach Centre. The objectives of the Resource and Outreach Centre are to provide pathways for people with disability to participate fully in the community, by means of establishing developmental, personal and social inclusion programmes. You will be required to undertake and ensure the execution of such other tasks/duties as may be deemed necessary to the successful implementation of the programme. Close liaison is required with ROC staff and members for the successful implementation of this position. Links will also be made with relevant voluntary and statutory agencies, families and friends of members.

Training, Experience and Qualifications

 

A minimum of 5 completed modules of QQI level 5 (Major Award) Care Support or similar qualification is essential. QQI Major Awards that are deemed relevant to IWA are:

 

Community & Health Services (to include minor components Safety & Health at Work and Care Provision & Practice)

Health Service Skills (to include minor components in Workplace Statutory Policies & Procedures and Care Skills and Care Support)

Health Care Support (to include minor components Safety & Health at Work and Care Skills and Care Support)

Youth Work (no specific minor components required)

Full Drivers Licence required.

 

Knowledge and Skills

 

Previous experience of developing and delivering projects or programmes

Previous experience of working with people with disabilities is required

Knowledge and understanding of Health and Safety regulations, as well as transport safety and standards of use is essential

Previous experience of driving transit vans to transport people with disabilities, or a willingness to do so, would be an advantage

Good organisational and IT skills

 

Behaviours

 

The ability to work as part of a team and work on own initiative

An ability to build strong relationships at all levels and show confidence among the team

Strong customer service focus

Be of good character

 

Competencies

 

Communicating and Influencing

Motivating and Empowering

Innovation and Creativity

Planning and Organising

Quality and Customer Focus

 

Remuneration & Benefits

 

Salary for this position is €14.23 to €15.82 per hour

Excellent working conditions

Training & development opportunities

25 days annual leave pro rata

Access to Defined Contribution Pension scheme and group VHI & HSF Health Cash Plans if the position is made permanent.

Employee Assistance Programme

 

This job description is a guide to the general range of duties and is not intended to be either restrictive or definitive and may be subject to periodic review.

 

ACADEMIC AND/OR PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:- Documentary evidence of your relevant qualification(s) may/will be required in advance of or during the recruitment process

Based in Dublin 11, The Fruit People we are looking for applicants with good communication and attention to detail to join our team as a Delivery Driver/Warehouse Operative.


Key duties:

  • Multi drops delivered efficiently to our customers in the Dublin area
  • Loading and unloading of goods.
  • Polite interaction with customers
  • Preparing orders on the production line based on customer requirements
  • Working in a fast paced environment alongside team leaders and management team

 

Job Requirements:


  • Full clean (European) driving licence
  • Good Spoken English
  • Good communication skills
  • Experience driving a van
  • Friendly and courteous to customers
  • Flexibility


Full training, uniform and PPE provided, and we are following all government guidelines related to Covid 19.


About us:

The Fruit People are market leaders in providing offices in Ireland with fresh fruit, healthy snacks, dairy products, and pantry items. We are a small and growing team, passionate about improving Workplace Wellbeing.


Job Type: Part time, Permanent


Hours of work: Part time role – 3 days per week

Description

Magnostics Ltd is biotechnology start-up company based in Dublin, Ireland, focused on using novel nanomaterials that improve the performance of in vitro diagnostics.  


About the role:

As Quality & Regulatory Affairs Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the quality activities associated with the establishment and maintenance of a manufacturing facility to produce RNA extraction kits and associated reagents. This role will be an integral part of the Quality and Regulatory Affairs team that is responsible for developing, maintaining and documenting our mission critical regulatory filings and registrations. Initially, this will be a standalone role, but as the company grows, there will be an opportunity to lead a cross discipline team supporting the quality systems and regulatory requirements for the organization.


You will have the opportunity to be involved in wide range of activities including - support Magnostics with ISO 13485:2016 and MDSAP requirements; interface with, prepare, and submit applications for the FDA 510(k)s, PMA, and CE markings; support the creation and maintenance of design history files; support regulatory affairs for new product development; monitoring, and support quality systems for manufacturing and new product development.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Interaction with regulatory agencies
  • Responsible for Company’s CE and US FDA Regulatory filings, be the liaison with the regional regulatory affairs team to help obtaining the required regulatory approvals to market the Company’s products worldwide.
  • Overseeing the quality assurance and compliance of all quality functions with ISO 13485 and FDA quality requirements and ensuring site readiness for PMA inspection
  • Audit support
  • Represent the company at both internal and external audits.
  • Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance to the quality management systems and regulatory compliance requirements including RoHS, REACH, CE Marking, etc.
  • Marketing and Product Support
  • Review and approve New Product Development Process Validation
  • Review advertising, labeling and public communications for regulatory compliance issues.
  • Assist in developing regulatory strategy for new products and claims.
  • Support creation, review and approval of Reagents, Equipment and Manufacturing documentation in support of Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Quality System Support
  • Support the quality management system to ensure regulatory compliance.
  • Assist in ensuring compliance to design control regulations during product development and delivery activities.
  • Documentation/deliverables ensuring compliance to relevant corporate and regulatory quality and validation procedures/work instructions and standards
  • Develop protocols for validation, evaluate data, and write reports
  • Prepare reports to evaluate effectiveness of quality systems
  • Customer Feedback Process and Supplier Quality
  • Serve as resource for problem identification, improvement, and resolution
  • Provide support for customer representatives in regards to quality issues. Coordinate customer complaint handling processes, including overseeing investigations of root cause and corrective and preventive measure implementation
  • Analyze and report meaningful quality metrics to ensure on-going improvement programs are put in place and continually strive for customer satisfaction.
  • Resolution and communication of quality issues between the plant, suppliers and customers
  • Work with suppliers to resolve or improve quality issues and to implement effective corrective action
  • Coordinate internal non-conforming materials handling processes; ensure that root cause investigations of root causes and associated implementation of corrective and preventive measure are in place internally and at suppliers
  • Management and board support
  • Responsible for keeping management team informed of regulatory status of products and significant regulatory issues.
  • Provide management and leadership in the development and implementation of quality and regulatory strategies and processes
  • Provide counsel, training, and interpretation of regulatory requirements to company personnel and assist as a liaison between the company and regulatory bodies.
  • Coordinate Management Review process and meetings. Calculate and coordinate Quality metrics and KPIs reporting, trending and tracking against improvement targets


What you will ideally bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in field with 5+ years exp. or Master’s degree in the field with 3+ years’ experience ideally gained in a RA/QA function in an IVD company
  • Experience with FDA submissions and CE/EU submissions and technical files
  • Experience with EU MDR
  • Desirable to have previous experience in manufacture of reagents, Process/Equipment validations.
  • Leadership & regulatory expertise would also be highly advantageous
  • Must be a creative thinker with the ability to develop regulatory strategies by thinking out of the box.
  • Excellent speaking and presentation skills and ability to communicate effectively across functions and external partners.
  • Self-starter and ability to work collaboratively across the business
  • Strong team member and ability to identify and drive quality improvements
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
  • Detailed orientated and organized with a proven ability to create processes which teams can follow.


Compensation & Benefits

Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience.

 

Right to work in the EU

All applicants must have the right to work in the EU.

Job title: Assistant Director/Senior Planner 

Employer: Eastern & Midland Regional Assembly

Closing Date: 3pm, Thursday, 22nd October, 2021

Salary: Starting from €77,522


About the Employer:

The Eastern and Midland Regional Assembly (EMRA) is one of the three Regional Assemblies in Ireland. It was created alongside the Southern and Northern & Western Regional Assemblies by the Local Government Reform Act 2014 and officially established in January 2015.

Regional Assemblies play an important role in promoting and supporting balanced regional development and are tasked with a general competence to co-ordinate, promote and support strategic planning and sustainable development and to promote effectiveness in Local Government and public services in different areas of the state.  


About the Role:

The Assistant Director/Senior Planner position forms part of the senior management team for the Eastern and Midland Regional Assembly and has particular responsibility for the role of sustainable spatial planning and economic development across and between regions. The postholder will work under the direction of the Regional Assembly Director, in close contact with the members of the Assembly, relevant local authority chief executives, the Department of the Housing, Local Government and Heritage, other senior public servants, colleagues of the Regional Assemblies, senior figures from the private sector, third level institutions, and wider non-governmental and community interests.


About You:

The ideal candidate shall:


  • hold a qualification in Planning (at least level 8 on the National Framework of Qualifications)
  • have at least eight years’ satisfactory relevant experience of planning work
  • possess a high standard of technical training and expertise
  • possess a high standard of administrative and management experience




The Public Appointments Service is committed to a policy of equal opportunity and encourage applications under all nine grounds of the Employment Equality Act.

Paul O’Donovan & Associates, Chartered Accountants are a medium sized firm based on Monahan Road, Cork. We are seeking to recruit a trainee accountant pursuing a career within a professional body.

We are looking for qualified finance graduates hungry for a career in accountancy and who will not shy away from hard work. In return, you will join a growing team of successful individuals in the industry and have the opportunity to become a qualified accountant within 3 years or experience with a view to same. The candidate will gain exposure to various industries and a variety of clients within a professional practice and will establish yourself as an expert within the industry. On top of that, you will work very closely with management and partners and will be trained to a very high standard.

The Role

As a Trainee Accountant with this medium sized firm you will work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with a variety of clients from different industries.

Your duties will include:

  • Bookkeeping, Preparation of Vat returns
  • Preparation of Sole Traders financial statements
  • Preparation of Income Tax Returns
  • Preparation of relevant Contracts Tax returns
  • Preparation of Management Accounts
  • Preparation of Audit exempt financial statements
  • Assisting on Audit Assignments
  • Preparation of Corporation Tax Returns
  • Preparation of Company Secretarial Returns
  • Ad hoc accounting and administrative work as required
  • To participate in relevant training and development courses as agreed with your manager

You will be kept up to date on technical changes in accountancy and tax legislation and will be involved in implementing such changes within the company.

The candidate must have the following attributes/skills for this job:

  • Degree qualified within Accountancy, Commerce or a relevant field as a minimum.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Exam Focused - Willing to do Professional Accountancy exams.
  • Excellent problem solving skills with a practical hands on approach
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines
  • Highly motivated and professional
  • Team Worker & Career Driven
  • Strong IT Skills essential

Benefits:

  • Salary (as a trainee) will be discussed on application
  • Full Exam/Educational support provided
  • Excellent Career Progression
  • Opportunity to work within a wide industry spectrum and gain valuable experience with SME's

We are an accredited employer under the training programmes for both Chartered Accountants Ireland and ACCA. In recognition of the support we provide to our ACCA trainees working towards their ACCA Qualification we recently received the Platinum ACCA Approved Employer Certificate in Trainee Development and the ACCA Approved Employer – Practicing Certificate Development.

Reference ID: TA

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: €20,000.00-€25,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work remotely:

  • No

Brook Foods now requires a Food & Event Catering Support Team Member, with a full clean drivers licence for its Events business primarily around Cork City and County.

Qualities Required:
A reliable and conscientious Food & Events Support Team Member who is a front facing People person with excellent communication and comprehension skills.

A competent and responsible driver who will look after the vehicles, events equipment and the logistics of both.

This role would be ideally suited to someone with a genuine interest in Food and its presentation who possesses good initiative.

Main responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Collection & delivery of food orders from our central production unit to various locations.

Knowledge of HACCP is essential to ensure food is delivered within time and temperature requirements.

Items to be checked against order to ensure accuracy and any discrepancies communicated to a member of staff.

On delivery order must be checked by recipient and signed off by both.

Daily & weekly van checks maintained and any issues brought to managements attention

Some flexibility is required in this role, you may be required to assist with the service of Events/preparation of food.

Good written & spoken English is essential.

Brook Foods are delighted to announce we are currently recruiting for a Full time Restaurant Supervisor for Abtran Blackrock, Cork. We are seeking a highly talented and driven person with a customer focused personality to assist with managing the day to day operations of this Restaurant. We are looking for someone with excellent organisational skills, the ability to prioritise their workload and someone who posesses the ability to communicate effectively with a range of audiences. Candidates must have strong experience in their desired role and come from a strong catering background with a good knowledge of all aspects of food and beverage preparation and customer service.

Main duties are:
To assist as directed with all aspects of preparation and presentation of food to the company’s standard and ensuring adherence of legislation
To promote a friendly and welcoming atmosphere and to utilize selling techniques to benefit both the company and the client
To carry out cashier duties as required
To ensure tables and condiments are kept clean at all times and that condiments are well stocked
To assist in setting and replenishing the food service counters and vending machines as and when required
To ensure retail stock items are ordered within the purchasing budget
To ensure that all food and beverage items are displayed at all times in accordance to site requirements
To undertake all necessary cleaning to the company’s standards according to the cleaning Rota
To ensure that staff on site are fully knowledgeable of their required duties and carry them out at all times
To ensure daily cashing up procedures are adhered to
To ensure that staff rosters are signed off weekly along with break sheets before being submitted
To ensure lodgments are completed per site requirements
To ensure high standards of personal hygiene, cleanliness and neatness ensuring full uniform is worn at all times
To comply with statutory and company hygiene regulations in handling storage of food and beverage

An experienced Restaurant Supervisor must have excellent customer service skills, be well presented, a team player and enthusiastic in being part of a large and diverse team.

Fluent English language is essential.

Description

Motor Distributors Limited, the exclusive importer and distributor of Mercedes-Benz in Ireland wishes to recruit a Training Administrator to join our Mercedes-Benz Passenger Car Sales Department, based in our Head Office on the Naas Road, Dublin 12.

Description

Magnostics Ltd is biotechnology start-up company based in Dublin, Ireland, focused on using novel nanomaterials that improve the performance of in vitro diagnostics.  


About the role

We have a great opportunity for a Chemical Process Technician to join our small but growing team. You will become an integral part of the team and will work closely with our manufacturing department to synthesize HMag® in a QMS environment, which is a key component of our CE-marked viral RNA extraction kits for COVID-19.


What you will do?

  • Work with our engineers and business development team to meet a production schedule and develop new products. 
  • Prepare compounds, reagents, and solutions used in laboratory and manufacturing processes.
  • Ensure compliance in all areas from Goods receipt to final labelling.
  • Analyze and test various substances to find their composition and chemical compliance.
  • Assist the team in developing, trouble shooting, standardising and improving existing production methods and procedures. Write technical reports to describe their methods, results and findings.
  •  Present your findings to engineers, scientists, and other colleagues.
  • Deliver project goals and assist in implementing, troubleshooting, and reviewing process improvements.


What you will ideally bring:

  • Degree in Science with some prior laboratory experience in GMP processes.
  • Strong knowledge of chemical reaction optimization and the characterization of fine chemicals.
  • Knowledge of GMP manufacture, quality test and document process.

Description

Magnostics Ltd is biotechnology start-up company based in Dublin, Ireland, focused on using novel nanomaterials that improve the performance of in vitro diagnostics.  


About the role:

As Quality & Regulatory Affairs Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the quality activities associated with the establishment and maintenance of a manufacturing facility to produce RNA extraction kits and associated reagents. This role will be an integral part of the Quality and Regulatory Affairs team that is responsible for developing, maintaining and documenting our mission critical regulatory filings and registrations. Initially, this will be a standalone role, but as the company grows, there will be an opportunity to lead a cross discipline team supporting the quality systems and regulatory requirements for the organization.


You will have the opportunity to be involved in wide range of activities including - support Magnostics with ISO 13485:2016 and MDSAP requirements; interface with, prepare, and submit applications for the FDA 510(k)s, PMA, and CE markings; support the creation and maintenance of design history files; support regulatory affairs for new product development; monitoring, and support quality systems for manufacturing and new product development.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Interaction with regulatory agencies
  • Responsible for Company’s CE and US FDA Regulatory filings, be the liaison with the regional regulatory affairs team to help obtaining the required regulatory approvals to market the Company’s products worldwide.
  • Overseeing the quality assurance and compliance of all quality functions with ISO 13485 and FDA quality requirements and ensuring site readiness for PMA inspection
  • Audit support
  • Represent the company at both internal and external audits.
  • Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance to the quality management systems and regulatory compliance requirements including RoHS, REACH, CE Marking, etc.
  • Marketing and Product Support
  • Review and approve New Product Development Process Validation
  • Review advertising, labeling and public communications for regulatory compliance issues.
  • Assist in developing regulatory strategy for new products and claims.
  • Support creation, review and approval of Reagents, Equipment and Manufacturing documentation in support of Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Quality System Support
  • Support the quality management system to ensure regulatory compliance.
  • Assist in ensuring compliance to design control regulations during product development and delivery activities.
  • Documentation/deliverables ensuring compliance to relevant corporate and regulatory quality and validation procedures/work instructions and standards
  • Develop protocols for validation, evaluate data, and write reports
  • Prepare reports to evaluate effectiveness of quality systems
  • Customer Feedback Process and Supplier Quality
  • Serve as resource for problem identification, improvement, and resolution
  • Provide support for customer representatives in regards to quality issues. Coordinate customer complaint handling processes, including overseeing investigations of root cause and corrective and preventive measure implementation
  • Analyze and report meaningful quality metrics to ensure on-going improvement programs are put in place and continually strive for customer satisfaction.
  • Resolution and communication of quality issues between the plant, suppliers and customers
  • Work with suppliers to resolve or improve quality issues and to implement effective corrective action
  • Coordinate internal non-conforming materials handling processes; ensure that root cause investigations of root causes and associated implementation of corrective and preventive measure are in place internally and at suppliers
  • Management and board support
  • Responsible for keeping management team informed of regulatory status of products and significant regulatory issues.
  • Provide management and leadership in the development and implementation of quality and regulatory strategies and processes
  • Provide counsel, training, and interpretation of regulatory requirements to company personnel and assist as a liaison between the company and regulatory bodies.
  • Coordinate Management Review process and meetings. Calculate and coordinate Quality metrics and KPIs reporting, trending and tracking against improvement targets


What you will ideally bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in field with 5+ years exp. or Master’s degree in the field with 3+ years’ experience ideally gained in a RA/QA function in an IVD company
  • Experience with FDA submissions and CE/EU submissions and technical files
  • Experience with EU MDR
  • Desirable to have previous experience in manufacture of reagents, Process/Equipment validations.
  • Leadership & regulatory expertise would also be highly advantageous
  • Must be a creative thinker with the ability to develop regulatory strategies by thinking out of the box.
  • Excellent speaking and presentation skills and ability to communicate effectively across functions and external partners.
  • Self-starter and ability to work collaboratively across the business
  • Strong team member and ability to identify and drive quality improvements
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
  • Detailed orientated and organized with a proven ability to create processes which teams can follow.


Compensation & Benefits

Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience.

 

Right to work in the EU

Description


Senior Mechanical Contracts Manager, Dublin, Immediate, Permanent

Your new company
A medium sized mechanical and electrical contractor with a turnover of €30+ million, based in Dublin. They work on a wide variety of projects including commercial, industrial, Data Centre & Pharmaceutical projects. They have a very busy project list of ongoing projects and projects due to start towards end to the year and start of 2022 ahead and are looking to a dd a senior member of staff to their mechanical division. They are known for being one of the best employers in the industry and have a very low turnover of staff. They work with a selected number of main contractors and win repeated business directly from clients and engineering consultancies.

Your new role
You will have full responsibility for a number of mechanical services projects. You will join the Operations team and be involved in choosing your project team for these upcoming projects. You will have overall responsibility for the successful delivery of the project and be expected to manage full financial aspects including cost control, pricing of variations, & monitoring of the overall costs against the tender. You will be expected to manage the full team of engineers, supervisors, sub-contractors, etc and ensure all works are completed in to the current health and safety guidelines. This is a unique opportunity in the current Irish market, as this role will allow you to pave your career path to a senior role within the company.

What you'll need to succeed
You will ideally have a Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Services/Building Services and at least 10 year's post qual experience in a Mid/Top Tier M&E Contractor. If you have a trade background also, it would be an advantage. You should be able to demonstrate proven experience on managing 2 Million+ jobs in the commercial/industrial field. You will be in a similar role with no room to grow or a Project Manager in a large M&E Contractor / Main Contractor ready to progress to this level.

What you'll get in return
The successful candidate will be paid an excellent salary in line with your experience. You will receive benefits including car / car allowance, an agreed bonus & pension allowances, etc. You will be exposed to large projects in all different sectors where you can continue to progress and grow in your career.

What you need to do now

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

  • Experience in performance test tools such as JMeter.
  • Experience with GIT based source control
  • Experience with Atlassian suite
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Who are we?

Founded in 1924, Irving Oil is a family-owned company specializing in the refining and marketing of finished energy products, with operations throughout Ireland, Eastern Canada and New England. Our company is known for its commitment to customer service, safety, environmental responsibility and our contribution to the communities where we live and work.

Top Oil, our Irish Sales & Marketing business, became part of the Irving Oil family in 2019. Headquartered in Dublin, Top Oil provides a true end-to-end solution – from port to pump and all the points in between, ensuring the best quality product for Irish industry, businesses, farms, homes and motorists across 32 counties.

Top Oil has a vacancy for an Oil Tanker Driver. The position is based in our Ennis, Co Clare Depot.

If you hold a current C Licence and are customer service focused, motivated and enthusiastic and are looking for an opportunity to further your career, please apply!

Primary Purpose of the Role: To load, transport and deliver oil in a prompt, professional and safe manner in accordance with Company and legal standards. To ensure truck and maintenance schedules/paperwork are completed accurately and on time.

The Job:

Customers:

  • To treat all customers in a professional and courteous manner.
  • To provide all customers with a safe and professional service in accordance with company delivery procedures
  • Maintain good relations with existing customers
  • Promote the company, service and products at all times
  • Be alert to sales opportunities and pass relevant leads to the Depot

Vehicles:

  • Drive your vehicle is a courteous and safe manner with regard to other road users and in accordance with road legislation and company policies and procedures
  • Ensure the best care and use of the Company’s vehicle and equipment
  • Report vehicle defects to supervisor immediately

Vehicle Loading And Delivery:

  • Load/unload your vehicle safely in accordance with Company procedures and legal standards.
  • Deliver oil to customers in a safe efficient manner in accordance with Company procedures.
  • At all times handle oil giving due care and regard to the environment.
  • Load your vehicle taking into consideration delivery route and load distribution required for each day.
  • Report any spillage immediately to your supervisor, attempt to contain the spillage in accordance with Company standards

Administration:

  • Complete the drivers stock reconciliation sheet on a daily basis
  • Complete a loading docket for each loading to your truck
  • Dip vehicle tanks daily or as required and ensure all stock figures are accurate and correct
  • Ensure all delivery dockets are kept in an orderly fashion and handed into the office at the end of each day
  • Complete daily and weekly vehicle checklists as required
  • Read the Company Drivers Handbook carefully and follow the guidelines as required
  • Complete detailed written incident reports

Cash:

  • Ensure all cash received from customers is crosschecked with your daily reconciliation sheet and handed into the depot daily

Other

  • At all times carry out all operational aspects of job with regard to documented company policies, procedures and safety information contained in the Drivers Handbook and other Company documents
  • Avoid loss or damage to goods or property
  • Participate in all company training and awareness programmes

Experience and Qualifications

  • Must hold a current C License
  • ADR / Haz Chem certificate is essential
  • CPC Certificates essential
  • Experience in the Logistics / Freight or Ideally Oil industry is essential

Personal Characteristics, Knowledge & Skills

  • Strong customer service skills and professional demeanor.
  • Strong time management skills.
  • Ability to follow Health and Safety regulations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work harmoniously with people at all levels within the organisation

Company description

Love Drogheda Business Improvement District (BID) CLG is a collaboration of 1561 levy payers working together to make Drogheda an even better place for everyone.

It exists solely to introduce significant improvements for the benefit of businesses and the community of Drogheda.

Its aim is to ensure Drogheda is increasingly known for its safe, attractive and welcoming look and feel by all those who work, study, live and spend leisure time in Drogheda.

Job description

Key Responsibilities
Carry out duties in respect of the general administration support for the BID CEO, including word processing, accounts admin, minute taking, maintaining detailed database records, digital marketing support and business engagement. This will be a flexible role with an opportunity to create, lead and deliver new and exciting projects within the Drogheda BID area that will help promote and encourage greater levels of visitation.

Main Tasks
Office administration

· Servicing all sub-groups and the recording minutes at Board meetings

· Assist with the production of marketing materials.

· Assist with marketing and special events as required.

· Business engagement with BID Levy Payers and other Stakeholders.

· Maintain detailed database records for BID area.

· Assist in the implementation of projects as directed.

· Assist in development of communication strategy for the BID.

· Increase outward communication to general public of BID activities and projects.

· Assist in funding applications.

· Ability to work with minimum supervision under the leadership of a board

· Respond to enquiries and provide information regarding BID Area.

· Support BID Manager, BID Officer Bearers and Board in the day-day running of Love Drogheda BID CLG

· Undertake any other reasonable duties as required by the BID Management.

Person Specification
Essential criteria

· 2 year’s previous administrative experience with customer service in an office environment.

· Excellent communication and relationship building skills.

· Clear and concise report writing skills

· Proven ability to assist in the delivery of multiple projects simultaneously.

· Experience in accounts administration
Ability to work with minimum supervision under the leadership of the board and in close cooperation with management.

· Fully computer literate.

Desirable criteria

· Qualification in Business, Marketing, Geography, Planning, Sustainability or Communications

· Working knowledge of social media platforms

· Understanding and appreciation of placemaking

· Knowledge of Drogheda town centre

N.B. We reserve the right to enhance the above criteria in event of an unprecedented response.

Salary: €35,000.00 per year

Love Drogheda BID CLG, follows all covid-19 safety precautions to protect both staff, clients and visitors. We have been supporting the BID Area in promoting a shop safe message.

Description

Overview

The primary function of this position is to manage, develop and maintain the Biocompatibility processes for Cook Ireland.

 

Reporting to: Engineering Laboratory Manager  

 

 

Find out more about Cook Medical here

Responsibilities

  • Become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Cook Ireland’s Biocompatibility processes.
  • Maintains an excellent understanding of the global medical device regulations especially with respect to Biocompatibility for example ISO 10993, and by identifying and critically assessing emerging standards, theories and methodologies and applying gained expertise within the Cook Ireland Biocompatibility processes.
  • Responsible for implementing regulatory requirements with respect to Biocompatibility as required.
  • Maintains a thorough understanding of all products Cook Ireland manufactures.
  • Assessment of Biocompatibility Requirements for new Products, Projects, Changes & Supplier Change notifications (SCNs) and ensuring the evaluation, determination, and documentation of biological safety for all Cook Ireland products is maintained.
  • Coordination with external Biocompatibility laboratories on testing required and compilation of requirements to conduct same for example: samples, quotes, critical review of protocols, reports, etc.
  • Update of Biocompatibility Assessments on ongoing basis for new testing completed and documenting per SCNs /other changes
  • Works closely with the Cook Ireland Regulatory Affairs Specialists to address Biocompatibility aspects for submissions for marketing Authorisations including responding to requests from Regulators.
  • Communication with consultant / toxicologists / peer review within Cook as necessary
  • A primary contact for Biocompatibility working groups / training going forward
  • Work closely to build effective relationships with other functions in particular Operations, Quality and Engineering.
  • Coordinates multiple projects at one time and provides regular reports to regulatory management and others as required.
  • Maintains and organises appropriate Biocompatibility records to demonstrate compliance with applicable regulations.
  • Performs additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Third level Qualification preferably in Science, 5 years’ experience in a regulated industry in a similar role is desirable.
  • Understanding of applicable guidelines and regulations, for example experience with ISO 10993
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and execute multiple projects
  • Ability to work in collaborative and independent work situations and environments with minimal supervision
  • Ability to remain calm and receptive in fast paced situations
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation.
  • Strong knowledge of medical device quality standards ISO13485/FDA practices and GMP or similar regulated industry standards.
  • Proven problem-solving skills.
  • Good computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft® Office.
  • Excellent organisational and team building skills.
  • High self-motivation.
  • Willingness and availability to travel on company business.
