Job Summary

Why you’ll be excited by this role…It is almost unimaginable to think of a technology that has not been influenced, impacted and in many cases made possible by MathWorks software. Your mobile phone, your social network, your TV streaming service, even your take out! MathWorks is the software that is accelerating the pace of engineering and science.

It is an exciting time to join MathWorks as we establish, develop and grow our shared sales & services center in Galway, Ireland. As a Software Maintenance Representative, you will focus on driving revenue growth through achieving or exceeding customer engagement standards in our maintenance renewal programs and products.

You will work on a diverse, multicultural team of software maintenance representatives that are aligned with sales representatives in a team selling environment to achieve individual and/or team goals.

Responsibilities

What you will be doing….
  • Grow revenue through attaining or exceeding maintenance and term renewal revenue goals
  • Manage timely closure of the assigned annual maintenance renewal contracts, term renewal and incorporate lapsed maintenance opportunities into selling strategies
  • Proactively contact customers and explain the product and support benefits of continuing maintenance services
  • Educate customers on purchasing options via web store and consolidations
  • Identify and manage add on or cross sell opportunities by closing business or transferring to appropriate sales representative to achieve the sale cycle
  • Prepare quotations as required and ensure accurate information for efficient processing of orders and investigate and resolve discrepancies
  • Ensure accurate customer data and sales activities are collected and entered into CRM system to advance the sales cycle
  • Demonstrate strong forecasting and funnel management of your assigned territory
  • Contribute to and support the territory plans in conjunction with sales representatives
  • Participate in funnel meetings as well as planning and delivery of sections of the annual territory and account plans
  • Partake on projects with local and international project team members
What you are really good at…
  • Selling. Consistent overachievement of sales and productivity goals
  • Responsiveness. Has a can-do attitude, is customer centric, displays empathy, and is quality focused
  • Being strategic, creative and focused. Ability to multitask, strong sense of urgency, willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
  • Taking care of the details. Is accurate in recording information clearly and concisely. Highly proficient computer, analytics and social networking skills
  • Communication. Exceptional persuasive verbal and written communication skills with excellent telephone skills and a high level of attention to detail
Qualifications
  • A bachelor's degree is required.
Additional Qualifications

You have…
  • A bachelor’s degree
  • 2-4 years post university experience, 1-2 years customer facing experience
  • Dutch/Flemish: highly proficient in both spoken and written (C1)
  • Exceptional persuasive verbal and written communication skills with excellent telephone skills and high level of attention to detail
  • Understanding of forecasting and funnel management practices
  • Completion of sales and/or phone skills training
  • Proficient working with a CRM system to facilitate lead qualification and advancement of sales cycle
  • Strong prioritization and time management skills
  • Experience working in fast-paced, disciplined, process oriented, sales environment
Even better if you have…
  • Additional language skills/multilingual
  • Worked in a shared sales & services or global business center

The Training Manager is responsible for the delivery of Learning Development services at best practice standard across the Life Pensions Division which includes Life Sales, Life Services Quality Control, Life Operations and CTS. Working with the business as a partner to identify learning and development requirements and delivering solutions that contribute to improved performance of the division.

Accountabilities of the Role

To ensure compliance with company policies, regulatory, professional and legal requirements.
To maintain commercial awareness relevant to this role in relation to changes in life and pension products and industry specific changes.
Display a passion for learning and an interest in helping learners improve their knowledge and skills; convey ideas with poise, confidence and enthusiasm.
Partner with the Life Division and CTS to identify their learning and development needs and understand the business and performance issues they face by demonstrating an understanding of their operational and strategic business goals.
For the division evaluate the overall learning requirements, business objectives, desired results, and constraints, conducting skills assessment to identify specific training needs. Keeping stakeholders informed of the progress of learning initiatives for their business area.
Establish a deep understanding and knowledge of all aspects of public sector pensions and financial requirements in order to design and deliver the Life Sales Trainee programme. Identify and draw on the expertise of subject matter experts for course content development when required. Ensure course content is updated to reflect regulatory and business areas process and procedural changes.
Meet the requirements of the Life division for successful exam completion for all minimum competency roles by providing support through tutorials and all other exam support. Assist the Life division in their continuous professional development (CPD) through presenting CPD approved training throughout the year for all departments within the division.
Coach and support Heads of Function within the division to effectively manage their team in respect to their performance management goals and objectives and their personal development plan. Offer integrated learning solutions through the performance management process and the progression plan process.
Promote LMS offerings, learning resources and how they can be used to support learning and development needs. Build awareness with the business on offering e-learning services and delivering e-learning evaluation.
Evaluate the effectiveness of all training and learning delivered within the division against the success measures and deliverables agreed at the outset.
Working closely with HR to attract, select and recruit successful candidates for the Life Sales Trainee programme.
Working with the other Training and LD functions across the company to ensure consistency of training policies and procedures.
Identify and implement improvements in the learning development offered within the Life division by using industry best standards and partnering with external providers to ensure the training offered by Cornmarket is best in class.

Skills Knowledge Required

Knowledge of risk control regulatory environment
Commercial awareness and understanding of the Life Pension industry, specifically the public sector market.
Primary degree in Business or HR/Training related discipline desirable
Must hold the QFA designation
RPA designation advantageous
Has a in depth knowledge and understanding of the Life division in terms of their core business, processes, products, business objectives and strategic goals
Understands different adult learning styles, learning principles and how to apply them to the design of learning programmes
Knows their role and responsibilities in relation to the mentoring role they are fulfilling, knows how to deliver quality feedback
Has an understanding performance management improvement processes and is able to support talent management programmes when required.
Has the ability to implement the full training cycle from Analysis stage through to Evaluation

Behavioural Competencies Required

Proactively identifies learning development initiatives which need to be undertaken to deliver business goals. Is proactive on developing an understanding of the organisations and divisions strategy
Displays strong commercial awareness and makes commercial decisions based on relevant facts that will result in a positive outcome for the business.
Demonstrates a genuine interest in training, coaching and developing others in order to improve knowledge and performance
Builds strong relationships with local business unit managers staff by adopting the most appropriate approach to deal with people and situations. Flexes own style in interactions with others to get the best out of each situation
Conveys information effectively using the most appropriate methods to reflect the needs of the audience to ensure understanding.
Efficient in the use of time and works in a well-structured way
Takes responsibility for personal development, learning from experience and new situations
Consistently works to a high standard and looks for ways to continuously improve training courses

Controlled Function

This role is a ‘controlled function’ as defined by the Central Bank Reform Act 2010 Regulations 2011. Any appointment will be conditional on the company being satisfied that the appointee meets the requirements as set out in the Fitness and Probity standards issued by the Central Bank. This requires the company to complete prescribed due diligence to assess the appointee’s fitness and probity.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Manufacturing Operator role will make an impact:

Key responsibilities for this role include:
Ensure that the manufacturing equipment and area is cleaned to GMP standards.
Ensure that BMR is correctly filled out according to SOP's.
Responsible for the correct running of granulation equipment.
Ensure that granulation is carried our according to relevant SOP's in accordance with the manufacturing schedule.
Ensure that other granulation processes are carried out i.e. drying, milling and blending in absence of fellow operatives.
Complete OEE sheets as required.
Report directly to Manufacturing Supervisor or Manager, if any problems or damage occurs.
Ensure that raw materials / excipients have been checked.
Operate granulating equipment, including Colette Gral, Fluid Bed Drier, tray ovens, Mill and discharge units in accordance with SOP's and as directed by the Manufacturing Supervisor / Manager.
Ensure that all safety standards are met while operating machines and handling product.
Responsible for a high standard of GMP and good housekeeping.
Carry out dispensing duties on the request of the Manufacturing Supervisor.
To adhere to all company and legislative health, safety and environmental requirements

The minimum qualifications for this role are:

Job description

Job Description:

To ensure maximum available uptime of production equipment and related services. You will inspect various production and service equipment and perform any corrective/preventative maintenance when required. To do well in this role you should have previous experience in industrial maintenance, be highly skilled with various hand and power tools, and be able to read and understand schematic diagrams and OEM manuals.

MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Maintain a safe working environment, ensuring that all H&S requirements and procedures are adhered to, including the correct use of specified PPE and Housekeeping standards.

2. Conducting routine inspections of equipment.

3. Carry out corrective and preventative maintenance of production equipment and service equipment.

4. Work with external contractors during equipment installation and onsite OEM service engineers.

5. Diagnosing mechanical issues and correcting them.

6. Ensure correct and safe operation of equipment and machinery.

7. Troubleshoot and maintain printing and converting equipment, conveyors, electrical systems, CNC machinery, pneumatic and hydraulic equipment.

8. Identify faulty equipment through observation and testing metrics.

9. Source replacement parts and perform repairs.

10. Work with Maintenance manager to continually update the production process and system software.

11. Attend daily shift meetings to prioritise work orders and minimise downtime.

12. Safely operate cranes, power tools, hoists and hand tools.

13. Assess the condition of used parts using appropriate tools and specifications.

14. Maintain parts and tools inventory.

15. Prepare maintenance reports and summary presentations using daily activity logs, analysis and trends.

16. Maintain electrical, pneumatics, hydraulics and mechanical knowledge via on-going training, industry workshops and technical reading.

17. Any other relevant duties that may be assigned.

Our shift patterns are currently:

7am-7pm and 7pm-7am (12 hour shifts)

Or

7am-3pm and 3pm-11pm (8 hour shifts)

Shifts are usually Monday to Friday but weekend work may be required.

LANDSCAPE CONSTRUCTION ESTIMATOR

Please Note: It is not necessary to have a landscape background to apply to this role, if you have transferrable skills from construction/civil engineering industry then please apply.

__
**

Would you like to work for one of Ireland’s top & most successful landscaping company’s? Redlough Landscapes Limited are currently recruiting for a Landscape Construction Estimator for our Development Department. The successful candidate will be given the opportunity to assume new challenges with our multiple projects taking place in the Dublin & greater Dublin area

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has a experience in either engineering or quantity surveying or working with developers/builders

Location: Hollystown Dublin 15 Salary: Competitive

Duration: Full Time Permanent Start: Immediate

About us:

REDLOUGH LANDSCAPES have over 30 years’ experience in developing and maintaining landscapes. We have worked for all the leading commercial and public bodies throughout Ireland. Our track record demonstrates our ability to complete some of the largest and most challenging landscaping projects in Ireland. See www.redloughlandscapes.ie or our Linked In https://www.linkedin.com/company/redlough-landscapes-ltd/ for examples of our project history.

Job Summary & Responsibilities:

An opportunity has arisen for a Landscape Construction Estimator to take responsibility for commercial hard and soft landscaping projects, throughout Ireland. We have a constant flow of price requests from main contractors which need to be priced and returned. Compliance submissions are also required. Leads also come from CIS database which is used to make proactive enquiries. We also tender for public work through etenders.ie portal.

We are looking for an individual who can bring expertise, experience and fresh ideas to the team, becoming integral to the future growth of the company.

Duties:

  • You will be involved in tenders for all landscape projects and Analyzing clients BOQs and returning prices
  • You will be responsible for assisting with the constant flow of price requests from main contractors which need to be priced and returned. Leads also come from CIS database which is used to make proactive enquirys We also tender for public work through etenders.ie portal.
  • Responsible for estimating, procurement & tendering
  • Collating quotations to calculate materials, equipment and labour costs
  • Responsible for assisting the director with the preparation of monthly valuations, cost reports & projections
  • Liaising and negotiating with, suppliers and subcontractors
  • Pre-contract meetings on site, and subsequent hand over to operations department.
  • Project cost control and reporting on budgets and valuations
  • Measure and record site information
  • Support the onsite team with forecasting and monitoring projects

Qualifications and skills required:

  • 3rd level degree in either civil engineering, quantity surveying construction management or business management
  • Experience working with developers/builders (advantage)
  • Landscaping experience not necessary but an advantage Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
  • Good awareness of tendering and the estimating process
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to build a relationship with clients
  • Ability to prioritize workload and co-ordinate a number of projects at the same time
  • Excellent budget management and punctual reporting deadlines
  • Good IT skills in Microsoft word and excel
  • Ability to work under pressure and strict deadlines
  • Ability to work on own initiative and be willing to work in a team

What we are offering?

An exciting and meaningful career path with challenging projects and learning from one of Ireland’s top landscaping companies. The successful candidate will have diverse work experience on office and site based assignments.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits available.

It’s not all work. Here at Redlough we work hard but we also are a work family who like to have fun too!

Be part of the growing team and apply today.

Interested candidates please apply with an up to date CV or call Rebecca Flynn for enquirys on 01-8207033

Job Title: Senior Project Manager

Division/Function: NDFA

Reports to (job title): Sector Head

Job Family: Project Management                                                                                                                                        

Career Stream: Professional

Career Zone: Line Manager/Senior Professionals

 

**Closing Date: 12th October 2021**

 

Summary of Business


The National Treasury Management Agency (NTMA) provides asset and liability management services to the Irish Government.

 

The NTMA, acting as the National Development Finance Agency (NDFA) provides financial advice to State authorities in respect of those public investment projects which are referred to it, with a capital value over €75million.

 

The NDFA also procures and delivers Public Private Partnership (PPP) projects as requested by State authorities (with certain exceptions such as Transport Infrastructure Ireland). In this role the NDFA is responsible for delivering the procurement and construction of projects referred to it before handing the completed asset over to the relevant sponsoring department/agency.

 

In addition, the NDFA provides post-handover contract management and support services to some sponsoring bodies in respect of the operation and maintenance of their operational PPP facilities, and directly procures certain Exchequer-funded projects on behalf of the Department of Education.

 

Details on these projects and other NDFA activities can be found at the following: http://www.ndfa.ie/.

 

 

Working at the NTMA offers excellent benefits including:

  • Flexible work options including remote working and variable work hours
  • An extensive wellbeing programme
  • Excellent learning and development opportunities that allow for full career development within the organisation
  • A diverse range of initiatives: LGBT+, Gender Matters, Disability Awareness, Sports & Social, Volunteering and lots more.
  • Reimbursement of annual professional membership fees
  • Defined Benefit Pension Scheme

 

Role Summary

We are seeking to recruit a Senior Project Manager to support the delivery and operation of large-scale Government building projects, primarily within the housing and education sectors.

 

This is a senior professional role with leadership and management responsibilities. The successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate excellent project management, technical and contractual experience in the field of infrastructure procurement and delivery. The ability to engage with stakeholders and counterparties at a senior level and to lead and develop our team are also key aspects of the role. Further details are included below.

 

Principle Accountabilities 

  • Lead the project management for procurement and delivery of a major building project.
  • Implement robust climate action/sustainability strategies and oversee scheme design and planning processes to ensure the highest sustainable development standards.
  • Direct and develop a project management team delivering services to sponsoring/sanctioning authorities in accordance with service level agreements.
  • Develop the project corporate governance structures in partnership with sponsoring/sanctioning authorities, ensuring clarity of roles and responsibilities between stakeholders.
  • Develop internal project management structures and processes.
  • Chair project team meetings and represent the NDFA on project boards, liaison committees and other key project meetings.
  • Create and manage stakeholder relationships and ensure that the integrity and reputation of the NTMA/NDFA is held in high regard.
  • Prepare reports, recommendations, board papers and presentations.
  • Active monitoring and reporting of project risks and control measures including in relation to costs and change control, programme, health and safety and construction quality.
  • Procurement and active performance management of external advisors, including ongoing communications and reporting.
  • Manage the preparation and delivery of:
  • All project inputs by the sponsoring agency and advisors required across the project lifecycle.
  • The design process (including statutory applications) necessary to deliver the project.
  • The procurement documents (including tender evaluation processes) for the project and all activities associated with the procurement process.
  • Oversee all project construction related activities (contract management (including dispute resolution), commissioning and handback).
  • Oversee the operations of a project post construction to ensure compliance with operational requirements.
  • Active engagement with the NDFA senior management team on resource planning and the development and delivery of the NDFA strategy.

 

Education/Knowledge

  • Third level degree (or equivalent) or higher, in architecture, engineering, construction, project management, quantity surveying or building related discipline.
  • Chartered membership of a relevant professional institution.
  • Project management qualification (desirable).
  • Knowledge of Project Ireland National Development Plan 2040, relevant published Government sectoral strategy, and the Climate Action Plan 2019, with understanding of the consequent implications for infrastructure development, procurement and delivery.
  • Knowledge of key issues and management strategies associated with climate change/sustainability, environmental, social and governance factors on large scale building projects.
  • Knowledge of construction health and safety roles, responsibilities and legislation.

 

Experience

Preferably 15+ years’ relevant project management experience relating to the delivery of major building or infrastructure projects.

 

Relevant experience will address the principal accountabilities above and include:

  • Leading one or more of the following project phases: procurement, design team management, construction and contract management, project management and/or operational asset management.
  • Recent experience of implementing sustainable, social and environmental management initiatives in project procurement and delivery is desirable.
  • Management of project budgets; design, capex, opex including change control, value engineering and risk management processes.
  • Recent experience working with major forms of public sector contracts (e.g., GCCC forms of contract) and/or of working in privately financed (PPP or PFI) projects, including the co-ordination of legal inputs/drafting.
  • Monitoring health and safety performance and promoting a strong health and safety culture on projects.

 

Skills

  • Excellent team leadership and project management skills.
  • Excellent collaboration and stakeholder management skills.
  • Highly innovative with strong analytical and decision-making skills.
  • Excellent communications (written, oral and presentation) skills.
  • Promotes the highest standards of ethics and integrity.
  • Promotes a culture of learning, development and high performance.



The NTMA is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We recognise that a diverse and inclusive workplace informs better decision making, creative thinking, innovation and drives business performance. We are strongly committed to ensuring that our workforce is representative of our society.

Role Description

Reporting directly to the Director of Global Benefits, you will work as part of a 2 person team to manage benefit and wellness programs, in addition to time off and leave of absence policies across EMEA and APJ. You are skilled at managing multiple programs in parallel, are adaptable, agile and can effectively work with multi functional partners at all levels and in various locations. You are passionate about employee benefits and make informed, timely decisions about programs while balancing business needs and employee experience. In your work, you will uphold our company values and contribute to the success of our business.


Dropbox is now a Virtual First company, which means work outside of an office will be the primary experience for all employees based anywhere in Ireland. This is an initial 16 month contract.


Responsibilities

  • Oversee the administration of all benefit, time off and leave programs across all locations
  • Manage operational aspects of benefits across multiple locations and timezones i.e. budgeting, renewals, ensuring programs align to local market and statutory requirements etc. 
  • Work with our network of brokers, partners and providers to ensure benefits are competitive and align with our team philosophy, while focussing on employee experience
  • Project manage, define and conduct market analysis as required
  • Manage/lead strategic international projects e.g. introducing a new benefit, enhancing or changing a benefit etc. 
  • Bring creative and thoughtful solutions to business or program issues as they arise
  • Act as a strategic partner for business by gathering and synthesising all relevant data to a decision, presenting it in a lucid way enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions
  • Collaborate with Global Benefits team on team wide projects, to scale processes and innovate programs
  • Partner with Compensation team on Total Rewards projects


Requirements

  • You possess 3 or more years of International Benefits experience
  • Experience establishing and building new benefits programs 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • You have excellent judgement and problem-solving capabilities; as well as the ability to make thoughtful decisions
  • You are intellectually curious and have a creative, solutions-based mindset
  • You are analytically driven; you utilize qualitative and quantitative approaches to problem solving 
  • You possess experience driving key programs and processes 
  • You have the ability to flex your style and build trust across the business
  • You are agile, fearless, and able to adapt to shifting priorities
  • You effectively partner with cross-functional partners (e.g. Finance, Legal) and the broader HR team to build a better employee experience for employees
  • Your attitude is "we, not I"

This role reports directly to the Corporate Tax Director and is part of a wider Tax team of 18 people. Flexible working opportunities are available. 


We’re looking for someone who can:


  • Advise on Irish corporation tax aspects of group initiatives and business transactions;
  • Provide pro-active corporation tax advice in support of the Group’s business objectives;
  • Manage the corporation tax compliance and provisioning processes for a portfolio of Irish subsidiaries;
  • Research areas of complexity in tax legislation, case law and practice;
  • Determine the impact of relevant legislative amendments on the business, systems and procedures and effectively communicating with the relevant business areas;
  • Assist in the management of corporation tax risk across the AIB Group by reviewing the end to end tax processes and ensuring that the correct procedures & controls are in place to manage tax risk; and
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with business units/divisions.


Who are we?

We’re AIB. A strong Irish bank packed with purpose - to back our customers to achieve their dreams and ambitions. That goes for our employees too. We’re made of small teams where you have the chance to shine.


Why join us?

We are excited about how we have changed our focus. We want to be at the heart of our customers’ financial lives by giving them an exceptional experience. We are building a culture that breaks the conventions of what our customer and employees expect of a bank.

Does this sound like something that you want to be part of?


You will need to show us that you:

  • Have a professional tax qualification and preferably also an accounting qualification;
  • Have at least 5 years relevant Irish corporation tax experience in practice or industry;
  • Have strong knowledge of Irish corporation tax issues of relevance to a banking group, together with a broad knowledge of other Irish taxes;
  • Are a good communicator with the ability to use a variety of communication and influencing skills;
  • Have a good IT skills and a high level of competence in Alphatax and Excel; and
  • Have experience of managing and dealing with diverse workstreams to specific deadlines.


If you feel you have what it takes, click apply and fill in the online application form. If you would like more information Noelle Ryan from the Talent Acquisition Team can help. You can contact careers@aib.ie

Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries.


You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily.


Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team. 


About the position:

Are you excited by the software industry and international business? Are you interested in a ground floor opportunity with a rapidly growing company that wants you to grow with them? If so, join our expanding Product Support team to work directly with our customers via email, web chat, and phone. 


What you will do:

  • Be at the forefront of the ticketing and help in routing issues to the appropriate support experts.

  • Fluent written and spoken English skills.
  • A pleasant personality and a commitment to user satisfaction.
  • Someone capable of managing shifting priorities, while maintaining organization and control of the expected product outcomes.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.


What we can offer you:

Our people are the key to our success and as a Globalization Partners employee, you can be assured that you are our top priority, from once you apply, right through to your first day and beyond.

We work hard and take care of each other, while enjoying ourselves along the way.

Description

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing high quality and affordable self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold.  Help us do it.

This role represents a unique opportunity for a QA Auditor who values autonomy and travel to broaden the scope of their role. The role requires approximately 60% travel and will afford you the opportunity to work in our great new office but also from home when not travelling. Currently, we are performing most of our audits remotely due to the COVID 19 situation; however, we do expect travel to increase within 2022. Travel will be mainly within Europe.

Our Audit team are central to Perrigo delivering on our vision (consumer trust), commercial targets and strategic advantage. The team is responsible for supplier audits of pharmaceuticals, medical devices, cosmetics and food supplements with the main focus on pharmaceuticals. The audits include audits for contract manufacturers, laboratories, materials suppliers, warehouses and transporters. You will work with a hugely experienced leadership team who will lead you without ego and with an authentic and genuinely appreciative style. There is much to be achieved in the coming months and years and your development and career progression will be vital to the success of this team. This is an exciting period for Perrigo that will see you benefit from both personal development and career advancing opportunities.

The preferred location for this role to be based is Dublin, Ireland. However, other locations can be considered.

Responsibilities include:

  • The QA Auditor will Plan, schedule, co-ordinate, lead, or participate, and follow up on assigned GMP audits of material and packaging suppliers
  • The responsibilities include timely lifecycle management of assigned audits by:
    • Developing and communicating appropriate scope, plan and agenda where acting as audit lead.
    • Effectively managing time/tasks to ensure appropriate audit preparation, efficient execution of audit activities, and timely reporting and follow-up.
    • Skilfully analysing audit data and correctly identifying departures from GMP.
    • Following up on audit observations and CAPAs through closure and verification.
  • The role may also include project work and continuous improvement initiatives relating to the audit process.

We are looking for motivated applicants who can represent Perrigo and our values while interacting with external suppliers and contract manufacturers. Our team works with a variety of different guidelines and procedures, and we place a strong importance on learning and development. We would like our team members to independently manage and prioritise their tasks and deadlines, with management support always available. We are looking for someone who has good attention to detail and enjoys being part of a high performing team.

Key Skills:

  • 5+ years Pharmaceutical experience (quality and/or auditing)
  • Pharmaceutical Supplier auditing experience, preferably IRCA certified or similar.
  • Thrive where afforded autonomy
  • Knowledge of relevant legislation
  • 3rd level education (chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, Chemistry, Pharmacy or a closely related field)
  • Strong analytical skills, excellent oral and written communication skills. Computer literacy with a working knowledge of MS Office and preferably Trackwise
  • Ability to work independently while consulting with others as appropriate
  • Enjoy travel

Apply through the link to initiate a discrete conversation.

Job Summary:  

Supplier Quality Engineer is responsible for leading project and supplier improvement activities for the quality engineering department. Other activities may be assigned as needed.


Authority Assignment:  

During periods of absence, the Quality Manager – Supplier & Manufacturing QA shall ensure that all the responsibilities of this position are appropriately assigned. The Quality Manager – Supplier & Manufacturing QA has the authority to act on the behalf of the Supplier Quality Engineer.


Duties/Responsibilities:   

•Manage Product and Process Validation activities with Suppliers.

•Lead Quality Engineering support at Aerogen on project activities i.e.: Design Improvements, Supplier Transfer’s, Cost Improvements, and New Product Introductions etc.

•Manage activities within the project teams ensuring that project planning is completed correctly with full evaluation and engagement from the necessary resources.

•Lead investigation of component/material quality issues should they arise during day to day production or within projects - work with quality, materials, manufacturing and suppliers to resolve issues.

•Support the selection, development, and management of new Suppliers to ensure Aerogen Supplier Approval Requirements are met.

•Establish analysis techniques and other quality control tools within project activities as well as utilization of these to solve specific supplier quality problems. 

•Overall responsibility for GMP standards and compliance within Aerogen’s Project Teams and Supplier Engagement.

•Maintain compliance with ISO and FDA Quality System regulations.


The role will also support external audits, internal audits and any relevant Quality/Regulatory compliance related activities as deemed necessary. The role will require a high degree of flexibility to coordinate the variety of tasks.


Education/Experience: 

•BE/BS Degree. A Post-graduate qualification in Quality Assurance is preferable although not mandatory.

•At least three to five years Quality Engineering experience or related role within the medical device industry.


Specific Requirements:

•Ability to work on own initiative.

•Strong team member with the ability to identify and drive implementation of innovative quality improvements.

•Ability to work within project teams, consistently meeting deadlines and ensuring that all actions are being addressed appropriately.

•Demonstrate and actively promote high levels of professional quality engineering.

•Good communication skills. Must have the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the company and with suppliers.

•Process Validation and Injection Moulding Experience Desirable.

•Good administrative/organizational ability with high level of attention to detail.

•Ability to liaise with suppliers, customers and regulatory contacts in an informed professional manner.

•Thorough understanding of ISO 13485 and FDA QSR standards.


Environmental Conditions:

Typical office environments, with work also performed in R&D and manufacturing labs, and customer/supplier locations.

Title

Senior QC Technologist

Company

Ipsen Manufacturing Ireland Ltd

Job Description

IPSEN

Ipsen is a dynamic and growing global specialty-driven biopharmaceutical company focused on innovation and specialty care.

We aim to make a sustainable difference by significantly improving patients’ health and quality of life and providing them with effective therapeutic solutions for unmet medical needs through differentiated and innovative medicines in Oncology, Neurosciences and Rare Diseases.

The patient is at the heart of everything we do, and we also care for our employees because they are the ambassadors who truly make the difference. We attract and develop bold, agile, entrepreneurial individuals who take full ownership of their decisions; leaders drawn by a purpose to make a direct impact through their work in people’s lives.

Job Description

The Senior QC Technologist will perform the analysis of samples in a timely manner according to approved analytical procedures, develop analytical skills through training and diversity in techniques. Assist QC Technologists within the laboratory in training and troubleshooting. When required assist in the disposition of materials ensuring that it is performed according to the manufacturing / shipping schedule.

Main Responsibilities
  • Analysis of materials as assigned. This may include testing of any of the following materials: Raw Materials, In-process intermediate samples, API’s, stability samples, cleaning and microbiological samples if deemed appropriate. Peer review may be performed according to approved analytical SOPs and as per relevant specification.
  • Results are compiled and submitted for review in a timely manner and it is important that attention is paid to the detail of the SOP and documentation. Promote accuracy and precision in daily laboratory routines in line with laboratory practices and calibrate laboratory equipment in accordance with the schedule.
  • The QC Senior Technologist must inform the QC Chemist /QC Manager of any issues as they arise, which may impact on the QC schedule and take on additional responsibilities over time, such as SAP Purchasing, Stability placements / scheduling, project work etc.
To be considered for the role, you will have a science degree and relevant industry experience and have an ability to work with minimal supervision and demonstrate excellent organizational and problem-solving skills as well as ensure that all analysis is performed according to approved analytical procedures, using approved practices and according to specification.

If you feel that this could be the right next step for you, we would be delighted to engage with your application.

IPSEN is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications, individuals are encouraged to apply regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

Description

Beschrijving

Wil jij een technisch vak leren? Wij bieden je een prachtige mogelijkheid! In deze baan als leerling elektromonteur ga je samen met een ervaren elektromonteur op pad om het vak te leren.

Samen ga je woningen installeren en daar komen de onderstaande allemaal aanbod:
Van LED-verlichting, centrale schakelingen en Internet of things, tot en met brandmeldinstallaties, en noodstroom-voorzieningen in deze baan komt alles op elektrogebied voorbij. Daarnaast ook de integratie van elektrasystemen met communicatiesystemen, klimaatbeheersinginstallaties, beveiligingssystemen en meer, alles moet naadloos samenwerken.

Je hebt het:

Het zou prettig zijn als je een VCA op zak hebt, maar die kan je ook op onze kosten gaan behalen. Wel vragen we een uitmuntende inzet en de drang om het vak te leren. Als je dan ook nog graag met gereedschap bezig bent en precies kan werken, solliciteer dan snel!

Je verdient het:

  • Een salaris tussen de 1600 euro en 2400 euro per maand op basis van 40 uur per week
  • Vakantietoeslag van 8,33% van je bruto salaris
  • 25 vakantiedagen & 13 ATV dagen
  • €0,19 euro reiskostenvergoeding per gereden kilometer
  • Exclusieve toegang tot het online leerplatform Intro Academy
  • Uitzicht op een vast dienstverband

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing high quality and affordable self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold. Help us do it.

Global Indirect Sourcing Manager – IT and Professional Services

The Global Indirect Sourcing Manager is primarily responsible for the strategic sourcing and negotiation of multiple complex spend categories to ensure cost effectiveness and performance standards in direct alignment with Perrigo’s Global Procurement strategy, category management structure, supplier management methodology and performance objectives. Collaborates with the Global Stakeholders to deliver best value global products and solutions to the company and its clients.

Responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:

  • Savings – Review and manage category spend and identify opportunities for cost improvements without negatively impacting quality of service.
  • RFx Project Management - Responsible for the end to end management of the sourcing process through collaboration and consultation with the Business Stakeholders.
  • Contract Management – Partner with the Procurement Legal Team to manage contract redlines and Terms of Business.
  • Implement Statements of Work for inbound services
  • Supplier Performance Management - Monitor performance and delivery of contracted services within your categories
  • Reporting - Spend analysis and Budgetary investigation

Requirements for the role include:

  • Bachelor's degree in business related field preferred
  • Fluent English speaker
  • Procurement certification preferred
  • Minimum of 5 years managing high spend, high complexity Global RFx processes with demonstrable competency in all stages of the Sourcing process.
  • Solid track record meeting substantial savings targets.
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills
  • High level understanding of Contract Terms and Conditions for IT, HR, Legal and Consultancy Agreements
  • Ability to coordinate multiple group efforts within the company to achieve defined objectives
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks, with awareness of deadlines
  • Ability to identify processes needing improvement, and to recommend improvement
  • Advanced MS Office skills in Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook
  • SAP knowledge and navigation skills

Our client is seeking to recruit a Finance Manager based in their state of the art manufacturing facility in Castlebar, Co. Mayo.


Key Responsibilities 


  • Participate in and manage the accounting operations and financial reporting
  • Implement and monitor accounting process and controls and document policies and procedures
  • Manage the accounting team; currently one AP team member, the AR function, and collaborate with the Customer Service billings team and other cross functional teams
  • Manage the timely collection of accounts receivable and payment of accounts payable
  • Perform the month end close process, including bank reconciliations, maintain the fixed asset register and depreciation, record payroll, prepare required journal entries, etc.
  • Prepare and issue timely financial statements and identify and report KPIs
  • Support the preparation of annual budget and forecasts, and investigate and report significant variances to management
  • Provide and review inventory cost reports and assist in the inventory cycle counting process and related reconciliation back to the general ledger
  • Process payroll and pension contributions in a timely manner
  • Support affiliated corporations on transaction and customer related queries, as required
  • Lead the annual audit and coordinate the provision of information to external auditors
  • Purchase requisition review, authorization and guidance
  • Prepare and submit grant applications
  • Provide support with financial analyses as needed, in particular for capital investments, pricing decisions, and contract negotiations
  • Crosstrain in D365 on AP, AR and GL transactions
  • Report directly to Director of Finance, along with controller of HQ in the US.


Key Requirements 

  • Ideally 5 years post qualified experience in a manufacturing industry related role
  • Financial and Management Accounting background.
  • Manufacturing and/or multinational experience is a distinct advantage
  • Experience in analysing financial data and report preparation & presentation, knowledge of Irish GAAP.
  • Commercial background with knowledge of ERP systems & product costing.
  • Intermediate to advance Excel skills.
  • Strong accounting knowledge of AP, AR, Inventory & GL, and month-end close.
  • Critical and effective problem solving and decision-making skills with the ability to work on one’s own initiative to resolve competing priorities and with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to manage people and processes
  • Excellent verbal & written communication and organizational skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to adapt to change are key to this role.
  • Be a strong team member with the ability to identify and drive efficiency improvements.


OTHER CONSIDERATIONS

As smokers continue to shed thousands of smoke particles even hours after smoking a cigarette and these particles will damage our products, only non-smokers are permitted to work in the facility

Your new company

To ensure the full range of HR activities are delivered within Linde Material Handling (Ireland) Ltd and by working with the Linde Ireland senior management team to ensure that the ITS EMEA and KION HR strategies are implemented throughout the Company. To ensure that Linde Ireland is resourced to budgeted levels and that all key HR processes are implemented effectively. To work with the ITS EMEA UK HR Management Team on the implementation of UK & Ireland wide HR projects and solutions. This role will need to update all policies and procedures to bring into line with KION policies.

What we offer:
Business Partner the Linde Ireland Management team and employees to create effective HR solutions in line with business needs. Lead the HR function in Linde Ireland, demonstrating professional integrity and act with a commercial mindset and business partner approach with the management team
Manage, monitor and control the headcount budget ensuring that headcount does not exceed these levels without specific authorisation.
Champion and conduct competency-based interviews ensuring vacancies are filled with the right quality of candidates in a timely and cost-effective manner.
Work with the management team and with ITS EMEA UK & Ireland HR to ensure that the Organisation Capability and Talent Review process is implemented in Linde Ireland.
Manage Employee Relations in Linde Ireland with business-like communications with recognized unions and employee representatives where appropriate and resolving any disputes or grievances using agreed policies and procedures.
Work with senior managers to build alignment with engagement strategies and plans at a local level and assess the potential impact of changes.
Work with managers to identify a top-level training plan for Linde Ireland in conjunction with national initiatives and ensure the timely completion of Employee Dialogues covering all employees.
Work with the Senior Manager Compensation & Benefits to centralise payroll management in ITS EMEA HR.
Ensure reporting for payroll, HR KPIs, Sustainability and other HR requirements are completed on time and to the correct standards and that these are reviewed with the Managing Director and senior management team on a monthly basis and implement resulting action plans.
Manage and review the recognition and reward structures in Linde Ireland ensuring alignment with ITS EMEA UK where appropriate
Implement and develop and document key processes for the delivery of strong HR service. Ensure Workday is used as the single source of truth for people management issues by employees, managers and HR in Linde Ireland

Tasks and Qualifications:
Degree or equivalent level.
Professional HR qualification (CIPD equivalent for Ireland)
Experience of managing HR and in a commercial or industrial environment
Lead action to ensure that the relationship between the Linde Ireland ITS management and its employees is underpinned by a framework of the company’s culture, policies, compliance and relevant employment law.
Lead employee engagement action in Linde Ireland to strengthen the connection that all employees have with their work, colleagues and their Company.
Demonstrates the ability to build individual and Company capability and knowledge through employee development initiatives to meet current and future business requirements and to create the highest levels of performance.
Able to ensure the Company is appropriately designed to deliver maximum impact in the short and long term and aligned with ITS EMEA and KION and structures. Able to design interventions to drive the appropriate culture, behaviours, skills and performance and provide insight and leadership on change management strategy, planning and implementation.
Ensure that the company has the right resource, capability and talent to achieve immediate and strategic ambitions now and in the future.
Able to deliver programmes that reward and recognise employees’ key capabilities, skills, behaviours, experience and performance, and that reward systems are market relevant, fair and cost effective.
Leads customer focussed HR service delivery excellence across the entire employee lifecycle by applying robust process and project management to enable effective and cost-efficient HR solutions; provide the company with HR KPIs to enable business improvement.
Able to effectively lead the HR function in Linde Ireland and is seen as a role model within the HR function and with wider management teams.

Brown Bag Films, Dublin Studio is currently looking for our next Lead Previz and Layout Artist!

Who are we?

At Brown Bag Films, we live by our motto; We Love Animation®. We also are

  • One of the top-performing animation studios operating worldwide
  • Creators of well-loved cartoons for kids and grownups in a fast-paced & energised environment
  • Award-winning dog lovers, artists, charity activists, amateur boxers (!), tech gurus, and extraordinary teammates
  • Pencil wielding, spreadsheet loving, people-focused do-ers who are passioned about their work

Our culture also shines through in our in-studio and web events. From go-karting to charity boxing matches, to haunted house tours, charity cycles across the country, enjoying JustEat vouchers - from sushi to pizza, competing with our fellow colleagues in growing our own sunflower to walking the Great Wall of China - loving animation means loving our crew!

About the role:

Our next Lead Previz and Layout Artist will maintain a project's Layout standards. Support the department supervisor by giving reports on the team and project, implementing and rolling out updates. Will mentor, develop and problem-solve the work of other artists in the team.

Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities will include:

  • Developing Layout workflows and techniques as well as approving and guiding Layout within the department both in-house and for overseas studios
  • Working with Directors and Production Design team to develop the cinematic style and look for the project
  • Assisting production in time bids
  • Resourcing, crafting, and contributing to documents on workflows
  • Mentor and training of other team members

Key Requirements
Knowledge, skills, and experience:

  • Proactive knowledge in improving storyboards through the creation of shot-viz
  • Ground-breaking knowledge of staging, composition, pacing, and timing in Animation
  • Experience in coaching and mentoring artists. Confident in outsourcing management with an emphasis on clear communication and follow-through
  • Able to point out, improve on, and troubleshoot current tools and animation issues
  • General knowledge of rigging, modeling, lighting, and FX. Good eye for editing and software knowledge

Please submit a full CV and outline all equivalent experience and why you wish to work with Brown Bag Films in your Cover letter.

Brown Bag Films is an equal opportunities employer that takes diversity and inclusion seriously. As a company, we provide high-quality kids' content, and we aim to have diverse characters so that all our audience feels represented. We also want the same for our own workforce, and Brown Bag Films is committed to looking for all kinds of talent to build a diverse workforce in which all social groups are represented.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process to perform essential job functions. We'd love to hear from you to request accommodation.

As a full-time hire you are automatically enrolled in our world-class training programme. It's 2 years of structured training, mentoring and specially chosen roles to set you up for a successful career in P&G Sales and recognized industry wide as the best leadership development programme.

The Role:
You will acquire a deep understanding of your customer needs and requirements as well as an in-depth understanding of your shoppers, categories and market.

You will create and sell tailored customer plans that mean both our brands and our customers will win and outperform the competition by negotiation contracts, promo plans and innovations.

You will develop and maintain a productive long-term relationship with your customer.

You will work within dynamic multi-functional customer teams which include finance analysts, supply chain managers, customer insight managers and shopper marketing.

What we offer you

Entrepreneurial leadership of your business - From day 1 our trust in you will allow you to be the expert on your business, to innovate and execute in an entrepreneurial style, and influence how decisions are made.

Continuous coaching - You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.

Dynamic and respectful work environment - Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting flexible working arrangements and work/life balance

Benefits - A job in P&G Sales offers a competitive salary as well as other great benefits such as a company car, great pension and share schemes. To find more information about our benefits package take a look here: https://www.pgcareers.com/benefits

Qualifications

To be a great fit for this role you will have:
Successful examples of leadership in your business or personal life.

Strong data analytics capability, to actively identify business opportunities.

A passion for winning.

Proven ability to collaborate with strong communication, influencing, and negotiating skills.

Account management experience with leading retailers, or experience within FMCG as a buyer working for a leading retailer.

OR a recently completed / almost completed third level qualification.

Fluent English and a full drivers license.

Good to know:
At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Our people are all equally talented in unique ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to inspire us with your unrivalled ideas?

Based in Dublin, Ireland

Who We Are:
lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

Job Summary:
Store Managers are accountable for every aspect of the retail store operations, ensuring that all areas of the store are engaged, performing, and delivering world-class guest experience. Store Managers build team capabilities to drive strategy and achieve key results for the business. This role is responsible for the talent acquisition strategy, ongoing people development and growth within their community.

Key Responsibilities of the Job

Leadership and People Management

  • Create and foster a respectful and inclusive team environment and culture by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for team members and guests.
  • Establish a vision for the store, based on key metrics and initiatives, and cascade to all team members.
  • Build a strong and diverse team that includes team members with various experiences, backgrounds, and skillsets to drive store operations.
  • Manage the store’s hiring process, including recruitment, selection, and onboarding, ensuring a focus on IDEA (inclusion, diversity, equity, and action) and other lululemon priorities.
  • Support ongoing learning and development of all store team members consistently and equitably by providing direct feedback, coaching, mentoring, and career path guidance, and addressing performance concerns.
  • Engage in career discussions to support and reinforce team understanding of how working at lululemon will contribute to career and personal growth.
  • Provide team member recognition, gap assessment, and overall performance documentation to support and reinforce the career and personal growth of your team.
  • Plan and prepare team member schedule according to labour requirements, availability, and budget considerations.
  • Address all employee relations issues, including knowing when to partner with People and Culture (P&C) team to take appropriate action.
Working with Others

  • Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members, focusing on personal and professional development.
  • Collaborate with in-store team members to ensure optimal guest experience that values guests’ time and support store operations.
Guest Experience

  • Support team members (e.g., leading by example or coaching) to ensure a great guest experience, including assessing guest needs, providing technical product education, and supporting in-store transactions and omnichannel programs (e.g., buy online pickup in store, phone sales, and ship from store options).
  • Move dynamically on the floor to assess and fulfill the needs of the business, team, and guests.
  • Address emergent issues, including guest escalations and emergency requests.
Operations

  • Manage whole store profit and loss (P&L) in accordance with goals (sales, budget, etc.).
  • Plan and execute high-level quarterly and annual planning for store with respect to strategy, budget, and labour (including recruiting and training/development).
  • Plan floor coverage and make decisions to maintain efficiency and effectiveness of floor operations.
  • Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
  • Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.
Budget Responsibility:
  • Accountable for controllable budget; labour hours; annual sales plan target
People Management:
  • Leadership role directly responsible for all store employees (may delegate some aspects of management)
Key Skills & Core Values You Bring

  • Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences
  • Integrity/Honesty: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner
  • Leadership: Is able and desires to lead, influence, and inspire others; motivates, empowers, develops, and directs people as they work
  • Decision Making: Uses logic and reasoning to evaluate alternatives and make effective, timely decisions
  • Adaptability/Agility: Tolerates uncertainty and ambiguity and can change priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Team Building: Creates and develops teams that maximize accomplishments; encourages unique contributions and different perspectives
  • Strategic Thinking: Sets strategies that are aligned to vision and values of the company to achieve goals/vision/further the mission; considers the 'big picture' implications of decisions
  • Resilience: Remains persistent; recovers quickly from setbacks
  • Change Management Leadership: Leads others through all phases of change processes and uncertainty
  • Business Acumen: Is able to quickly understand and address business information (e.g., profit and loss statements, budgets and sales forecasts, retail strategy and approaches)
Job Requirements

Eligibility

  • Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must have proof of the Right to Work and evidence relating to associated local legislative requirements (EMEA only)
  • Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with own transportation methods
Availability

  • Willing to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and holidays
Other Willingness Requirements

  • Willing to work as part of a team and also complete work independently or alone
  • Willing to work in an environment with bright lights and loud music
  • Willing to move through a store for most of a shift to help guests and accomplish work
  • Willing to move boxes weighing up to 30 lbs (13.6 kg)
Experience

  • 1 year people management experience
Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)

  • Education: High school diploma, GED, or equivalent
  • Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  • Experience: 2 years retail or sales specific management experience
In keeping with our mission, please connect with us at accommodations@lululemon.com if you have questions about how your unique abilities may translate to the requirements for this role, with or without a reasonable accommodation. In your email, please include the position title, the location of the position and the nature of your question or request.

Beyond The Paycheck (Benefits & Perks)
At lululemon, we care for and invest in the whole person - body, mind, spirit. Our total rewards program is designed to support you in achieving your goals and focus on the things you love. In addition to competitive base pay and a team-based bonus program, we also offer extended health plans, paid time off, savings plans, generous employee discounts, fitness/yoga classes, parenthood top up program and personal and professional development programs.

Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

The Role
Personio was founded in 2015, and its mission is to enable better organisations. We simplify and automate recruiting, payroll and human resource management software (all-in-one) for small to medium-sized businesses. Our HQ is in Munich, and we have additional offices in Madrid, London, Dublin and most recently Amsterdam. Globally we are home to almost 1,000 employees and over 4,000 customers. In January 2021 we raised $125 million in ‘Series D’ funding, making us the most valuable HR tech organisation in Europe. In 2021, we will scale our Dublin office to 200 people. Come join us!

At Personio, Customer Operations & Success is more than one specific role. It is rather an integral part of our company culture and defines how our customer-facing teams work. Customer Operations & Success follows the mission to maximize customer value in our everyday business. As part of this team, you enable our customers to understand the product, give feedback, encourage their growth, and make their people processes more successful. For our newly launched international implementation team in Dublin, we are looking for an Implementation Specialist who is responsible for the implementation of new International customers. You will examine the HR processes and organizational structures of our new customers and advise them on how to best use our HR software.

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:
Analysis of our new customers' requirements regarding our HR software
Structured support of Personio implementations through e-mails, telephone calls, and web demos
Ensuring customer satisfaction through advice on HR processes in Personio
Validation, preparation, and assistance with importing customer data
Involvement in the creation of training materials, e.g. help centre articles or webinars
Continuous optimization of our processes, e.g. through the automation of individual work steps
What you need to succeed
You must be fluent in English and one of the following languages: German, Italian, Dutch or French
You have a bachelor and/or master degree in economics, social sciences or any related field
You have a background in the B2B software environment, ideally with HR-related software in customer success, account management or any other customer-facing role
You are passionate about digital transformation in HR
You prioritise solutions over problems, always putting the customer first
You work autonomously and reliably
You are data-driven, and you feel very comfortable using MS-Office, especially Excel
Tools like Zendesk, Gainsight, and Jira already sound familiar to you
Why Personio
Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work! Work with us and receive:

Competitive compensation package that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Two Impact days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society. One day is for an individual project and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibility
26 days of paid vacation + 2 days off for Christmas and New Year's Eve (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Annual personal development budget of €1,500 for conferences, courses, books, career coach, etc.
Regular company and team events like Oktoberfest, ski trips, Christmas parties, and more! (COVID permitting)
Flexibility to balance work between remote and in the office
Comprehensive healthcare scheme covered for each permanent employee (excl. taxes).
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Discounts across a range of brands so you can save money while shopping at Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, Dia, etc.
Mental health support, as we know that mental wellbeing plays a major role in both our personal and professional success. #PersonioCares
With PersonioFlex, you decide where you work best. We offer a flexible 50/50 in-office and/or remote working framework. Our remote working policy allows you to work from home or anywhere in the UK or European Economic Area for up to 90 days per year

About us
Being a Personio means being part of something big. It means shaping the future of HR, the future of our company, and at the very same time: your future. As one of the fastest-growing B2B SaaS companies in Europe, we have raised $125 million in ‘Series D’ funding in January 2021, making Personio the most valuable HR technology company in Europe. We have a great product and a fantastic team that will continue to grow through 2021, from 500 to 1,000+. We already have more than 4,000 customers with a market that is only waiting to be developed further, but we aim high: Our goal is to build the leading HR platform in Europe.

At Personio, we believe in hiring people like you - ambitious, forward thinkers who want to be more than just another employee. Will you be one of them?

Customer Service Advisor - DHL

We are delighted to announce that we have partnered with DHL in the search for professional and enthusiastic people to work at the DHL Call Centre located in Shannon Co. Clare.

We are recruiting for Customer Service Advisors to supplement the core customer service workforce on a full time basis.

Guidant IRC has a long standing relationship with DHL and we are proud to see so many of our staff build their careers within the business.

This opportunity is based in Shannon, please note that this opportunity is not suited to remote working and you will be required to work on site.

If you have customer service experience or helpdesk experience and you're seeking an exciting career move then this could be an amazing opportunity for you. We are seeking a Customer Service Advisor to provide superior level customer service and business support to our client's customers using the DHL European Key Account Support (EKAS) service offering. This CS Advisor role comes with a generous salary and excellent benefits package.

Due to the nature of this role, we are looking for people who speak another language in addition to English. During your application, you will be asked to confirm the second language you speak.

  • The ability to collaborate within a team.
  • An approachable personality
  • IT proficient.
  • Exceptional understanding of reporting tools
  • Must be available to work shifts between 6am and 5pm Monday to Friday

We can offer you:
  • Flexible shift patterns.
  • Competitive hourly rate.
  • Development and training.
  • Full time hours.

IRC is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.

Job Overview

TE Connectivity (NYSE: TEL) is a $13 billion global technology leader. Our connectivity and sensor solutions are essential in today’s increasingly connected world. We collaborate with engineers to transform their concepts into creations – redefining what’s possible using intelligent, efficient and high-performing TE products and solutions proven in harsh environments. Our 72,000 people, including over 7,000 engineers, partner with customers in over 150 countries across a wide range of industries. We believe EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS – www.TE.com.

The HR Systems and Workforce Analytics teams manage TE's HR Technology. They build, implement and continuously improve global HR systems, data, reporting and analytics platform. They also develop custom reports to meet business requirements, monitor HR systems and analytics needs and provide technology and analytics solutions by designing new or modifying existing systems.

Responsibilites
  • Act as our Global Product Owner for Recruitment & Onboarding systems & applications
  • Collaborates with internal Human Resources customers to analyze HRIS requirements, develops and implements various HRIS solutions & procedures
  • Provides expertise in the analysis, design, development and implementation of our Global HRIS system & applications.
  • Partner closely with our Global Talent Attraction team to provide product knowledge & solutions.
  • Streamline & continuously improve system configuration for Talent Attraction - Recruitment > Onboarding > Hire.
  • Researches solutions to support HR programs and processes.
  • Acts as a liaison with IT (Internal & External) on technical issues and projects requiring data integration and other technical support.
  • Troubleshoots production issues, including problem research and analysis, and performing steps for resolution.
  • Documents system specifications, configurations, processes and procedures.
  • Partners with IT, HR and business to ensure effective use of methodologies and communication of test strategies, test results and performance through testing teams
  • Audits and reviews changes within HRIS to ensure proper controls and separation of duties and assists in establishing new controls, as needed.
  • Contributes to training program development and provides Tier 3 end-user support. Partners with COE’s & Shared Services on enhancements, new rollouts, etc.
  • Works with external vendors and other service providers to ensure the efficient, accurate, and timely exchange of information.
What Your Background Should Look Like
  • Bachelor degree (or equivalent); advanced degree preferred.
  • Typically requires minimum of 5+ years of HRIS experience or experience in data management
  • Experience with HR Systems configuration and reporting (SuccessFactors)
  • SuccessFactors Recruitment (RCM/RMK) & Onboarding 1.0 administration – ideally accredited or in the process of working towards accreditation.
  • Candidate should ideally have been experience in at least 1 previous global / regional implementation
  • Ability to communicate recommendations and solutions to non-technical clients and end users.
  • Experience building and executing test scripts for HR information system upgrades and enhancements.
  • Knowledge of Onboarding 2.0 (desired)
  • Knowledge of Employee Central (desired)
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel
Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability,Teamwork, Innovation

The successful individual will ideally have 4+ years experience in a pharmacy technician role, have excellent organisational & communication skills and experience in leading a service.

The role will involve weekly visits to homeless services shelters, engagement with homeless service users, staff and nursing & medical personnel, with whom we have excellent relationships.

This is a role for someone who is reliable & calm, who works efficiently and who can 'think outside the box' & solve problems on-the-go.

Its a unique opportunity for the right person

We really want to hear from you if you feel you tick the boxes

An immediate start is available and ideally we want to have recruited with a start date before the end of October

Expected start date: 4/10/2021

We are looking for a true leader with a strong background in the restaurant industry to take ownership of and develop the department while leading and developing the team.This is an exciting role for someone to join the team at the time of a new beginning.Role OverviewThe Restaurant Manager is responsible for managing the operation, financial performance and development of the Restaurant Department as well as leading and developing the team. The successful candidate should be up to date with the latest trends, demonstrate exceptional communication, organisation & service skills along with a good financial acumen.Main Duties· Manages all activities, supervisors, and service staff in the Brasserie Restaurant to maximise guest satisfaction & profitability and to achieve revenue goals and forecasts.· Works with the Food & Beverage Manager to create the Marketing Strategy for the Brasserie and implements the plan in the departments· Completes and Monitors rosters for the department in accordance with departmental budget· In
