Job Summary
AECOM has a Freedom to Grow policy that celebrates flexible working; if you are interested in joining us, we should be happy to discuss a working arrangement to suit you. AECOM is seeking a highly motivated and experienced EHS consultant. Working within our expanding EHS Transactions and Compliance Team you will be responsible for managing bids, projects and for the technical delivery of a variety of EHS Due Diligence, Compliance and Management System projects. You will be supporting national and international clients across a wide range of sectors including oil and gas, chemical, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, food and beverage, automation, healthcare and financial industries.

Working within a specialist EHS team you will also collaborate with other AECOM teams as appropriate to ensure that client expectations are met, and project objectives are achieved.

This position provides the opportunity to work closely with internal and external clients. You will provide advice to leading private sector businesses including some of Europe’s leading private equities and industrials. At AECOM, we work to exceed our clients’ expectations and you will be required to work within tight deadlines, often on multiple projects. You will be forward thinking and have a ‘can do’ attitude.

Nationally our Practice is one of the largest in the UK and has an established track record in successfully delivering projects for clients We are now looking to drive growth in the Practice with individuals that can offer demonstrable experience in winning projects, who have a sound understanding of client needs in this sector; can be proactive in their approach to work; who can engage effectively with a large AECOM team with a very diverse range of skills and experience and who want to share in our enthusiasm and determination to lead and drive growth in our important client-base.

AECOM is built to deliver a better world. We design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets for governments, businesses and organizations in more than 150 countries. As a fully integrated firm, we connect knowledge and experience across our global network of experts to help clients solve their most complex challenges. From high-performance buildings and infrastructure, to resilient communities and environments, to stable and secure nations, our work is transformative, differentiated and vital. A Fortune 500 firm; see how we deliver what others can only imagine at aecom.com and @AECOM.

The successful applicant will work within our regional team. The role will likely involve a mixture of both some site work and office work. The successful applicant will be expected to assist Directors with growth in this sector – both from external client relationships and from collaboration with other internal AECOM teams that are aligned to this sector. The appointed person will be expected to take on client management, direction of projects, and lead on tender and bid submissions.

Further detail on responsibilities include:
  • Deliver, lead and coordinate detailed EHS compliance and due diligence audit programmes.
  • Lead and/or support winning bids and proposals, focussing on, but not limited to, EHS compliance, due diligence, management systems etc.
  • Participate in EHS audits as necessary and prepare accurate audit reports using varied reporting formats often within demanding reporting timescales.
  • Deliver challenging EHS due diligence assignments (Desk Studies, Phase I Assessments, EHS Site Assessments etc.) and prepare commercially focused succinct reports.
  • Understand clients’ needs and build sustainable relationships in order to meet our business development goals.
  • Work with internal clients and grow opportunities within the AECOM business.
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of our services and team by evaluating project successes and challenges and sharing lessons learned to enhance performance within the business.
  • Support marketing initiatives for the team.
  • Where appropriate, act as a mentor to more junior personnel.
  • Apply and encourage a high level of health and safety awareness and quality management at all times.
  • Ensure effective communication with the project team and clients.
  • For this role you will ideally hold a strong undergraduate degree in an environmental, science or engineering based subject, be chartered or working to chartership with a relevant UK/Ireland institution, have at least 8 years relevant experience, and be willing to travel within Ireland UK to support bids and projects with occasional European and global travel. We are particularly looking for candidates with the following:

Minimum Requirements
  • The value of diversity and inclusion is readily apparent in creating a collaborative, supportive working environment and in delivering innovative, contextually appropriate projects.It is very important to both what we do and the way we do it. We welcome applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds and experiences. The important thing for us is that you can demonstrate that you can effectively fulfil the needs of the role. If you feel you can fulfil the requirements of the role, but there are other factors that are making you hesitant in applying, we would still like to hear from you and see if we can work together to overcome any challenges.
  • Experienced Project Manager with exposure to clients.
  • Educated to degree level in a relevant subject or demonstrate an equivalent EHS qualification.
  • Excellent, pragmatic knowledge of the application of EHS legislation, guidance and standards.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, in EHS discussions in a professional, sensitive and non-conflicting manner.
  • Demonstrate a working knowledge of EHS inspection, auditing, permitting assessments and reporting.
  • Ability to work independently and prepare high quality professional proposals/bids/reports.
  • Motivated individual with the ability to work independently or as part of team, with the initiative to complete tasks.
  • Excellent planning, organisational skills and be a good time manager.
  • Reasonable flexibility and willingness to travel nationally to conduct site visits.
  • Open and honest.
  • A background in Industry is advantageous, as is experience in the Pharmaceutical sector.

Preferred Qualifications
  • NEBOSH Diploma or General Certificate (or similar) in health and safety. Appropriate industry experience may be substituted for, or supplement, formal health and safety qualifications
  • A post-graduate qualification is desirable.
  • Member of a relevant technical professional body, e.g. IOSH, IEMA etc.

Your benefits will include:
Helping our employees achieve a healthy work-life balance is important to us. If you join AECOM, as well as receiving a competitive salary, you’ll also have the opportunity to explore flexible working arrangements. Core benefits include 25 days’ annual leave, company pension scheme, private medical insurance, life assurance and one paid annual professional institution membership fee. You can also choose from a wide range of flexible benefits to suit your lifestyle.

You’ll also be able to give back to communities with up to two paid CSR days each year. Through our charity, The AECOM Foundation, you can volunteer to support children in developing countries. And if you’re a member of the Reserve Forces you’ll receive an additional 15 days paid leave for training commitments.

What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

The Messaging team is responsible for delivering messaging solutions to our customers using the Genesys Cloud, AWS architected product. We work with 3rd party messaging platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Twitter. As well as with SMS and MMS messaging. We are continuing to expand this product line and provide additional solutions and features for our customers. This role will help drive those features.

As a Principal Engineer on the Messaging team, you will be designing and developing high quality software to deliver key features in support of the product roadmap. You will be working on tools and infrastructure challenges involving software engineering. You will also be working with other service teams in the Genesys Cloud ecosystem, to deliver new features to our customers, maintain existing features, and drive software design and implementation.

You will be joining a collaborative team of like-minded people who thrive on technical problem solving and relish design challenges. Working in an Agile team environment, our team is mainly back end focused but with capabilities to deliver full features across Front-End, Back-End, Eventing and Storage layers. Genesys Software Engineers think through implementation details of scale, security and usability. We write code in Java and JavaScript mainly, and work with many cloud technologies, including DynamoDB, SQS, S3, Kafka, Jenkins & GIT. We also work directly with product managers and support engineers to fully develop and support our messaging solutions.

Location: For this role we are open to candidates being eventually office based in Galway, remote workers long term or a mix of both.

This role will enable you to:
Design and develop high quality, efficient, testable software to implement key product features in the Genesys messaging space
Bring features all the way through the Design, Test, Deploy, Maintain cycle.
Contribute to the overall architecture of the system and the wider ecosystem.
Actively contribute input and direction to the Product roadmap.
Actively participate in team code reviews.
Act as a mentor to other members of the team.
Enhance overall team velocity.
Apply processes appropriately for data security, traceability and information sharing.

This role might be right for you if:
Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science or related disciplines.
Excellent programming skills, particularly in Java.
10+ years of experience in Software Engineering.
Experience of designing & developing REST API’s.
Expert level understanding of object-oriented programming & design.
Cloud Native application development, preferably AWS based.
Proactive, self-driven, and possessing a growth mindset.

Ticking these boxes would be great, but they are not required:

Understanding of Microservices architecture principles and best practices.
Familiarity with social messaging solutions and 3rd party platforms for those messages (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Twitter, etc). Familiarity with sms/mms messaging solutions.

Benefits:
Flexible work schedules and work from home options
Development and career growth opportunities
Excellent pension scheme
Bonus scheme
Health Insurance
Income Protection & Life Assurance

Description

Client

My client currently has a requirement for a Network Security Architect to join their growing team in Dublin. This role requires a Network and Security expert who is a self-starter and can deliver projects in their entirety from beginning to end. You will design large solutions involving the latest in Routing and Switching technologies along with modern firewalls and other security equipment.

Responsibilities

The role will involve designing solutions for one of my clients largest customers. This would require you to be capable of learning the customer’s environment and network quickly. Being capable of supporting the existing network, and being capable of designing new network solutions in their entirety. This would include (but not limited to): Meetings with customers, stakeholders, and management, designing new solutions with the ability to be able to back the choices made in the design stage, create HLD and LLD documentation with detailed and clear written documentation (including Visio diagrams etc.), implementation, testing, handover, and support. You will be working as part of a bigger dynamic team who manages this cutting-edge customer from day to day. Some out of hours work is required, as the customer’s equipment is located in 2 Dublin Data Centers, and the only time change interventions are allowed is out of hours. Should this be required, you would not be expected to work normal hours the next day. Although you would be working day-to-day in the customer account team, you would still be a key part of the network team, and reporting into the Head of Networks for Ireland. This is a very supportive team, who shares knowledge and assists each other when needed. An excellent learning and development program is in place to allow you to advance your knowledge and further your career in many different areas.

Experience

  • Cisco CCNP/CCIE Routing and Switching qualifications
  • Checkpoint CCSA/CCSE and other Firewall experience required (Cisco ASA, Fortigate, etc.) to Engineering level
  • Excellent knowledge of IP routing protocols such as: mBGP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, Static Routing etc.
  • IPSec VPN and Remote Access VPN solutions
  • Data Centre Solutions such as Cisco Nexus Switches, Hyperconverged Technology, IOS-XE and IOS-XR OS

Contact

If you feel this role is for you please contact Mick Duffy on +353 1 525 4647 or mduffy@softwareplacements.ie

Description

Amazon is seeking Security Engineers to join our internal threat reduction team. Join the team responsible for providing developing and executing the insider threat program for Amazon. The team’s mission is to reduce to risk insiders can pose to Amazon, and the primary responsibility of this role will be to lead internal threat investigations across Amazon.

The role provides the opportunity to investigate potential internal threat cases, provide internal threat subject matter expertise, research and recommend technology and process improvements, and build the tools and capabilities to support those efforts. We build tools to match the scale of Amazons environment, pushing the limitations of existing tooling and evolving beyond those limitations. As part of this team, you will participate in building large scale, customized tools that enable you and the team to rapidly investigate, proactively detect, and increase collaboration across partner teams.

Key Tasks Include
  • Serve as a primary internal threat investigator, using an array to tools and capabilities to investigate internal threat cases
  • Provide subject matter expertise in all aspects of internal threat investigations
  • Provide analytical and operational support to internal risk investigations, mitigation, and program objectives
  • Participate in and lead large-scale incidents requiring parallel investigations, executive communications, reports, and postmortems across a global scale
  • Communicating effectively with varying audiences at multiple levels of sensitivity, often including legal, human resources, business leaders, and partner information technology and information security teams
  • Evaluating the impact of current security trends, advisories, publications, and academic research to Amazon
  • Developing trends and insights based upon data to drive continual improvements

Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Degree in related field with a strong technical background (additional years of experience may be considered in lieu of degree)
  • 3 years of demonstrated experience in areas such as internal threat (aka insider threat), digital forensics, or internal investigations
  • Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy in a global environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate security and business risk to a broad range of technical and non-technical audiences
  • Scripting skills (e.g., Perl, Python, Bash, PowerShell )

Preferred Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience with AWS cloud solutions
  • Keen interest for candidates with knowledge in Data Sciences, Machine Learning, or Artificial Intelligence
  • Experience with digital forensics as part of legal proceedings (e.g., evidence handling, affidavits, testimony)
  • Relevant industry certifications or training which demonstrate intimate familiarity with the insider threat discipline (e.g. CERT, CCITP, NITTF)
  • Coding proficiency in Python, Go, or similar language

Company - Amazon DS Ireland Limited

Job ID: A1754922

Overview

Add an annual turnover of $22.5 billion to a rental and leasing fleet of more than 1.7 million vehicles spread across 9,500 locations worldwide and you get Enterprise Rent-A-Car – a business that’s grown into the largest global mobility provider in the world.

Join us, and after an initial virtual classroom-based orientation session, you’ll be assigned to a branch office for hands-on business training. Here you will learn valuable business skills from capable mentors who were once in your shoes. That’s because nearly all of our full-time employees started as a graduate in our Management Training Programme, including our current CEO.

This allows everyone to learn our business from the ground up and to understand how they play a significant role in seeing it succeed. Our promote-from-within culture ensures that you’ll have a well-rounded training experience and learn skills in management, finance, operations, sales and customer service.

As you progress, increasingly more opportunities will become available to you. You can choose, as most people do, to continue your rewarding ascent within our Rental Operations managerial track. Then - in as little as two years from joining as a graduate - you could become a Branch Manager, in charge of your own team and your own profits. Or you can explore one of many other exciting options within Enterprise including Human Resources, Accounting, Revenue Management, Sales, Marketing and more.

What is certain is that we encourage all of our employees to be the best they can be, and diversity is a priority in all areas of our business. We have been included in The Times list of Top 50 Employers for Women for sixteen years in a row, and have been honoured with many other awards along the way.

Enterprise is also still family-owned – our CEO Chrissy Taylor is the third generation of the Taylor family to run the company. This allows us to look forward even more confidently to the future, providing the stability we need to pursue the long-term good for our business, our employees and our customers, even in these challenging times.

As you are considering a position with Enterprise, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today – and every day – the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response, please visit the Enterprise Rent-A-Car website.

Responsibilities

As a Graduate Management Trainee, you are empowered to make business decisions that greatly affect your career as well as the bottom line. You’ll gain responsibility for developing new business and maintaining current relationships. You’ll be responsible for understanding cost control, reading your branch’s P&L statement and understanding what it takes to run a profitable business. You will also learn how to deliver exceptional customer service.

We will teach you how to effectively communicate, influence, and interact with all types of customers, vendors, and colleagues. You’ll learn proper sales techniques, problem solving strategies and conflict management. Those skills will provide you with the opportunity to market to local business partners and build solid, long lasting relationships with key business decision makers. In your development to become a successful manager at Enterprise, you’ll learn how to mentor, train, develop, manage and promote staff of your own. In turn, we’ll reward your development with pay increases and opportunities for continued promotions.

Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree is preferred; however, professional experience can be substituted if applicable.
You must have a full driving licence, but we do make accommodations for applicants who don’t drive due to a disability.
No drug or alcohol related offence on driving record within the last five years is permitted.

Additional Information

Regardless of your socio-economic background, university attended, subject studied and degree attained, Enterprise will always look at how you perform against our competencies and will judge you on that alone.
Please let us know about any accommodations you may need to participate in our recruitment process.
Please limit your application to only one job posting based on where you live and/or plan to work. Applying to multiple locations will delay your application being processed.
This job posting is for applications within the following locations: Waterford and Wexford.

Description

Exciting role to be part of a growing dynamic finance team. This role is responsible for the accurate accounting of the company’s revenues and ensuring compliance with the group’s revenue recognition policies & procedures.

Key Responsibilities:
Ensure timely and accurate completion of all monthly and year-end revenue-related close procedures and processes including the preparation of journal entries and reconciliations for all P&L and related balance sheet accounts (e.g. Deferred revenue, revenue accruals etc.)
Review revenue related contracts for compliance with revenue recognition guidelines to determine appropriate accounting treatment.
Ensure compliance with group accounting policies, processes, and procedures.
Work with Q2C to determine appropriate revenue recognition treatment in accordance with group policy in a timely and accurate fashion.
Provide detailed flux, variance analysis and KPI metrics on a monthly basis. Identify unusual trends and communicate findings to management.
Work closely with Sales Operations and Q2C teams on all customer matters.
Work closely with the external audit team regarding all audit requirements and support the completion of all revenue related disclosures in the financial statements.
Help lead the implementation of best practices including the standardisation and improvement of processes, procedures, controls and systems to scale our business and revenue expansion
Participate in ad‐hoc projects as required
Requirements
Third level degree & a recognised accounting qualification with at least 3-5years PQE (preferably with a Big 4 accounting firm).
Previous experience in a GL accountant role with good technical knowledge and experience of working with an ERP System – preferably NetSuite. Proficiency in MS Office especially excel and word.
Proven ability of working in a dynamic team, good interpersonal skills, strong analytical skills, strong communicator and experience of working with and reporting to senior leadership
Energetic, driven and solutions focused. An ability to work on own initiative while working to tight deadlines with a high attention to detail
Experience of working in the Software or Technology industry (Preferably SaaS)
Experience of working on Growth Companies with annual Revenues of >$100m trading in multiple jurisdictions in multiple currencies with multiple legal entities
Hands on experience of designing and implementing policies, procedures and systems
About Teamwork

Teamwork provides an intuitive SaaS platform for Client Services companies to become efficient, organized, profitable and happy! Our platform has revolutionized how companies manage their daily workflows for improved automation, productivity, and profitability. It acts as the ‘one-stop-shop’ practice management solution enabling our customers to track, manage, and invoice their projects. Our relentless customer-focus has been rewarded with thousands of amazing customers all across the globe and millions of users who sign in every day. We pride ourselves on creating market leading software, working with outstanding people, and going above and beyond for our customers. Trusted by more than 20,000 teams across 170 countries, Teamwork is in acceleration mode as we set our sights to become the undisputed Project Management platform for Client Services companies everywhere.

We believe in hiring great people and look to ensure everyone has the best possible experience of work, everyday. We strive to be open and transparent, humble and customer focused. And we thrive on curiosity, getting results and working together relentlessly to deliver excellence. We are a company of action, full of triers and doers: we try things, we make mistakes, and we learn from them. Our personality is unmistakable: we work hard, take joy in our wins and each other's successes and important life events. And we care and support each other when life throws lemons. More than anything we embrace a straightforward approach to getting things done. We are fanatical about our customers: and when talent meets passion, success happens.

We are a remote-first team, with the option to work out of our Cork HQ campus, Belfast or Boston hubs - or fully remotely. At Teamwork we believe that work is what you do, not where you sit.

Teamwork is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Description

Exciting role to be part of a growing dynamic finance team. This role is hugely varied and will provide the candidate with excellent exposure across the broader finance team.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for the month end and year end reporting close process for all assigned entities (including consolidation) ensuring timely completion and accuracy in line with FRS102.
Maintaining a close working relationship with other finance functions such as AP, AR, Revenue as well as FP&A and our external partners.
Responsible for statutory and tax compliance for assigned entities. This will involve end to end preparation of statutory financial statements (including consolidated financial statements), corporate income tax returns, indirect tax returns for all applicable jurisdictions and other statutory compliance filing.
Ensuring compliance with group accounting policies, processes, and procedures.
Manage intercompany related transactions (payments, invoicing, cross-charges, reconciliations etc) while ensuring compliance with transfer pricing agreements and latest laws and regulations.
Responsible for the maintenance & adherence of the wider finance team and business to the group chart of accounts across the P&L and balance sheet.
Responsible for the preparation of consolidated monthly management accounts and leadership/board reporting providing detailed analytical review of budget to actuals and prior periods.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to support system and process improvements for the month end closing cycle.
Help lead the implementation of best practices including the standardisation and improvement of processes, procedures, controls and systems to scale our business.
Participate in ad-hoc projects as required.

Third level degree & a recognised accounting qualification with at least 3-5years PQE (preferably with Big 4 accounting firm)

Hands on experience of designing and implementing policies, procedures and systems.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Amazon is a company of builders. A philosophy of ownership carries through everything we do — from the proprietary technologies we create to the new businesses we launch and grow. You’ll find it in every team across our company.

Every day across the world we develop the ideas, the services and the products that make life easier for tens of millions of customers. From providing Earth’s biggest selection of products to developing ground-breaking software and devices that change entire industries, Amazon is a place of invention and progressive thinking.

Amazon is continually evolving and is a place where motivated employees thrive and employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. It’s as simple as this: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.

With every order made and parcel delivered, customer demand at Amazon is growing. And to meet this demand, and keep our world-class service running smoothly, we're growing our Operations team across Europe. Delivering hundreds of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, our Operations teams possess a wide range of skills and experience. These range from business analysis and inventory management, to team leadership, engineering, transportation and retail. Our network of Fulfilment Centres is supported by Operations Managers, Support Managers, Senior Operations Managers and Team Managers. Between them, they take responsibility for the receipt and stowing of inventory, picking, packing and shipping, to ensure that our customers receive what they want, when they want it.

Whatever your background or current area of expertise, if you’re motivated by results and driven enough to achieve them, Amazon is a great place to be. We’re all about flexibility: we expect you to adapt to changes quickly and we encourage you to try new things and take your career down different paths. Because it’s only by coming up with new ideas and challenging the status quo that we can continue to be the most customer-centric company on Earth.

We can offer you the chance to work with and for great people in a company where you can really make a difference. We also offer competitive compensation packages. If you would like to work for a fast growing global organizations, giving you unlimited future career and development opportunities – then apply for Amazon.

About The Role

Amazon is seeking an exceptional, talented and innovative Recruiting Coordinator to deliver first-class administrative support for our

Operations Recruiters.

If you seek new challenges every day, this is the place for you. The role will require the ability to work on a large number of recruitment processes for varying client groups in our Operations Network.

The person in this role must be able to multitask, work independently, take a hands-on approach, pay high attention to detail and interface effectively with candidates and business leaders at all levels.

You will cover all administrative tasks during the recruitment process from beginning to end. You’ll need outstanding communication, professional interpersonal skills, and the ability to function in an innovative environment. You should also demonstrate the ability to deliver excellent results in a very short timeframe.

This is a unique opportunity to be involved in a highly dynamic environment. The role provides a superb introduction to recruitment and as Amazon is rapidly expanding, we expect to be able to provide opportunities for progression.

Key job responsibilities
  • Supporting the recruitment team in the administration of the complete application management process for open roles throughout Europe
  • Being the first point of contact for all candidates and maintaining contact with all candidates throughout the whole recruitment process
  • Scheduling high numbers of phone and in-house interviews (incorporating panel members from countries worldwide)
  • Communication with candidates (responding to applicant queries, updating them on their application status, sending invitations to interviews, rejecting unsuitable candidates by email)
  • Ad hoc recruitment projects (maintaining statistics on interviews, open positions, time-to-fill and the like via the internal applicant tracking systems)
  • Facilitation of interview panels
  • Continuous innovation of the recruitment process suggesting and implementing ways in which it can be improved

Basic Qualifications
  • A Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in HR, Communication or other related fields
  • Experience using Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Outlook)
Preferred Qualifications
  • A first experience in recruitment, HR or Admin in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly pro-active & customer centric attitude
  • Ability to prioritize & multitask
  • Very well structured, organized, and detail oriented
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal & written)
  • Experience with in house Applicant Tracking Systems
  • Experience in high volume scheduling for multiple sites
  • Experience with Oracle (raising PRs / tracking invoices)
  • Speaking another European language is always a plus
  • Comfortable working on own initiative
Sound interesting? We wait for your application.

For more information on Amazon Operations visit our microsite: http://www.amazon-operations.co.uk

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Position Description:

The Yardi Support Officer is responsible for supporting the end users of the accounting system and other business solutions and will work directly with business users and software administrators to deliver solutions in a fast-paced environment. Acts as key point of contact for the business applications and interacts heavily with senior-level business associates and works directly the Global Real Estate Platform Leader on technology vision and Roadmap planning. The Support Officer will act as a solutions specialist with no direct reports. The Support Officer has strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and is versatile at juggling multiple tasks and projects concurrently. The Support Officer is a self-starter, quick learner, capable of grasping new concepts quickly and will consistently deliver results in a client-focused culture.

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Subject matter expert for technology solutions used by the Real Estate Operations teams.
  • Consistent involvement in implementing solutions across Alter Domus’s real estate product lines including but not limited to the following examples:
  • Advanced Yardi functionality
  • Yardi training materials
  • Best practice/consistent processing methods
  • Work with Real Estate team leads to ensure best practices are utilized across all of Real Estate service offerings.
  • Work with Global RE Platform Leader to review, suggest, and implement process improvements to ensure compliance adherence across Real Estate accounting/operations group.
  • Knowledge of current industry standards (ex: ILPA reporting, return calculation methodology, performance modeling, etc.).
  • Strong understanding of the tools and resources needed to meet deliverables.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of team training materials/plans and ensure team is adequately trained in a set time frame while giving appropriate feedback to trainees and trainer on gaps that need addressed.
  • Supporting role in Yardi Implementations.
  • Support the system setup portion of the implementation process.
  • Compile and follow up on instructions provided to CoE backload team to ensure correct setup/backload.
  • Support the coordination of data validation for funds being migrated.
  • Support the coordination of custom reporting setup.
  • Support the coordination of training for ongoing production staff.

About Yondr


Yondr is a developer, owner operator and service provider of hyperscale data centers. Our mission is to meet growing businesses' data center capacity and technical real estate needs faster, more elegantly and with better performance outcomes than anyone else. As an organisation, we self-fund, design, deliver and operate hyperscale data center facilities globally.

 

The Role


A very exciting opportunity for a Global Debt and Transaction Advisor within the business working closely with the Finance teams at a Global level.

 

 Duties and Responsibilities


  • The ability to identify real estate investment transactions with suitable funding solutions and implement them with appropriate funding partners.
  • Work closely with Asset Management Team to define and implement a variety of sourcing and investment strategies
  • Manage the development budget and financial processes liaising with Asset Management and Finance on forecasting and reporting
  • Take an oversight role in the acquisition due diligence process, including banking, legal, technical and commercial documentation.
  • Create initiatives to take advantage of market opportunities, reduce operational threats and business risks, and maximise core business strengths
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders such as investors, external consultants, legals, brokers, real estate owners, private investors, institutional investors, banks and credit fund providers.
  • Be fully up to date on all aspects of the legal documentation and agreements, as well as communicating this information in an accessible format to relevant stakeholders.
  • Identify new potential fundraising streams and produce strategies to access these funds
  • Optimise the capital structure of the business
  • Assess capital market opportunities and begin to implement processes to streamline future capital structures
  • Assess and implement both asset and portfolio based fundraising strategies at a global level
  • Research into potential targets for direct approaches through existing relationships/networks and new business
  • Manage deal team workstreams from start to finish across the full investment process
  • Please note, duties and responsibilities are subject to change.


 

Person Specification


  • An experienced and highly skilled fundraiser who has worked at a comparable level with minimum 10 years of experience
  • Expert knowledge of commercial real estate investment markets

Application Deadline: November 30, 2021, 23:59 (GMT)


Program Details: DevelopMed offers 12 prestigious Precision Oncology Fellowships to experienced researchers at the early stage of their careers. All fellowships are 3 years and are based in Irish research performing organizations: University College Dublin (UCD), National University of Ireland Galway (NUIG), University College Cork (UCC), and the RCSI University of Medicine and Health Sciences (RCSI). Fellowships also include 3-6 month secondments at any research institution in the academic, industry, clinical, and/or charity sectors. This program is coordinated by Systems Biology Ireland (https://www.ucd.ie/sbi/) in University College Dublin (https://www.ucd.ie/). DevelopMed prioritizes interdisciplinary training and career support to fellows, with the aim of developing the next generation of leaders in Precision Oncology. 


Eligibility Criteria: All applicants must, at the time of the deadline for submission of proposals, be in possession of a doctoral degree or have at least four years of full-time equivalent research experience. Fellowships are open to candidates of any nationality, who at the time of the deadline for submission of proposals, shall not have resided or carried out their main activity (work, studies, etc.) in Ireland for more than 12 months in the 3 years immediately prior to the deadline for submission date. Applicants may also not have resided or carried out their main activity in the Republic of Ireland for more than 3 years in the 5 years immediately prior to the call deadline.

Description

Operations Engineer (Security) 

You may be known as a Security Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer or  Developer Operations Engineer, here at Swrve you will be an Operations Engineer (Security). Swrve's Operations team play a key role in the development and delivery of our SaaS infrastructure, building scalable and resilient backend systems which process billions of events a day and handle apps with tens of millions of daily users.

You will create and manage automation with a focus on security that will allow Swrve to continue to scale beyond our current 10 billion events per day while maintaining (or exceeding) our 99.999% uptime and high customer focus goals.

All projects delivered by Swrve's Operations Engineers use carefully assessed technology, are repeatable, well managed and documented, and are easily understood by the Engineering team.

As an Operations Engineer (Security) you will be comfortable working with Linux hosts in a cloud-only environment, and troubleshooting problems that range across application, host and network infrastructure. You will work with the development team to deploy regular updates and features to the Swrve product while maintaining the quality and performance of our systems. 

You will join a cross-functional security team that will constantly assess, manage and respond to security issues, risks and threats.

What you’ll do

  • Have a focus on security and security-related projects
  • Have ongoing project work across a variety of technologies - as wide or as narrow as your expertise with the opportunity for exposure to learning new technologies
  • Work on an operations engineering team who are passionate about what they do
  • Have a strong dislike for repetitive work. Automation of operations is an important part of the role
  • Provide support and guidance around scaling, high availability, performance and security to our software engineers
  • Be on call 24/7 every 4-5 weeks but work proactively to avoid being woken up
  • Enhance our security monitoring systems by identifying and analysing key metrics
  • Represent Ops on cross-functional Security Team
  • Support SOC2 and ISO27001 certification programs

Advantageous Experience and Skills

  • BSc or higher in Computer Science or related discipline or relevant industry experience
  • Involvement in security certification and audits (SOC2, ISO27001, PCI)
  • Familiarity with security control frameworks (NIST, ISO)
  • Experience managing large scale distributed systems and task automation
  • Experience in a highly available and highly secure environment
  • Ability to work independently and as part of an engineering team, working on multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
  • Strong Linux server administration
  • Containerisation technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Proficiency in a scripting language (Python, Perl, Bash, etc.)
  • Experience working with server virtualisation, IaaS and PaaS Platforms (AWS, Terraform, Cloudformation)
  • Experience administering application servers, web servers, and databases (Jetty, Nginx, MySQL, Postgres, etc.)
  • Version control (Git, SVN etc.)
  • Configuration Management (Chef, Puppet, Ansible etc.)
  • Monitoring/alerting (Nagios, Sensu, Zenoss, Graphite, Grafana etc.)
  • Security Tools and technologies
  • Networking protocols/technologies - HTTP(s)/TCP/DNS/Load Balancing
  • Experience in aggregated log solutions (Logstash, Splunk, LogEntries etc.)
  • Delivery automation (Jenkins, Groovy)
  • Strong work ethic and meticulous in planning
  • Experience with Continuous Deployment/Integration
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What we offer

  • Flexible Vacation Policy
  • Remote first/with access to workspaces across Ireland when needed
  • No meetings Fridays
  • Competitive salary with Share Options
  • Full contributory pension
  • Comprehensive health and dental insurance
  • Volunteer days - you can spend these helping out with a charity
  • Fitness reimbursement policy

 

Swrve is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to the continued development of employment policies, procedures and practices which do not discriminate on grounds such as gender, civil status, family status, ethnicity, age, disability, sexual orientation, religion or membership of the Travelling community.

Candidates must have a valid permit to work in Ireland.

For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. Harnessing our leadership position in office and production print technology, we’ve expanded into software and services to sustainably power today’s workforce. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business solutions and financial services are designed to make every day work better for clients — no matter where that work is being done. Today, Xerox scientists and engineers are continuing our legacy of innovation with disruptive technologies in digital transformation, augmented reality, robotic process automation, additive manufacturing, Industrial Internet of Things and cleantech. Xerox is looking for a fluent Danish speaking Customer Support Agent, where you will be the first point of contact for customers to provide the best and most cost-effective solutions to the end user. There is a strong focus on meeting required SLA and KPI’s and we incentive this with a bonus opportunity. Additionally, this role will work as a liaison with various escalation teams will be a key task within the role.

The roles will suit enthusiastic candidates with customer service experience and a willingness to learn and develop. We will consider candidates who are already based in Dublin or willing to relocate (generous relocation package provided).

Main Responsibilities:

* Act as the primary country contact for customers on all escalations

* Handle telephone/Web calls and deal with them promptly, efficiently and with empathy to ensure a positive experience for our customers

* Invite customers to participate in telephone problem resolution using available tools to diagnose and resolve technical problems

* Facilitate or escalate customer issues and complaints, both internally and externally

* Co-ordinate all consumable calls in order to enable dispatch of Xerox & Multi-vendor consumables to customers

* Co-ordinate all Break/Fix calls in order to enable dispatch of Xerox & Multi-vendor engineers to customers

* Liaise with Various Helpdesks, Xerox and Third-Party Service Providers escalating through these avenues to close

* Flexibility to take on additional tasks as directed by Team Lead

* Validate Customer details and requirements on data entry, deal with appropriately

* Maintain accurate database information

* Obtain call closures details on all dispatched calls

* Works within established procedures with a moderate degree of supervision

* Identifies problems in straightforward situations, and makes sound decisions using standard procedures

Qualifications and Experience:

* A-Level Education / Leaving Certificate or equivalent.

* Fluency in Danish and English in writing and speaking

* Minimum of 6 months working in similar customer support role

* A good and detailed knowledge of IT Fundamentals, Operating Systems, Desktop Applications, Networking, Network protocols, etc.).

* Skill and competency at providing professional technical telephone support.

* A strong aptitude and interest in developing detailed printer hardware knowledge to a Specialist level.

* Able to control interactions with customers using persuasion and influencing skills.

* Able to work under pressure and deal positively with difficult situations.

* Aptitude for understanding and troubleshooting technical problems.

* Able to convey sensitivity and a positive approach to customer needs.

* Can demonstrate effective interactive skills and ability to work as part of a team.

* Strongly self-motivated to learn new skills to fulfil basic position requirements, to become expert in the position over an extended period of time, and to progress within the organization.

* Able to be self-aware and conscientious of meeting all personal, team, & organization metric targets

* Excellent team player with a committed approach to teamwork and customer responsibilities.

* Flexibility with working time patterns which will need to align with in country requirements

* Ability to follow relevant instruction and to use appropriately relevant Xerox knowledge bases

* Able to maintain and project a helpful and courteous attitude in any circumstances.

* Highly resilient under pressure and adaptable to unforeseen work demands.

Project/Process Engineer - County Cork.

In this role you will work in a progressive and production focused Engineering Team, reporting to the Plant Engineering Manager, and you will have direct responsibility for delivery of process excellence in a top class facility.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Project Design & Delivery-

  • Assist and manage the delivery of key projects that have an impact on the site objectives
  • Implement engineering guidelines and quality GMP’s
  • Integrate lean design and performance as key target of the project in the Call for Tenders
  • Follow up on tenders for the different contractors and discuss lay-out, P&ID’s, utilities, etc.

  • Follow up the execution of the equipment works (including acceptance tests, regular visits).

  • Ensure support, training and knowledge transfer to the future plant staff regarding processes and equipment
  • Coordinate all the suppliers involved in the scope
  • Coordinate the qualification and validation tests
  • Organize and realise the start-up of all the process equipment
  • Support the production team during the ramp up of the process equipment

Manage Process Reliability & Capability-

  • Develop the capability of all processes to meet customer specifications
  • Maintain complex in-house processes to ensure stability
  • Deliver new projects and solutions that ensure a constant rate of continuous improvement
  • Keep up to date with ever changing technological environment, equipment changes and product changes
  • Monitor and improve OE - Track and process line reliability and performance. Identify bottlenecks within the process, report and conduct root cause analysis with relevant team members

Facilitate Continuous Improvement-

  • Ideally experience in a GMP manufacturing environment designing and implementing projects / process improvements

  • Proven problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with staff at all levels across multiple functions of the organisation
  • Ideally Lean Six Sigma Methodology experience
  • Experience in standardisation and improvement of processes

Finance Partner

Finance

Specific Purpose contract

Ref: R0012040

Reporting to: CFO

Bord Gáis Energy generates, sells and trades energy for use in the Republic of Ireland. We’ve been in operation since 1976 and today we supply over 750,000 customers with energy in Ireland. In 2014 we became part of Centrica plc. We are a progressive company with a reputation for experience and expertise in the energy market, and are committed to ensuring that all of our activity is aimed at benefiting and serving our customers.

Reporting to the CFO, as Finance Partner you’ll have overall responsibility for supporting the commercial teams with financial planning, business case development, financial modelling and performance management. This role is heavily commercially focused and will require you to support and influence a variety of senior stakeholders right across the organisation.

We’re looking for someone with strong commercial acumen who’s also efficient, innovative and enjoys teamwork. You’ll be comfortable working on multiple projects to tight deadlines and will be a capable leader with well-developed presentation skills.

Your Main Responsibilities
  • Develop a deep understanding of business activities, targets and associated outcomes, working with the relevant senior stakeholders to help deliver our strategy
  • Assist in the review and forecasting of the financial performance of the business on a monthly basis, providing insight to senior stakeholders to support effective decision making.
  • Demonstrate strong general accounting and financial analysis skills with proven ability to leverage this knowledge for driving business improvement.
  • Development of financial business cases as required which support business growth, improved customer service or reduced cost to serve.
  • Work alongside FP&A to ensure financial reporting delivers the analytics and insights required to assist management drive business change.
  • Understand all the applicable key business risks and work with the key stakeholders as required to drive a deeper understanding of the mitigating controls and help incorporate any necessary change agenda
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across the UK&I business to optimise cross functional opportunities
Strategic
  • Be a senior leader within the organisation, contributing to, and leading companywide initiatives
  • Influence & drive strategic decision making with excellent, timely and appropriate insights supported by financial analyses
  • Be an independent voice in commercial conversations, challenging business cases and workstreams to ensure clarity around the cash benefits
  • Support a culture change that is pivoting away from operating profit to a focus on cash – supporting this with changes to processes and reporting where required
Leadership & Teamwork
  • Assist in developing and coaching the Finance team, maintaining strong engagement levels
  • Develop a strong culture of accountability, ownership and continuous improvement within the team
  • Partner effectively with other local and group finance teams, ensuring strong cross functional collaboration; drive cash management initiatives and ensure key business risks are understood
  • Support the transformation agenda across Finance, helping to drive change and leverage expertise of the UK ACE team
About You
  • You’ll be a qualified ACA/ACCA accountant with a minimum of 8 years’ post qualification experience
  • You will have a high level of personal energy, accountability, integrity and commercial acumen
  • Strong stakeholder management skills across all levels of organisation
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts to diverse audiences in multiple formats
  • Energy, commodity retail or commodity wholesale industry experience would be a distinct advantage
  • You will be a lateral thinker, allowing you to gain a good understanding of the key drivers of the business
In return, you’ll receive a competitive salary, generous annual leave allowance, and a host of other benefits, including volunteering days with our charity partner, Focus Ireland. You will enjoy our friendly and collaborative office culture, with excellent work/life balance.

Our Values

care | delivery | collaboration | agility | courage

The closing date for receipt of applications for this vacancy is 6 October 2021. Canvassing will disqualify.

Applications will ONLY be accepted via the ‘Apply’ button.

This role is being handled by the Centrica recruitment team and NO agency contact is required.

Global Client Associate - German Speakers

Key Responsibilities
  • Resolve routine and complex client service issues in a thorough and expeditious manner, utilizing sound judgment with an emphasis on courtesy. Client inquiries typically encompass a broad array of themes including:
    • Operability of TWS, IBKR Mobile, IBKR WebTrader execution platforms including trading modules and analytical tools; Cash deposit and withdrawal activity, position transfers, and account administrative functions
    • Product availability and attributes; Exchange, clearing and depository functions; Order types and routing logic; Order status, trade and delivery settlement, exercise & assignment, expiration processing, and corporate actions
  • Margin calculations; Commission structure, interest and fees
  • Coordinate activities with other local and international Customer Service divisions and interaction with external departments such as Programming, Clearing, Cashiering and Compliance on common issues. Contribute to the development of client service systems, policies and procedures
Qualifications & Experience
  • Fluent in English and German
  • University degree (NFQ level 7) in finance, economics or related field
  • 2-3 years’ experience
  • Experience in financial services position (e.g., brokerage, banking, trading, exchange or clearing house) preferred but not required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to accommodate client inquiries directed via telephone, web ticket or online chat
  • In depth understanding of the following financial instruments: stocks, bonds, options, futures, options on futures, foreign exchange and funds
  • Working knowledge of various exchange operations and regulations, product offerings and specifications, execution platforms and rules, and margin methodologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, medium-size office environment
If you are motivated, have strong initiative, are analytical and methodical; we can offer you a position that will both challenge and reward you. You will be part of an exciting team that is helping to shape one of the world’s strongest brokerage brands. We are looking forward to receiving your online application.

Company Overview

Interactive Brokers ("IBKR"), a subsidiary of publicly-traded Interactive Brokers Group, Inc., based in Greenwich, Connecticut (NASDAQ: IBKR) is a low-cost provider of trade execution and clearing services for active traders, institutional investors, financial advisors and introducing brokers. IBKR’s premier technology provides electronic access to stocks, options, futures, forex, bonds, and funds worldwide from a single IBKR Integrated Investment account. IBKR is one of the largest online brokers by trade volume and is consistently ranked at the top of its field.

Our employees are part of a dynamic, multinational, fast-paced, results-oriented team working to provide our customers with state-of-the-art trading technology, superior execution capabilities, worldwide electronic access, and sophisticated risk management tools.

Our headquarters are in Greenwich, CT, USA. IBKR has offices in the United States, Australia, Canada, China, Estonia, Hong Kong, Hungary, India, Ireland, Japan, Luxembourg, Russia, Singapore, Switzerland and United Kingdom.

IBKR is a member of NYSE, FINRA, and SIPC. Interactive Brokers Group brokerage affiliates are regulated by securities and commodities agencies around the world.

We are recruiting a number of Administration Specialists for our customer. Our customer is based in Swords, Co. Dublin. They will be responsible for conducting our customer's annual Christmas telesales campaign, contacting repeat and new customers to secure orders for the final quarter of the year. They will provide administration support to our customer's permanent sales team and assist with uploading orders, handling queries, and facilitating replacements or any ad-hoc duties as required. This is a temporary contract for 3 months. The rate of pay is €12 per hour (Approx €2000 per month).

Key Responsibilities.

· Conduct Annual Christmas direct mail campaign and contact repeat and new business customers to secure their orders for Quarter 4.

· Telesales campaign

· Temporary Seasonal role until Christmas.

· Monday – Friday 9:00-5:30 with additional overtime required in the run up to Christmas.

· Entry of corporate orders onto the corporate order sales systems.

· Pro-active monitoring of the corporate sales inbox.

· In-Bound telesales call handling.

· Outbound telesales call handling.

· Sales query handing.

· Supporting the field and inside sales team

· Processing gift card replacement and credit note requests.

· Undertake any other duties that may be required.

Skills and Experience

· Minimum 1-2 years in a sales or customer facing role.

· Strong computer literacy skills.

· Good customer service skills.

· Client focused.

· Good written and verbal English.

· Good administrative skills.

· Accuracy and attention to detail.

· Good organizational skills.

· Pro active / Problem solving skills.

· Team player but ability to work independently and of their own initiative.

Essential Skills

· Good IT and administrative skills.

· Customer service experience.

· Previous experience in a corporate work environment.

· Client focused.

· Confident and ability to articulate One4all product suite to potential and existing clients.

· Ability to work within a face paced working environment.

Desirable Skills

· Third level education desired but not essential.

The ideal candidate will be dynamic, proactive and have loads of initiative. The person will have a good working knowledge of website technology and be very comfortable with IT generally. Ideally, we would like this person to have some experience in Sales or Customer Service.

The person will have excellent communication skills as they will be contacting potential customers by phone, ZOOM teams and email. The role be within the inside sales team so it is important for the individual to be able to work as part of a team.

Good organisational skills and an ability to work on own initiative are essential.

Contract length: 3 months

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: €12.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Administration: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer Facing: 1 year (preferred)

Description

EOS Clinic, FULL TIME PERMANENT MANAGER WANTED - ALL IN HOUSE TRAINING PROVIDED.

 

EOS Clinic, are a thriving Aesthetic Clinic in the heart of Castletroy, Limerick- founded in 2011. We offer a range of Medical Skin Treatments from Anti-Wrinkle treatments to Dermal Fillers. 

 

Due to our extremely kind and supportive network in EOS, and the potential for growth within all roles, all of our EOS employees are with the company long term. This speaks volumes for our happy work environment we nuture at EOS.

 

This EOS job opening is both rare and fantastic, and we welcome you to apply to join our fantastic team.

 

EOS Clinic, are dedicated to daily growth and improving our customers experience on a daily basis.

 

All training will be provided, however experience is helpful in the following areas.

 

*Office administration experience

*Acting Team leader

*Excel in customer service and consistent improvement of same

 

*Excellent job prioritising skills 

*IT Skills (moderate)

*Social Media usage (moderate)

 

*Excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to build genuine rapport

*Highly professional 



Duties:

 

*Front of house, welcoming clients to EOS

*Participate in daily reflection meetings with the EOS team on areas we can improve our service

*Responsibility of cash flow 

 

*Develop a strong working relationship with all colleagues and clients

*Daily completion of checklists developed by the HR department for your role (including daily duties/tasks to be completed)

*Maintain excellent communications with Management and all other departments across the business.

 

*Management of Stock ordering 

 

 

If you feel you can bring a significant contribution to the EOS workplace and don't meet the exact below criteria , we still welcome you to apply. 

The hiring process for this role will be finalised in the coming weeks, so please apply at your earliest convenience to avail of the opportunity to join our fantastic team.

 

Please send us your CV, with a Cover Letter attached telling us why you would be a great addition to our growing EOS team.

 

PLEASE EMAIL YOUR APPLICATION TO : eos@eosclinic.ie

 

All suitable candidates will be contacted within 72 hours of applying.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read this advert.

Salary: Starting at €14.50 per hour, negotiable pending experience.

Do what you love. Love what you do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About the Team
Do what you love. Love what you do. At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work. About the Team This is not “just another” customer service role! Workday’s Financial area has a broad range of business-critical products, each packed with its own set of brilliant features to ensure our customers meet their everyday requirements. From Expenses to Business Assets, Procurement to Financial accounting and much more, we are there to support our customers in all their financial needs. However, we do not stop there! Behind every great product is an amazing team and the Workday financial support team is a crucial part of that. We don’t just deliver customer service; we deliver the Workday experience and sure that may sound like a pitch, but it really isn’t. At Workday Customer Satisfaction is fundamental to our culture and you don’t have to, just take our word for it, in fact we invite you to check out our 2021 Global Impact report, specifically the customer success section (p49-57). https://www.workday.com/content/dam/web/en-us/documents/other/workday-2021-global-impact-report.pdf
About the Role

Key to delivering such an experience is this amazing team of experts ready to deal with every detail of our customers’ challenge. Through replication, subject matter expertise and collaboration we are equipped to deal with any query or challenge that arises and will work with the customer until every part of their challenge is addressed. It is crucial that we address every part, while being sensitive to their business impact considering the pivotal role our products execute in their business.

About You

You genuinely care about helping people and ensuring they get the help they are looking for regardless of how complex the challenge might be. Through collaboration with your network and an analytical approach you tackle these challenges, enhancing your knowledge on the go and pursuing the best solution to meet your customer’s needs, regardless if that customer is external or internal. Once you reach the desired outcome you know exactly how to deliver the message guaranteeing absolute clarity and effectiveness. The reason you are able to do all of this is because you have several years of experience in situations that have helped you develop these skills.
Basic Qualifications
  • Advanced Workday User or Implementation Knowledge
  • Experience leading Financial or ERP implementation projects – Financial systems, General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Procurement, or comparable
  • Previous SaaS support experience preferably in financials.
It would be noteworthy if you have one or more of the following:Other Qualifications
  • An extensive Troubleshooting/Problem solving background
  • Critical and Analytical thinking skills
A fit works both ways, so what’s in it for you?
Happy employees lead to happy customers, and that’s why employees are at the center of our values. We believe our employees are at their best when everyone works together and feels like they belong. We want to work with talented, smart, compassionate, kind, and personable people who choose a team-first culture. We offer an employee-first culture to support and encourage our employees and their families. This ranges from a supportive all-inclusive environment to amazing company events and highly competitive benefit packages, we want you to work with us for the right reasons and help strengthen our amazing culture.

Workday is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Further, pursuant to applicable local ordinances, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

You may view the Workday's Pay Transparency Policy, and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notice, by clicking on their corresponding links.

Workday is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans during our application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at accommodations@workday.com.
