Description

Cartoon Saloon is a five time Academy Award (R), Golden Globe (R), BAFTA and Emmy nominated animation studio based in Kilkenny in the South East of Ireland. Employing over 200 crew, we are currently working on a number of projects in production and in development.


We are looking for a Technical Animator on our new Mystery Adventure TV Series.

Responsibilities:

  • To be responsible for the output of files and layers from Animation in Toon Boom Harmony to Compositing in After Effects;
  • To assist with technical checking and fixes in both Toon Boom Harmony and After Effects when required;
  • To assist with the Scene Prepping of Toon Boom Harmony files with the most up to date scene animatic, layouts, characters and props for each scene as and when available from the design and build departments, and camera moves when required;
  • To assist with pre-comp renders in After Effects when required;
  • To ensure quality and style of show is consistently achieved in work and that all notes/retakes are added;
  • To work closely with our Assistant Director, Animation Supervisor and Compositing Supervisor to ensure that all shots contain all assets and information necessary for the relevant departments (Scene Prep, Animation, Compositing);
  • To assist with the quality control of each AE file before they leave the TA department;
  • To address any problems and communicate progress of work to the relevant Production Manager and Production Coordinator.

  • This is an entry level position; a degree in 2D Animation or experience on an animated TV series production would be a plus
  • Basic knowledge of Toon Boom Harmony is required
  • Basic knowledge of After Effects and Photoshop would be a plus
  • Enthusiastic about growing a technical skill set more than creative one
  • Excellent organisation and attention to detail / accuracy
  • Excellent communication, both verbal and written skills, including a high level of English and ability to communicate with a wide range of personalities
  • Positive focussed approach to work
  • Ability to take direction and work on a fast pace series production
  • Ability to manage time successfully in prioritizing tasks
  • Able to work in-house in Kilkenny, Ireland.

Cartoon Saloon is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and Inclusion are core to who we are, and we recognise the great value each one of us brings to the team. If you require an accommodation due to a disability with your application or recruitment process, please contact jobs@cartoonsaloon.ie and we will be happy to accommodate you as best as we can.

Description

Based in: Dublin

Reports to: VP Finance, Global Controller

Compensation: Competitive

Role Type: Full-time, Permanent

Genesis is a global software company with a pioneering vision, technical innovation, and team that is changing IT delivery. Permanently. We’ve just completed our Series B funding round, backed by Accel, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Salesforce Ventures, Citi, Illuminate Financial and Tribeca Early Stage Partners and due to growth, we’re recruiting now for Senior Accountant. Interested? Read on to find out more.


The company is in a period of exceptional growth, and we are recruiting an experienced finance professional to join us who is ready, and excited by the challenge of helping us scale. With key operations in both Europe and the Americas this role will play a pivotal part in helping to establish and scale a best-in-class finance function as the business experiences rapid growth. This is a collaborative, cross-functional role that provides visibility to key metrics across the company, allowing for exposure to senior leadership. In this role you will be responsible for all areas relating to the general ledger, month end close and global compliance as well as implementing processes and systems that will allow the company to continue to scale at a rapid pace.

How you’ll play your part

The top candidates will excel in a rapidly changing and evolving entrepreneurial environment, been through a growth / scale-up journey and have extensive experience in a high growth SaaS business model. This is an exciting and challenging role, which will be a senior stakeholder within the office of the CFO.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Thorough understanding of the company and general ledger structure and ensures accounting set ups align with the business
  • Maintain the close calendar and ensure a well-coordinated, consistent, and timely accounting close
  • Review and prepare month-end account reconciliations and ensure the completeness, accuracy, and appropriateness of supporting documentation to support the accuracy of the consolidated trial balance
  • Lead annual audit including managing PBC lists, driving deliverable requests internally and collaborating cross-functionally, and managing relationship with auditors.
  • Implement and document efficient processes to ensure ease of scalability of department
  • Assist with decision making re systems implementation to assist with rapid scaling
  • Hire and train new team members
  • Collaboration with various other teams and departments on ad hoc projects that contribute to continued growth and scaling of the business

  • Experience in a fast-growing SAAS environment
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or equivalent practical experience.
  • Professional accounting certification (i.e. ACA, ACCA, CIMA)
  • Experience with accounting principles, including IFRS, US GAAP, and related international accounting standards.
  • Positive attitude and desire to collaborate cross-functionally and work in a high growth, rapidly changing environment
  • Experience of business partnering with excellent problem solving and analytical abilities.
  • Ability to handle a varied and diverse workload, while ensuring accuracy, timeliness, a high degree of attention to detail, and a commitment continuous process improvement.
  • Ability to interpret and effectively communicate department performance to relevant stakeholders
  • Experience with NetSuite, or comparable ERP system
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multi geographical team in a dynamic fast-paced environment

  • A competitive remuneration package is available for the successful candidate.
  • 25 days holiday + public holidays.
  • Private Healthcare & Pension Plan
  • Company Bonus Plan.
  • A tailored personal development and training program.
  • Autonomy. Trusted and empowered to deliver and be your best.

Think you can help us change the FinTech industry? Apply now and we’ll be in touch once we’ve reviewed your CV.

We are only accepting applications from candidates directly. Given application volumes, we do not require approaches or CVs from recruitment agencies.

Genesis – Code Less, Do More

About Us

We are technology pioneers with a clear purpose of being the Low-Code Application Platform (LCAP) for financial markets - changing IT delivery across the entire industry. We work faster, harder and smarter than the competition so that we can solve some of the biggest and most complex challenges to deliver innovation and digital transformation.

We value every one of our employees and everyone in the company makes a difference. The diversity of our people makes us who we are, and we work hard to make everyone feel included, no matter your background. Come join and be part of the Genesis family of pioneers and lets Code Less and Do More!

Description

We are an award winning civil and structural consultancy with operations in the Ireland, UK and the Middle East. We currently employ in excess of 180 people and we are always looking to add high calibre talent to our team. We recruit subject matter experts, and those with the potential to attain this accolade. We promote a culture of technical excellence, unwavering commitment to our clients and a workplace environment that supports learning, development and enjoyment.


Are you ready for your first graduate opportunity, working in an organisation that really values your individual contribution? Do you want to combine your core technical skills in a learning orientated organisation? Are you committed to delivering real value for the clients you serve? If you answered “Yes” to each of these questions then we believe you will hugely enjoy working for ByrneLooby and you will be highly rewarded for the contribution you make.

Our projects provide a unique opportunity to combine technical understanding with practical implementation. We work for a predominantly contractor client base and these clients require not only smart ideas, but practical and buildable solutions.

At ByrneLooby, you will experience an environment where your contribution will be highly valued and where you can really make a difference. We offer opportunities to work on a variety of projects including foundations, deep basements, earthworks, site investigations and other assets. As part of the project team you will contribute to overall project delivery and will find this position highly rewarding. You will contribute to creating value for our clients by developing expert technical solutions for complex problems. You will be supported and mentored by industry experts, while being given the space to demonstrate your own knowledge, creativity and abilities.

We believe it is important that all staff have individual and tailored development and progression plans. We will work with you to understand your core interests, objectives and career ambitions and together we will map a route to achieve these goals. We are committed to investing significant resources for the development of our people.


Skills, Knowledge and Experience:

  • Minimum 2.1 Degree or Masters in Civil Engineering, experience in the field of geotechnical works is desirable but not essential for this position
  • Has proven technical knowledge of specific subject areas pertaining to geotechnical works and proven ability to use relevant software
  • Experienced & confident with report writing and presentation skills
  • Can communicate effectively with clients, colleagues and outside agencies and build effective working relationships and always aiming to exceeding client expectations
  • Adheres to all Codes of Practice, Design Standards and Health and Safety Regulations
  • Represent and promote ByrneLooby in a professional manner and develop effective working relationships with clients and potential clients
  • Is committed to Continued Professional Development

Key Accountabilities:

  • Working as member of a project team to deliver quality services to clients
  • Ensures all geotechnical designs are in accordance with set standards and all recommendations are robust, value-based and commissionable
  • Ensures that designs are delivered on time to our clients and that the design fulfils the client’s brief
  • Inspects construction work and ensures that all aspects of design are correctly implemented
  • Monitors processes and results and ensure that they comply with relevant safety, legal, ethical and regulatory requirements
  • Ability to make appropriate judgements and decisions and exercise initiative
  • Assisting at tender stage of projects

This role attracts the following benefits package:

  • Competitive salary
  • Attractive pension benefits
  • Death in service cover

Description

ByrneLooby is a multi-award winning international firm of designers and project managers. Our teams of highly skilled professionals provide industry-leading solutions for complex construction projects across Europe, North Africa and the Middle East. We have expertise across the fields of geotechnical, civil, structural, water, energy and marine engineering and we work collaboratively with our clients, applying this expertise, to achieve optimum outcomes.


Skills and knowledge

· Proven knowledge of local and national environmental legislation and standards

· Management of planning applications & undertaking pre-application consultation with local authorities

· Preparation of EPA Waste/IED/IPC Licensing Applications or Waste Facility Permit Applications

· Experience in the planning, design and permitting of soil and waste recovery facilities.

· Experienced in the co-ordination of environmental monitoring programmes (water, effluent, discharge licence related) and preparation of periodic compliance reports.

· Experience in collation and submission of Annual Environmental Reports

· Confident with report writing and presentation skills

· Can communicate effectively and confidently with clients, colleagues and outside agencies and build effective working relationships and always aiming to exceed client expectations

· Must be organised, deadline-oriented and able to prioritise tasks accordingly

· Represent and promote ByrneLooby in a professional manner and develop effective working relationships with clients and potential clients

· Is committed to Continued Professional Development

Key Accountabilities

· Working as a member of the project team to deliver quality services to clients

· Liaising with clients, subcontractors and key stakeholders to ensure that projects are kept on target

· Creating and developing reports and presentations for submission to regulatory bodies

· Ensures all reports are in accordance with legislation and standards

· Performing fieldwork, sampling, research and interpreting laboratory analysis results

· Ability to prepare tender documentation

· Performing other duties as assigned

· Management of projects in compliance with ByrneLooby’s Integrated Management System (IMS)

· Ensure project staff are aware of, and fully compliant with, the requirements of the IMS

· Management of sub-consultants, team members and project timelines


Experience Criteria

· Bachelors or Master’s degree in Environmental Science/Geology/Engineering or related field

· 4 – 8 years’ experience

Description

ByrneLooby is an international multi-award-winning engineering and environmental consultancy with design and project management capability across a wide range of engineering sectors. With offices in Ireland, the UK and the Middle East, our team of highly skilled professionals provide industry-leading solutions for complex large-scale infrastructure over the full project delivery cycle. We are adept at creating and delivering solutions for technically challenging projects across ten key industry sectors; Water, Marine and Coastal, Transportation, Flooding, Geoscience, Buildings, Conservation, Energy, Waste and Environment.


We are currently recruiting an ambitious Tender Manager who will be responsible for identifying and winning key local and international multi-disciplinary tenders with blue-chip clients across a broad range of engineering sectors. The Tender Manager will be required to identify, prepare and respond to opportunities; drive tendering strategy, identify value propositions, contribute, manage, and lead the production of winning tenders; and drive tendering improvements and best practice across all business regions.

The Tender Manager will lead and contribute towards the tender; and will assist with driving a winning strategy, devising and managing the delivery programme, agreeing on key deliverables, managing inputs from subject matter experts and overseeing the development through to successful submission. The Tender Manager will work collaboratively with the Commercial Manager, technical leads, identified members of the tender team, writers (where appropriate) and graphics team.

They will manage and maintain the tender tracker that records prospective tenders and tracks the progress of submitted tenders to allow us to gain a holistic view of our tender suitability, client relationships, pricing strategies, success rates, and value propositions. This will allow the department to make data-driven decisions towards tendering, in collaboration with Business Unit Directors.

The Tender Manager will act as a key member of the Commercial Department, reporting directly to the Commercial Manager.


Key Accountabilities

  • Responsible for oversight and management of the tendering team including delivering challenging tenders within a specified time and budgetary framework.
  • Develops, maintains and improves internal procedures that contribute towards the development of high-quality tenders efficiently.
  • Takes an overarching view of the tendering activities and team to identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Develops a systematic and effective approach to tendering which encompasses the complete tendering process: sourcing, planning, execution, submission and tracking of all tenders.
  • Ability to make informed Go/No Go decisions by reviewing contractual terms and conditions, price/quality ratio, key pass/fail criteria, identifying suitable partners and delivery teams.
  • Assesses the tender information required, understands the tender questions, identifies the relevant expertise and any potential partners which may be required to fulfil the tender scope, coordinates the response material from all parties involved within set deadlines and responsibilities (including sub-contractors and joint partners), and ensures that the completed submission put forward is the best possible response in terms of completeness, appropriateness and demonstrates the best value-added options to the purchaser.
  • Able to develop the value proposition that may include our USP, project risks/mitigation measures, client insights, previous tender feedback etc to assist in formulating project-specific tender responses.
  • Develops a tender execution strategy that is tracked using a tender execution plan (TEP) that informs the live status of all tenders including, as a minimum, an overview of the tender, roles and responsibilities, deliverable requirements, deadline dates etc. This document shall service as the tender project management tool.
  • Communicates and delegates tasks to internal and external tender contributors, prepares for and conducts meetings for each tender to ensure timely execution.
  • Contributes towards the tender pricing strategy.
  • Reviews tender responses to ensure they satisfy the client requirements, are tailored to the project requirements (non-generic) and highlight the summary points raised.
  • Ability to guide technical teams’ tender responses to meet the clients’ requirements.
  • Oversight of the Tender Tracker that includes all sourced, issued and followed up tenders.
  • Maintains the administration of the tenders, makes appropriate judgements & decisions and exercises initiative.
  • Responsible for resource scheduling of the Tender team based on current tendering commitments and general tendering administrative tasks.
  • Produces high-quality project-specific documents, creative marketing material and client submissions that are tailored to the purchaser's needs.
  • Reviews and formats draft bids to comply with ByrneLooby’s brand guidelines and purchasers’ requirements.
  • Obtains feedback from purchasers when tenders are unsuccessful and sets up lessons learnt workshops to promote continuous improvement.
  • Prepares bid bonds if required.
  • Works closely and maintains an effective working relationship with the other members of the team to ensure effective coordination and co-operation.
  • Ensures OpenAsset is kept up to date and drives the usage among business units.
  • Demonstrates commitment to the job and continuously develops skills.
  • Strives to continuously improve the ByrneLooby tender process.
  • Adheres to company and external Health & Safety procedures.
  • Other duties as required.

Skills & Knowledge

  • 10 years- experience leading large multidisciplinary public and private tenders in the engineering sector.
  • Knowledge of formulating high quality, project-specific tender responses.
  • Engineering or Commercial background
  • Efficient and proactive management style
  • Effective professional communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Detail orientated
  • Proficient in MS Office suites (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)
  • Proactive and positive, with the ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines
  • Customer focus
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Self-starter, able to work independently and in teams
  • Flexible and adaptable
  • Effective in using technology
  • Professional Presentation skills

Description

ByrneLooby is an international engineering consultancy that is expanding its Irish operations to accommodate increasing demand from our solid client base. ByrneLooby is dynamic, we don’t hang around and we don’t like red tape. We are always thinking about better solutions and constantly trying to improve. We love challenges and we are never complacent. We challenge convention and are committed to creativity.


The primary role of the QHSE Coordinator is to provide support to the Quality, Health, Safety and Environment (QHSE) Department in accordance with the ByrneLooby Integrated Management System (IMS).

Main Responsibilities

  • Provide IMS support throughout all Business Units as required
  • Promote understanding and compliance with the ByrneLooby IMS
  • Demonstrate and promote safe leadership
  • Maintain a high level of integrity and confidentiality with regard to Company information
  • Interface with multiple business units and individuals in various capacities in a professional, courteous and respectful manner
  • Ensure adherence to all ByrneLooby IMS policies and procedures
  • Undertake project and systems audits, complete and distribute audit reports and track findings to closure
  • Maintain Quality, Health, Safety and Environmental information
  • Monitor Corrective Action compliance
  • Assist in preparing and maintaining compliance for ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001 and OHSAS 18001 certifications
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of the IMS
  • Assist in supplier and subcontractor approval
  • Maintain, process and format IMS documentation
  • Prepare H&S incident and KPI reporting
  • Prepare Environmental KPI reporting
  • Keep abreast of legislation, regulations and industry standards impacting the Company’s IMS
  • Assist Quality Manager on any other duties as required

Experience Criteria

  • Educated to a degree level or relevant experience
  • Three years’ experience within a Quality, Health, Safety and Environmental department
  • Membership of a professional Health & Safety organisation e.g. IOSH
  • Previous experience within construction or consultancy an advantage in Quality Management, Health & Safety Management, Environmental Management, Document Control Skills & Knowledge
  • Ability to work within strict deadlines
  • Must be able to work without constant supervision
  • Excellent reading, proof-reading, editing, and technical writing skills and verbal communication skills in the English language
  • Strong verbal, listening, and written communication skills
  • Superior organisational skills and ability to oversee a large number of files
  • Must have applied knowledge of QHSE Management Systems
  • Experience in auditing essential
  • Must be a team player and interact well with other cultures
  • Must have proficient computer and software skills on Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Visio)
  • Experience with document control/document management software an advantage
  • Travel to UK offices may be required

Permanent/ Full time

Remarkable Jobs are delighted to be working for a dynamic global organisation who have offices based close to Limerick. Our client offers their services in more than 120 Countries, and the list is growing. Due to a recent acquisition our client is experiencing further growth, and we are looking to engage with experienced Software Development candidates who have strong experience with windows OS, networking, cloud and web based applications alongside working exposure in ASP.NET, MVC/Web API and Microsoft SQL Server.

  • Follow documentation requirements whilst maintaining excellent project history files for all software code written

Software Developer Qualifications and Skills will include:

  • 5+ years' experience in technology development and deployment
  • Experience with windows OS, networking, cloud and web based applications
  • Strong experience in ASP.NET, MVC/Web API and Microsoft SQL Server
  • Willingness to learn and work on own initiative
  • Detail-oriented and process driven

It would be great if you also had these desired skills, but not essential : knowledge of Delphi 6/7, Expertise with Microsoft Azure or other online application platforms, and Project Management experience

The Senior Manufacturing Quality Engineer for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for supporting the quality activities associated with the establishment and maintenance of a manufacturing facility to produce Blood Virus (BV assays). Reporting to the Quality Lead BV Program, this position is part of the Quality group and will be located in in our Co. Clare facility. If you thrive in a multifunctional, role and want to work to build a career in quality in a world-class organization—read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
  • Review and approve New Product Development Process Validation documentation/deliverables ensuring compliance to relevant corporate and regulatory quality and validation procedures/work instructions and standards.
  • Co-ordinate the Non-conformance processes (NCs) for New Product Development areas ensuring compliance to Quality and Regulatory Standards.
  • Participate in cross functional teams providing Quality guidance and support in the determination of appropriate NC root cause analysis and implementation of effective corrective actions. Perform CAPA (corrective and preventive action) activities and document in the Global CAPA system (Smartsolve) if required.
  • Develop strong, positive and beneficial working relationships and effective information flow with other departments and within the Project team and Quality department.
  • Support creation, review and approval of Equipment and Manufacturing documentation including design assessment. Initiate/review/approve document Change Controls (CCFs) and Equipment Change Controls (ECCs) ensuring Good Manufacturing Practices are maintained and comply with company procedures to support Project Deliverables.
  • Ensure Quality project deliverables are achieved within agreed timelines and in compliance with global and local procedures/work instructions.
  • Overseeing the quality assurance and compliance of all BV functions with ISO 13485 and FDA quality requirements and ensuring site readiness for PMA inspection, conduct internal audits to ensure compliance to the QMS.
  • Liaise/partner with the Technical Operations dept to ensure effective transfer of knowledge.
  • Analyze and report meaningful quality metrics to ensure on-going improvement programmes are put in place and continually strive for customer satisfaction.
  • Represent Quality at both internal and external audits.
  • Use of Danaher Business System (DBS) tools and techniques to streamline start up processes and ongoing Quality operations e.g. Standard Work, Transactional Processes, kaizen planning event and lead the implementation of new technologies and innovative solutions into quality activities as appropriate
  • Other duties as prescribed by the Quality Lead – BV and/or R&D Quality Manager
The Essential Requirements Of The Job Include
  • Bachelor’s degree in field with 5+ years exp. OR Master’s degree in field with 3+ years experience.
It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:
  • Desirable to have previous experience in manufacture of Immunoassays, Process/Equipment validations.
  • Strong team member and ability to identify and drive quality improvements Excellent planning and organisational skills Ability to communicate effectively across functions and external partners. Ability to work collaboratively across the business
  • Can work from home for partial weeks, come on site as required

The ideal candidate will possess the following attributes:

  • Previous experience in fresh food/deli department would be beneficial
  • Knowledge in food safety, hygiene and HACCP would be beneficial
  • Customer driven with great communication and interpersonal skills
  • Hard-working and flexible, with the ability to work both as part of a team and on own initiative
  • Professional & polite manner is essential
  • Committed to continually improving department standards with an attention to detail
  • Committed to delivering great customer experiences in a busy environment
  • Enjoys working in a fast paced team environment and with a willingness to embrace new challenges


CUSTOMER CARE

  • To serve, communicate and interact with customers in a friendly and efficient manner providing the highest standard of customer care
  • Assist customers with any queries regarding fresh food department products
  • To deal with customer complaints in a professional and pleasant way and refer to the department manager / store management where appropriate

OPERATIONAL & STORE PRESENTATION

  • To prepare and serve high quality fresh food products in line with department requirements
  • Ensure merchandising and product presentation is of the highest standard at all times, adhering to department planograms as advised
  • Prepare customer orders in a timely, cost-effective and efficient manner
  • To be familiar with and implement fresh food offerings and promotions
  • Ensure fresh food equipment, service and storage areas are maintained to the required level of hygiene and that cleaning is carried out as per the documented programme
  • Practice careful stock handling so as to minimise product waste
  • Adhere to the department portion control policy
  • Assist with stock-taking as directed by your manager

FOOD SAFETY

  • Monitor and record critical food safety information and maintain necessary HACCP documentation
  • Comply with all current food safety regulations & control systems ensuring products are stored, cooked and served in accordance with the BWG Food Safety Manual
  • Comply with allergen information requirements including labelling and display of prepack and loose products in the department
  • Contribute towards the department achieving symbol group awards through the store standards programme
  • Cooperate and provide information as requested by external auditors visiting the premises

GENERAL

  • To work collaboratively with management and all store employees in achieving department & store objectives
  • To take responsibility for your health & safety and that of your colleagues and customers, and to take action to reduce risks and hazards
  • To undertake other additional duties as may be assigned by management
  • To participate in and complete all necessary training for the role as identified by management

Sous Chef - Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Sous Chef in the 4* Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane located in front of the Bord Gais Energy Theatre by the docklands.

We offer free gym membership to our fully equipped Club Vitae, Leisure Centre with pool, free meals on duty, uniforms are provided and other great benefits.

Objective of the Role

Reporting to the Head Chef, the sous chef plays a vital role in supporting the operations management of the kitchen, and in the production of excellent food.

Key Duties and Responsibilities

Support the kitchen operations for the hotel.
Lead by example in excellent food production.
Mentor our skilled and ambitious culinary staff.
Support the Head Chef in their duties, occasionally deputise in their role.
Play an important role in the success of our conferences and events offerings.

Requirements:
Experience as a chef in hotels or similar.
Unrelenting focus on quality.
Qualification in culinary arts, or similar is desired, but not essential.
A personal desire to be developed and to learn in your role.
Ability to support the successful operations of the kitchen.
Ability to build relationships and influence with all levels of the business.

About our culture:
Dalata Hotel Group – Ireland’s largest hotel group has a number of exciting positions on the horizon. As Dalata continues to grow and expand in Ireland and the UK it’s more important than ever to have the right team alongside us, in the near future we will be opening the doors of new hotels creating many jobs and investing millions in the Irish and UK economy.

We lead through our Dalata values of “Our People, Our Fairness, Our Service and Our Individuality”. If you have the right attitude and energy you will have great opportunities to progress within the group. Our company is a place where you can do great things – individually and as a team. You will have the opportunity to develop your talent, be recognised and rewarded for your commitment and pursue a fulfilling career. We also have a number of unique and recognised training programmes to aid your professional and personal development and pride ourselves on creating an objective, supportive and fair working environment for our employees.

Dalata Hotel Group Plc is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Description

Job Title: Communications Executive

Location: FAI Headquarters, Abbotstown, Dublin 15, Ireland

Direct Reporting Line To: Communication Manager

Commencement Date: ASAP

Duration: 3 months

The Position:

The Football Association of Ireland is seeking a Communications Executive on a three month fixed term contractto help drive the promotion of Football in Ireland.

The role is primarily based in the FAI Headquarters on the National Sports Campus and the candidate will work within the Communications Department reporting directly to the Communications Manager.

This role will require flexible working including evenings and weekends in line with the business requirements as and when required. The candidate will also be expected to travel and represent the Association in a professional manner and live the FAI values at all times.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for Grassroots content on FAI platforms and publications
  • Maintain and update Grassroots website content as required on www.fai.ie site
  • Working with the Communications Manager to devise weekly, monthly and yearly plans relating to all football activities as required
  • Updating all FAI digital and social media platforms as required
  • Compile a monthly progress report and organisational calendar on all other tasks assigned
  • Liaise with clubs, Leagues and Associations to work directly with their respective media officers and secretaries as required
  • Work closely with FAI departments as required
  • Assist the Communications team on specific projects and hosting of events
  • Active involvement with FAI events, e.g. AGM, Seminars
  • Assisting with cover for colleagues where necessary
  • Covering communications tasks on a weekend and on a rotating basis
  • Other duties as assigned from time to time by the Communications Manager

THE PERSON:

The successful candidate will have the following:

Qualifications

  • Third Level Degree preferred in Journalism, Media Studies, Communications, Sports Management or equivalent

Experience

  • In-depth knowledge of Grassroots Football in Ireland
  • At least 3 - 5 years’ experience working in media / communications / journalism along with experience in video (TV / audio / digital media)
  • Proven track record in media, digital, social media platforms and/or communications and public relations
  • Proven track record of delivering high-profile, innovative campaigns
  • Previous experience of pitching fresh, creative approaches to projects
  • Experience in project management and delivery of KPIs
  • Be competent with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook (Full Microsoft office suite)/ Apple suite
  • Experience with Photoshop, Final Cut and Audio editing are highly desirable
  • Ability to prioritise, be thorough, detailed orientated and solution focused
  • Highly skilled in editing and working to strict deadlines
  • Strong understanding of social media (awareness, impact, implementation)
  • Experience of delivering desired results for a sponsor or stakeholder
  • Proven involvement in football (communications, administration, coaching, volunteering etc.)

Skills and Attributes

  • Be self-motivated, enthusiastic and comfortable working within a team
  • Possesses excellent organisational, communication skills (oral and written), IT and reporting skills, with an emphasis on attention to detail
  • A comprehensive understanding of the structures of grassroots football in Ireland
  • Knowledge of the key participants and stakeholders within grassroots football
  • Track record of delivering detailed presentations
  • Ability to manage and influence key stakeholders
  • Experience of conducting interviews, writing match reports, and editing sensitive content
  • Willingness to adapt to challenges, to learn new techniques, and embrace opportunities for professional development

Process of application is via the careers page on the FAI website at www.fai.ie/careers

Closing date for receipt of applications is close of business on 8/10/21

Shortlisting process will take place immediately thereafter.

The Football Association of Ireland is an equal opportunities employer

Description

Full time Shop Assistant needed for the MACE Maxol station in Blessington.

  • 35+ hours per week.
  • Must be available throughout the year on a flexible basis.
  • Must be able to start at 6.00 am.
  • Experience preferable but not essential as full training will be given.
  • Must be of legal age to sell cigarettes.

WORK LOCATION: MAXOL STATION IN BLESSINGTON


CUSTOMER CARE

  • To serve customers in a friendly and efficient manner providing an exceptional standard of customer care
  • To communicate with the customers in and effective and welcoming manner
  • Ensure products are served to customers in line with Food Hygiene Requirements
  • Maintain knowledge of current in deli sales and promotions
  • Assist customers with queries regarding deli products

OPERATIONAL & STORE PRESENTATION

  • To accurately compute sales prices, total purchases and receive & process appropriate payment from the customers in line with cash register and/or cash handling policy
  • Assist customers in bagging purchases
  • Maintain knowledge of current in store sales and promotions
  • Answer customer queries with regard to the store and its merchandise
  • To deal with customer complaints in a professional and pleasant way and refer to the Store Manager where appropriate
  • Open and close cash registers performing tasks such as counting money, balancing cash drawers and making deposits in line with cash handling policy
  • Clean shelves & counters and sweep floors internally and externally ensuring store is tidy and free from clutter at all times
  • Clean all areas of the store (including staff facilities) as directed by Assistant Store Manager/Store Manager
  • Maintain a clean and well organised back store area
  • To receive and check stock in line with company guidelines
  • Ensure stock is packed in line with company merchandising guidelines
  • Update shelf edged labels as instructed by the Assistant Store Manager
  • To rotate stock appropriately minimising waste
  • To be vigilant at all times to prevent stock loss and waste
  • To conduct stock takes as instructed by Assistant Store Manager/Store Manager
  • To take care for your health & safety and that of your colleagues and customers and take action to reduce risks and hazards

FOOD SERVICE

  • Check temperatures in the deli area ensuring they are compliant with HACCP regulations
  • Maintain HACCP records in line with store policies
  • Monitor Critical Control Points and ensure food is not open to contamination
  • Comply with relevant controls around all foods including Fresh and Red Meats

GENERAL

  • Any other duties that may be assigned to you by the Assistant Store Manager/Store Manager


  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Numerical abilities
  • The ability to work as part of a team
  • The ability to use initiative
  • Sound judgement with the ability to make decisions
  • Self-motivated
  • Good attention to detail

You would be joining a leading automobile financial services provider and reporting to the Head of IT & Project Management. The successful candidate will take on the IT Governance & Domain Manager role with primary responsibility for IT Security, compliance governance, application platform stability, incident response lifecycle management.

Key Responsibilities:
Actively work to minimise risk of security breaches
Protect the integrity and accessibility of all information
Implement and communicate information security, policies and procedures across the organisation and with external suppliers
Promote best practice in security management
Manage Access & Identity Management (AIM) governance

Lead and direct the IT Service Delivery team and third party infrastructure team to ensure that service level agreements (SLAs) and operational level agreements (OLAs) are defined and delivered in accordance with key performance indicators (KPIs)
Lead on reporting IT KPI’s to the business with a view to maintaining a preventative measures maturity approach
Lead Service Delivery communications and continuously improve IT Services informed by best practices in operations such as IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and 3rd party DevOps
Develop IT service portfolio that meets business needs
Oversee the procurement of local software/ IT equipment

Key role requirements:
3+ years’ experience in a similar role ideally in a financial services organisation
Demonstrate the ability to identify potential future risks, anticipate problems and direct mitigating action
Demonstrate knowledge and experience of implementing IT and information security best practices
Collaboration is highly important; you’ll need to demonstrate your experience of coordinating a team of highly motivated technologists
Proven people management experience
Experience of delivering excellence in service improvement disciplines
Experience of adopting ITILv3 or v4 processes in change, problem and incident management and continual service improvement
Excellent technical background and ability to work with infrastructure and software delivery teams across a diverse set of technologies
Experience with HPSM and M365 application suite
Ability to prioritise activities effectively in order to maintain the optimum level of service to business partners and third parties
Knowledge of how to develop and manage internal and external Service Level Agreements
Experience of process design and improvement

Who are PM Group?

With a network of offices in Europe, Asia and the US and a multi-discipline team of 3,200 people, we deliver complex, capital projects in the life sciences, food and beverages, mission critical/ICT, advanced manufacturing, energy and environmental sectors. We are 100% employee owned so work together to make our company successful.

:

:

What are we offering?

An exciting and meaningful career path, working on innovative, challenging projects and learning from industry experts as part of PM Groupâ€™s world leading multi-discipline team. We offer a competitive salary with opportunities to travel and gain a variety of experiences.

 

It's not all work. At PM Group we work hard, but we make sure to have fun too!

As a Outsourcing Governance and Oversight Associate, you'll drive structure and discipline around Ireland's outsourcing by setting and using standard project framework, establishing partnerships and performing business impact analysis.

Business Overview

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients' needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

Key Responsibilities
  • Take a supporting role in maintaining the overall Outsourcing / Governance roadmap and coordinate the delivery of the different projects and initiatives composing it to ensure consistency cross LoB and Functions
  • Managing and running monthly governance forums and committees across multiple legal entity and lines of business
  • Undertake effective escalation and communications to stakeholders
  • Ensure robust design and continuous update of the Legal Entity governance framework to support changing products as well as to meet regulatory demands and changes, particularly within local branch jurisdictions.
  • Execute and implement Governance and Oversight control priorities and strategy
  • Drive risk mitigation and control remediation programs in relation to Governance and Oversight across the business
  • Build positive relationships through on-time delivery of commitments and ensure effective communication with our stakeholders.
  • Partner with the business and functional colleagues to guide consistent and rigorous JPMorgan controls management framework and practices, design and implementation of control enhancements

 These points have been carefully considered as being essential for the role. Your background must accurately reflect most of these for your application to be considered.

This Project Manager role involves responsibility for project coordination of client projects within Transfer Agency – including scope definition, planning, risk management, stakeholder management and project governance. The role reports into the IFDS Change Management Group in Dublin, Ireland.

Work within the TA PMO structure and ensures that all standard templates are used

Advanced computer skills (MS Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook, Project)

Positive approach and attitude in a busy global multi-stakeholder company to help deliver high quality and timely registrations, local and global team build and support corporate growth and patient treatment options. Line Management of more junior team member (internal and external).

Job Purpose:
The purpose of this role is to represents the Operations function and provide operational and system support to the ongoing expansion requirements of the department. The breadth of this role includes working on sustaining batch support activities and supporting construction, commissioning, verification/qualification, and production start-up in the new expansion area.

The Operations Support Specialist is responsible for providing process, equipment, system support to the operating unit, ensuring that Operations Support Specialist project deliverables and Operations Readiness deliverables are completed as intended to support the manufacture of batches (e.g. water trial, engineering runs, DEMO batches and Process Validation studies).

﻿Responsibility includes all support activities and operational functions necessary to ensure successful completion of project objectives which may include short term shift-based assignment during manufacturing of process validation batches.

This project role focuses on tasks including but not limited to; detailed design/process mapping, closure analysis, risk assessment, SOP & PBR document generation, technician training, standard work capability, 5S, EBR (PMX/AMPS) generation, process understanding in support of orchestrate model development. The role will also include supporting and resolving operational issues during manufacturing.

Responsibilities

Participate in Operational Readiness Activities including Commissioning, Validation and Process Validation
Batch execution planning and trouble shoot technical issues.
Responsible for right first time creation of SOP, paper batch record and other documentation, as well as all records requirements in MES or future electronic systems
Training of colleagues in new processes and equipment which may involve short term shift based assignment during manufacture of batches.
Completion of activities detailed within the Project schedule.
Raise executes and manages change controls.
SME for bio-processing operations providing expertise and insight to ensure that facility design enables safe and efficient operation and rapid product changeover to maximize facility utilization.
Development of innovative, new and lean method of moving from one product to another.
Specification and introduction of new materials and consumables for the Multi Product environment.
Liaise with Tech Services, Engineering, EHS, Quality, Automation and external parties regarding aspects of operating a Multi-Product Facility.
Support and lead key meetings on behalf of Operations.
Participation in Factory Acceptance Testing for key equipment packages (Travel may be required).
Lead/participate in risk assessment activities.
Develop standard work model to align with existing operations.
Update 5S plans to include new products requirements.

Qualifications, Education, Experience:
Diploma / Bachelors or Equivalent.
Familiarity of systems such as MCS, Orchestrate, MES, QTS, SAP, LIMS and PDOCs
2+ years biopharmaceutical manufacturing experience.
In-depth working knowledge of Biopharmaceutical processing.
Knowledge of cleaning validation/verification execution.
Experience downstream production equipment (chromatography, UFDF) and materials (column resins) would be beneficial.
Experience writing technical documents such as SOPs and batch records.
Experience with standard work, 5S and structured problem solving would be beneficial.
Excellent communications skills essential

The candidate

Demonstrate the GC OWNIT values
CI tools/- capability is a key building block for learning & development - Trained and M1 certified.
Proactive engagement with key stakeholders.
Best practices developed and shared with other teams /sites.
Best practices actively sought and copied.
Proactive & effective communication within and different functional groups in the Operating Unit.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Research and Innovation Manager, College of Science, Engineering and Food Science

Specific Purpose Whole-time Post
(anticipated duration of 3 years)

UCC wishes to appoint to the role of Research & Innovation Manager within the College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. The College of Science, Engineering and Food Science, with approximately 500 academic and research staff, is a significant driver of research activity at University College Cork. With an emphasis on excellence in research outputs and impact and research led academic programmes, activity takes place across the nine academic units and the research centres and institutes that the College leads or plays a significant role in, including the Environmental Research Institute, the APC Microbiome Institute, and Tyndall National Institute. The College plays a significant role in the leadership and activity of a number of SFI research centres including MaREI, INSIGHT, AMBER, CONNECT, LERO and SSPC.

The College now wants to take its research activity to the next level by appointing a Research Manager into a senior role within the College management team. This is an exciting and pivotal role which will give the successful candidate an opportunity to shape and drive the research ambition of the College and play a vital role in the achievement of the University’s strategic objectives.

Please note that Garda vetting and/or an international police clearance check may form part of the selection process.

For an information package including full details of the post, selection criteria and application process see https://ore.ucc.ie/. The University, at its discretion, may undertake to make an additional appointment(s) from this competition following the conclusion of the process.

Informal enquiries can be made in confidence to Professor Sarah Culloty, Head of College of Science, Engineering and Food Science, email: collegeheadsefs@ucc.ie For further information on the College, please visit https://www.ucc.ie/en/sefs/

UCC is committed to creating and fully embracing an inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated. As a University we strive to create a workplace that reflects the diversity of our student population where people from a wide variety of backgrounds learn from one another, share ideas, and work collaboratively. UCC is committed to being an employer that recognises the value of diversity amongst its staff. We encourage applicants to consult our policies at https://www.ucc.ie/en/edi/policies/ and initiatives at https://www.ucc.ie/en/edi/implementation/ and we welcome applications from everyone, including those who are underrepresented in the protected characteristics set out in our Equal Opportunities & Diversity Policy.

Appointment may be made on the Admin I (Grade 7) Salary Scale: €72,224 - €95,142 (Scale B) / €69,049 - €90,383(Scale A).

Applications must be submitted online via the University College Cork vacancy portal (https://ore.ucc.ie/). Queries relating to the online application process should be referred to recruitment@ucc.ie, quoting the job-title.

No late applications will be accepted.

Specified Purpose Whole-Time Posts
(Anticipated Duration of 3 years)

UCC wishes to appoint two Instructional Designers to the newly-formed iEd Hub. These newly established posts are directly connected to and funded through Pillar 3 (Innovation and Agility) of the Human Capital Initiative (HCI). The iEd Hub is a HCI-funded project which will be delivered by a consortium led by University College Cork and includes Munster Technological University and multiple enterprise partners in the Life Science/Medtech sector.
The funding awarded under HCI will allow the consortium to develop, over the next 4 years, a novel, agile educational platform to produce next generation graduates for the Health & Life Science industry sector in Ireland. This programme will support the development of both Pharma and Health Tech industries and strengthen their partnership with the University, MTU and the Health Service.
The Instructional Designers will work within a team tasked with the development of a suite of programmes within a defined-time period, and assistance with the delivery of these programmes. The successful candidates will help to provide technical and pedagogical support to the iEd Hub, contributing significantly to its goal of developing a suite of novel programmes in association with industry partners in the life science sector.

Description

At Upland Software, you’ll find smart, creative teams who love working together to deliver value for our customers, and a global culture of growth and possibility. Our operating model has always supported remote work—and as we keep growing and evolving our workplace, that won’t change. We’re passionate. We’re proactive. We take pride in our work, and we love a good challenge. Sound like you?

Opportunity Summary

As a Director of Software Engineering, you’ll be responsible for a significant area of the technology team. You’ll lead engineers across multiple product areas at Rant & Rave, including multiple technology functions. Both tech leads and individual contributors report into you. Your day-to-day will be not generally spent writing code, but you will be responsible for the organization’s overall technical competence, guiding and growing that competence in the whole team as needed via training, hiring, and other tactics.

Upland Rant & Rave is a customer engagement software platform that captures customer and employee feedback to drive positive change through feedback collection, sentiment analysis, and data visualization. We are seeking tech-savvy professionals who are passionate about the software industry, who learn quickly, and who are motivated to succeed. 

Upland Second Street sits within the Customer Experience Management business unit of Upland Software, a public company (UPLD) that helps organizations tackle everyday tasks with heroic enthusiasm. Our team brings deep expertise to a broad range of industries, functional areas, and complex needs—and you could join that team.

Responsibilities

As Director of Software Engineering, you should have a strong technical background and spend some of your time researching new technologies and staying aware of trends in the technology industry. You will be expected to help debug and triage critical systems, and you should come to understand the systems you oversee well enough to perform code reviews and help research problems and their potential solutions. You’ll lead the team through improving our technical infrastructure and implementing large projects, all while improving efficacy of that team through better process, tooling, and people.

Your primary concern is smooth execution of complex deliverables. You’ll focus on continuous improvement of Rant & Rave’s teams, standards, processes, codebase, and infrastructure to create technology that will deliver sustainable value to the business. You are responsible for creating an organization that has a high velocity. You will be a strong leader who sets a good example for cross-functional collaboration between technology and other functions within Rant & Rave and across the broader company.

You are the leader for recruiting, headcount management, planning, career growth, and training for your employees. You will be responsible for balancing business-focused work with technical debt and strategic non-customer-facing development projects. You’ll guide the goal-setting process for individuals and teams within your organization. As needed, you may also manage relevant vendor relationships and participate in the budgeting process.

This role will report to the Vice President of R&D for Customer Experience Management.

Requirements

Technical Skills 

  • Comfortable with debugging and problem-solving
  • Experience writing automated tests alongside features and bug fixes
  • A knack for recognizing and teaching people to author scalable, maintainable code
  • Able to independently envision solutions and write clean code to implement them

Process Skills 

  • Experienced with Agile development methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban
  • Comfortable interviewing, hiring, and onboarding software engineers
  • Able to lead meetings that provide value, but also knows when not to call a meeting
  • Understands common Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) by which software development teams are measured

Interpersonal Skills 

  • Thrives collaborating in a team environment with a diverse range of people
  • Able to have a change of mind, and able to change the minds of others
  • Capable of working without a company office, on a fully remote team 
  • A very strong communicator who can both simplify technical concepts to explain them to nontechnical stakeholders and explain business direction to the technology team in a way that inspires and guides them

Growth Skills 

  • Possesses a good work ethic; a self-starter with a desire to grow
  • Always looking for better ways to get the job done

Bonus Points 

  • Deep understanding of web standards, including accessibility
  • Deep understanding of JavaScript, CSS, and React
  • Deep understanding of Java, AWS, and microservice architecture
  • Experience with Qlik

Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. To learn more, visit www.uplandsoftware.com.

Upland Software is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status.

Description

Career Choice is an innovative Amazon program uniquely designed to upskill our employees who are interested in pursuing a future outside of Amazon. By partnering with educators to deliver training that will lead to high-demand career paths, we are proud to give eligible employees the tools they need to make a move and pursue their career aspirations beyond Amazon.

We are looking to hire a curious, bright, articulate, analytical, and customer-oriented person with a desire to be a part of this unique mission-driven team. You will be charged with raising the bar on the quality of education our associates receive by supporting various relationships and partnerships across multiple teams and organizations.

Key Responsibilities Are

The role of the Career Choice Program Specialist supports the Global Education Programs Team. You are agile and able to manage multiple work streams at once.
  • Resolving escalations from our educational partners and associates using the Career Choice benefit when they have payment or application-related issues and identifying process improvements to reduce future escalations.
  • Managing the Career Choice school catalog, composed of the academic programs offered by our 300+ educational partners
  • Supporting educational partners across all facets of the student life cycle from marketing programs to placing graduates into new jobs outside of Amazon
  • Supporting projects involving cross-functional teams (marketing, operations, tech, and data) as they arise and leading calls with HR staff in various Career Choice countries
  • Creating pivot reports to showcase various data points such as payment or application status, participation, completion, or school catalog entries.
This position can be based in either Cork, Ireland or Lux


Basic Qualifications
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
  • Experience with using, compiling, cleaning, analyzing, and presenting data
  • 2+ years’ experience in a data driven customer service or operations role
Language fluency in English and at least one of the following: Spanish, French, German, Polish, Italian and/or Slovak languages.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Familiarity with Quicksights, Salesforce, and Sharepoint
  • Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good judgment with regard to maintaining confidentiality
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in a multi-cultural environment

Company - Amazon Ireland Sup Svcs Ltd

Job ID: A1711963

Suir Engineering are continuing to expand and are looking to hire Electrical Project Engineers for High Voltage, Energy and Renewables projects across various locations in Ireland.


About Us

Suir Engineering Ltd. has over 35 years of electrical, utilities, renewables, instrumentation, and mechanical expertise, with a directly employed workforce of more than 1100 people and in the region of €200 million revenue annually – it has offices in Dublin, Waterford, Limerick, Cork, Sweden and Denmark.


Suir Engineering Ltd. operates in the following sectors: energy & utilities, renewable energy, data centres, pharmaceutical and food and beverage. Although its primary focus is on the Irish market, Suir Engineering is delivering successful projects in Europe.


Overall Role Objective

 

The Electrical engineer is responsible for the design, development and maintenance of electrical control systems and/or components to required specifications, focusing on economy, safety, reliability, quality and sustainability. The Electrical Engineers will be involved in projects from the concept and detail of the design through to implementation, testing and handover.



Key Responsibilities/Duties


  • Design of HV protection and control systems
  • Development and review of schematic drawings and single line diagrams
  • Developing HV system studies including protection coordination, arc flash, voltage regulation, load flow and fault level reports
  • Pre-commissioning and commissioning of GIS and AIS Substations
  • Direct contact with client as Company representative
  • Complying with specific project safety requirements
  • Detailed design covering all aspects of High & Low voltage equipment
  • Detailed design of secondary control and protection systems
  • Specification, selection and procurement of the range of equipment
  • Preparation and interpretation of technical specifications and enquiry documentation
  • Assist with the preparation of technical and contract documentation for issue.
  • Monitor progress against the program and issue progress reports.
  • Prepare method statements and risk assessments.
  • Carry out document control, recording and transmitting information.
  • Liaising and co-ordinating with clients, other members of the design team and contractors on technical issues.
  • Managing all technical queries on site and assist project team in all site electrical engineering issues to include: the management, the planning, the testing and commissioning and the handover of all project systems.
  • Prepare programs using MS project.
  • Plan, schedule, conduct, and coordinate program of assigned engineering work and projects.
  • Assemble bid, approval, and construction issue drawing packages.
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of the design and change if necessary.
  • Estimate cost, reliability, and safety factors.
  • Use computers extensively to produce and analyse designs.
  • Generate specifications for parts.
  • Control the efficiency of processes.
  • Supervise technicians and other engineers during development phase.
  • Build, test and modify product prototypes.
  • Any other reasonable and relevant duties as requested by your Manager, necessary to meet the ongoing needs of the company.


Qualifications / Skills


  • An Honours degree in electrical engineering.
  • 2+ years high voltage experience within the Irish market
  • Transmission & Distribution experience advantageous
  • Experience within the energy and renewables sector an advantage
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Fluent English with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Good IT skills, particularly in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office Packages.
  • Ability to work to strict deadlines.


Benefits: 

  • Competitive salary
  • Employer Pension Contribution
  • Healthcare Package
  • 21 days annual leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Bike-to-Work Scheme
  • Free Parking.

Description


Quality Coordinator - Hybrid Work (Dublin and Remote)

This well-established and highly regarded software platform is actively recruiting a Quality Coordinator to join their growing team - Hybrid - (Dublin and Remote)



This company in Dublin 15 have a superb working environment and the company invest heavily in developing and training their employees.

In your new role as Quality Coordinator you will be responsible for applying the protocols and practises of software quality assurance throughout the software development lifecycle. You must be meticulous and thorough, well organised and have good documentation skills.

Duties
  • Generate quality control operating procedures and supply the necessary quality control data for submission to regulatory bodies
  • Audit and analyse processes and procedures and perform GAP analysis
  • Identify quality problems and recommend solutions
  • Maintain the Quality Management System in a state of audit readiness
  • Liaise with regulatory bodies including US FDA and HPRA
  • Review and approve validation deliverables to ensure full compliance with Health Authority regulatory requirements and support its regulatory inspections
  • The approval of lifecycle/design controls documentation and deliverables, including the approval to release system implementation and/or changes for production use
  • Provide quality oversight in support of engineering, release and post-market support activities for:

SaMD - Standalone software medical devices

SiMD - Medical devices with embedded software
  • Medical device infrastructure and internal hosting of product software
  • Participate in audits and approve audit non-conformity action plans
  • Demonstrate an understanding of many relevant Quality and Compliance principles and its applications
  • Work with project teams to keep them informed of project status, including any barriers, by assisting and driving status meetings to communicate and address project risks or issues
  • Define internal standards to move the organization toward a more positive risk management posture by utilizing extensive knowledge of current and emerging best practices in risk management
  • Proactively monitor systems and processes to ensure compliance with standard operating procedures, audit compliance and industry best practices



Requirements


  • 2-3 years of experience in a similar Quality role, working with ISO 13485 standards , experience with IEC62304 is desirable
  • An understanding or exposure to GAMP 5 guidelines
  • Experience or understanding of software development cycle
  • Ability to demonstrate compliance with FDA regulations
  • Excellent documentation skills
  • Superior Analytical and problem-solving and communication skills
  • IT Skills
  • Good interpretative and critical thinking skills

This really is a fantastic opportunity to join a large, highly regarded software platform. For immediate consideration, apply with your CV asap.

Keywords: ISO 13485, GAMP, Software Development Lifecycle, Audits, Quality, Quality Control, Quality Assurance

Description

Our teams strive to make Amazon the best place for Sellers, Vendors and Brands (our customers) to reach consumers, driven by the experience and support we provide them in growing their businesses locally and globally. We leverage technology including automation, self-service, associate tools, and machine learning to both prevent Seller, Vendor and Brand contacts based on knowledge obtained during our support interactions, and to handle those contacts with quality and efficiency.

We hire the world’s brightest minds, offering an environment in which they can relentlessly detect, design, and drive solutions to improve the Amazon customer experience. We do this every day by solving complex business and technical problems with ingenuity and simplicity.

The Sr. Support Experience Program Manager is a core member of the Selling Partner Support (SPS) program team and will own key programs to improve quality of support and overall experience for our Selling Partners across North America, Europe and Middle East along with India marketplaces. The ideal candidate will be customer obsessed with high bias for action and deep knowledge in data instrumentation and analytics. There is no shortage of opportunity to relentlessly advocate on behalf of our customers with data to influence and drive results.

The Ops Support Experience team has a 360-degree approach to continuously advocating for, and driving improvements on behalf of our customers; 1) Eliminate – detect, solution, and resolve customer-impacting issues upstream by providing relevant and timely insights into the product development cycle as seen by downstream events, 2) Automate – assess and identify opportunities to provide automated, self-service solutions for our customers when and where needed, and 3) Optimize – when a customer does contact SPS for support, optimize the experience by ensuring SPS associates have the tools, resources, policies and protocol to exceed the customer’s expectations.

The Core Responsibilities Of This Opportunity Include
  • Advocate on behalf of Selling Partners in all engagements with SPS and Business teams.
  • Drive people, process, and technology initiatives to optimize the Selling Partner experience end-to-end.
  • Deliver program initiatives and improvements based on Selling Partner feedback and core SPS performance measurements.
Critical Skills To Be Successful
  • Leader: Experience leading teams, whether directly or indirectly, to collaboratively deliver valuable results.
  • Influencer: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence organizations to gain support and overcome resistance with data and persuasion.
  • Driver: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end programs, working through obstacles across multiple teams and organizations.
  • Problem Solver: Ability to utilize strong analytical and problem-solving skills to work through complex challenges.
  • Communicator: Ability to communicate clear and concise expectations and requirements with business and technology teams. Capacity to present well-reasoned and data-driven proposals in both verbal and written form.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


Basic Qualifications
  • Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
  • 3+ years of experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams
  • 3+ years of experience in program or project management
  • 3+ years of experience delivering cross functional projects
  • Experience in people management
  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • 3+ years of experience leading large complex programs
  • 3+ years large scale solution development and delivery including Lean, Six Sigma problem solving methodology
  • 3+ years of experience working cross-functionally with product management, product development, and operational support teams
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's Degree from an accredited university, preferably in Technology, Statistics or Business
  • Prior Process Improvement/Project Management (PMP) experience with demonstrated success in leading projects in Cross-functional
  • Certified Black Belt/Green Belt from a reputed institute or organization
  • 3+ years of experience working directly or indirectly with operational support management

Vivid Money is an innovative FinTech start-up that offers a unique mobile banking app at your fingertips. Whether it’s payments, transfers, multi-currency accounts for your travels, spendings reports, split bills — with Vivid, managing all your finances and investing your money is easy, flexible, and 100% transparent.

The Payment Operations (PayOps) Manager will be working as part of an Operations team based in Dublin, Ireland in establishing and implementing payment operations processes and procedures to enable our payments business to grow. The focus will be to help our payments business scale by partnering with payment and card scheme providers in Europe along with our peers within the company.

What you’ll do:

  • Support the establishment of a Payment Operation function including setting requirements and developing operating policies and procedures
  • Implement service fee validation and reconciliation processes
  • Monitor the processing of all SEPA, SWIFT and Card Payments
  • Resolve payment issues from beginning to end, working with your team, engineering, and external partners to troubleshoot and resolve issues
  • Provide subject matter expertise for integrations with payment schemes and corresponding banking relationships
  • Serve as the point of contact for our European Payments team
  • Manage and keep up-to-date records for payment reconciliations, chargebacks and disputes
  • Assist with the development of monitoring reports and dashboards that capture deep insights into our business through leading indicators, visualizations, and early warning mechanisms
  • Work across the business to implement automations and continuous improvements in line with changing industry and best practice requirements
  • Lead the Payment Operation function hiring, coaching, mentoring, and developing the team

What you’ll need in order to be successful:

  • At least 5 years of experience within an EU regulated bank, payment institution or FinTech is required
  • At least 3 years of experience working within a Payment Operations team is required
  • Previous experience in establishing and running reconciliation processes
  • Comprehensive experience in the day-to-day payment exception management process
  • Subject Matter expert on payments including experience with integrating into payment schemes such as SEPA, SWIFT and Cards
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Experience in managing teams both onsite and virtual
  • Proactive approach and ability to demonstrate initiative
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Proven ability to work in a team and be a role model
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong analytical skills that allow effective reporting and understanding of problems
  • Strong MS Office and Google Suite skills
  • Familiarity and experience in working on new product applications to the Central Bank of Ireland is a plus
  • Previous experience of working in a startup environment is a plus
  • Proficiency in English both written and spoken. A second European language is considered a plus
  • Based in Ireland

What we offer:

  • Competitive benefits package
  • Opportunity to participate in the creation of a new and innovative company
  • Great working atmosphere in a motivated and dynamic team
  • Individual opportunities for career growth and immediate starting possibilities

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: €75,000.00-€80,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Retention bonus

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
