Yahoo is a global media and tech company that connects people to their passions. We reach nearly 900M people around the world, bringing them closer to what they love—from finance and sports, to shopping, gaming and news—with the trusted products, content and tech that fuel their day. For partners, we provide a full-stack platform for businesses to amplify growth and drive more meaningful connections across advertising, search and media.

We are looking for a Sales Account Manager to join us at Yahoo.

The EMEA Partner Markets are a diverse and dynamic team working across a variety of territories throughout the EMEA region. With a high focus on new business opportunities, we have consistently delivered fantastic results year-on-year and are now looking for a stellar account manager to help drive this business even further.

What you'll be doing:
Lead and develop advertiser accounts through up-selling and cross-selling
Work closely with remote sales teams to ensure smooth onboarding of accounts
Build robust client relationships and develop deep understanding of their business goals in order to make new suggestions across a range of Oath products and features
You will get the opportunity to work closely with ad operations to ensure timely and accurate campaign set-up
Who are you?
You have a deep understanding of the data driven advertising landscape
Excellent verbal and written communication
You have a proven ability to develop and grow new business accounts
Fluent written and spoken English
The ability to perform in a fast-paced, highly changing environment and be driven to meet and exceed targets
Ability to develop strong client relationships
Ability to effectively communicate with and influence the key internal and external partners
Great attention to detail
Demonstrate time management and prioritization skills
Analytically minded
Previous experience of campaign optimization is a plus
Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding the Gemini Native platform
Drive high performance across Gemini though ongoing campaign optimization
Troubleshoot and work with teams to tackle any advertising or associated platform issues reported
Analyze and effectively communicate client results based on campaign performance and reporting data via email as well as voice and video calls
Actively drive revenue growth and find opportunities to develop incremental business
Prepare and be accountable for quarterly growth plans for strategic accounts
Attend face-to-face business reviews with key clients within their local markets

Yahoo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. Yahoo is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please submit a request via the Accommodation Request Form ( www.yahooinc.com/careers/contact-us.html ) or call 408-336-1409. Requests and calls received for non-disability related issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

Currently work for Yahoo? Please apply on our internal career site.

Yahoo is a global media and tech company that connects people to their passions. We reach nearly 900M people around the world, bringing them closer to what they love—from finance and sports, to shopping, gaming and news—with the trusted products, content and tech that fuel their day. For partners, we provide a full-stack platform for businesses to amplify growth and drive more meaningful connections across advertising, search and media.

The Account Management team is a diverse and dynamic team working across a variety of territories throughout the region while leveraging our DSP and Media Ad Platforms. As an Account Manager you will own a set of high value advertiser accounts together with your Sales counterparts. You will be accountable for driving revenue and increasing online market share for Yahoo and to build strong client and agency relationships through excellent service and execution in partnership with the other sales teams.

You will work independently to identify, prioritize and support your set of advertisers through strategic account set up and operating across the full sales cycle - pre-sale, mid- and post-flight. The primary role is to ensure consistent, timely and accurate delivery of all advertising campaigns booked by the business. Assistance in campaign reporting and analysis are also essential to this role to ensure optimum performance is provided for all advertising campaigns.

You will work directly with advertisers at all levels of their organization helping to identify opportunities and promote behaviour that grows investment and ensures long-term client success and satisfaction across our ad platforms.

We look for people who work well under pressure and are exceptionally detail-oriented, collaborative and truly excited about working in a fast-paced environment. Our Account Management team is currently looking for a talented individual who will serve as a liaison between the sales teams, internal and external partners and agencies.

What you'll be doing

Partnering with your Sales counterparts and internal teams, own a set of our premium high-value advertiser accounts from pre-sales, campaign set-up and management to post-campaign analysis and future opportunity development

Serve as primary contact for specified advertising agencies, direct advertisers, and content partners in regard to all operational matters

Lead and develop advertiser accounts through up-selling and cross-selling

Ensure timely and accurate campaign set-up including receipt of advertising creative from advertising and agencies, coordination of campaign scheduling, and partnering with Finance to recognize revenue

Build robust client relationships and develop a deep understanding of their business goals in order to make new suggestions across a range of Yahoo products and features

Manage campaigns; execute creative swaps and revisions, monitor campaign status and ensure campaign delivery, and optimize campaign performance

Meet individual and Team KPI’s to achieve team goals and maintain ‘gold standard’ services across all digital platforms

Work closely with sales teams to exceed client expectations and deliver upon requests in an efficient and timely manner

Report any campaign/creative delivery issues to your Sales partners

Work to the Yahoo’s processes, policies and standards set by the business and organise own workload

Troubleshoot and work with teams to solve any advertising or associated platform issues reported

Ensure all Sales team members are kept updated about the status of their booked campaign

Who are you?

Fluent in English. Fluency in one of the following languages is a plus: German, French, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Danish, Swedish

Description

Molding Specialist

COMPANY SNAPSHOT:

Would you like to be a part of an industry-leading team? We are an award-winning packaging company that has been in business for over 13 0 years. We are viewed as a world leader in the packaging industry. We are looking to add a manufacturing professional to our team. We are an essential business, and through our continued growth, an opportunity has opened up to join one of the most established and highly regarded businesses in the area. Rise With us .

POSITION SUMMARY:

·   To operate, process, set up, and troubleshoot lining, molding, and all auxiliary equipment assigned by rotation schedule or supervisor. To properly perform order, color, and material changes and machine start-ups/shut-downs including quality inspection and documentation.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

1.       Processes and troubleshoots machines to produce quality parts;

2.       Perform order change: enter startup, in-process inspection, and shutdown into IQMS system;

3.       Performs color changes; notifies supervisor of color change status; clean tips if necessary

4.       Verifies raw materials comply with work requirements.

5.       Samples and visually inspects production, record quality problems and generate process correction report.

6.       Informs supervisor of substandard production quality.

7.       Checks material status and calls for more materials if necessary.

8.       Checks that all machine sensors and guards are operating properly.

9.       Informs maintenance and supervisor of machine problems and fills out maintenance work requests.

10.   Cleans machines and work areas of material, caps, oil, etc., clean filters, scheduled sanitation duties

11.   Fills and empties color and virgin hoppers

12.   Segregates scrap material

13.   Relieves other PS during breaks

14.   Backup PS for other shifts; Covers for absences/vacations on other shifts.

15.   Follow all GMP and food safety guidelines

16.   Adheres to all safety rules and procedures and Code of Conduct.

17.   Completes necessary documentation for all assigned machines. Follow manufacturing work Order (BOM)

18.   Any other duties as assigned by Supervision/Management

19.   This is a safety-sensitive position

20.   Fill out repair forms for mechanical repairs

Description

Job Introduction

At Sodexo, we are passionate about food and we place our customers at the heart of everything we do. Our talented chefs use their passion to create beautiful dishes with the finest ingredients, while being sensitive to nutritional needs and environmental impact. It all comes to life when food that tastes amazing and delights our customers!

To provide this excellent service, we have a team of passionate Food Service Assistant behind us, and we currently have a vacancy to join us!

Main Responsibilities

You’ll be responsible for preparing and serving food with care and attention, replenishing stock, and ensuring all work areas are glistening! 

With customer service at the heart of what we do, you’ll always provide excellent customer service. You will serve all customers on our EPOS till, cashing up at the end of service.

To keep our service running like clockwork, you’ll complete all administration when needed, focusing on tasks such as checking food temperatures, food wastage, cleaning and washing up.

You will always ensure that all Health and Safety regulations are followed.

The Ideal Candidate

This is a customer facing role so it’s important to have a positive, friendly attitude. You will work as part of a team and will need to have strong communication skills, being able to also work independently.

Experience handling cash and working in a similar industry (i.e. food service, catering or hospitality) would be great, but generally customer service experience will tick the box!

A general knowledge of health and safety procedures would also be beneficial.  

Source: Sodexo

Job Introduction

Duties and Responsibilities

  1. Have full knowledge of all areas which are to be cleaned in the course of duty
  2. Ensure all areas are cleaned efficiently and in a timely manner to the required standards.
  3. Have full working knowledge of all cleaning equipment, materials and agents and use cleaning equipment as directed by your line manager only after correct COSHH training has been given.  Report any equipment which is faulty, mark as faulty and do not use.
  4. Report any safety hazards or inappropriate compromises to the line Manager e.g.  locked fire door, lifting flooring, lights not working etc
  5. Ensure that the specified safety signage is used at all times, e.g. wet floor signs and “warn/advise” customers where possible.
  6. To be aware of material expenditure and cost and avoid unnecessary waste
  7. Ensure that cleaning stores are kept clean and tidy and equipment stored safely at all times.
  8. Comply with all security regulations for cleaning materials, equipment and buildings as laid down by client and Sodexo and report immediately any shortages or discrepancies found.
  9. Ensure a high standard of personal hygiene and appearance and general cleanliness to comply with statutory and Company regulations, wearing company uniform as specified.
  10. Inform your line manager of low levels of cleaning material stocks where appropriate so that new supplies can be re-ordered
  11. To deal with any complaints by immediately reporting them to the Line Manager.
  12. Attend training courses and meetings as is necessary to maintain standards in the contract and assist in carrying out the job role efficiently (Some of which may occur outside normal working hours)
  13. Provide cover in other areas in times of sickness and holiday.
  14. Ensure all cleaning equipment is kept clean & maintained in safe working order.  Report any defects to the supervisor/Manager immediately.
  15. Comply with all Company policies procedures and client site rules and regulations
  16. Comply with all Company & client policies and statutory regulations relating to Health & Safety, safe working practices, hygiene, cleanliness, fire and COSHH. This will include your awareness of any specific hazards in your work place
  17. Carry out all other reasonable tasks as directed by management

To attend meetings and training courses as may be necessary from time to time.  Some of which may occur outside normal working hours.

18. To carry out reasonable periods of overtime as may be required from time to time.

19.       To train new colleagues by showing them tasks and how thing are done.

20.       To report and take action on customer and client complaints or compliments and any incidents of accident, fire, theft, loss, damage and unfit food or other irregularities

21.       Maintaining a supply of clean crockery and cutlery for use by clients in their staff restaurant

22.       Supporting the team in the kitchen by replenishing equipment in a timely manner

23.       Maintaining the cleanliness and health & safety on site by completing cleaning tasks as trained to, filling in cleaning schedules as directed and using chemicals as trained to use

24.       Setting up, delivering and breaking down hospitality requests

25.       Providing support to the kitchen team by back filling colleagues while on leave or absent from work when trained in their role

26.       Assisting in the receipt and decanting of deliveries as requested including inspecting deliveries for damage and taking the relevant temperature of high risk goods

27.       HACCP documentation completion e.g. Fridge Temperature Checks, Core Cooking Temperatures when trained to do so and raising issues when they arise

Main Responsibilities
  • Cleaning duties to include kitchen, equipment, floors, stores etc
  • Pot washing duties
  • Dish wash duties
  • Accepting deliveries
  • Storing deliveries
  • Temperature record taking and recording
  • Adhering to HACCP regulations
The Ideal Candidate
  • Experience in food handling, cleaning and customer service skills.
  • Knowledge of Food Hygiene or HACCP. Further training, will be provided by the organisation.
  • Customer Service – a strong commitment and track record in providing a high level of customer service in a busy environment.
  • Communication – good communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to relate positively to customers at all level.
  • Flexibility – the ability to work on own initiative and as part of a team in a rapidly changing environment.
Source: Sodexo

Application Support Specialist

Our client is an innovate Irish owned software company with state-of-the-art offices based in Dundalk. This company continue to grow and expand their dynamic team and are currently looking for an Application Support Specialist to join them on a permanent basis.


They require 2+ year's relevant application support experience, ideally with a software company.

You will be supporting a range of Accounting, Stock, CRM, E-Commerce, Business Intelligence and Supply Chain Management modules within their ERP Software solution and you will be a key member of this evolving team.


Job Reference: BBBH 20187

What will an Application Support Specialist do?

  • You will be responsible for assisting their growing customer base with technical and operational queries across a wide range of business processes.
  • Respond to system operation inquiries, documenting the issues, and working towards the optimal solution.
  • The right person for this role will have a deep interest in technology and will utilise creative thinking and problem-solving skills to address issues.


What does the Ideal Candidate look like?

  • 2+ year's relevant application support experience, ideally with a software company.
  • A day to day working knowledge of Accounting, ERP or Business Management Software systems.
  • A degree or third level qualification in Computer Science, Accounting or Business.


Experience in any of the following is desirable but not essential as training will be provided:

  • Strong knowledge of Databases, like SQL Server, MySQL including SQL scripting & SQL Admin Studio.
  • Working knowledge of FTP/SFTP, SSL Certs, REST API, SOAP, SoapUI, Postman, Excel, and CSV files.
  • Experience in relevant business software - 3rd Party Integrations, EDI, Logistics, Warehouse Management, CRM, E-Commerce, Business Intelligence.
  • Day to day working with Accounting, ERP or Business Management Software.
  • A good knowledge of financial and management reporting or financial acumen.


Benefits?

  • Pension Plan.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Flexible working hour's & flexible annual leave.
  • Wellness Program.
  • Exercise Reimbursement.
  • State of the Art Workspace & Office.

Our client is an innovate Irish owned software company with state-of-the-art offices based in Dundalk. This company continue to grow and expand their dynamic team and are currently looking for a Senior .Net Developer to join them on a permanent basis.


They require 5+ years' experience in .Net Stack Development (Windows Forms/WebAPI/MVC). This person can be based anywhere in Ireland as it is a remote based role.


The role's primary focus is on the design and construction of their market-leading suite of Web, Desktop and Mobile applications targeting the ERP marketplace.


Job Reference: BBBH 20058

What will a Senior .Net Developer do?

  • Work within their evolving Agile process and across our .Net, .Net Core, Desktop and Web. Applications. A blend of design, architecture, planned work, bug fixing, investigation and research.
  • Collaborate with the client-side development teams in building their state-of-the-art web client technology.
  • Support other company departments - Project Management Office, Customer Success Office, Sales and Marketing.

  • 5+ years' experience in .Net Stack Development (Windows Forms/WebAPI/MVC).
  • SQL Server Knowledge.
  • Proficiency in designing and building well-constructed solutions for scale.

Benefits?

Training Academy Administrator

Join the Access Family and see how we make software ideas become a reality!

Our core value of ‘Love work, Love life’ has been central to our success and so we’re looking for people to join us who share our passion for making things better every day, to help us achieve 2 million users of the Access Workspace platform.
Are you ready for the challenge?
What are we all about?

At Access we love software and how technology never stays the same. It's this obsession that drives us to work closely across sectors to understand the business needs of our customers - from professional services to manufacturing to not for profits and more.

We're passionate about helping our customers stay one step ahead of the challenges facing their industry and business. That's why over 1 million users and over 35,000 organisations rely on Access software to help their organisation thrive.

About you:
The successful candidate will have strong knowledge in Quality Assurance and test automation. Domain experience of payroll, pension and/or expenses systems, and People XD/CoreHR Systems in particular, is an advantage. You will be primarily responsible for working with the product development teams to maintain the quality of the application, and ensure the system operates as expected. You will have a keen interest in test automation, continuous deployment practices, and seek to increasingly automate the QA process, as well as completing the necessary manual procedures. You will have experience of working in an agile and high-performing team, with strong communication, time management and organisational skills.

You should be keen to learn and proactively develop your skillset, and enthusiastically engage and collaborate with your team-mates. You are eager to take ownership of individual tasks and follow through to completion, and can easily adapt to changing priorities and overcome challenges.

Day-to-day, you will:
Write, develop, and maintain automated Test Scripts, primarily within the UT/PLSQL Automation Framework to ensure maximum coverage, quality, and scalability across products.
Design and execute manual testing to a high standard, taking an approach suitable to an agile, fast-paced environment, according to the product teams’ definitions of done.
Engage with your product and development team mates to understand current workloads and priorities, and ensure tasks are completed successfully and on time.
When required, participate in other development projects, to expand your experience and skillset.
Contribute to developing test processes and improvements.
As a well-rounded QA Engineer, your Skills and Experiences likely include:
Degree with relevance e.g. Computer Science.
1 years + experience in a QA/automation development role.
Knowledge of payroll, pension or expense systems, preferably People XD / CoreHR applications.
Oracle PL/SQL and UT/PLSQL knowledge an advantage.
Excellent attention to detail.
Self-starter who will get tasks going, and Drive to completion.
Excellent communication and organizational skills, including ability to multi-task across different projects, releases and work well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
What does Access offer you?
We are a growing software company and we deliver on what we say we do! We take the development of our people very seriously! We will work with you to carve out your success plan and an opportunity to accelerate your career and make a real difference.
In addition to our standard benefits of 25 days holiday, a match contributory pension and healthcare you will get:
A Competitive Salary
Giving Back/Charity days
Quarterly Socials
6 weeks Sabbaticals (after 6 years of service)
The Access Group Big Break: our all-expenses paid holiday to Spain

Led by the Festival staff, the Festival Coordinator will be the key individual setting up the venues and coordinating with the entire Her Screen team to ensure the smooth running of the event.

 Ensures the employees and volunteers of the organisation efficiently store all festival materials and documents in SharePoint or Google Drive.

  •  Assisting with proofing film texts, advertisements, and news stories 
  • Liaising with Manager Corporate and Community Partnerships to ensure the festival’s partners have been looked after.
  •  Preparing for the HERIFF festival launch includes creating a run sheet, collating video material, helping with the guest list, assisting with media and sponsorship requirements, and packing down the venue. 
  • Preparing for screenings in the South-West of Ireland or regional areas (Killarney, Tralee, Dingle) includes shipping materials, run sheets, liaising with the venues, and a small amount of marketing.
  •  Processing tickets for Online and walk-in customers. 
  • Processing comp tickets for guests and sponsors.
  •  Proofing the festival run sheets for accuracy.
  •  Liaising with the venue, front of house, and volunteers to ensure the venues are prepared for the festival. Includes set-up of necessary documents, creating an inventory of banners and sponsor material, and setting up an on-site office.  


 CORE COMPETENCIES 

Team Focus: Is committed and skilled at working with and assisting others in achieving positive outcomes

 Flexible: Demonstrates a willingness to take on new challenges, roles and responsibilities and adapt positively to changing working conditions and priorities 

Self Starting: Highly motivated to achieve, shows initiative and acts proactively to deliver excellent results without directive supervision. 

Interpersonal: Skilled at building rapport, understanding others needs and developing effective working relationships  


BENEFITS

Work from home

● Résumé and portfolio building experience in Event Management(film festival industry)

● Great opportunity to learn about what happens behind the scenes of a year-round cinema and an international film festival

● Class credit (if applicable)

Description

Who we are:

We are a company founded on the principle of People & Planet above Profit and we are proud of our B Corp Status. JoJo is a team effort and so many of our employees have put their heart and soul into their jobs, making sure we offer the most gorgeous collections and deliver the best service.

We may have grown into the UKâ€™s leading mother and baby retailer, but we will never compromise on the quality of our products â€“ itâ€™s part of our DNA! Our customers trust us to offer excellent quality at reasonable prices. All our team members strive to be the best they can be and we love how we support each other.  

We put our growth down to our passion for people and our commitment to running an ethical and sustainable company. Couple this with our fantastic designs, innovative products, attention to detail and the never-ending pursuit of high standards means we have built a company that makes all of us proud.

Our Values:

 

The most useful thing a person can do in this world is to create ethical employment in a business which is a force for good, respecting our people and our planet.

 

We embrace and openly welcome people from different cultures, perspectives and experiences to create a diverse and enriched company. We work hard to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people, regardless of background to make sure we grow our company sustainably and with different cultural influences. We are guided by our values and B Corp status in everything we do, and we recognise that being a diverse and inclusive employer helps us make a difference to all our employees and customers.

What we expect from you:

Each JoJo store is unique whether thatâ€™s trading over two floors, having a quirky layout or being situated in an interesting place. They have a life of their own.   Our Unique Selling Point (USP) in this ever-changing retail world is the relationship we build with our customers, many of them loyal to our brand and to their local store team. This is where you come in - youâ€™ll be the face of JoJo providing a fantastic level of customer care and service that we are renowned for and one we pride ourselves in upholding always. Youâ€™ll be guiding, informing, and assisting our customers in the correct purchase of our huge range of clothing and products. This could be an expectant parent, an excited grandparent or other friends or family.

 

Our B Corp principles are so important, and every member of our teams will always uphold them. As we move into a digital retail world, offering an Omni-Channel customer service is expected as this builds on customer loyalty. As such most of our stores offer Ship from Store or Click and Collect options, you will take ownership of preparing and shipping all such orders daily.

A day in the life:

  • Assisting our customers in many different and sometimes diverse situations, from bra measuring or discussing our maternity wear, to demonstrating a baby carrier to an intrigued parent.
  • Preparing Omni-Channel orders.
  • Liaising with customers in store or via the phone on Omni-Channel orders.
  • Using our digital or virtual learning platforms to continuously develop your knowledge and retail skills.
  • Embracing new product knowledge or learning to increase sales opportunities.
  • Actively listening to our customersâ€™ needs and working out what the best solution is for them.
  • Taking pride in keeping your store looking immaculate.  
What we look for in you:
  • Previous retail, customer service and sales experience
  • Competent IT skills and excellent systems ability, with an aptitude to pick up new systems quickly.
  • The ability to learn and retain a high level of product information and be able to communicate this effectively to our customers.  
  • Youâ€™ll need a self-develop mentality and a curiosity to learn new product independently.
  • We donâ€™t like hard sales techniques, but youâ€™ll need to demonstrate a level of sales ability, which includes active listening skills, empathy, and an understanding of our customersâ€™ needs.
  • Youâ€™ll be working within a small team; therefore, the ability to work in a harmonious and respectful manner is important.
  • Working in a retail environment requires a level of flexibility, most of our stores are open 7 days a week.
  • We like to keep our stores looking tip top, so youâ€™ll have a keen eye for detail and play a key role in maintaining our standard

Just to give you a taste of our culture, weâ€™ll be looking for you to:

  • Be a brand ambassador, ensuring that our values and ethos are never compromised
  • Be honest and respectful
  • Work collaboratively
  • Talk openly and actively listen
  • Take ownership of all aspects of the role

 

The benefits.:
  • Competitive hourly rate
  • We believe R&R is important so for each year youâ€™re with us, you have an extra dayâ€™s holiday!
  • Why work on your Birthday? Have it off!
  • Letâ€™s celebrate doing well â€“ encouragement schemes
  • Helping plan for the future - contributory pension scheme
  • Get on the move - cycle to work scheme
  • Support for planning your finances - JoJo saving scheme
  • Being mindful â€“ Health and Wellbeing Hub
  • Having a great time - fabulous social events
  • Supporting our communities â€“ volunteer days
  • We love our products! 40% discount off JoJo branded lines
  • "It's up to you" learning environment - ongoing training and educational development initiatives and opportunities

Who We Are Looking For

This Project Manager role involves responsibility for project coordination of client projects within Transfer Agency – including scope definition, planning, risk management, stakeholder management and project governance. The role reports into the IFDS Change Management Group in Dublin, Ireland.

Experience in managing projects and interaction with all groups involved in the project lifecycle, both internal and external is key, with a client facing element being preferred but not mandatory.

As a Project Manager - Change Management

What you will be responsible for:
  • Manage operational and technical system change projects within the Transfer Agency department
  • Develop the Business Case in conjunction with the Project sponsor.
  • Develop project scope based on the objectives together with input from the appropriate stakeholders, both internally and externally
  • Engage extensively with clients to establish exact requirements, agree solutions and define timeframes for project deliverables
  • Coordinate of stakeholders across multiple locations and time zones
  • Focus on governance, documentation and sign of same throughout the life cycle of the project
  • Proactively identify and manage project risks and issues and track same
  • Perform a cost/benefit analysis under the direction of the Project Owner
  • Monitor project milestones
  • Report project status and issues to business unit on a regular basis.
  • Present project updates and key decisions at program level steering meetings
  • Coordinate User Acceptance Testing and implementation planning
  • Assist with the development of the Training Program for the project
  • Interface with other business units involved in the project and coordinate activities across all organizations and stakeholders involved in the project
  • Coordinate internal Legal & Risk requests
  • Work within the TA PMO structure and ensures that all standard templates are used
  • Management of multiple projects simultaneously and management of pipelines of small related projects will also be a feature of the role
Education & Preferred Qualifications
  • 4-5 years of management/supervisory/project management experience in financial services
  • End to end experience of project lifecycle
  • Experience with client facing engagement and management of same
  • Knowledge of Transfer Agency function an advantage
  • University degree in accounting, banking, finance, business administration, or equivalent professional qualification
  • Advanced computer skills (MS Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook, Project)
About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Job ID: R-678949

Who We Are Looking For

State Street seeks to recruit a Cyber Security manager in the Cyber Fusion organization. This position requires leadership experience in information systems, security response, vulnerability management and building cross-functional initiatives.

This leader will be responsible for enhancing the rapid response program for zero-day and other emerging vulnerabilities. This candidate should be a proven global security and operations leader with the ability to effectively drive results, manage and build relationships with senior leaders and team members in a geographically dispersed team environment. This position will report up in the Global Cyber Security Organization and will report directly to the MD of State Street’s Vulnerability Management organization.

What You Will Be Responsible For

As Cyber Security manager you will
  • Lead the rapid response team to improve and implement the control roadmap
  • Hire industry experts to mature an effective program
  • Analyze vulnerability assessments and remediation plans
  • Enhance the enterprise posture against zero-day and emerging vulnerabilities
  • Drive the end-to-end vulnerability lifecycle from discover to closure
  • Centralize remediation status communications
  • Act as a change agent throughout our organization and the enterprise
  • Recommend, build support and implement process and technical controls to protect the enterprise
  • Maintain situational awareness, collaborate, influence and lead initiatives across the enterprise
  • Work closely with business units to understand people, process, and technology in order to build effective vulnerability management strategies
  • Actively train team members on Fusion Center processes, governance and priorities
  • Synchronize with Cyber Defense Center to monitor and research information sources for re-emerging and zero-day threats to assess risk to the enterprise
  • Deliver integrated capabilities across various sub-disiplines within the fusion organization, Global Cyber Security and Global Technology Services
  • Work with stakeholders to set the remediation battle rhythm for cybersecurity protection efforts
What We Value

These skills will help you succeed in this role
  • Ability to consider short term and long term implications of a recommended solution
  • Virtual leadership expertise with ability to effectively drive results, provide feedback/direction, and manage and build relationships with leaders and team members in a geographically dispersed environment
  • Ability to make difficult decisions in unique situations, present recommendations under pressure to senior leadership and to cross-functional teams that my have conflicting positions
  • Background in security threat analysis and ability to determine risk level of identified threats and remediation urgency specific to the environment
  • Managerial expertise in information security, a security related field or other complex information risk management function
  • Knowledge and understanding of structuring complex data across varied data sources
  • Expertise in leading teams to identify gaps, design solutions, implement and maintain new cybersecurity services and tools
  • Demonstrated ability to identify core issues and work with leaders and team members to resolution
  • Strong organizational, task switching, and prioritizing skills
  • Ability to work independently and solve challenging problems while collaboration with stakeholders
  • Knowledge and interest in current vulnerability related trends
  • Attention to detail
  • Driving to results
  • Strategic thinking
  • Collaboration and influencing
  • Senior Executive communication
  • Working professionally with confidential information
  • Advanced presentation skills, both orally and written
  • Ability to work well with others and under pressure
  • Expertise in building collaborative organizations with cross-business unit and cross-functional teams in a geographically distributed enterprise
  • Demonstrated professionalism in approach to communicating ideas and solutions in simple language to team members, senior leaders and business partners
Education & Preferred Qualifications
  • 8+ years of related experience, specifically in IT Engineering, Security Operations, Cloud Security and enterprise vulnerability remediation
  • 3+ years management experience leading cyber security teams
  • 2+ years of experience within a vulnerability management role
  • 2+ years leading rapid remediation activities
  • Experience with Strategic Planning and enterprise-wide technical solution implementations
  • In-depth experience assessing security vulnerabilities specific to a given environment
  • Understanding of how to triage vulnerabilities and tool findings
  • Security certification a plus
  • Software development and/or scripting experience a plus: Python, Perl, MySQL, etc.
Why this role is important to us

Our technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.

We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.

Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. Job ID: R-679345-1

Description

Overview:

RCSI HOSPITAL GROUP

 

RCSI Hospitals Group was established in 2015 and comprises the following hospitals:

 

  • Beaumont Hospital, Dublin
  • Connolly Hospital, Dublin
  • Cavan and Monaghan Hospital
  • Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital, Drogheda, Co. Louth
  • Louth County Hospital
  • Rotunda Hospital, Dublin

 

The Academic Partner for the Group is the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland (RCSI).

 

The RCSI Hospitals Group serves populations in five counties â€“ North Dublin, Meath, Louth, Cavan and Monaghan.   A wide range of emergency, diagnostic, treatment and rehabilitation services are provided across these, supported by a workforce of approximately 8,353 WTE staff.   Our aim is to provide high quality and safe care underpinned by the development of a single effective corporate and clinical governance structure.

 

The RCSI Hospitals Group is committed to improving clinical performance in scheduled and unscheduled care and the development of clinical networks and delivery systems to improve access to excellent care, in accordance with the HIQA National Standards for Safer Better Healthcare and in alignment with the National Committee on Clinical Excellence, the National Clinical Programmes and the National Cancer Control Programme Guidelines.

 

Further information about the RCSI Hospital Group can be found at our website: http://www.rcsihospitals.ie/

 

OUR LADY OF LOURDES HOSPITAL, DROGHEDA

 

Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital is a model 3, 432 bedded Hospital, with 24/7, 365 emergency care and related services.   It is the main acute hospital in the North East region.   The Hospital Services include Critical Care, Orthopaedic Trauma, Surgery, Medicine (wide range of specialties), Acute Stroke Unit, Cardiology, Gynaecology and Obstetrics and Paediatrics.   The Emergency Floor includes: An Emergency Department (Resus, Majors, Minors, RAT), a Clinical Decision Unit, an accredited AMAU and an accredited ASAU, and a Paediatric Emergency Department.

 

The services include scheduled and unscheduled care activity and with inpatient acute services being primarily of unscheduled care origin. The hospital team deliver safe and timely access to our patients and community and perform highly in national unscheduled care and ED Key performance indicators.

 

BEAUMONT HOSPITAL

 

Beaumont Hospital, incorporating St. Josephâ€™s Hospital Raheny, is a large academic teaching hospital 5km north of Dublin City centre. Beaumont Hospital provides emergency and acute care services across 54 medical specialties to a local community of some 290,000 people. In addition, Beaumont Hospital is a designated cancer centre and the regional treatment centre for ear, nose and throat, and gastroenterology, and the national referral centre for neurosurgery and neurology, renal transplantation, cochlear implantation and mechanical thrombectomy.

 

Beaumont Hospital is the lead Level 4 hospital within the Royal College of Surgeons Hospital Group, which includes Connolly Hospital, Rotunda Hospital, Cavan/Monaghan Hospitals, Drogheda/Louth Hospitals, and the Royal College of Surgeons.   Beaumont Hospital employs approximately 4,000 staff and has a bed complement of 820 beds. Beaumont Hospital is the principal teaching hospital for the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland.   Beaumont Hospital also enjoys close links with Dublin City University, especially in the area of nurse training, and with other academic institutions in respect of training and research.

 

St. Joseph's Hospital Raheny, is an acute hospital that provides both medical and surgical in-patient care, day care, outpatient, outpatient physiotherapy and radiology services.   A dedicated Care of the Elderly Rehabilitation Unit and a 100 bedded Raheny Community Nursing Unit have also been developed on the St. Josephâ€™s campus.

 

Applications are invited for the following post:

 

Consultant Physician in Infectious Diseases

 

This is an appointment to the RCSI Hospitals Group on a Type B basis under the Consultantsâ€™ Contract 2008 by the Health Service Executive to Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital, Drogheda for 33 hours per week and Beaumont Hospital for 6 hours per week.

 

Applicants must be registered in the Specialist Division of the Register of Medical Practitioners maintained by the Medical Council in Ireland in the specialties of infectious diseases and general (internal) medicine.

 

Please note a panel may be formed from which other permanent vacancies for Consultant Physician in Infectious Diseases, OLOLH may be filled.

 

Informal enquiries may be made to Dr Eoghan de Barra, Consultant in Infectious Disease, Beaumont Hospital.


Applications can be made by emailing your CV to

consultanthr@beaumont.ie

together with the names of four referees or by applying online at www.beaumont.ie/careersno later than 12pm on 22nd October 2021.

Due to continued expansion, Gilheany & co., currently have a vacancy for a trainee accountant. The ideal candidate will be an individual who wants to join an energetic practice and gain exposure to a diverse range of clients across a number of industry sectors.

Excellent opportunity for a junior HR administrator to gain exposure to many aspects of HR including onboarding, payroll and recruitment

HR Administrator (Perm)

Location : Dublin North

Salary €30,000

The Role:

  • Be the point of contact for any HR enquiries received via telephone, email or ticketing system and ensuring they are answered within agreed timeframes.
  • Routine HR administration processes, e.g. sick and absences files, annual leave bookings and records, contract changes, maternity/paternity/parental processes etc

  • 6/12 months experience in a HR Administration role on a fast paced team
  • Experienced working in a fast paced pressurised environment.
  • Highly organised and ability to manage multiple tasks at any given time.
  • Knowledge or Experience working in the Aviation industry is an advantage.

Description: Business Development Manager (Electrical bias)

My client is a leading utility solutions provider servicing all renewable sectors.

About the Role:
My client are seeking a Business Development Manager (Electrical bias) to join our team. The successful candidate will report directly to the CCO / Leadership Team. The BD Manager will be primarily responsible for Business Development across the Group, including the following:

BD relevant to all areas of Mainline Group
Market Research
Supply Chain development
PR and Mainline Group profile enhancement.
Branding
Acquisition research.

The role will also have a Bid Management brief in support of the Commercial Director, where The BD Manager will assemble bid teams with the relevant technical, estimation and business knowledge required to prepare a winning bid, whilst taking ownership of the end-to-end bid process.

The BD Manager is responsible for managing a Bid from initial assessment through to contract award, including value proposition / strategy development, solution development, commercial considerations, partner identification, and risk management.

This is a highly networked role that requires an ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines in a fast-paced work environment. This position requires a high degree of business acumen, and an individual who possess excellent problem-solving skills, superior organisational and communication skills and the highest level of discretion and professionalism.

Key Responsibilities:
All aspects of BD noted above
Responsible for the production, quality and timely delivery of compliant, commercially sounds, market-leading, winning bids and proposals.
Manage the Customer experience and relationship.
Manage the Supplier experience and relationship.
Plan and manage bid teams and inputs from a variety of internal stakeholders.
Increase the win rate / effectiveness of our bids and proposals.
Track and effectively manage issues and risks throughout the bid process.
Contribute to the written proposal - both in terms of content and presentation.
Ensure Bids have gone through the appropriate commercial signoff process.
Arrange all post bid reviews with customers, post contract award.
Manage the contractual and compliance processes relating to all opportunities and customer engagements.
Manage the handover process (to Operations) for all won opportunities.
Ensure that all bid documentation produced is fully compliant with customer requirements.
Interface with all parts of business as necessary for the completion of BD and Bid proposals.
Perform a critical review of Bid processes to identify areas of further efficiency.
Perform a review of win and loss opportunities to ensure key lessons are learned.
Reviewing trends and carrying out data analysis to identify areas for improvement.
Identify, agree and deliver on key performance indicators for the Role.
Support and assist the Commercial Director in all BD related matters.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Ideally degree educated.
Experience of MV/HV electrical work would be beneficial.
Structured, action orientated approach.
Experience managing multiple internal and external stakeholders.
Previous BD & Bid management and presales experience is desirable but not essential.
Technical writing experience is desirable but not essential.
Understand the procurement processes.
Proficient at producing and presenting proposals.
Has excellent attention to detail.
Good time management skills and ability to multitask.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with staff, at all levels, and third parties.
Ability to set and meet objectives.
Structured, competent, capable of prioritising workloads efficiently and effectively
Strong understanding of the customer journey, extremely customer centric.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal skills.
Excellent Commercial knowledge and understanding
Strong IT skills with Microsoft Office packages, including diagnostic skills
Good Business Knowledge
Ability to “roll the sleeves up” and work independently

Location: Office base is Wilton, Cork & supporting operations nationwide.

Position: Permanent & Full time

Inside Sales Representative

Key Responsibilities
  • Identify and care for customer needs, business objectives, and success criteria
  • Maintain a full sales pipeline
  • Learn client personal computer devices with the ability to demo, sale, and share the full value add of the devices
  • Develop and maintain relationships with the field sales team, partner sales teams, and other relevant channel stakeholders
  • Support customers in internal conversations to create buy-in from key customer account stakeholders
  • Maintain relationships with customer accounts to continue driving future sales in the account base
  • Maintain and leverage accurate customer records within CRM tool
  • Support the development of a process to ensure meaningful customer touch and experience
  • Establish a trusted advisor role with accounts by being assertive, present and relevant
  • Serve as product and service advocate for the client building interest and awareness of client’s value proposition
  • Management and achievement of weekly, monthly and quarterly sales goals
Attributes For Success
  • Experience selling in the Public/Education Sector
  • Coachability and a willingness to learn
  • Strong Hunter mentality with the ability to investigate new leads and generate results
  • Sales experience in Enterprise level accounts will be highly considered; experience engaging and managing the sales process with high level executive stakeholders
  • Technical knowledge and background with ability to expand knowledge base around technical products; an affinity for innovative and emerging technology
  • Results-oriented with proven success in sales attainment, maximizing sales results and ability to excel in a team environment
  • A developed presence for conducting and managing online customer demos
  • Ability to quickly articulate technical and business value propositions via phone and email
  • Ability to effectively navigate through multiple web applications
  • Ability to learn quickly and maintain a current, comprehensive knowledge of client’s products and services
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office and relevant computer software and hardware
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including outstanding telephone presence
  • Prepare and deliver proposals, presentations as needed
What’s required to be considered?
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred
  • Minimum of two years of sales experience; technical sales preferred, specifically, with Saas, Hardware, or Software Sales
  • Experience in a full sales cycle process with high level executive stakeholders
  • Experience in complex sales processes
  • Proven success in a quota driven, high demand sales environment
  • Ability to work in highly dynamic, fast paced working environment where self-motivated individuals succeed
  • Experience with technical sales, specifically with technical products and systems
About MarketStar

Rated as one of the Salt Lake Tribune’s Top Workplaces in 2019, MarketStar is one of Northern Utah’s largest private employers and have offices in Ogden, Salt Lake City, and Dublin, Ireland. Our employees have helped launch, sell, and support thousands of products and services on behalf of the biggest and brightest companies in the world.

MarketStar is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Company Overview:
Here at Trinity Biotech, since our founding in 1992, we have built a deep heritage of innovation across biology, software and engineering that is focused on positively impacting the health and wellbeing of millions of people across the world.

Trinity Biotech is a public company listed on the NASDAQ and headquartered in Ireland, with manufacturing and R&D sites in Ireland, North America and South America. Trinity Biotech puts our people at the center of creating products and leaving legacies that are far reaching across the globe, with our products sold in over 75 countries globally.

We are proud of the contribution our products are having in helping health authorities & communities in the management of broad range of medical conditions, including our strong history in supporting the management of HIV through our Uni-Gold product and more recently, in the global fight against Covid-19.

We seek leaders who want to make a difference to the lives of millions across the world through our innovative, market leading products.

We are always seeking new talent to join our teams and continue this legacy.

Come join us and be part of the continuing journey!

Overview of the Group Financial Accountant Position:
This role offers an excellent opportunity for a newly qualified accountant to develop their skills in a growing, successful Irish company. The chosen candidate will join an experienced team of finance professionals based in the Group headquarters in Bray.

The main duties include but are not limited to the following:
Responsible for the consolidation of the Group's accounts on a monthly basis.
Preparation of Group management reports for the Board including key performance indicators and cash flows.
Treasury management including coordination of cash funding to subsidiaries.
Financial controller duties for one of the Group trading entities (turnover $11m), involving the preparation of a monthly financial pack, investigation of variences, overseeing credit control and preparing corporation tax computations.
Preparation of periodic SEC filings (20-F and 6-K) and quarterly earnings announcements.
Preparation of monthly accounts for the Group holding company.
Administration of and accounting for Company share option plan.
Assist with Company Secretarial filings.
Ad hoc analysis and reporting.

Candidate Profile:
Professional accounting qualification with a training in a practice, ACA or ACCA.
Strong knowledge of IFRS.
Excellent communication, organisational and interpersonal skills.
A demonstrated ability to take ownership for tasks and responsibilities.
Strong MS Excel & Word skills.

3 to 4 years relevant experience. Must have a passion for fresh, local & seasonal produce, with lots of seafood. Able to work as part of a team of Chef’s in a high volume kitchen.The The Kings Head Bistro is an award winning Restaurant.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to €35,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
We hold the Failte Ireland Safety Charter. We have also invested in Novaerus air purification system which in place in the Kitchen for the protection of our staff

Work remotely:

  • No

Description


FRS has a number of open medical vacancies for immediately available Senior House Officers. We need healthcare professionals who can take up a post within days - only applicable to doctors who don't need a work permit or visa.

As a senior house officer, you would report to the Head of Medical Department or Consultant in-charge / Registrar. The SHO is primarily responsible for examining patients and often play a part in the administration of health education. They would have to work well as a team and with their Registrar in charge. The role provides an excellent opportunity to learn from experienced Registrars and Consultants. It would be a challenging and busy role but excellent for career development as a NCHD (Non-Consultant Hospital Doctor)

Essential Requirements:
  • IMC registration or in the process of registering with IMC
  • Relevant qualifications
  • 1 - 2 + years' relevant experience
  • IELTS certificate with an overall band score of 7.0
  • Irish or UK experience desirable
  • Experience and availability for on-call duties

In order to practice medicine in Ireland, it is necessary to be registered with the Irish Medical Council (IMC). For further information on how to register with the IMC follow the link https://www.medicalcouncil.ie/Registration/

FRS Recruitment is the leading provider to Medical and Healthcare professionals to public and private hospitals throughout Ireland. We pride ourselves in the standard of service we provide to both candidates and clients. We also have a dedicated Compliance Officer to provide unparalleled support and guidance throughout the recruitment process, and throughout a relocation process if applicable.

If you are interested in working in Irish Hospitals, please contact Dave Maher, Medical & Healthcare Division, FRS Recruitment. Tel: M:+353 (0) 86 130 1705. I will be in contact with you on receipt of your CV, and to deal with any queries you may have.

Software Development Graduate – Work from home


To be successful in the role you must have

  • A minimum Degree (QQI Level 8 or above) in Computer Science, Software Development, or a related programming-centric qualification.
  • A major passion for technology and an aptitude for problem solving
  • (Ideally) experience with or an active interest in Java. .Net, C++, Python , Php, Ruby or Scala development and / or microservices.
  • We have projects and roles coming up in Java. .Net, C++, Python , Php, Ruby and Scala so you may be selected for one or two of these languages – please also indicate your strongest in your application.
  • Initially you will do 2 weeks training in Dublin, then a hybrid role ( 50 % office , 50% home ) of full time work from home


What's in it for you?

Why we believe you'll love it here…

  • You will be working with leading edge technologies enabling for faster, safer, cleaner, energy efficient and more robust solutions for our customers
  • Our software has over 100 customers world-wide, you’re sure to find a challenge worthy of your skills!
  • Your skills will be honed and developed through our Agile team culture, as well as on-the-job training, dedicated learning and development programs.
  • We’re a diverse bunch, with over 10 nationalities in our Irish operations . Expand your horizons in a rich multicultural, supportive environment


What do we offer?

  • A healthy work-life balance (flexible hours, remote working options, maternity/paternity and parental leave)
  • 24 annual leave days
  • Clearly defined career paths, improved with inhouse training and financial support for external study
  • Opportunities to travel around the world and work directly with our customers
  • Pension scheme, health insurance, company doctor, life cover and sick pay/income continuance plan
  • Tax saver commuter/bike to work scheme

Description

Description

Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe’s largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC.

Carrying 154m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 82 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 470 aircraft,with a further 210 Boeing 737s on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY25.

Ryanair is currently recruiting for a Continuing Airworthiness Records Officer to join our growing Engineering team.

Based in Dublin, the successful candidate will join a team of experienced engineers to ensure the continued airworthiness of our current and growing fleet of Boeing and Airbus aircraft.

The Role

The Continuing Airworthiness Records Officer, will work within a dedicated team and provide support in the following areas:

  • Ensuring components installed on current and new aircraft acquisitions are transferred to the Engineering System
  • Ensuring components requirements are accurately controlled and forecasting
  • Ensuring maintenance records of life service limited parts are accurately controlled and forecasting
  • Control Aircraft component configuration and ensure all Engineering systems are up to date and all component replacements are accurately transacted
  • Assist with aircraft & component records review as required.
  • Travel to bases supporting our fleet may be required to support this role.

Requirements

  • Relevant Degree or equivalent engineering qualification
  • Previous AMOS experience preferred
  • Must have excellent communication skills, both in-person and by electronic means.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision in a collaborative team environment
  • Computer literate, with working knowledge Word, Excel
Apply for this job

Description

Description

Ryanair are currently recruiting for a Maintenance Control Support Engineer to join their team.

The successful candidate will be based in our new Head Office in Airside Business Park in Swords. This is an excellent opportunity to join our Engineering department and gain experience in Europe’s leading airline as we expand our fleet to over 500 Boeing 737

Duties will include:

  • Assisting with the return to service of AOG aircraft.
  • Liaising with Engineers/Flight crew with regard to technical defects.
  • Dispatch of the Lear Jet to transport engineers and spares to aid AOG recovery.
  • Review of open HILs and other forecasting maintenance to ensure that tasks are being planned and accomplished as required.
  • Update and distribution of Tech Issues to provide visibility of fleet AOG status

Requirements

Successful candidates will possess the following qualifications, skills and attributes;

  • Relevant degree or Aviation experience
  • Excellent communications and organisational skills.
  • Ability to react to changing situations in a calm and controlled manner.
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Willing to work shifts including night shift

Description

Description

Ryanair is Europe’s favourite airline, carrying over 106m p.a. on more than 1,800 daily flights from 81 bases, connecting 200 destinations in 31 countries on a fleet of 330 Boeing 737 aircraft, with a further 350 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable Ryanair to lower fares and grow traffic to 180m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of more than 10,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and has an industry leading 31-year safety record.


The Department

Ryanair Labs Dublin is dedicated to hiring the best IT talent that Poland has to offer, where software developers can have the freedom to work on game changing projects that will have an impact on our business from day one. When we started Ryanair Labs +6 years ago, we weren’t expecting we would grow to a team of +500 based across 4 locations that would change the way people in Europe travel. Working at Ryanair Labs Dublin you will have a chance to work in fast-paced international environment where you can exchange your experience and ideas.

The Team

Our Frontend development team is made up of almost 30 Software Engineer, working across 15 independent teams. These delivery focused project pods work on the Ryanair website, Ryanair Rooms website, and internal applications. Our continuous delivery approach means we follow the Agile Scrum methodology.

The Role

We are looking for talented software engineer to join our digital development team. In this role you will work closely with our development and product team to develop, modify and support our website and user interfaces across all channels. We want someone who is motivated by emerging technologies and has a passion to drive digital transformation. A real desire to work in a collaborative and fast-paced retail environment is essential. You will be joining Ryanair at an exciting time with an ambitious roadmap to become digital leaders and pioneers.

The Stack

Our Tech Stack is based on the latest frontend technologies and frameworks. We are using the latest version of Angular and a microsites architecture. All our projects are hosted in the cloud (AWS) using a serverless infrastructure delivered with cloud native pipelines. We are using feature flags to rapidly deliver new functionalities to our users safely.


Responsibilities:

  • Delivering best-in-class user interfaces across the Ryanair.com platform
  • Developing high quality, testable and performance software using agile practices
  • Driving best technology and software development practices in the team with passion and enthusiasm
  • Assisting analysts and business stakeholders in shaping, estimating and planning new requirements
  • Participating in regular showcases of new work to the product owners and business stakeholders
  • Striving for continuous improvement within the team

Requirements


  • Proficient on modern frontend techology stack (HTML5, Typescript, CSS)
  • Comfortable coding custom JavaScript solutions as well as utilising existing frameworks
  • Expert knowledge of building high performing and available websites and how to apply page performance optimisation techniques
  • Adept at building and maintaining cross browser/device compatible sites
  • Exposure or appreciation of agile development practices
  • Passionate about user experience
  • Comfortable working and maintaining a CI/CD environment.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent understanding of the coding standards required for high volume websites from a security and performance perspective
  • Experience of working with large e-commerce websites and their underlying databases.
  • IT Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience
  • 2 - 3 years’ experience in a fast paced commercial environment
  • Bonus points AWS knowledge and proficiency


These positions are based in our Dublin Head Office in Ireland.

Please apply with your CV in English.

Benefits

The work that you do will be seen by the millions of customers across Europe!

Competitive Salary - Including Airline Benefits.

Apply for this job

Description

Description

Europe’s largest low fares airline has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Media Manager to drive and deliver paid media communications for Ryanair. Reporting into the Head of Brand Communications, you will be a key member of the Ryanair Marketing Team responsible for media planning and buying to drive yield and growth across Ryanair’s top markets.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop global and local media strategies and plans that deliver measurable impact against Ryanair’s business goals.
  • Plan and manage Ryanair’s paid media budget to support brand, sales and partner advertising activities.
  • Lead and establish effective business relationships with relevant media vendors and publishers and lead rate negotiations at the highest level.
  • Build and grow capabilities in digital advertising activities to grow revenue across digital channels.
  • Manage Ryanair’s sponsorship portfolio across its key markets.
  • Lead the relationship with Ryanair’s media agency and support with planning, buying and performance to build drive business results and efficiencies.
  • Build strong working relationships with marketing channel owners and senior internal stakeholders within the business to deliver outstanding results.
  • Critically analyse the performance of campaigns to determine opportunities for improvement and optimisation.

Requirements

  • +5 years paid media experience agency/client side covering all aspects of paid media.
  • Advanced understanding of traditional media (TV, Radio, OOH, Partnerships) channels.
  • Digital acquisition experience, with deep understanding of full digital landscape and customer funnel from a commercial perspective.
  • Media experience across multiple European markets desirable, but not essential.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and autonomously.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent stakeholder management with team and agency.
  • Performance driven with high level of commercial acumen.
  • Analytical and the ability to problem solve and make decisions.
  • Experience managing Google Ads and Facebook Ads accounts directly desirable.

Benefits

Competitive salary and airline benefits

Region: Europe
