Description

The Role: Parts Manager

Location: Dublin

Salary: Negotiable

Our Parts Manager is responsible for;

  • Leading and developing a warehouse inventory control team, accountable for processing spare parts orders
  • Maintaining accurate parts data within the business systems to provide support for parts and inventory functions
  • Maintaining parts inventory levels across the business by analysis of stock movements and efficient cleansing / disposal of excess and obsolete inventory
  • Managing the purchase order to supplier process, identifying potential issues promptly, working with internal stakeholders and suppliers to resolve
  • Maintaining parts data within protean, parts set ups, updating pricing, linking popular numbers and managing superseding part numbers
  • Managing the cycle count of engineer van inventory/stores/other sites, and authorisation of new site requests
  • Controlling the parts return process maximising cost recovery
  • Backorder management and recovery for parts delivered direct to sites
  • Ensuring all inventory losses through non-compliance are visible & allocated to appropriate areas
  • Ongoing analysis of inventory, driving to planned levels and cost-effective removal of slow moving/obsolete stock
  • Managing the booking in process for new equipment.

Our Parts Manager will demonstrate;

  • Previous experience within a similar role
  • Good understanding and knowledge of Health and Safety
  • Excellent knowledge of Inventory Management Systems
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Good communication skills
  • Excellent knowledge of creative problem-solving tools and techniques.

Our Parts Manager will receive;

  • A negotiable basic salary
  • Briggs Boost benefit scheme offering high street discounts
  • Contributory pension scheme
  • Eyecare vouchers
  • 23 days holiday + bank holidays

About Us

Briggs Equipment is an engineering services and asset management specialist with its people core to everything that it does. We are Hyster Group’s exclusive distributor for materials handling equipment in Republic of Ireland and have extended our offering to include industrial cleaning, aerial access, groundworks, agricultural plant and machinery to offer customers a total solution based on the service we can provide. Our team members are highly skilled and can offer flexible and bespoke solutions for our customers across a range of new, used or short term hire equipment.

Our Values

  • Safety first
  • Easy to work with
  • It’s our business
  • Innovate and Improve
  • Build trust

Our values are based around employee experience as we believe this will also support high levels of customer engagement. We want our people to be empowered to identify improvements or risks and offer solutions. We encourage open and honest communication to make Briggs the best place to work.

Our Culture

We empower our people to make the right decisions for the right reasons which ultimately is to provide long term security of employment for us all. Our people tell us that they know what is expected of them at work and that they have the opportunity to do what they do best every day. We have an open communication style embracing two way discussion to obtain feedback for continual improvements.

Description

Conference & Banqueting Supervisor - Clayton Hotel Cork City

We have a fantastic new vacancy for a Conference & Banqueting Supervisor in the Clayton Hotel Cork City.

Objective of the Role

As a Conference & Banqueting Supervisor you will assist the Conference & Banqueting Manager with maintaining all standards and procedures, throughout the delivery of the event. You will support in building foundations of the department, by supporting the creation and implementation of service standards and staff training.

· Assist in the running of meeting & events.

· Ensure standards are maintained and well as all polices and procedures relating to F&B within Meetings and Events

· Be forward thinking and innovative when it comes to ways of working and best practice.

· Proactively come up with suggestions to ensure all events are a success.

· Continuously improving service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand and anticipate guest needs, deliver training, guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed

· To be an ambassador for Dalata as well as a strong leader who embodies our values and commitment to our teams.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

· Minimum 2 years experience in a Supervisor role within Banqueting/Meeting and Events.

About our culture:

Dalata Hotel Group – Ireland’s largest hotel group has a number of exciting positions on the horizon. As Dalata continues to grow and expand in Ireland and the UK it’s more important than ever to have the right team alongside us, in the near future we will be opening the doors of new hotels creating many jobs and investing millions in the Irish and UK economy.

We lead through our Dalata values of “Our People, Our Fairness, Our Service and Our Individuality”. If you have the right attitude and energy you will have great opportunities to progress within the group. Our company is a place where you can do great things – individually and as a team. You will have the opportunity to develop your talent, be recognised and rewarded for your commitment and pursue a fulfilling career. We also have a number of unique and recognised training programmes to aid your professional and personal development and pride ourselves on creating an objective, supportive and fair working environment for our employees.

Dalata Hotel Group Plc is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Site Reliability Engineer DevOps - Linux , Kubernetes


Remote / Flexibility - candidates must have EU Citizenship or Irish Stamp 4 or Stamp 1


Office Location: Dublin City Centre, Dublin 2 , Pearse Street , beside Trinity College Dublin


The Synchronoss Site Reliability Engineer is primarily responsible for maintaining a highly technical and professional relationship with customers during all phases of the client life-cycle. From build-out, deployment, to ongoing support. . The ideal candidate will be passionate about an operations role that involves deep knowledge of both the application and the underlying infrastructure. The ideal candidate will also believe that automation is a key component to operating large-scale systems efficiently. 

 

 The candidate will need to be able to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment with experience in:

  • Cloud and virtualization-based technologies (Amazon Web Services (AWS), VMWare).
  • Java Application Server Administration (Weblogic, Widely, JBoss, Tomcat).
  • Docker and Kubernetes 
  • Linux/UNIX Administration (CentOS and RedHat).
  • Developing and supporting cloud infrastructure designs and implementations and guiding application development teams.
  • Configuration Management tools (Chef or Puppet or ansible).
  • Log aggregations tools such as Elastic and/or Splunk.
  • CI/CD tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins, and Spinnaker
  • Automate infrastructure and application deployment-related tasks using terraform.
  • Automate repetitive tasks required to maintain a secure and up-to-date operational environment.


How you will help

  • Build and support always-available private/public cloud-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications. 
  • Build AWS or other public cloud infrastructure using Terraform.
  • Deploy and manage Kubernetes-based docker applications in AWS.
  • Deploy and manager enterprise java applications on Java application servers such as WebLogic, WildFly, and Tomcat
  • Create custom OS images using Packer.
  • Create and revise infrastructure and architectural designs and implementation plans and guide the implementation with operations.
  • Interface between application development, infrastructure support, and tools (IT Services) teams.
  • Development and documentation of Chef recipes and/or ansible scripts. Support throughout the entire deployment lifecycle (development, quality assurance, and production).
  • Help developers leverage infrastructure, application, and cloud platform features and functionality, participate in code and design reviews, and support developers by building CI/CD pipeline using Bamboo, Jenkins or Spinnaker.
  • Create knowledge-sharing presentations and documentation to help developers and operations teams understand and leverage the system's capabilities.
  • Learn on the job and explore new technologies with little supervision.
  • Leverage scripting (BASH, Perl, Ruby, Python) to build required automation and tools on an ad-hoc basis.


Who we have in mind


  • At least 2 years of experience in deploying, managing, and supporting enterprise containerized applications in Kubernetes
  • Kubernetes administration
  • At least 6 years of building and managing private cloud or public cloud infrastructure using Terraform.
  • At least 4 years experience in managing enterprise applications deployed in Java Application Server Administration such as Weblogic, Widely, JBoss, Tomcat.
  • Hands-on experience including, but not limited to:  
  • Ability to script in at least one of the following: Shell, Perl, or Python.
  • Experience with monitoring solutions such as LogicMonitor, Prometheus.
  • Experience with GiT
  • Experience with APM tools such as NewRelic or Elastic
  • Experience with CI-CD tooling experience (Atlassian or similar)
  • Proven ability to deliver a superior operations experience working directly with corporate clients' technology teams and associated change management.
  • Enjoys learning and adapting to advancing technologies and procedural changes.
  • Proven incident and problem solving (troubleshooting) skills with an emphasis on timely resolution.
  • Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively and professionally with other engineers, teams, and business partners.
  • Ability and desire to work in a team environment.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and analytical skills, with the ability to tailor communication to the intended audience.
  • Experience working with ticketing systems.
  • Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation.


Be great if you had:


  • AWS experience across the full breadth of AWS technologies.  
  • MongoDB experience is not a firm requirement but is highly desired for this role. 
  • Previous experience in a technical operations role.
  • Experience with MapR, Cassandra, or zookeeper.
  • Physical hardware and firmware exposure.
  • Experience with virtual server environments (KVM, Xen, VMWare, OpenVZ, etc.)
  • Load balancer support (Cisco ACE, F5 LTM, Citrix, etc.)
  • Experience diagnosing complex issues through packet capture analysis (Wireshark, tcpdump)
  • Familiarity with IP-enabled storage solutions.
  • Familiarity with fiber channel switches and SANs (Brocade, IBM, Hitachi, HP)
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent education in related fields
  • Certificates of training in associated fields/equipment




Synchronoss Technologies (NASDAQ: SNCR) is a Mobile Innovation leader that provides Personal Cloud Solutions and Software-based Activation for Connected Devices across the globe.

 

We know the TMT space. Our platforms, products, people, and partners help Telecommunications, Media, and Technology companies shift their digital business into high gear.

 

We are helping companies create digital customer journeys that reduce cost, improve consumer satisfaction, and create new revenue.

 

We are committed to focusing on helping our customers, even during this global crisis, create new revenue streams, reduce costs and delight their subscribers with our Cloud, Messaging, Digital and IoT products and solutions.

Our primary focus is to provide a turnkey eCommerce solution that includes platform and inventory system, digital strategy management and guidelines, as well as an automated remarketing system in conjunction with our sales-funnel that we have created. In other words, we will help companies to open sales channels and position themselves for the future.

Looking to join SproutMedia? We’d love to have you!

We are an internationally orientated marketing and e-commerce company that sells unique products to customers worldwide. We are looking for high motivated and talented interns for at least 6 months. Your task will be to assist our local and international teams.

Working at SproutMedia as an intern is not only an immersive intellectual experience where your impact is felt on a daily basis, but is also an enjoyable one!

Tasks

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Support our Marketing and Content Team
  • Support our Social Media/ Campaign Management team
  • Support our Buying and Product Research team
  • Support our Customer Care team
Requirements

YOUR PROFILE:
  • The candidate should be working toward an undergraduate degree.
  • French Native Speaker
  • Good communication skills in English.
  • Strong written & verbal communication
  • You are open-minded, team orientated and reliable
  • You have high operational readiness, flexibility, organizational- & communicational skills
  • You have the capability in motivating yourself
Benefits

WE OFFER: A full-time paid internship, preferably 6 months starting October 2021
  • Top working conditions and a nice atmosphere
  • International Projects & Teams
  • Creative working & thinking
  • Remuneration of EUR 400,- per month*
Become a part of SproutMedia and send us your convincing application (resume and cover letter) including your earliest start date.

Who Are We?


Architas Multi-Manager is a dynamic Investment Company, focused on delivering multi-manager investment propositions. Our consistent investment process enables us to design muti-manager solutions as well as act as a centre of investment excellence for the AXA Group. We are a member of the global AXA Group, bringing multi-manager expertise to the whole company.

We are currently looking for an Junior Portfolio Manager Manager whose main role will be to manage investment products and support Architas in achieving its strategic objectives through involvement in client relationship management and product development.  

If you are looking for a challenging role in a dynamic and rewarding environment we would love to hear from you.


What You Will Be Doing 


Assisting Investment Managers in their investment decision making by producing timely and accurate portfolio data and analytics, supporting them in various operational elements of trading, managing and maintaining internal data files used in the investment decision making process, and providing general assistance to Investment Managers when required.


1.   Ownership of the Fund Set Up process for new instrument set ups across the Investment Team, working closely with Operations and other departments.

2.   Assisting in the production of Portfolio analytics for portfolios. Task involves uploading data to systems such as Style Analytics, creating fund of fund look-through reports and assisting Investment Managers create holdings-based style/risk reports. 

3.   Manage and maintain internal fund database of portfolio holdings to aid in the production of portfolio level summary reports

4.   Manage and maintain specific files used to support client meetings and investment manager decision making 

5.   Assist in the production and collation of investment materials used in various client and internal governance meetings

6.   Create bespoke content as required for internal and client reporting purposes from time to time.

7.   Supporting Investment Managers respond to adhoc queries or tasks from time to time

8.   Continued professional development in support of competency assessments.

 

What We Are Looking For


Knowledge, Skills, Experience and Qualifications required for this position:


•   Graduate and/or finance related professional qualification

•   Some experience working in an Investment or Financial services environment

•   An interest and basic understanding of the workings of investment markets and fund management

•   Competent in the use of Microsoft office, especially Excel and PowerPoint 

•   Qualifications: Working toward a professional qualification is desired 


We have done our best to paint a picture of what we are looking for in this role; however we know that some candidates may be discouraged from applying if they don't meet every requirement. If you don't tick every box, but are excited by the role and the prospect of working for Architas, then please press apply!

This is a Program & Project Management Analyst supporting an Accenture client’s software asset management and compliance division. You will be part of a wider team that is responsible for supporting the client in managing multiple software reviews, from notification stage throughout its conclusion and within a geographic region or business segment.

This would suit a candidate with minimum 3 to 4 years of project management experience strong operational focus and industry expertise.

Responsibilities:
Running the end-to-end multiple software asset management engagement and compliance reviews
Supporting Program and Project Management, managing timeline & milestone achievement for reviews.
Identifying risk or issues that may impact the reviews’ progression and customers’ engagement.
Developing and maintain strong and positive collaboration with customers and key client internal stakeholders, while always displaying a customer first mindset.
Anticipating and supporting conflict management and resolution as required.
Governing data/documentation quality and adherence to client policy and regulations.
Ensuring that applicable client policies are adhered.
Creating, distributing, and explaining tailored management reporting
Using client tools to pull relevant documents and data and archive via SharePoint.
Continuously updating multiple engagement opportunities in CRM
Ensuring all documentation related to each engagement meets client quality requirements.
Continuously driving process improvement initiatives as part of the global team.

Qualifications:
4 + years of experience in a project-based or Operations role
2 + years of experience in commercial scale IT infrastructure, Software licensing or software asset management.
Facilitation of meetings with multiple stakeholders
Tracking and documenting actions, risks, and issues
Acute attention to detail
Ability to work well with teams and build strong working relationships.
Demonstrates flexibility in fast-paced environment.
Ability to coordinate multiple tasks at one time.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Sense of personal accountability and self-motivation
Understanding of commercial scale IT infrastructure and Software licensing knowledge
Fluent in English

Preferable Skills:
Additional European language such us Italian, French , Spanish it is a plus.
Project management or Software Asset Management Certifications.

About Ericsson

At Ericsson, we develop wireless network technology that enables the next generation of smart devices and the Internet of Things. The advent of 5G, IoT and real-time connectivity – from connected cars to personal wearables to smart grid technology – will again fundamentally change our world. It will pull us into an age of sophisticated machine intelligence, blended virtual and physical realities, and complete network connectivity. We are at the forefront of this change, helping service providers meet expectations today and in the future by focusing on network quality and an evolution path to 5G. We are setting both 4G and 5G speed records, leading in network slicing and distributed cloud and reducing complexity with innovative Artificial Intelligence and machine learning solutions. Our dedication to developing leading technology is underlined by the more than 42,000 patents we have worldwide, including our landmark 5G patent application that was the largest ever in our industry in terms of inventors.

Our Software Campus in Athlone has over 1000 developers working on software solutions and applications in Java, Python, JavaScript on the Linux Platform, both on bare metal and in the cloud. We use the latest Agile processes, harnessing the power of Automated Testing, Continuous Delivery and Deployment. Our systems handle terabytes of data…daily.

Do you want to work in an exciting and collaborative team environment using the latest tools and technologies? Then we want you! At Ericsson, you’ll have the opportunity to develop software for radio networks around the world while working in a software development team and learning from experienced developers.

What are the minimum requirements for the role?

On track to achieving a minimum 2.1 Hons Degree in Computer Science or related field
Passion for technology and an aptitude for problem solving

What do we offer you?

An opportunity to work for the global leader in telecoms networks using the most up to date and cutting-edge, ground breaking technologies as well as continuous training and development. You will build a career in an environment which supports initiative and personal growth.

Wattics is offering a great opportunity for an experienced sales manager to massively grow sales of our software as a service (SaaS) platform for energy management analytics.


Wattics is a fast-growing international SaaS company with head office in Dublin and with customers in 50 countries and the #1 choice of energy managers and consultants according to peer-online reviews. Our software is used by a network of energy professionals working for leading global brands such as Kings cross, Apple computers, Google, Nike, Prada, IKEA, Chanel and thousands more.


The global energy market is booming and undergoing a fundamental transformation. Smart meters, energy services, renewables, and saving technologies are spreading fast around the world. Cloud-based energy and IoT management analytics are at a focal point to understand business operations, decide on investments and discover saving opportunities.


We look for talented salespeople with a strong passion for closing SaaS deals through web demonstration of the dashboard, that understands the art and mechanics of inbound lead generation, who are self-driven, that master CRM tools such as Hubspot and website-chat tools such as intercom. Talented people that can effectively demonstrate the Wattics platform to C-level executives in global energy service companies, energy suppliers, utilities and system integrators.


ABOUT YOU


A professional sales personality: driven, energetic, accountable, decisive, independent, well organised and practices effective time management.


Working knowledge of SaaS (Software as a Service)/cloud-based software architecture, data integration, metering hardware and energy services.


A track record of software sales achievements, online technical dashboard demonstrations and management of leads and deals at scale.


3+ years experience in SaaS sales, energy and/or environmental related field.


Degree in business, Economics, IT, Environmental Science or Engineering.


Strong communication and networking skills in a digital sales organization with impeccable social and intercultural communications skills.


Confident negotiator and comfortable interacting with people on the highest level.


Ability to work in an evolving and dynamic environment with minimal supervision.


Strong familiarity with key SaaS metrics and how to use them to drive sales.


A passion for energy efficiency and the energy management market.


Knowledge of multiple languages is desired but not required.


Working knowledge of Hubspot and Intercom is highly desirable.


Proficient in IT, presentation and CRM tools.


RESPONSIBLE FOR


Seeking and contacting new qualified leads: energy managers, energy consultants, suppliers, energy service companies, system integrators etc ( energy partners)


On-boarding of qualified energy partner leads through conference calls, online software demonstrations, face to face meetings, webinars, focused events.


Identifying and expanding a network of hundreds of global energy partners.


Management, training, and tracking energy partners’ sales performance.


Closing multiple deals with acquired energy partners.


Ensuring achievement and reporting of monthly/quarterly sales targets.


Providing customer feedback to refine technology roadmap and priorities.


Working with the marketing and exec team to identify effective sales strategies to differentiate our offering in the market.


Monitor and report on market and competitor activities and provide relevant reports and information.


REMUNERATION & BENEFITS


A competitive base salary, a significant sales commission and expenses paid.


5 weeks paid holidays + 1 extra week paid to pursue your own project to help the World.


A great start-up environment, fun, fast-paced, young, outgoing, positive and friendly.


Share options in Wattics after year 1.


Excellent career opportunities to develop a sales team and grow massively within the company.


Remote work is allowed. Otherwise, the offices are located in the heart of Dublin city, Berlin and Italy, if you would like a bit of office time.


Assistance to relocate if needed.


Twice a year country-side company team retreats.

Job Title: Part Qualified Accountant

Employment Basis: Full-time and Permanent.

Office Location: Dublin, Ireland

Career Level: CL11 - Analyst

This is a fantastic opportunity for a part qualified accountant to take the next step in their career with an innovative company that offers interesting on the job training in a dynamic environment! Accenture is committed to employee development supporting the successful candidate to complete their accounting qualification and has great career advancement opportunities.

Accenture’s global finance teams work at the heart of Dublin’s digital docklands to provide strategic, operational, and analytical support across Accenture’s global businesses. Our various teams range from corporate development and financial management professionals to accounting and tax experts, and everything in between. Our Irish hub contains 300 finance team members, and we are continually expanding, providing a wide range of career opportunities. We drive career progression and skills development because we recognise that we succeed only when our people grow.

Summary:
The will be assisting the team with the month end financial reporting including, journal preparation, P&L and balance sheet analysis and completing balance sheet reconciliations. You will be working closely with a diverse team of experts and learning from their experience on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
Preparation of monthly analytical review on P&L and Balance Sheet including variance explanation.
Month end preparation and review of various journals to ensure US GAAP compliant
Perform monthly internal controls in compliance with Sarbox
Balance Sheet Account reconciliations and analysis.
Provide accounting support to the Team Lead/Manager
Involvement in setting up and improving on accounting processes with a view to making them more efficient
Meet key reporting deadlines on a monthly and quarterly basis
Other ad hoc duties as required

Preferred Skills:
Pursuing a Professional accounting Qualification (ACCA / ACA / CIMA / CPA)
Knowledge of Accounting Principles.
Minimum of one years’ experience in an accounting environment.
Degree in Business, Finance or equivalent qualification required.
Experience of Accounting Systems with knowledge of SAP being an advantage.
Analytical and computer skills in MS Office, strong Excel as definite advantage.

Remuneration and Benefits:
Accenture offers a competitive salary and extensive range of benefits for this position include paid overtime (up to manager level), annual performance bonus, comprehensive study support, and a hybrid working model. Employees also have the option to avail of a 15% discount on shares, private healthcare insurance cover and the company pension plan with matched contributions.

King and Moffatt has successfully delivered multiple large-scale projects in Ireland, the UK & multiple locations in Europe. We pride ourselves on being a full building services solutions provider. We are looking for an experienced Electrician for roles in the Midlands and Dublin all site based.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Assemble, install, test, and maintain electrical or electronic wiring, equipment, appliances, apparatus, and fixtures, using hand tools and power tools.

· Diagnose malfunctioning systems, apparatus, and components, using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.

· Connect wires to circuit breakers, transformers, or other components.

· Inspect electrical systems, equipment and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.

· Advise management on whether continued operation of equipment could be hazardous.

· Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures, using testing devices to ensure compatibility and safety of system.

· Maintain current electricians license or identification card to meet governmental regulations.

· Plan layout and installation of electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures, based on job specifications and local codes.

· Direct and train Apprentices to install, maintain, or repair electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures.

· Prepare sketches or follow blueprints to determine the location of wiring and equipment and to ensure conformance to building and safety codes.

· Use a variety of tools and equipment, such as power construction equipment, measuring devices, power tools and testing equipment.

· Perform business management duties such as maintaining records and files, preparing reports and ordering supplies and equipment.

· Work from ladders, scaffolds, and roofs to install, maintain or repair electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures.

· Perform physically demanding tasks, such as digging trenches to lay conduit and moving and lifting heavy objects.

· Scheduling events, programmes and activities, as well as the work of others.

· Comply with all EHSQ policies and procedures as required.

· This list is not exhaustive or exclusive.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

· Leaving Certificate with a pass in Mathematics desirable or equivalent.

· Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities.

· Excellent organizational skills.

· Safepass

· Manual Handling

· Colour Vision test certified

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Electrician: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Safe Pass (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

Who Are We?


Architas Multi-Manager is a dynamic Investment Company, focused on delivering multi-manager investment propositions. Our consistent investment process enables us to design muti-manager solutions as well as act as a centre of investment excellence for the AXA Group. We are a member of the global AXA Group, bringing multi-manager expertise to the whole company.

We are currently looking for an Junior Portfolio Manager Manager whose main role will be to manage investment products and support Architas in achieving its strategic objectives through involvement in client relationship management and product development.  

If you are looking for a challenging role in a dynamic and rewarding environment we would love to hear from you.


What You Will Be Doing 


Manage investment products according to their objectives and with regard to both product and regulatory restrictions, and support Architas in achieving its strategic objectives through involvement in client relationship management and product development. 


1.   Management of Multi-manager/Fund of Fund portfolios according to their objectives, and with regard to both product and regulatory restrictions. 

2.   Implementation of strategic and tactical asset allocation, as appropriate, to align with Architas asset allocation positioning.

3.   Portfolio construction incorporating informed allocation of risk and factor exposures.

4.   Make fund selection decisions appropriate to portfolios managed.

5.   Sector Lead responsibility requiring research, monitoring and oversight of external investment managers and their offerings including funds and segregated mandates 

6.   ESG Due Diligence coverage and ESG integration in line with Architas policies

7.   Participation in client relationship meetings and presentations to internal and external stakeholders in association with sales, marketing, and PR departments. 

8.   Support the development of new investment strategies and vehicles to take advantage of market, regulatory, tax, and product developments to establish and maintain a market leading investment offering. 

9.   Continued professional development in support of competency assessments.

 

What We Are Looking For


Knowledge, Skills, Experience and Qualifications required for this position:


•   4 to 8 year’s experience in Manager Research and Fund of funds 

•   CFA Charterholder (at our discretion) or similar qualification 

•   Continuing investment management competence

•   Graduate and/or a finance related professional qualification 

•   Proven knowledge and experience of systems and processes, manager research, investment markets, managers and investment management techniques

•   Strong presentation skills


We have done our best to paint a picture of what we are looking for in this role; however we know that some candidates may be discouraged from applying if they don't meet every requirement. If you don't tick every box, but are excited by the role and the prospect of working for Architas, then please press apply!

The Job: Group Financial Accountant
The Client: Our Client is a Medical Devices company who specialises in development, manufacture and marketing of diagnostic test kits and equipment.
The Location: Bray, Wicklow

This role offers an excellent opportunity for a newly qualified accountant to develop their skills in a growing, successful Irish company. The chosen candidate will join an experienced team of finance professionals based in the Group headquarters in Bray.

The main duties include but are not limited to the following:

  • Responsible for the consolidation of the Group's accounts on a monthly basis.
  • Preparation of Group management reports for the Board including key performance indicators and cash flows.
  • Treasury management including coordination of cash funding to subsidiaries.
  • Financial controller duties for one of the Group trading entities (turnover $11m), involving the preparation of a monthly financial pack, investigation of variances, overseeing credit control and preparing corporation tax computations.
  • Preparation of periodic SEC filings (20-F and 6-K) and quarterly earnings announcements.
  • Preparation of monthly accounts for the Group holding company.
  • Administration of and accounting for Company share option plan.
  • Assist with Company Secretarial filings.
  • Ad hoc analysis and reporting.

Candidate Profile:

  • Professional accounting qualification with a training in a practice, ACA or ACCA.
  • Strong knowledge of IFRS.
  • Excellent communication, organisational and interpersonal skills.
  • A demonstrated ability to take ownership for tasks and responsibilities.
  • Strong MS Excel & Word skills.

Zazzle is looking for amazing E-Commerce Merchandisers to join our growing merchandising team.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Localisation & Merchandising, the E-commerce Merchandiser will work with colleagues worldwide and across the company, including SEM, SEO, Creative, Promotion, and the International team.

As part of the Growth team, you are key to successful product-based marketing at Zazzle. As a product, “storyteller,” you will shape the messaging for crucial shopping experiences with seasonal, trendy, and timely product selections. As an expert in shopping experiences, you will craft experiences filled with novel and customer-converting ideas. Our merchandising tools allow for instant feedback on experiences you build, your ability to evaluate, synthesize, and report your insights is part of the role. Most importantly, you will show a passion for continually optimizing and growing the Zazzle marketplace.

This role is located in Ireland, in our office in the city center of Cork, or remotely.

Now, for a bit more about us. You might have heard of Zazzle, and we bet someone you know has used Zazzle. But for the uninitiated, Zazzle is a destination where you can design, sell, and customize thousands of products and designs. Our mission is to enable our users to create anything imaginable. We have millions of customers and a million plus independent designers on our platform, we’re profitable, and we’re (secretly) a global juggernaut that’s growing like crazy. We have fun, and we lead with empathy. In fact, leading with heart is one of our values.

Want to learn more about Zazzle? Then head on over here . If you want to learn more about this role, then read on.

As An E-Commerce Merchandiser, You Will
  • Be responsible for creating merchandising site experiences including landing pages, promotional pages, hubs, search results, custom pages, and ensuring that all deadlines are met
  • Work closely with the SEM team to optimize our feeds to improve shoppability and drive conversion
  • Propose and build new site experiences including page layouts, shopping paths, browse navigation, product categories audience personalization, and shopping intent-based flows
  • Collaborate with teammates on our trend-based and seasonally relevant merchandising calendars for key site experiences and product categories
  • Be accountable for and report on merchandising experience conversion and revenue targets weekly, monthly, and quarterly. Propose and make adjustments based on the results
  • Analyze post-mortem data, trends, product assortment, and competition to present to management and revise strategy
  • Review all site experience and product options before major launches and promotional campaigns to ensure consistent, on-trend branding and according to SEO best practices
  • Proactively review and analyze market trends to develop new business opportunities
Qualifications We Are Looking For
  • 2-3 years of e-commerce merchandising related experience
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Strong understanding and passion for online shopping experiences, UX, UI, and visual site merchandising
  • Ability to balance between strong consumer insight and analytics with a creative eye for design and trends
  • Ability to analyze and synthesize information and recommend actions
  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multitask
  • Detail-oriented, hands-on, with a can-do attitude
  • Flexible team player who easily adapts to a changing environment and can collaborate with all levels in the organization
  • Proficient in Google docs and Analytics tools
  • Knowledgeable of the American market and its media trends, religion, politics, events, holidays, etc.
Zazzle is people-powered; we care about your success. Our benefits include work from home, health and wellbeing coverage, profit sharing, and so much more. We are pet-friendly and lead with purpose because we’re on a mission to make and create anything imaginable.

We’re looking forward to meeting you – there’s so much more to share. Apply now.

We celebrate and embrace the uniqueness and creativity of our teammates, designers, makers, and partners! We strive to continuously build a diverse and inclusive culture and community that empowers all of our teammates to be authentic and achieve their true potential. You'll be joining Zazzle at a very exciting time in our growth and playing a significant role in our success. This is a true opportunity for your own personal growth, an opportunity to be innovative and creative, and truly make a difference in our future.

Our client a leading medical device company in Limerick are currently recruitment for a Production Support Engineer to join their team. The primary purpose of this position is to provide technical support to all manufacturing engineering activities as carried out by the company. Role available on the evening Shift.

Reporting to the Senior Manufacturing Engineer

Responsibilities & Duties

Ensure that Production engineering activities are carried out according to company operating procedures, and that a high level of productivity and quality is achieved and maintained.

Provide immediate response to Call-out from Production on issues impacting the production of products.

Prepare, review, and approve change requests and other quality system documentation requiring manufacturing engineering sign-off.
Plan and execute projects to ensure that project timelines, quality and cost targets are met.

Production Support and Maintenance/Calibration activities.
Lead quality improvement and cost reduction projects.
Tool design activities

The Ideal Candidate

Good computer skills, knowledge of CAD system an advantage.
Willingness and availability to travel on company business.

Description


Accounts Payable Assistant - Permanent Job - Dublin 22 - Office Based - up to €45k + benefits

Your new company
Your new company is a well known and extremely successful engineering company based in Dublin West. This company offer excellent career progression and are growing at a healthy rate. The role will be based in the office full time.

Your new role
You will report into the Accounts Payable Manager, joining a team of 9 Accounts Payable Specialists. Each AP specialist looks after a company subsidiary and is responsible for processing up to 100-200 invoices per week, 3 way matching with POs and delivery dockets. You will also create the payment file for the payment runs to be approved by the AP manager. On top of that you will set up new suppliers, deal with supplier queries and carry out supplier account reconciliations. You will assist with month end for eg. accruals and other tasks.

What you'll need to succeed
This client is happy to meet with candidates who have 1+ years' experience and candidates who are highly experienced in Accounts Payable, the most important thing is that candidates have the right attitude, can work in a fast-paced environment and work well as part of a team. Strong excel and sage experience are preferred but not required.

What you'll get in return
You will be rewarded with a generous salary between €28,000 - €45,000 depending on experience, pension, study support, flexible working hours (in the office) and free parking onsite. Excellent opportunities to progress your career also.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

.

Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.

Job Description

Responsibilities
  • Develop and execute a bi-annual business plan for your book of business in order to achieve and exceed your sales quota.
  • Deliver a sales approach to activate, grow and close new business consistently with new advertising prospects and customers for LinkedIn, working closely with our Partners & your Client Solution Manager.
  • Deliver a consultative sales approach that answers Key Decision Makers marketing objectives, while also implementing a tiered service approach to deliver growth.
  • Use a data-driven led approach to client activation, growth, creating and tailoring narratives and strategies specific to the industry and country in which you work on
  • Attend relevant product, sales and business trainings, remain abreast of all upcoming product solutions and explore our various suite of products across LinkedIn in order to deliver a cohesive sales approach to your clients
  • Provide updates to the management team on your pipeline and sales forecast
  • Travel may be required up to 10%

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of client relationship management or sales experience.
  • Business fluency in English Dutch

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience of working with high growth clients.
  • Experience of using insights to drive commercial success.
  • Experience of working in a target-driven environment.
  • Ability to carry and hit quota incorporating complex sales cycles in a competitive advertising marketplace.
  • Ability to drive results and collaborate with major customers, creating relationships across many levels of a client.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and evolving environment
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience

About Us

LinkedIn was built to help people achieve more, and every day millions use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our mission is to connect the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful and our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. We help businesses grow, we transform lives through innovative products and technology and we strive to help our employees find their passion and purpose in this vision. Join us in changing the way the world works.

At LinkedIn we are committed to attracting and hiring diverse talent into our organisation. While you may feel you don’t fit 100% of our qualifications, we encourage you to not let this hold you back from applying if you believe this is the role for you.
All Dublin jobs at LinkedIn are available under our ReturnIn Scheme, for people returning to work from family or care responsibilities. This will include extra support through interview stage, and if successful, an extended induction according to your needs. To access the scheme just let your recruiter know that you're a returner when you apply.

Description


Health & Safety Manager needed for Dublin City building project - Permanent - €70,000 / €75,000 DOE

Your new company
largest multinational construction business operating nationally with expertise and experience in the delivery of many of Ireland's flagship infrastructural and building projects. With best-in-industry capabilities, we help public and private sector clients reduce carbon emissions and enhance sustainability over the lifecycle of their buildings and infrastructure.
Now looking for a talented health & safety manager to join their team on an ongoing Dublin City based building project. This project is the construction of 216 apartments aimed primarily at serving the demand for high-end accommodation in Dublin's booming private rented sector. The concierge-serviced development will comprise a mix of one- and two-bedroom units complemented by an onsite gym, multipurpose rooms and retail space at street level. The scheme will also include some 13,000sq ft of landscaped communal space.

Your new role
You will oversee a group of health & safety officers/advisers and will be expected to carry out the following on a day to day basis:

  • Energy and drive to deliver high levels of HSE performance
  • Appetite to be part of a successful HSE team
  • Actively coach and promote HSE to on-site teams
  • Objectively evaluate construction activities against business standards and legislation
  • Ability to walk alongside the Project Management Team to understand programme and risk profile associated with future works in order to provide support and effectively control
  • Actively engage with the operational team to commend HSE working methods or gain improvement
  • Have the skill to take HSE documentation and reduce content whilst maintaining all essential elements
  • Take a toolbox talk/briefing and engage with a team so that the message clearly lands and constructive feedback is collated
  • Have incident investigation experience and be able to work with the Project Management Team to create accurate reports identifying learning opportunities
  • Maintain a professional relationship with client representatives
  • Be dedicated to the role with a 70:30 split between workplace and site office
  • Be an active participant in the wider business HSE community


What you'll need to succeed

  • At least 5 years industry experience, including large construction site exposure
  • Ability to manage a small junior team
  • Recognised HSE Degree or Diploma
  • Awareness of environmental legislation
  • Effective IT skills
  • Fluent English and eligible to work in Ireland
  • Strong time management skills


What you'll get in return
Opportunities! Opportunities to work with a great team on some of Ireland's largest and most exciting construction and civil engineering projects. Opportunity to develop your skills to the highest industry standards while earning competitive salaries.

They are committed to its employees and offer strong competitive salaries along with benefits such as; 8% pension contribution, health care program, Learning and Development opportunities, further education, company vehicles (depending on the role), opportunities to travel, bike to work scheme, company laptop, company phone, flexible working arrangements and many more.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Unum Carlow is an ambitious, innovative Technology Centre working as a global team to drive digital transformation. Unum is one of the world's leading employee benefits providers.
We are seeking individuals to join our team of talented IT professionals. If you thrive working in an agile, fast-paced, and delivery-focused environment Unum is for U.

General Summary:
Software Engineer 2 are responsible for the building and/or configuration of software solutions within their business portfolio with little to no oversight and exhibit a mastery of the application and technical skillset subject matter expertise for their area of responsibility. They ensure software is delivered to high quality standards by collaborating with their agile team members and by leveraging unit testing and continuous integration. They are able to accurately estimate work required to deliver software features. They use critical thinking skills applied to solution design and implementation for the delivery of business value. The Software Engineer 2 role may mentor Software Engineers and Associate Software Engineers.

Must have

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science is preferred, or equivalent relevant business experience
4+ years experience with demonstrated success in software development or equivalent experience
.NET framework experience
C# or Java
Clearly demonstrates analytical ability and critical thinking skills
Takes a logical, analytical approach to problem solving and pays close attention to detail
Experience with Agile Development Methodologies, CI/CD, Devops
Self motivated and results oriented
Takes an innovative approach to problem solving
Able to solve complex technical problems and drive system optimizations
Demonstrates strong focus on quality delivery and delighting customers; holds self to high standards of delivery
Demonstrates good oral and written communication skills.
Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.

Nice to have

Financial Services / insurance experience preferred
Knowledge of developing web services and REST APIs.
Experience with JS
Automated testing experience
Experience of Test Driven Development (TDD)

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Responsible for the estimation, design, implementation, and maintenance of new and existing features for the existing portfolio of applications for a business area. Able to complete complex feature development tasks.
Responsible for communication and collaboration with key stakeholders in the delivery of features
Design, codes, configures, unit tests, maintains, and documents software deliverables using agreed upon standards and tools. Leads sizing and estimation activities within the agile team.
Communicates daily with the Scrum Master or Team Lead and the Agile team on progress made and planned progress for the coming day and reports any impediments that are blocking their progress
Participates in code reviews and sprint retrospectives; ensuring their ideas for team continuous improvement are communicated so that the overall process and team can improve sprint by sprint and readily receives feedback for self-improvement. May lead parts of same.
Focuses on delivering business priority and value at all times
Responsible for ensuring the quality of existing and new features through both manual and automated testing and use of continuous integration techniques, where practical
Demonstrates an interest in software architectures and seeks to design solutions in alignment with Company stated architecture and standards
Leads proof of concept work and prototyping when necessary
Collaborates with Business Analysts to confirm understanding of business requirements relating to features to be delivered and to help the Business Analyst define requirements that can be delivered from a technical perspective
Collaborates with User Experience (UX) designers to ensure designs produced can be translated efficiently into working solutions for feature delivery
Collaborates with the agile team to establish the definition of done for each of the stages of production within the team
Collaborate with Test Engineers and Senior Test Engineers to ensure that software meets the definition of done; ensuring successful transition of work to the next stage of production during the sprints
Ensures an innovation culture in the team by continuous improvement of deliveries and participates in evaluating new processes and technologies that can be applied to future feature delivery
Collaborates with Technical Support Engineers to transition software features to a production environment ensuring that the deliveries meet application performance criteria, release standards; and ensures application and system stability.
Automates testing of software to industry standards of software automation ensuring very high quality application/solution delivery and efficient regression of existing features
Ensures that the latest project progress is known to the agile team by ensuring Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools are up to date and participating in daily standups outlining progress made, progress planned and detailing impediments
Thinks with the mind of the end customer at all times, ensuring solutions seek to improve the customer experience and delight their customers.

Role Description

The Fund Accounting Associate is a member of the Fund Accounting team who will be primarily responsible for overseeing the NAV production process and ensuring accurate and timely calculation of the NAV in line with procedures. They will be a point of contact for collaborating across functions. The Fund Accounting Associate will work with team members and team managers to ensure all issues are resolved in a satisfactory manner.

The Fund Accounting Associate will also be required to work closely with the wider AIS line of business (Investor Relations, Compliance, Internal Audit, Private Equity and Real Estate) in addition to 2nd line of defence partners.
  • Responsible for the timely accurate calculation of the NAV.
  • Ability to investigate & validate NAV movement.
  • Assist the team to ensure production and review of the daily/weekly/ad hoc/monthly NAV production.
  • Adhere to and ensure adherence to a defined control environment.
  • Identification of risks and implementation of remediation on the same.
  • Contribute to ownership and responsibility of the end to end NAV Operating model.
  • Manage resource planning of the team while partnering with wider teams.
  • Assist in Client Due Diligence visits along with Internal and External audit reviews.
  • Be a key driver and unwavering advocate to deliver best in class services internally and externally
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders, clients, third parties, as well as with other business groups across JPMorgan
  • Understanding of Alternative investment fund types across multiple jurisdictions
  • Adhere to JPMorgan's established processes and procedures
  • Strive to modify / iterate processes and flows to continually improve accuracy, reduce redundancy, and mitigate risk
Qualifications
  • Experience in a Fund Accounting Team at this level
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • In-depth knowledge of the treatment of complex financial instruments in the NAV and NAV drivers.
  • Strong Client management skills and ability to build key relationships.
  • Team player, professional and proactive approach to work, positive attitude with an ability to communicate across multiple sites
  • Very strong communication skills both oral and written
  • Strong organizational skills with a drive for impeccable quality
  • Ability to work with a high level of precision in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
  • Ability to work independently with strong follow through
Job Requirements
  • Bachelors degree required (business discipline preferred)
  • Significant experience in the Financial Services industry, preferably with prior experience in alternative funds

As the EMEA Tax Manager you will join Aptiv’s global tax function in Dublin. Your role as the EMEA Tax Manager will be to assist with tax structuring/planning, tax audits, income tax accounting, reporting, and compliance for Aptiv with a leading focus on German companies.

You will have the opportunity to work on tax structuring, transfer pricing, accounting, and reporting activities on other entities in the EMEA region.

The co-location of core global finance teams in Dublin will mean you get broad exposure to all aspects of a multinational finance function through your involvement in the numerous cross-functional projects of which tax are a part. As an EMEA Tax Manager you will have the opportunity to travel to Aptiv’s German offices located in Wuppertal, Tornesch, and Niederwinkling.

Your Role

Assist with the company’s strategic tax planning involving global allied transactions and assist with the implementation of tax planning strategies and other financial arrangements.
Assist with the management and over-seeing of tax controversies in EMEA.
Work closely with local finance teams and EMEA tax and finance staff to ensure timely, accurate and complete preparation of quarterly and annual US GAAP tax reporting requirements under ASC 740 and drive tax provision consistency and best practices,
Review of tax reporting submissions to ensure that they reflect proper application of US GAAP ASC 740 principles, tax structuring actions, and the consistent application of intercompany transactions for Aptiv’s companies.
Coordinating and training of local finance teams on the US GAAP tax reporting procedure and assisting in the clarification of tax accounting and reporting issues.
Assisting with the management of the tax return process, which are outsourced to third party providers. Review provision-to-return calculations and communicate the impact of return filings to the Aptiv tax provision.

Your Background

A recognized professional accounting qualification and a recognized German professional tax qualification is required.
5-7 years plus tax experience, ideally with both big 4 public accounting and industry experience.
Familiarity with international tax and transfer pricing principles.
Fluent German and strong proficiency in English required (English is the business language in our finance and tax group).
Strong time management and organization skills with the ability to meet strict deadlines for US GAAP reporting needs and manage a number of projects at any one time.
Willingness to travel (may require up to monthly travel to Germany).

Aptiv Rewards & Advantages

Competitive compensation package including; Bonus Potential, Healthcare, Pension & TaxSaver schemes.
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.
Recognition for innovation and excellence.
Opportunities to give back to the community.
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world.

Depositary Service Product Development - Risk Strategy - VP

JP Morgan Chase

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/

Depositary Services

JPMorgan is one of the world's largest Depositaries with over US$2.3 trillion of assets under depositary. The business is part of the Securities Services organisation and is critical to the success of the Custody and Fund Services enterprise, operating primarily in EMEA and the USA.

The Depositary Services business oversees that clients' funds are managed in accordance with applicable regulations and policies, ultimately acting on behalf of the funds' investor base. This involves regular oversight and on-going monitoring of the funds' investment activities, governance, appointed service providers including 3rd parties, and other fiduciary activities. The business is in the early stages of a strategic transformation programme, which will introduce fundamental changes to its technology infrastructure, approach to its daily activities, and organizational structure. The initiative is being managed in close partnership with several other areas within the Securities Services organization.

The business is recruiting for a Vice President in the Risk Strategy Team within Depositary Services Product Development, tasked with driving transformational change in the Depositary risk assessment framework. This is a front office role that will require pro-active partnership with business specialists, operational support teams, technology groups, vendors, legal & regulatory specialists, risk and control partners, and other project stakeholders to drive change within the business.

The Primary Responsibilities Of The Role Are To
  • Critically review and challenge the current risk assessment operating model to propose a streamlined risk assessment framework across the business. Build risk assessment toolkits aligned with the nature, scale and complexity of the fund strategy and organisation of regulated clients:
  • Direct the relevant stakeholders including functional leads, depositary managers and technology partners to implement an EMEA wide Depositary Services risk-based approach able to dynamically inform the scope of our fund and client oversight model
  • Manage and contribute to multiple projects establishing and delivering strategic risk-based approach to core Depositary processes & connected strategic initiatives
  • Own the end-to-end delivery of the strategic vision for 1st line of defence Risk and Metrics Framework
  • Proactive leadership in defining and implementing risk-based metrics across functional processes
  • Ownership and implementation of risk framework
The Successful Candidate Should Have
  • Enthusiasm and drive to effect significant, transformational change across all levels of the business
  • Confidence to challenge existing processes and proactively put forward constructive proposals
  • Ability to influence key stakeholders
  • Background in depositary and/or risk desirable combined with a strong overall understanding of the key oversight functions i.e. Custody, Fund Accounting, Transfer Agency & Investment Management.
  • Working knowledge of AIFMD and UCITS.
  • Significant experience in project, change management, process design.
  • Effective research and analytical proficiencies
  • An ability to work collaboratively in teams.
  • A demonstrated ability to be curious; interpret, analyse and explain complex financial regulations; identify risks and requirements; and drive change.
  • A demonstrated ability to combine similar complex requirements to form practical solutions that can be communicated and implemented in straightforward terms.

Maintenance Technician Cork

Main duties and responsibilities :

  • Maintain site process equipment (including site utilities). Replace and repair defective mechanical, electrical and pneumatic equipment when and where necessary. .
  • Carry out scheduled Preventative Maintenance (PM's) on process equipment in order to prevent unscheduled equipment downtime.
  • Schedule with production personnel required shutdown works in order to minimize the impact on production schedules.
  • Liaise with all Maintenance, Production, Service, Quality and any other CWS personnel, to meet the company’s gaols and objectives..
  • Always adhere to site safety protocols. Ensure safe work practices at all times, risk assess work tasks when required. Liaise with site safety personnel (QESH) and participate in Safety and technical/production team meetings as required.
  • Support and help sustain 5S/Lean initiatives across the site.
  • Liaise with contractors and schedule works while ensuring that all follow CWS protocols.

Skills :

  • Ability to solve mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic issues on various production and facility equipment
  • Ability to troubleshoot mechanical breakdowns by reading and interpreting electrical/mechanical schematics & service manuals

Education / Work experience :

  • Preferably Mechanical/Electrical Trade Qualification or work in a similar role with over 5 years’ experience
  • Working knowledge within a Food/Pharma or commercial laundry environment an advantage but not essential
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work on own initiative and as part of a team
  • Working knowledge of lean tools such as 5S an advantage but not essential.

Job Title:    Sales Developer /Merchandiser

 

Reporting to:   Sales Manager for Britvic Ireland

 

 

The Purpose of the Role:

 

To raise the awareness and heighten the profile of the clientâ€™s brands within a given territory, by the achievement of Client key result areas and targets.

Description

Overview:

If you are passionate about computer technology and eager to develop a career in technology sales, Quest is the place to be. Within  Support Renewals, we are looking for an  Inside Sales Coverage Renewal Representative  to work as part of a team based in  Cork, Ireland.

 

Quest  provides end-to-end solutions that enable more affordable and accessible technology around the world, empowering people everywhere to do more. You will be part of a collaborative team that believes in honest communication, shares creativity and welcomes different perspectives. There is a winning culture built on a platform of integrity and a spirit of innovation. We will also provide the mentoring, training and opportunities for you to fulfil your ambitions and potential.

Responsibilities:

The primary responsibility of the  Inside Sales  Coverage Renewal Representative  is to maintain and grow revenue with our existing customers. This is inclusive of managing current renewals, upselling prepaid maintenance and reinstating lapsed customers. The Inside Sales Renewal Representative will create strong working relationships with the Quest Software sales team, and other internal teams, to ensure complete customer satisfaction.

 

  • Achieve quarterly assigned sales quotas
  • Maintain accurate forecast and activities for assigned region in the CRM (Siebel & Salesforce)
  • Effectively defend against competitive pressures and uncover additional opportunities
  • Take an account management approach to identify co-termination and reinstatement opportunities
  • Interface with Quest Software Renewals Management, Technical Support, and Business Unit teams to help ensure customer success and timely feedback being returned to the business leadership of Quest Software
  • Build knowledge on a specific technology solution area such as security, database or systems management products.  You will stay up to date on our new technology and support offerings which will enable you to increase your sales to your customers.  A successful individual will develop relationships with his / her peers in field sales, technical support or with the product managers to ensure customersâ€™ needs are met.
  • Work independently managing full sales cycle to close
    • Leverage cross-functional resources to achieve results/meet customer needs
    • Partner with other members of the Renewal team and with field sales to support in the selling process
Qualifications:
  • Required
    • Fluent in English and French
  • Advantageous
    • Bachelorâ€™s degree
    • 2+ years of inside sales, renewal or account management experience (software related industry is preferred)
    • Strong organization skills with an emphasis on territory management
    • Excellent PC and internet skills with a strong understanding of Microsoft Office (specifically Outlook and Excel)
    • Experience working in a fast paced environment; must be a motivated self-starter with the ability to handle a high volume of e-mail communications and out bound calls
    • SaaS sales and customer success experience a plus

Description


Health & Safety Advisers wanted for Dublin OR Kildare project(s) - Permanent - €50,000 / €60,000 DOE

Your new company
You will be joining the largest multinational construction business operating nationally with expertise and experience in the delivery of many of Ireland's flagship infrastructural and building projects. With best-in-industry capabilities, we help public and private sector clients reduce carbon emissions and enhance sustainability over the lifecycle of their buildings and infrastructure.
They are currently seeking a health & safety adviser for a Dublin based project and another health & safety adviser for a Kildare based project.

Your new role
You will report to the project EHS Manager and will be expected to carry out the following:

  • Energy and drive to deliver high levels of HSE performance
  • Appetite to be part of a successful HSE team
  • Actively coach and promote HSE to on-site teams
  • Objectively evaluate construction activities against business standards and legislation
  • Ability to walk alongside the Project Management Team to understand programme and risk profile associated with future works in order to provide support and effectively control
  • Actively engage with the operational team to commend HSE working methods or gain improvement
  • Have the skill to take HSE documentation and reduce content whilst maintaining all essential elements
  • Take a toolbox talk/briefing and engage with a team so that the message clearly lands and constructive feedback is collated
  • Have incident investigation experience and be able to work with the Project Management Team to create accurate reports identifying learning opportunities
  • Maintain a professional relationship with client representatives
  • Be dedicated to the role with a 70:30 split between workplace and site office
  • Be an active participant in the wider business HSE community

What you'll need to succeed

  • At least 5 years industry experience, including large construction
  • Recognised HSE Degree or Diploma
  • Awareness of environmental legislation
  • Effective IT skills
  • Fluent English and eligible to work in Ireland
  • Strong time management skills


What you'll get in return
Opportunities! Opportunities to work with a great team on some of Irelands largest and most exciting construction and civil engineering projects. Opportunity to develop your skills to the highest industry standards while earning competitive salaries.

They are committed to its employees and offer strong competitive salaries along with benefits such as; 8% pension contribution, health care program, Learning and Development opportunities, further education, company vehicles (depending on the role), opportunities to travel, bike to work scheme, company laptop, company phone, flexible working arrangements and many more.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
