Description

Overview:

Add an annual turnover of $22.5 billion to a rental and leasing fleet of more than 1.7 million vehicles spread across 9,500 locations worldwide and you get Enterprise Rent-A-Car â€“ a business thatâ€™s grown into the largest global mobility provider in the world.

 

Join us, and after an initial virtual classroom-based orientation session, youâ€™ll be assigned to a branch office for hands-on business training. Here you will learn valuable business skills from capable mentors who were once in your shoes. Thatâ€™s because nearly all of our full-time employees started as a graduate in our Management Training Programme, including our current CEO.

 

This allows everyone to learn our business from the ground up and to understand how they play a significant role in seeing it succeed. Our promote-from-within culture ensures that youâ€™ll have a well-rounded training experience and learn skills in management, finance, operations, sales and customer service.

 

As you progress, increasingly more opportunities will become available to you. You can choose, as most people do, to continue your rewarding ascent within our Rental Operations managerial track. Then - in as little as two years from joining as a graduate - you could become a Branch Manager, in charge of your own team and your own profits. Or you can explore one of many other exciting options within Enterprise including Human Resources, Accounting, Revenue Management, Sales, Marketing and more.

 

What is certain is that we encourage all of our employees to be the best they can be, and diversity is a priority in all areas of our business. We have been included in The Times list of Top 50 Employers for Women for sixteen years in a row, and have been honoured with many other awards along the way.

 

Enterprise is also still family-owned â€“ our CEO Chrissy Taylor is the third generation of the Taylor family to run the company. This allows us to look forward even more confidently to the future, providing the stability we need to pursue the long-term good for our business, our employees and our customers, even in these challenging times.

 

As you are considering a position with Enterprise, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today â€“ and every day â€“ the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response,  please visit the Enterprise Rent-A-Car website.

 

Responsibilities:

As a Graduate Management Trainee, you are empowered to make business decisions that greatly affect your career as well as the bottom line. Youâ€™ll gain responsibility for developing new business and maintaining current relationships. Youâ€™ll be responsible for understanding cost control, reading your branchâ€™s P&L statement and understanding what it takes to run a profitable business. You will also learn how to deliver exceptional customer service.

 

We will teach you how to effectively communicate, influence, and interact with all types of customers, vendors, and colleagues. Youâ€™ll learn proper sales techniques, problem solving strategies and conflict management. Those skills will provide you with the opportunity to market to local business partners and build solid, long lasting relationships with key business decision makers. In your development to become a successful manager at Enterprise, youâ€™ll learn how to mentor, train, develop, manage and promote staff of your own. In turn, weâ€™ll reward your development with pay increases and opportunities for continued promotions.

 

Qualifications:
  • A Bachelorâ€™s degree is preferred; however, professional experience can be substituted if applicable.
  • You must have a full driving  licence, but we do make accommodations for applicants who donâ€™t drive due to a disability.
  • No drug or alcohol related offence on driving record within the last five years is permitted.

Additional Information

  • Regardless of your socio-economic background, university attended, subject studied and degree attained, Enterprise will always look at how you perform against our competencies and will judge you on that alone.
  • Please let us know about any accommodations you may need to participate in our recruitment process.
  • Please limit your application to only one job posting based on where you live and/or plan to work. Applying to multiple locations will delay your application being processed.
  • This job posting is for applications within the following locations: Drogheda.

The Global Customer Operations Manager (m/f/d) will be having a global operational client responsibility in collaboration with the respective Strategic Account Manager for the assigned client. The Global Customer Operations Manager is responsible for successful long-term management of strategic clients across multiple sites and organizational units, developing and expanding the client relationship at the tactical level. The Global Customer Operations Manager is the first point of contact for the client and all internal departments of all operative activities. In this role you will directly report to the Vice President Customer Operations located at Werum head office in Lueneburg (Germany).

Your role in our team
  • Dedicated global responsibility, oversight & coordination of all operative activities for one strategic client of Körber Pharma Software and the entire MES Program
  • Functional & organizational consultancy for the costumers MES program
  • Functional responsibility for the customer operations and the assigned global program leadership team
  • Establish a support and communication structure for all internal & client-facing operational activities
  • Coordination of regional Körber Pharma Software teams and global expert teams as well as involved partners
  • Account development in cooperation with Strategic Account Manager
  • Opportunity and risk assessment
  • Relationship management internal and external
  • Client Communication/ Account/Performance Review
Your profile
  • Several years of successful experience within the operational Program Management arena in a similar role, e.g. MES Program Manager, Account Director or comparable
  • Several years of working experience for an IT services company
  • Excellent numerical, literacy, and written skills
  • Being able to communicate effectively and build relationships at all levels
  • Holding excellent organizational and project management skills and be able to prioritize your own workloads without supervision
  • Fluent English
  • Willingness to travel for a significant percentage of time
  • All non-EU candidates must hold a valid Visa or work permit enabling them to work in Ireland and across Europe on a full-time basis
  • A valid driver’s license is required
Your benefits
  • Flexible work times in the office or working from home
  • Work in a global organization with international customers and colleagues
  • Lean hierarchies and open door culture
  • Good team spirit globally and locally
  • Opportunities for personal development enabling attractive career paths as you work in interesting,
  • challenging and varied projects
Recruitment Team

Job Title: Estrella Galicia Brand Ambassador


Location: Nationwide


Estrella Galicia is the result of the Rivera family’s passion for beer. A tradition that goes back four generations to produce something extraordinary. Estrella Galicia have been brewing and packaging their beers since 1906 in Galicia in northern Spain, the brewery is independent, and family owned and run.


The Opportunity:

Passionate and want to make an impact?

We are recruiting a game-changer who wants to make a real impact in the on-trade and off-trade markets in Ireland. This will be a field based role but will also include utilising the Carlow Brewing Company facilities at Carlow and Dublin in learning, presenting and showcasing our products and our story to the customer audience and opportunities open to us.


The Ideal Candidate:

Your role is to champion, support and educate staff and consumers in the off trade and in high profile and leading on-trade bars, pubs and restaurants, working with customers to create impact and promote flavour, culture and preference with a globally recognised beer brand. You will also have an active role in all brand activation events to promote the beer to trade and consumers.


You’ll be a natural self-starter, with prior experience of premium on-trade bars and restaurants, with the ability to plan your time, multi-task and prioritise being essential. You will thrive on making relationships in your area, championing quality and first-class service and delivering impact to on-trade venues and their customers by sharing your knowledge and passion and rolling-out campaigns and bespoke packages to support.


You will also play a pivotal role in supporting the Carlow Brewing sales team in gaining new stockists.


You will receive extensive training and personal development opportunities and the support of your manager to help you be the very best you can be.


Skills and Experience

  • We are looking for candidates with strong communication and influencing skills, who are self- motivated and able to plan and work a varied work pattern
  • Certificate/Diploma in Sales & Marketing or related field
  • You should excel at working both by yourself and as part of a team
  • Have natural enthusiasm and the tenacity to continue achieving and learning from your experiences
  • Ability to report and present data and reports
  • Confident in presenting and talking to people with a real drive for quality
  • If you are bright, articulate, hard-working, a self-starter, passionate about beers and want to grow, we’d love to hear from you.
  • Demonstrated commitment to building strong business relationships.
  • Full Driving Licence essential
  • Previous experience of working in the on-trade and/or brand management and promotion within the FMCG industry
  • Flexibility to work some evenings weekends as required


Salary: Commensurate to experience


Other Benefits: Laptop, Phone and Vehicle will be provided

Tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Take ownership of new projects from concept through to deployment
  • Help develop new features to support business needs

The ideal candidate would have at least 2-3 years of front-end and back-end development experience.

Salary available €55,000 - €65,000 per year depending on experience. RSU and Relocation Package available.


If you would like to know more about this opportunity, feel free to contact Parm Shergill directly.

Description

Job Description

Our Team Vision

Tenable has vast quantities of data that holds the potential to significantly increase the security of our customers (> 50% of Fortune 500). We need to build a scalable data platform that can ingest and process security data (Terabyte - Petabyte) from a wide range of sources and make that data and resulting insights from Machine Learning algorithms readily accessible to power Tenable applications (Tenable.AD, Tenable.OT, Tenable.io).

Your Role

We are looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. Focused on designing, developing, and maintaining state-of-the art solutions for the data processing services within Asgard, our new analytical platform. As a Staff Software Engineer on the Data Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to be part of designing, implementing and maintaining highly scalable and reliable cloud-native microservices using modern technologies and programming languages.

Your Opportunity
  • Act as a technical leader helping to design and build a highly scalable analytical platform to process Petabytes of data.
  • Work with some of the most cutting edge technologies at scale (kotlin, AWS Lambda, AWS Batch, Spark, Athena, Redshift, Snowflake, Sagemaker,....)
  • Work cross-functionally with other engineers, UX designers, product owners and various Tenable teams to build data products
  • Promote clear and simple software design while actively driving the team toward better practices and solutions
  • Support a true DevOps / CICD software delivery model
  • Lead POC’s into new technologies that could improve how and what we build.
  • Work closely with the Data Science team to automate innovative data science solutions
  • Promote high quality, aimed at areas such as security, reliability, testability and maintainability
  • Drive innovation by contributing new ideas for our processes, tools, and technologies
  • Help to create and maintain the Data Engineering roadmap in collaboration with the team
  • Coach and mentor mid-level and junior staff
What You’ll Need
  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or a directly related field, or equivalent work experience
  • 8+ years of software development experience, including experience with leading projects
  • Experience developing in languages such as: Java, Kotlin, Python, or Go, and a willingness to learn new languages as needed
  • Experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, EMR, Kafka, Hive, Presto, Athena, Airflow
  • Experience designing and developing distributed pipelines for real time data processing
  • Experience with Big Data processing within cloud environments, ideally AWS
  • Experience with relational and non-relational data stores
  • Experience designing and developing Restful APIs
  • Accountability for the behavior of your software in production
  • Experience coaching and leading mid-level and junior staff in the design, implementation, and execution of highly technical development projects
  • Experience in working in an Agile team, and an enthusiasm for working collaboratively within and across product teams
  • The ability to work independently and as a part of a team, and to lead/drive projects as necessary
  • The desire to continuously learn and be exposed to new technologies
Why our engineers love working in Tenable (based on survey results):
  • We have all been directly impacted by cyber attacks. The mission we have as a company around cyber exposure means what Tenable does, really matters. The work we are doing will continue to contribute to improving our customers' cyber security, ensuring our most sensitive data is protected.
  • The flexibility to work from home is something that is really important. While other companies offer this, it is something that is at Tenable’s core. We have done it for a long time and we have the processes and technology to support it.
  • Tenable is a company that has enormous growth and continues to grow yet we still have a start-up feel where each Engineer has the opportunity to make a big difference to the future direction of Tenable. This is great in that we can all make a difference and have significant opportunities for career progression in an exciting and growing company.
  • Cybersecurity is cool (different than the standard marketing/advertising/retail/… industries) and it is getting more and more mainstream attention as people become more aware of the importance of data security and the implications of data breaches.
  • Our Engineers really like that innovation is at our core and we invest heavily in events such as INIT and innovation day to help nurture our innovative spirit’s. As engineers we have the opportunity not only to build our future products but also influence what those products will be.
  • Cyber Exposure is a new category within cybersecurity and this means we are now encountering and solving long standing problems in the cyber security industry that no other company has been able to solve. Luckily we have access to the best tools and petabyte scale data lakes with the richest data sources to help us on our journey. Our Engineers enjoy the diverse and challenging problems we solve on a daily basis.
  • Our Engineers feel that our collaborative spirit is very strong and we can actively collaborate with incredibly talented individuals and teams with diverse skill-sets and this helps us to solve the challenging and exciting problems we face whilst developing our own skills. One Tenable is our core value and we live by this on a daily basis in Engineering.
  • We are committed to cloud technology (AWS) and have access to a long list of bleeding edge technology’s plus the more conventional (Kafka, Spark, Kubernetes, CockroachDB, Presto, Scala, Kotlin, Python, Tableau, Elasticsearch, S3, Aurora, Redshift,…..)
  • We have an open culture where Engineers are free and expected to challenge the norm. This is how we grow and improve.
  • We are committed to our Engineers development and there is a very generous allowance available for study, conferences, …
  • Not everything is perfect but we have a culture where engineers can help us continue to grow and improve.
If you’ve reached this point in the job description and feel you’re still not sure if you should apply…Just do it! We know there are no perfect applicants. You may not have 100% of all those bullets listed above - and that’s okay. If you’re feeling like you’re not going to fit in with our teams - that’s not okay. We're One Tenable which means however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, we encourage you to submit an application if it’s a role you can be passionate about doing every day.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

Global Payroll Manager – Financial Accounting Advisory Services:

Our client is one of Ireland’s leading professional services firms. We are currently seeking a Global Payroll Manager on a permanent basis to join a growing team which has grown from rapidly over the last couple of years.

Job Description:

· Utilising in depth payroll knowledge and experience to support clients in short and medium term project engagements on domestic and international payroll e.g. payroll provider transitions, payroll process reviews, audits and short-term staff shortages

· Supporting clients in assignments to design tailor made solutions.

· Maintain and develop existing and new client relationships to ensure our partnership is real.

· Onsite and offsite client support with delivery of their domestic and international payrolls.

· Dealing with day-to-day client employee queries on domestic and international payrolls.

Job Title: NPI Programme Manager

Location: Drogheda, Co. Louth


This is a maternity contract and would be the ideal role for a certified project manager from an NPI (New Product Introduction) background to advance their career in a fast-growing Irish organisation.


Role Overview:

The NPI Programme Manager will be responsible for leading a cross-functional product team in a fast-growing organisation to deliver new products and formats. Working alongside a cross-functional, global team, they will aim to meet strategic objectives through the delivery of a programme of work with multiple projects running in parallel, managing the full project lifecycle from initial concept through to deployment, production and launch. They will be responsible for all schedules, budgets, resources, and deliverables for WaterWipes Innovation and Renovation projects. They will manage the customer relationship at a senior stakeholder level and while they may have some day-to-day project delivery responsibility, they will typically be managing a small team of project managers. They will need knowledge of the larger landscape without neglecting granular details while tracking project health and risk, resolving issues, maintaining standards and monitoring scope and project quality.


Key Role Responsibilities


Portfolio Management:

  • Manage and develop pipeline/portfolio of NPI projects, life cycle management of the programme (multiple products)
  • Drive successful (on-time and on-budget) delivery of a portfolio of projects, through proactive management of dependencies, issues and risks 
  • Creating and managing programme plans
  • Manage programme scheduling and gap closure requirements
  • Achieve scope, schedule, and budget requirements
  • Maintaining programme objectives
  • Identifying and resolving issues and risks
  • Implementing change practices
  • Maintaining budgets
  • Reviewing project metrics across the entire pipeline/portfolio, identifying potential problems and resolving or escalating
  • Reporting monthly on the health of the portfolio, calling out hot spots, issues, and projects needing attention
  • Leading Stage Gate Reviews
  • Ensuring compliance with WaterWipes Stage-Gate & S&OP processes 
  • Support commercial teams where needed with new product/market launch

Team Leadership:

  • Team leadership of 2 x Project Managers and 1 x Administration Assistant
  • Leading team meetings and setting expectations for PM and extended project teams
  • Manage resource planning and staffing activities for specific projects
  • Clearly communicate roles, expectations, and accountabilities to the team
  • Drive accountability within the core and extended for schedule and project deliverables
  • Be a resource to facilitate the resolution of project issues
  • Guide, coach, direct, and develop direct reports

Process Development

  • Effectively manage multiple new process development projects/activities 
  • Ongoing review and challenge of existing processes, implementing continuous improvement changes as needed
  • Implementing change practices

Stakeholder Management:

  • Managing WaterWipes stakeholder relationships across the business, from SMEs, project team members, external partners up to Senior Executive level

Strategy Management:

  • Assist commercial teams in developing long-term product portfolio vision and strategy
  • Provide input to and oversee the execution of the strategic plan, monitoring, and adapting as needed

This is not an exhaustive list and may be subject to change and amendment. 


Education & Qualifications

  • Minimum of 8 years experience in a similar role
  • Technical Degree and/or Masters' or equivalent
  • PMP (or equivalent) certification required

Skills & Expertise 

  • Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple projects and programs
  • Experience in Product/Project Lifecycle implementation
  • Experience working within new ERP implementation projects
  • Strong experience building and nurturing relationships with multiple stakeholders at all levels of the business up to the executive level
  • Proven leadership skills. Demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional teams of all levels (local and global) and to effectively influence without authority 
  • A passion for continuous improvement 
  • Strong communicator - you proactively and positively communicate with your peers and customers to support and inform
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Strong analytical skills, structured/analytical thinker – can simplify complex problems and issues in an easy to understand manner
  • “Hands-on”, “can-do” and enthusiastic attitude
  • Ability to thrive in a constantly changing, extremely fast-moving environment

Please note: All candidates must have documented evidence of their right to work in Ireland.

About The Role


At Cainthus, we work together on multi-disciplinary teams to develop a state of the art product with computer vision and data science at its core. The Technical Product Manager role is a key role for Cainthus in helping to direct and drive our innovation and product development and ensure product success. 


The focus of the role is to act as the voice of the customer and the business within the Product Development Teams, and to define and prioritize work according to business needs to ensure we can deliver support and maintain our customer solutions. 


In this role, you will report to the director of product management and work as part of the product management team, where you will work closely with product managers and other internal stakeholders.

 

Key responsibilities:


Capture business requirements

  • Understand product vision and business context.
  • Translate business needs into requirements for technical teams.
  • Understand computer vision AI model development and maintenance processes.
  • Develop business requirements in areas such as
  1. New insights based on our computer vision technology.
  2. AI model quality and performance.
  3. Internal AI development tools.
  4. Operational and maintenance processes.


Prioritize work for development teams

  • Work closely with product managers to understand business needs.
  • Capture technical requirements as epics and stories for development.
  • Break down complex items into discrete packages of work.
  • Work with development teams and stakeholders to estimate and plan work.
  • Maintain a backlog of prioritized work for multiple development teams.
  • Maintain a balance of feature, quality and technical enablement work.


Support product development 

  • Identify & manage important dependencies between teams.
  • Work closely with data scientists and ML engineers to troubleshoot issues.
  • Maintain product documentation and related collateral.
  • Communicate decision-making as required.
  • Participate in team meetings as required.
  • Share knowledge within the company.



Additional Responsibilities 

  • Evaluate and prioritize new ideas and potential product features captured from customers and other stakeholders by assessing the value, viability, and feasibility risks with input from commercial and engineering teams;
  • Continuously improve professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies.
  • Be a great team player!


What we’re looking for


  • You should be passionate about what you do, and confident in your abilities.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner in a relevant domain
  • Experience working in software based on AI and machine learning technologies
  • Experience with diverse development methodologies and tools.
  • Comfortable working in an environment with high levels of uncertainty.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, and listening skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner.



What we offer


Joining our team has its rewards. You will be working in Dogpatch Labs, a unique start-up community located in the historic CHQ Building in the heart of Dublin Digital Docklands. Here, you will have the opportunity to attend different events and meetups hosted by the tech community. Our benefits include:


  • Fully paid Group Health Cover for you and your immediate family;
  • Pension Scheme with 5% company matching;
  • 25 days paid holidays per year (21 days flexible and 4 set company days);
  • Generous ESOP Scheme;
  • Flexible Wellness Benefit;
  • Family-Friendly Benefits;
  • Bike to Work and Tax Saver schemes;
  • Management approved education and career development support.

 

About Us

We’re passionate about transforming farming through the use of our technology. We believe in taking ownership and want to be accountable for the work we do. We value transparency. We work together in agile multi-disciplinary teams and collaborate closely with a group of dairy farmers who ensure that our work has a meaningful impact on their farms. We love learning from each other, solving challenging problems, and having fun along the way.

Summary:
Engineering Technician

Permanent

A vacancy exists for a permanent Engineering Technician within my clients Maintenance Team. This role will directly report to the Maintenance Supervisor and is a shift based role. Based within the Dublin manufacturing facility, the overall responsibility of the technician will be to complete all maintenance activities as required on site.

Key responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:

To work as an Engineering Technician and perform the following day to day duties within the Sterile Operations Business Unit to agreed standards and run rates:

  • Machine Changeovers, diagnose and repair machine breakdowns.
  • Complete all CMMS and give support to the operations team as necessary.
  • Develop and update work orders, spare parts.
  • Complete PMs to maintain the equipment and keep accurate records of same.
  • Develop and/or assist in machine improvements and identify and become involved in all continuous improvement's projects aimed at optimizing equipment effectiveness.
  • Maintain all company documentation to the highest GMP standard and ensure all company documentation is completed correctly e.g. work orders, logbooks, autoclave forms, LPRs, training records, plant data books etc.
  • To assist in developing and maintaining an appropriate spare parts stock.
  • Compile and participate in shift handover meetings to ensure continuous smooth running and proper communication of issues.
  • Engineering Technicians should be cross trained, interchangeable and flexible to cover maintenance activities relating to other areas.
Skills & Experience

  • You must have completed time as an apprentice and must hold the appropriate trade certificates.
  • Minimum 5 years relevant industrial experience working as a maintenance fitter/engineering technician within Pharma/Medical Device or Food Production is required.
  • Strong understanding of GMP and a right first time approach is a must.

Microbiologist (Projects)

About The Opportunity

Two contract positions have become available within the QC Microbiology Department within the specialist Projects team. These positions are intended to be dedicated to supporting the introduction of a brand new, multi strength product to Sanofi Waterford. Due to the new product status of the incoming product, the successful candidate would be exposed to a wide variety of technical microbiological subjects including qualification of new build cleanrooms and critical utilities (pharmaceutical water, nitrogen, process air etc), microbiological method verifications and product performance qualifications.

As a member of the QC Microbiology team the successful candidate would also have the opportunity to support additional projects across the site including laboratory equipment qualifications, media qualifications, amongst others.

About Sanofi Business Unit

The multiple national award-winning Sanofi Waterford biopharmaceutical and medical device campus is located in Waterford on Ireland’s southeast coast. Established in 2001 and now with more than 700 employees, the site has seen more than €600m invested in state-of-the-art infrastructure and technology. Diversification continues to bring new products to Waterford and the expanded site portfolio continues to create new opportunities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support of new product introduction for multi strength lyophilised drug product
  • Performance of microbiological testing and qualifications
  • Support the site contamination control strategy by performance of environmental monitoring and HACCP assessments
  • Generation and execution of qualification / verification protocols
  • Generation of reports to summarise the outcome of protocol executions

About You

To excel in this role you will need to have:

Essential requirements:

  • Minimum of 1-2 years’ experience in the GMP pharmaceutical environment
  • Minimum of a degree (Level 7 or 8) in applicable biological or engineering field of study, however relevant experience can be considered in lieu of a degree qualification
  • Experience in microbiological method verifications (bioburden, endotoxin, sterility) a distinct advantage
  • Experience of qualification of cleanrooms and / or critical utilities a distinct advantage
  • Experience of manufacturing in the aseptic environment a distinct advantage
  • Strong technical knowledge of relevant regulatory and industry guidelines for aseptic manufacturing and microbiological studies

What Sanofi Can Offer You

  • A role where you are instrumental to creating best practice and as the organisation grows, you can too
  • We offer a generous package including flexible benefits, and are committed to helping you have a healthy work-life balance throughout your career with us
  • A newly refurbished gym is available onsite
  • You will be based in our Waterford site which is accessible from M9
  • Parking available onsite
  • This is a full time role and we support flexible working

About Sanofi

Empower Life Everyday

At Sanofi we work across human health from vaccines to rare diseases, and consumer healthcare. This creates opportunities to work across different areas to build a diverse and exciting career. Sanofi has the capabilities and resources to support your aspirations to fulfill your ambitions and be the best you can be.

Our purpose at Sanofi is to work passionately every day to understand and solve healthcare needs of people across the world. Our ambition is by 2025, to be a top 3 innovative, global and diversified human healthcare company. One that embraces transformative technologies and is focused on its area of excellence, which means we’re not there to try to solve everybody’s problems. We want to focus on those areas where we know we are making a difference.

The values we are live by are teamwork, courage, respect and integrity.

We are proud to have been awarded Global Top Employer 2021.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Description

Delivery Station Manager

At Amazon we treat every single day like its day one. And we never sit still while we do it.

Are you up for crafting solutions and solving tomorrow’s problems today?

Then we have the opportunity for you!

We’re seeking a Delivery Station Manager to join our Amazon Logistics team. You’ll operate out of one of our dynamic Delivery Stations: they are at the heart of Amazon’s rapidly growing Operations and Logistics network: they’re where we sort and process our parcels. They’re also where we developed our industry-leading workflows.

As a Delivery Station Manager, you’ll deliver inspiring, supportive leadership for the teams you lead. But at the same time, you don’t shy away from rolling up your sleeves and getting involved whenever necessary.

You’ll be directly responsible for developing a team of Area Managers and their direct reports: meanwhile, you will report to the Senior Operations Manager. The quality of your leadership is key to success in this role: you’ll tactfully motivate and inspire your teams to do their best work, while planning schedules and activities that balance their needs with that of the business.

Another key aspect of the role is to lead on numerous process improvement projects, with the aim of streamlining all activities, both for yourself and the team members you lead. The ideas, innovation and leaps out of the status quo that you come up with could very well be rolled out across the Amazon network: this immense opportunity is yours for the taking.

Job Description

Your role will be pivotal in the overall management, control, organisation and direction of the Delivery Station. Your responsibilities will include, amongst others:

Maintaining Health and Safety standards within your remit area, while promoting and inspiring a culture of safety on-site,

Become proficient on specific, larger-scale processes and activities within Delivery Stations, such as 5S audits,

In your inventory control and systems environment, you’ll handle meaningful data collection, updating operations metrics on an hourly basis,

Therefore, you’ll aim to achieve productivity targets, reduce cost per unit, eliminate errors and ensure an excellent customer experience,

Partnering closely with other support teams (HR, Finance, Facilities, Safety and Security, IT) on staffing plans, schedules and performance levels,

Implement progressive process change and contribute in cross-functional Six Sigma initiatives within your site and the broader Amazon EU Operations network,


Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Description

Amazon's Customer Service (CS) department is seeking an experienced Market Research Program Manager to join the EU CS Data, Insights and Design team. Our mission is to amplify customer feedback and empower the business to continuously improve the customer experience. As a Market Research Program Manager, you will be responsible for defining and executing on a comprehensive market research roadmap spanning a broad set of experiences and involving multiple types of concurrent user research. Research activities will span from generative work (field work, development of customer models and persona building), evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation), to summative research (interfacing with market research to parse through and translate market segmentation data). From a customer perspective, your goal is to highlight and solve Amazon practices that drive unintended consequences or undesirable responses from customers to improve customer satisfaction rates across multiple journeys and customer personas. From a CS perspective, your goal is to bridge the gap between the needs of the business and how our CS associates interact with customers in order to drive quicker and lasting adoption of policies and processes for an improved customer and CS associate experience.You will bring customer insight in to the business that helps leaders make decisions quicker and bring more knowledge regarding customer nuances in countries.

We are looking for an individual contributor who will be responsible for employing best-practice methodologies in order to obtain timely user/system insights. Your insights will inform decision-making and you will regularly interact with our business partners, project/program management and CS leadership to identify relevant research questions, design and implement insightful research studies. You will disseminate and inspire action from the results, ultimately shaping the EU CS experience on behalf of our customers and associates.

Key Responsibilities
  • Defining the direction and roadmap for the program whilst gaining consensus and clear alignment across Amazon business and CS functions
  • Leading large and high impacting projects across EU CS with multiple or overlapping areas
  • Owning the end-to-end research process, implementing and documenting new and improved research approaches, methods and processes
  • Performing data analysis to determine key findings and recommendations
  • Conceiving creative ideas that are outside-the- box and deliver top-quality, innovative, cohesive deliverables that are customer-focused, simple and intuitive
  • Identifying the best method or mix of methods to address research questions, with consideration for timeline and resources
  • Regularly looking outward to identify opportunities for improvement and to incorporate advancements in user research methods and tools
The Ideal Candidate Will Have
  • End-to-end experience with all aspects of the user research lifecycle (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting, communicating, budgeting research)
  • Hands-on experience with: lab-based user testing, remote testing, concept evaluation, field research, and survey design
  • Experience in best practices for user research and knowledge of what approaches work and which don’t
  • The ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
  • The ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously and multi-task in an agile environment
  • A clear passion for making a positive impact on customers’ lives through your work

Basic Qualifications
  • BA/BS in psychology, sociology, anthropology, human computer interaction or related discipline
  • Proven success conducting user research, hands-on experience in survey design is a must-have
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables with a focus on quantitative methodologies
  • Extensive experience operating as an individual contributor in a user research role.
  • Experience in customer profiling/creation of personas whilst considering psychological/emotional aspect of experience and processes
Preferred Qualifications
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with users of all ages and diverse backgrounds
  • UX Research experience in EU markets
  • Experience in conducting user research for Customer Services
  • Experience in emotional analysis and design
  • Speaking additional languages is also of benefit

Arvato Supply Chain Solutions is part of Bertelsmann. We combine the advantages of a global corporation with the reliability of a family-run business. We take care of our 15.000 employees in more than 20 countries who profit from a wide range of benefits and professional development programs.

Job Title : Logistics Operator (Level 2)

Job Code : H3GO_L2

Department: Telco

Reporting to : Telco and On Demand Business Operations Manager

Main purpose of job : Handle and control of all materials in a safe, accurate and efficient manner and provide optimum material & build supply service to production. To provide a quality shipping service to the client in accordance with customer & Arvato requirements

Main Tasks/responsibilities
  • Offloading, checking & put away of all goods received from vendor’s internal & external.
  • Pick & issuing of all material’s as required, maintenance of call off program
  • Handling/storing & all movement of all goods within the logistics area in a safe, efficient and controlled manner.
  • Printing from SAP daily shipping requirements, shipping off SAP. “Real Time”
  • Buddy check of all material movement.
  • Cross training.
  • Liaise with and support departments with reference to material availability & movement – call off‘s shortages & recommits etc.
  • Documentation & control, metrics & reporting
  • Issuing of shipping instruction to freight forwarders - booking carriers, admin, delivery confirmations, delivery service, communications etc.
  • Carrying out regular cycle counts/physical inventories.
  • Maintain & adhere to the highest level of inventory accuracy within internal warehouse – maintenance interim bins, system integrity.
  • Ensure & improve a high level of safety & housekeeping standards are maintained throughout logistics – use of reach & counter balance - wearing of PPE.
  • Ensure working within all company policies & procedures & adherence to security regulations.
  • Stock Management - Material Obsolescence – Purge Process.
  • Cost Reduction – consolidation of requirements materials, transport & services.
  • Assist with queries relative to logistics in a co-operative and timely manner - escalation procedure.
  • Obtain P.O.D.’s as required by client services, finance or other relevant departments in a timely manner.
  • Assist in continuous development & improvement process within the H3G business area.
  • Other duties as may be required
Other
  • Based on your current job role, or any role assigned to you by your manager, you will have access to the arvato and the customer data that is relevant for the completion of your role. You are not entitled to access, or seek to access, arvato or customer data that is not directly associated with your job role. You must treat arvato and customer data in line with our Data Classification processes but if in doubt you should default to treat all arvato and customer data as private & confidential. You must comply with all Security & IT Policies in relation to the protection of arvato and customer data
  • You will comply with Internal Policies & Procedures and with our ISO certification requirements, specifically ISO 9001; ISO 14001 & ISO 27001.
  • You will be required to be flexible in this role and must be prepared to perform other tasks and undertake additional duties in any area of the business as determined by Management. These tasks may be outside your normal work area
  • You will ensure compliance to the conditions of the Wholesale Distribution Authorisation and Good Distribution Practice.
  • You will comply with the requirement of the QMS for Arvato Ireland.
Essential Requirements

 Technical Competencies
  • Relevant experience in a similar role
  • Relevant stores/shipping experience
  • Knowledge of good stock keeping procedures & systems
  • PC Literate
  • ERP Systems experience
  • Communicative English (Written & Oral)
  • Numerical Skills
Behavioural Competencies
  • Initiative
  • Solution Orientation
  • Collaboration
  • Organisational Commitment
Desirable Requirements
  • SAP knowledge & experience
  • Experience working in a high tech environment
  • Knowledge & experience of Six Sigma processes & procedures
  • Fork truck driving certification & experience

Description


Senior EHS Adviser need for Dublin City building project(s) - Permanent - €65,000 / €70,000 DOE

Your new company
You will be joining one of Ireland's leading general building contractors.They have successfully completed circa 1,000 projects (and counting) in both the public and private sectors. These projects range in value from €5m to €80m across commercial, pharmaceutical, educational, healthcare, residential and industrial sectors. In addition to the standard procurement approach, they are a multi - disciplinary business and also operate on a design and build and PPP basis.
Currently recruiting for a Senior Health and Safety Adviser. The role will be based in Dublin and the successful candidate will report directly to our EHS Manager.

Your new role
Reporting to EHS Manager, you will be expected to carry out the following on a day to day basis:

  • Plan and coordinate training and maintain records.
  • Review sub-contractors' Safety Statements and Safety Compliance.
  • Lead & promote a positive culture in relation to all health, safety and environmental work practices.
  • Identify areas of risk and develop risk assessments/measures to reduce and control.
  • Conduct weekly audits, safety inspections and tool box talks.
  • Investigate/report accidents and incidents on-site ensuring relevant accident information.
  • Communicate at all levels with project stakeholders.
  • Keep updated with current policies and procedures.
  • Communicate with Senior Management and Site teams on Health and Safety requirements for site.
  • Implement Method Statements and assessments.
  • Provide information to support pre-qualification requirements for various clients.
  • Maintain PPE Stocks, ensuring staff are well equipped for site work.
  • Delivering Health & Safety induction programmes for new employees or contractors working on site.
  • Ensuring all Health & Safety documentation is current and up to date at all time.
  • Involvement with Senior EHS Manager in maintaining ISO 45001 and Safe-T Cert Accreditations and Standards.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Degree qualification or its equivalent in Health & Safety
  • 5+ years in a relevant position - ideally with construction industry experience.
  • Strong report writing and computer skills essential
  • Full Driving License.
  • Highly organised with strong communication skills

What you'll get in return
While offering a base salary of circa €65,000 - €70,000 (depending on exp.), they appreciate the value of hard work, professional working practices and high standards and in return can offer an excellent overall package to the right person. All applications are treated in the strictest confidence.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Global Reinsurance Group have a newly created permanent opportunity available for a Senior Financial Accountant. The successful candidate will be a Qualified Accountant with at least five year post qualified experience working in the Insurance or Reinsurance sector. This position is currently remote working. In the future this role will be a hybrid of remote working and Dublin office based.

Role overview

The Senior Financial Accountant is responsible for financial accounting, budgets, financial reporting and aspects of regulatory reporting, who ensure that the respective entities financial results are accurately recorded and fully analysed.

Key Responsibilities

Participation in quarterly closing process and Group financial reporting
Integration and reconciliation of underwriting data into general ledgers
Ensure financial reporting is accurate, complete and appropriate for group and segment reporting
Responsible for reinsurance underwriting system reconciliations
Assist with the management and support of service providers responsible for booking underwriting transactions
Prepare and analyse all accounts and the general ledger records
Prepare quarterly group reporting disclosures and regulatory reporting inputs
Responsible for reviewing bank reconciliations and proactive cash management
Participate in key finance systems initiatives and implementations
Development of SOX documentation
Act as point of contact for Internal and External auditors
Prepare ad-hoc analyses and financial reports as required by the CEO and Board of Directors

Qualification and Experience required

Professional accounting qualification is required with a minimum of 5 – 8 years of post-qualification experience
Extensive experience working in the Reinsurance or Insurance sector is required
Proficiency in Irish GAAP and/or IFRS for insurance and reinsurance
Familiarity with US GAAP, particularly in relation to differences to local GAAP for reinsurance transactions
Working knowledge of regulatory capital standards and reports including Solvency II

For more details please get in touch with Elaine Liston on 0863516302 or apply on line for more details.

This is a new Biologics QC laboratory so this role presents a great development opportunity for someone with the appropriate skillset and experience to play their part in the technical set up and development of the laboratory.

Responsibilities of the role :

  • Support the set-up of the new Laboratory by working with the relevant stakeholders, vendors and suppliers on equipment
  • Participate in analytical method transfer/validation to the Bioassay laboratory
  • Knowledge and experience in some or all the following is an advantage; Inhibition of Proliferation assay, Potency assays, Binding assay, Maintenance of cell lines for cell-based bioassay, ELISA and Western Blot
  • Protocol generation and review – method Transfer / validation.
  • Creation and revision of training material for the bioassay laboratory.
  • Perform laboratory investigations to determine root cause and Implement of appropriate corrective and preventative action.
  • Review and approval of bioassay analytical data.
  • Ensure that all laboratory operations are carried out in compliance with EHS, cGMP and regulatory commitments
  • Participate in risk assessments, inspections, audits, incident investigations, etc. and implement and follow-up on corrective / preventative measures.
  • Maintain data integrity and ensure compliance with company SOPs, specifications and cGMP regulations.
  • Promote and participate in the implementation and maintenance of relevant safety programmes.

 

Qualifications;

Here are the minimum qualifications and essential functions for this position:

  • BSc in Science or equivalent qualification
  • Additional qualification in Biopharma Science an advantage
  • 1-2 years of  relevant experience working with a variety of bioassay and aseptic  techniques in a GMP laboratory within the biological and/or pharmaceutical industry.
  • Previous experience in the transfer and qualification of Bioassay methods.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and testing experience in an FDA/HPRA approved QC laboratory
  • Experience in regulatory audits
  • Good working knowledge of QC Systems and Trackwise
  • Excellent communication skills and strong team work credentials
  • Self-motivated and able to prioritise
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Positive, can-do attitude

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

The Trial Capabilities Associate provides clinical trial capabilities in support of clinical development. The associate is accountable to ensure the investigator sites meet requirements to enroll study participants into clinical trials and support ongoing activities during site maintenance and close-out. The associate is responsible for obtaining clinical trial authorizations and ethical approvals, execution of the budget and contract, and activities related to clinical finance, records management and site training. The associate will ensure inspection readiness through a complete, accurate and readily available Trial Master File. Additional local responsibilities may be required as needed/appropriate for the local geography and/or to cover regional differences.

Primary Responsibilities

This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the job requirements at the time it was prepared. The job requirements of any position may change over time and may include additional responsibilities not specifically described in the job description. Consult with your supervision regarding your actual job responsibilities and any related duties that may be required for the position.

Clinical Trial Responsibilities
  • Initiate investigator site activities, including collection and submission of regulatory documents, customization and negotiation of informed consent documents, serve as the point of contact for a site’s ERB and Competent Authority (CA)(where applicable), communicate and negotiate budgets with site personnel and internal teams, negotiate and obtain fully-executed contract, track and ensure site compliance to required training, and effectively drive timelines aligned with company priorities
  • Communicate directly with sites to enable start-up and maintain an active collaboration with sites during maintenance and close-out
  • Identify, communicate, and resolve issues
  • Ensure country specific regulatory and data privacy requirements are incorporated into submission documents and any other documents/systems
  • Leverage previous site / review board engagements to efficiently drive new work
  • Populate internal systems to ensure accuracy of trial / site performance
  • Understand and comply with procurements, legal and financial requirements and procedures
  • Populate Trial Master Files and libraries for future reference
  • Provide feedback and shared learning for continuous improvement
  • Leverage trial prioritization
  • Anticipate and monitor dynamically changing priorities
Minimum Qualification Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree preferably in a scientific or health related field, two years clinical research experience or relevant experience preferred
  • Fluent in English and Italian
  • Understanding of the overall clinical development paradigm and the importance of efficient site activation
  • Applied knowledge of project management processes and skills
  • Appreciation of / experience in compliance-driven environment
  • Ability to learn and comply with financial and legal guidelines and policies (budget and contract)
  • Effective communication, negotiation, and problem solving skills
  • Self-management and organizational skills.

SAP Order Management Functional Support – Senior Consultant

How will you build a better working world?

Our SAP practice is experiencing an exciting period of growth. We are interested in hearing from experienced SAP professionals who would like to take their careers to the next level.

EY's global SAP practice now totals more than 19,000+ dedicated SAP professionals in over 150 countries and we are investing heavily in S/4HANA, Ariba, IBP, SuccessFactors, Concur, GTS, SCP, and other new SAP solutions. We are helping our clients to tackle their most difficult challenges by implementing SAP solutions that enable business transformation and deliver real value for our clients. We operate local and remote teams across multiple locations, we design and build global solutions with variations to meet local requirements and we deploy these in ways that maximize value for our clients.

The Opportunity

We are recruiting for a large global SAP S/4HANA implementation being delivered from Dublin.

Amongst a variety of exciting career opportunities available within our SAP practice, we are seeking an experienced SAP Order Management Consultant at Senior Consultant level to join our Dublin SAP team.

As a Senior Consultant in EY, you will become a key member of our SAP team. Your role will be focused primarily on the delivery of SAP services to a large global client implementing SAP S/4HANA. Secondary focus will be on support and broader practice development. In this role, you will help develop high-performing individuals and teams, leading and supporting them to deliver exceptional client services.

Your Key Responsibilities
  • Participating in design workshops to gain a clear understanding of our client’s industry and business requirements
  • Learning about accelerators such as SAP Model Company or EY’s Pre-Configured Industry Solutions for potential use as design accelerators on client engagements
  • Producing key project deliverables including, design and configuration documentation, functional specs, data migration specs, test scripts, training materials etc.
  • Support and drive standard SAP solution adoption across the Order-To-Cash business processes
  • Developing and testing detailed functional / technical designs for business solution components
  • Supporting the planning and management of client projects throughout all phases – Prepare, Explore, Realize-Build, Realize-Test, and Deploy
  • Sharing knowledge of best practice within the SAP team and across other firm disciplines, as well as developing other members of the SAP team
  • Supporting the development of the SAP practice, including leading internal team activities, supporting sales activities, and facilitating client events

To qualify for the role, you must have
  • A third level qualification in Business, Technology, Engineering, or a related discipline
  • SAP certification
  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience in SAP Order Management implementations in a Consulting or similar external client facing environment
  • Experience with, or demonstrable understanding of, S/4HANA Order Management or OTC best practice processes, key benefits, and implementation scenarios
  • Knowledge of functional areas like Vistex, quality management (QM), materials management (MM), warehouse management (WM) and finance and controlling (FI-CO).
  • Proven experience in designing and configuring SAP EWM processes – including SAP EWM design and configuration and integration with other third-party systems
  • As this role may require international travel at times, proof of EEA work rights will be required at interview stage

What Working At EY Offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
  • Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise, and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities, and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now.

Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

Booking Holdings Financial Services (hereinafter “BHFS”) is based in Dublin, Ireland and provides financial services in the form of payment services and e-money products across all the brands. BHFS is committed to conducting its business in compliance with applicable laws, regulations and guidelines, with integrity and to the highest ethical standards.

Job Overview

Booking Holdings Financial Services, is building out a finance team with experience within a regulated financial services environment, helping to deliver a world-class payments operation to support Booking Holdings Inc’s brands globally. The company is seeking to hire a Senior Financial Accountant into the team. Reporting to the Financial Controller the successful candidate will be part of a finance team responsible for both the day to day financial operations of the Irish business as well supporting new business initiatives across the company. The team will be responsible with ensuring BHFS is in compliance with all its regulatory and statutory responsibilities from a financial control and oversight perspective and will partner with both internal and external service providers to ensure a strong internal control environment. The team be accountable for the delivery of timely, complete and accurate financial statements and management reporting and supporting financial analysis, and will support the local executive team in pursuit of the company’s objectives.

Responsibilities and Duties
  • Ensure the timeliness, completeness and accuracy of financial statements in accordance with general accounting and corporate standards.
  • Ensure all payment operations and treasury activities and associated reconciliation controls are completed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Ensure all intercompany reconciliations are completed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Delivery of local and corporate management reporting and financial analysis.
  • Support both Internal and External audit review processes.
  • Support all Statutory, Regulatory and Tax reporting for the business.
  • Support the Accounts Payable and Inter-Company billing processes.
  • Budgeting and Forecasting.
  • Partner with both internal and external service providers who support the business.
  • Support finance and accounting requirements of local Holding entity in Ireland.
  • Ensure a strong internal control environment within the finance function.
Qualifications And Experience
  • Qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA)
  • 3rd level degree or equivalent preferred
  • 5 plus years experience
  • Experience of working in regulated financial services. Ideally within Payment Services but not essential.
  • Knowledge of IFRS, Irish Statutory & Tax reporting requirements.
  • Good knowledge of MS Office and Financial ERP (SAP) systems.
  • Excellent financial analysis skills
  • Excellent writing, communication, verbal and written, and organizational skills.
  • Eager to learn new technologies and ideas. Comfortable navigating complicated and nuanced issues.
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a fast paced team environment.
About BKNG

Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. At Booking Holdings, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world every day through seamless technology powered by our six major brands:
  • Booking.com
  • KAYAK
  • priceline
  • agoda
  • Rentalcars.com
  • OpenTable
Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

Securing your Future!

Build the future of digital identity! HID Global’s Extended Access Technologies business area (EAT) embeds trust into the world of digital devices with innovative authentication technologies. Every day, we create the most innovative global authentication solutions for a variety of customer applications. We are a diverse, multi-disciplined, growing multinational technical company that offers its employees a fun work environment, flexibility and career opportunity. We are the Evolution of Authentication.

What you will be part of:

HID Global powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places and things. We make it possible for people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely. Our product and services are used by millions of people around the world to navigate their everyday lives.

Working at HID:

HID Global is an innovative fast-paced organization, with many possibilities to make a difference and add value. We empower our employees to achieve great things by taking ownership of their future career.

We value diversity and endorse an open-minded collaborative working environment. We are a company with integrity at our core. HID Global is an ASSA ABLOY Group Brand.

The Position :

HID Global’s Extended Access Technologies business area (EAT) is building out a new Lean-Agile Center of Excellence (LACE) team that is driving the EAT Lean-Agile business transformation and optimization including the implementation of Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe). This new role, Business Change Manager, will lead and manage continuous improvement initiatives and business enabler epics, with a focus on business efficiency and scalability within the business area, and provide coaching for the EAT business cultural adoption of DevOps.

This dynamic role will report directly to the Senior Manager and has a wide-ranging global area of responsibility and influence for b usiness transformation, business change and continuous improvement across all teams and functions in the business area.

The successful Business Change Manager will coach and train cross-functional teams and facilitate the EAT business implementation roadmap of deployment and refinement of SAFe while delivering maximum customer value in everything that they do.

The role requires reasonable levels of personal flexibility to support the needs of the global business working with geographically distributed teams and includes variable frequency of international travel.

What we are looking for:

The ideal candidate must possess in-depth knowledge of managing multiple concurrent business transformation, change management and continuous improvement initiatives with demonstrable experience of delivering results.

An Agile coach with a growth mindset, the successful candidate will be an effective communicator to cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders, have an eye for detail and be an effective problem solver.

The role requires a Bachelor’s degree or higher or equivalent combination of education and applicable hands-on experience. Project or program management experience in both Agile and Waterfall environments would be advantageous to the role, as would formal qualifications such as SAFe, PRINCE2, APMP, PMI PMP or Lean Six Sigma.

This exciting new opportunity is ideally suited for a motivated candidate desiring directed autonomy and authority to drive business change that makes a real difference.

We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!

On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.

When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

My client is looking for an experienced ServiceNow Software Engineer as a key member of the Agile team driving our Digital Transformation forward with the Technical Product Owner and/or Principal Software Engineer to ensure the delivery of the agile team meets agreed upon architecture standards. They participate in the conceptualization, design, development and delivery of solutions within their business portfolio in conjunction with business area architects. The Sr. Software Engineer will research third party/cloud solutions to ensure successful integration of the technology. They will be deep application and technology skillset subject matter experts.


The Role


Leads the conceptualization, design, development, implementation, and maintenance of new and existing features for the existing portfolio of applications for a business area. Provides technical leadership and direction for EPIC features delivered. Ensure application solution design conforms to agreed upon quality attributes such as performance, fault tolerance. Design, codes, configures, unit tests, maintains, and documents software deliverables using agreed upon standards and tools.  Collaborates with Principal SE and architects on coding standards, processes, tooling and frameworks required for the delivery of features in the sprint or product backlog.  May complete the design of components of an application that supports and advances the reference architecture.  Ensures that solutions delivered by self or team members are secure and scalable, comply with defined standards and best practices.


Actively looks for solutions that are buy over build and are cloud based. Ensures product backlog has appropriate technical stories and participates in their prioritization. Provides ongoing and appropriate mentorship for Software Engineers and Associate Software Engineers. Responsible for application solution quality from design and implementation to deploy and run. Participates in definition and maintenance of software standards. Responsible for communication and collaboration with key stakeholders in the delivery of features.

 

Maintains depth of technical understanding of third party/cloud solutions and implementation of solutions. Evaluates technical impacts from and coordinates implementation of new product releases. Participates in estimation activities within the agile team. Communicates daily with the Scrum Master or Technical Product Owner and the Agile team on progress made and planned progress for the coming day and reports any impediments that are blocking their progress.  Participates in code reviews and sprint retrospectives; ensuring their ideas for team continuous improvement are communicated so that the overall process and team can improve sprint by sprint.

Responsible for ensuring the quality of existing and new features through both manual and automated testing and use of continuous Integration techniques. Demonstrates an interest in software architectures and seeks to design solutions in alignment with Company stated architecture and standards. Participate in Proof Of Concept work and prototyping when necessary. Collaborates with Business Analysts to confirm understanding of business requirements relating to features to be delivered and to help the Business Analyst define requirements that can be delivered from a technical perspective. Collaborates with User Experience (UX) designers to ensure designs produced can be translated efficiently into working solutions for feature delivery.


Collaborate with Test Engineers and Senior Test Engineers as to ensure that software meets the definition of done; ensuring successful transition of work to the next stage of production during the sprints. Contributes to an innovation culture in the team by suggesting improvement of deliveries and participates in evaluating new processes and technologies that can be applied to future feature delivery. Collaborates with Technical Support Engineers to transition software features to a production environment ensuring that the deliveries meet application performance criteria, release standards; and ensures application and system stability. May serve in a Scrum Master role for an agile team. Automates testing of software to industry standards of software automation ensuring very high quality application/solution delivery and efficient regression of existing features. Ensures that the latest project progress is known to the agile team by ensuring Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools are up to date and participating in daily standups outlining progress made, progress planned and detailing impediments.

 

Experience

 

Degree in IT or similar. 2+ years of ServiceNow experience. Strong experience of test driven development (TDD) and unit testing, leveraging automation tool-sets. Good experience in continuous integration. 6+ years experience in software development and delivery track record in a range or roles in a scrum environment.  Takes a logical, analytical approach to problem solving and pays close attention to detail.
