Company Profile:

OpenSky a European challenger brand to the large global software consultancies, delivering innovation across Government, Transport, Environment and Health sectors in the Ireland and the UK.

Due to business growth, OpenSky has a role for an Office Administrator based in our Naas, Co Kildare headquarters on a permanent part-time basis – approx. 20 hours per week over 4 days. This an excellent opportunity for an experienced professional to utilise their skills and experience in an international working environment working with innovative technologies and solutions.

Why Join our Team:

OpenSky is a dynamic, exciting place to work. We hire exceptional people, and every one of them is empowered to think independently, take initiative and be innovative in their job. We are committed to ensuring that our performance and reward strategies are designed to effectively support our employees at every opportunity and offers an excellent work-life balance.

At OpenSky our employees enjoy the creative, agile and meaningful work they do, the resources and technology they have access to and the benefits we offer. The projects we work on make a real difference, and that’s what makes us distinct in our industry. This very factor means that our employees get to work with the latest and emerging technologies.

We’ve built a truly unique culture here at OpenSky, where our employees are always learning, challenged with interesting projects and rewarded with fantastic benefits. We attract talented individuals from a wide range of cultural, geographic and educational backgrounds whom bring with them a rich variety of skills and experiences.

Our plan is simple; we hire the best people whom possess the skills, talent, expertise, experience and motivation that we require and when we find them, we help them grow, develop and achieve their goals.

The values we share help us to thrive and succeed, both as individuals and as a team. If you share those values, you’ll fit right in!

The Job:

We are currently looking for an Office Administrator who will be an enthusiastic culture bearer and advocate for our people experience. Reporting to the HR and Operations Manager, this individual will manage the in-office facility needs as well as provide administrative support to management and staff, focusing heavily on building a flourishing people experience in the office.

The position is the backbone of the Ireland office and instrumental in making sure everything in the office operates smoothly on a daily basis. We need a creative, enthusiastic and organised individual who is ready to not only preform daily administrative tasks but also present ideas to make our head office a more engaging and welcoming environment. The individual will be working on a permanent part-time basis – approx. 20 hours per week over 4 days.

Key Tasks:

  • Providing administrative support to the Manager, Team and wider office.
  • Being a point of contact for staff for all office related queries eg. office supplies, maintenance issues, booking of meeting rooms etc.
  • Research and is proactive around improving office efficiency or cost savings and able to present ideas with context and clarity.
  • Reporting, data entry, and keeping track of visitors as well as answering calls/emails
  • Dealing with ongoing office related matters
  • Ensure meetings are set up efficiently and provision of catering as required
  • Setting up meetings, company events and making travel arrangements
  • Manage incoming and outgoing post, couriers etc.
  • Understand, serve, and advocate for the needs of our onsite and virtual teams.
  • Liaise with building management/security/facilities services providers, phone and IT
  • Manage office supplies and place orders.
  • Promote a clean, organized, and efficient workspace - including the coordination of an ongoing cleaning service.
  • Actively participate in workplace optimisation and presentation
  • Collaborate with Finance department in allocation of petty cash, receipts, invoices, PO’s etc.

Essential Skills:

  • A minimum of 2-3 years relevant experience in a similar role
  • Qualification in Secretarial/Office Administration or equivalent
  • Computer literate with strong Microsoft Office suite skills
  • Excellent oral & written communication, word processing, dealing with email and telephone enquiries
  • Experience of establishing and maintaining effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to work effectively as part of a team, while also being able to carry out his/her own work under minimal supervision
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Highly organised and flexible with strong attention to detail
  • An enthusiastic person able to work under pressure to work in a busy office
  • Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams

Personal Skills:

  • A strong, high performing work ethic with a focus on personal development and clear goal setting
  • Accurate and organised methods of working
  • Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal English
  • Ability to work autonomously and on own initiative
  • Motivated self-starter with experience in a fast moving and fast scaling environment
  • Required creative thinking and personal initiative
  • Organised with advanced documentation skills
  • Excellent time management, organisation, presentation, and prioritisation skills
  • Highly organised with ability to multi-task, work to deadlines and deliver under pressure
  • Open-minded, proactive self-motivated team member
  • Self-confident individual with strong interpersonal and communication skills

The above statements are not an exhaustive list

What we Offer:

You will form part of a high-performance team, working together to deliver projects of national and international importance changing the way large Business and Governments work.

  • Competitive Salary – market adjusted
  • Continuous Professional Development
  • Education Assistance Programme
  • Company Pension
  • Incremental Increases in Annual Leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
  • Annual Health Screening
  • Employee Referral Scheme
  • Ethical Employer
  • Friendly, fast paced atmosphere
  • International working environment in a growing company
  • Work with innovative technologies & solutions
  • Microsoft Dynamics & Personal development programmes

Please note we do not require the assistance of third parties

OpenSky Data Systems is an equal opportunities employer

Part-time hours: 20 per week

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Experience:

  • Administrator: 2 years (preferred)
  • Microsoft Office: 2 years (preferred)

Work remotely:

The opportunity

This position is project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for voltages at 110kV and 220kV, new 220/400kV GIS and cable replacements and HVDC.

These activities cover all works associated with the development and design phase for individual schemes, through to construction and commissioning of new capital investment works, modifications to existing transmission lines and plant, specialist engineering studies, maintenance works and the development of tender documentation for competitive tendering purposes.

Your responsibilities will include:
Overseeing the project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for transmission lines at 110kV and 220kV, new 220/400kV GIS and cable replacements and HVDC projects.

Developing and deploying project controls and planning strategies, processes, procedures and systems to ensure effective - integrated scope, cost and schedule planning. The development and agreement of project baselines (scope, cost, time). Efficient progress measurement and earned value management reports. Change management and control. Development of reports, KPI’s and dashboards.

Directing a team of planning and scheduling engineers.

Liaising closely with the commercial and risk functions to ensure an integrated approach to scope, cost, resource and schedule control.

Providing periodic project and programme level report.

Driving and ensuring compliance with adopted processes and procedures.

Training and supporting staff in techniques, system and tools.

About you

You have a proven track record in the delivery of projects in electricity transmission and distribution. You have experience in interface with internal/external customers. You have experience in project management of schedule, budget, risks and issues for high-value projects. You have proven ability to work with stakeholders, internal and external parties, e.g., equipment suppliers, manufacturers, service providers, professional bodies, and work within a strong team-working culture. You have a proven ability to communicate complex technical or commercial issues to peers or senior management. You have proven experience in writing clear and concise documentation.

You have a degree qualification or HND/HNC in a technical subject. You are a member of a relevant institute. You are digitally savvy, can build lasting client relationships and provide support to strong, motivated teams. You will have experience in project management and be hungry to grow your career and enjoy the opportunities Mace has to offer.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.

Job Overview

TE Connectivity (NYSE: TEL) is a $13 billion global technology leader. Our connectivity and sensor solutions are essential in today’s increasingly connected world. We collaborate with engineers to transform their concepts into creations – redefining what’s possible using intelligent, efficient and high-performing TE products and solutions proven in harsh environments. Our 72,000 people, including over 7,000 engineers, partner with customers in over 150 countries across a wide range of industries. We believe EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS –

Creganna Medical is ranked among the top 10 global companies in the medical device outsourcing industry. The company specializes in the design and manufacture of minimally invasive delivery and access devices for a range of therapies. Serving over 400 companies across 30 countries, Creganna Medical’s customers include the world’s leading medical device and life science companies. Headquartered in Galway, Ireland, Creganna Medical has a global operational footprint with design and manufacturing facilities spanning the U.S., South America, Europe and Asia. http://www.creganna.com/

TE Connectivity's Health & Welfare Teams provide or coordinate employee-related health and wellness programs, including medical care, medical screening and health education. They may manage the company's internal employee-oriented medical activities including medical leaves of absence and individual employee health records.

This is a part time maternity role 2-3 days per week.

Job Responsibilities
  • Case management- nurse led; liaise with the Occupational Health Physicians, Physio etc. Organize and facilitate staff referrals to the company doctor as needed. Timely reports to management/ HR/H&S. Referrals to the Occupational Health Physician/Physio.
  • Work in partnership with Management Teams, HR & Employees to minimize sickness absence, and applying best practice to employee welfare.
  • Initiating, maintaining and updating of individual OH records, ensuring confidential, effective and safe operation of manual and electronic systems. Proactively promote good health at work.
Further Duties
  • Organise and administer pre employment medicals/re-deployment health assessments and health surveillance programmes for staff identified by risk assessment.
  • Routine administration of the Occupational Health department such as Vaccination programmes, audiometry testing, pregnancy risk assessments etc
  • Comply with local and global company policies and any other applicable legislative requirement, i.e. GDPR and Health and Safety regulations
  • Co-ordinate health promotion events and support employees with their occupational health needs while at work and advise on work related activities
  • Participate in claims management meetings
  • Manage the onsite Mental Health First Aid Team and act as a referral point to the EAP service
  • First-Aid back up to onsite first aiders to any on-site injuries, and arrange effective prompt follow-up
  • Remain up-to-date on best practices, new techniques and any relevant changes in legislation
Qualifications
  • Registered with NMBI. (Nursing and Midwifery Board of Ireland)
  • H.Dip/Msc in Occupational Health, Safety and Hygiene.
  • Registered with An Bord Altranais
  • Minimum 5 years post registration. Minimum of 3 years in Occupational Health in an industry/manufacturing setting
  • Broad Experience with people and excellent interpersonal and communications skills
  • Excellent PC skills and the ability to multi task is important
  • Strong attention to detail required
  • Preferable previous experience in a Manufacturing Environment
Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability,Teamwork, Innovation

We have an exciting opportunity for a Night Shift Production Manager to join a Leading Food Producer, based in Cork.

Full time, permanent position. 

Competitive salary with a monthly and yearly KPI bonus! 

Annual leave 20 days rising to 21 days after 5 years and increasing 1 day a year thereafter to a maximum of 25 days.

  • Lead daily pulse meetings and ensure Line Sups huddles are effective.
  • Ensure procedures & management routines are implemented.
  • Implement Employee Handbook & Company Values.
  • Identify and resolve employee issues in a timely manner and uphold the principles of respect and dignity at work.
  • Manage the absence and pay review process for production operators.
  • Participate in HR Investigations and Disciplinary hearings as required.
  • Line responsibility as assigned.


Requirements: 

  • Previous work experience at supervisory/management level in a FMCG and/or manufacturing environment.
  • Hands on experience in production in a food processing company would be a distinct advantage.
  • Good people management/supervisory experience.
  • Experience of HACCP/BRC.
  • Business, Financial, Commercial acumen.
  • Results driven with a proven ability to deliver targets and meet deadlines.
  • Decisive, displays sound judgement whilst thinking laterally and innovatively.
  • Learning agility and a continuous improvement orientation.

You will join a small team in a key role as Sales and Marketing Manager.

 

The role will be challenging and varied, and you will support the business development and marketing functions across, Eberdon, our property development company, an independent property development management, asset management and operations management company in the residential rental sector and Amergin, our Chartered Accountancy and Financial Advisory Practice.

 

The focus of your role will be to support the Leadership Team in the formation and execution of the marketing and communication plan, but you will also be involved in other areas of our business as needs arise.

 

As a firm we seek to deliver an exceptional level of service and expertise to our investors and our clients. We work hard to surpass expectations ensuring that our investors and clients are confident and then delighted in the service that we provide. We strive to always ‘do the right thing’ in acting with decency, honesty, and transparency.

 

We are offering the right person a long-term career within the firm with strong potential for career development. The firm operates an ethos of encouraging work life balance and long hours are not a feature of life within the practice. We facilitate both flexi time and hybrid office attendance arrangements. Our city centre office is close to all forms of transport and is surrounded by many beautiful parks, shops, and restaurants.

 

The salary will reflect the experience you bring to the role and will be in line with market rates.

 

 

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Department:     Marketing

Reports to:        Managing Director 

Date Prepared: September 2021

 

Job Duties Include:

 

Ø Support the Leadership Team in the formation and execution of the marketing and communication plan.

Ø Develop and execute campaign plans, pre and post campaign follow up and analysis.

Ø Assist and, in some cases, drive in totality the coordination and smooth running of events, designed to drive sales while taking responsibility for marketing administration.

Ø Work closely with the business divisions to compliment and maximise all opportunities.

Ø Support the development and maintenance of relationships with the client base.

Ø Develop further our website, social media and email channels and ensure required information is maintained up to date.

Ø Identify and implement software to support the automation of the function.

Ø Maintain highest quality and compliance standards.

 

Job Requirements:

 

Ideal candidate will have.

Ø Excellent communication. interpersonal and presentation skills.

Ø Self-motivated and able to meet deadlines.

Ø Strong work ethic.


Qualifications Should Include:

 

  • A marketing qualification or business equivalent is a requirement in this position. If a marketing qualification has not been achieved before the commencement of this position, then you must work towards achieving said qualification.
  • A Property Services Regulatory Authority (PSRA) licence.     

 

In addition, the candidate will:

·       Have three years’ experience in a marketing environment.

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where And Why

Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking an Inbound Sales Development Manager to lead our growing EMEA Inbound Sales team. The right person for this role is self-motivated, a real go-getter, who wants to lead a team responsible for developing and identifying new revenue opportunities with new logos across EMEA.

Who?

This Person Will Also Have

Twilio is looking for a leader who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of leading an inbound sales team.
  • Several years of experience in sales development management.
  • Proven record of sales success.
  • Ability to hire, onboard, and continuously train new Business Development Representatives
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing conditions at a fast-paced, growing company
  • Experience in successfully managing people to achieve performance goals.
  • Robust Salesforce analysis of marketing campaigns.
  • Excellent communication, organizational and time management skills.
What?

As an Inbound Sales Development Manager, you will live Twilio’s Magic Values:
  • BE AN OWNER: Lead, coach, and manage a team of Business Development Representatives to meet and exceed targets.
  • EMPOWER OTHERS: Interview and hire top quality Business Development Representatives to continue to scale the region.
  • RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Drive team and individual execution through strong metric and forecast management.
  • EMPOWER OTHERS: Develop and mentor Business Development Representatives for career growth within the Twilio Sales organisation.
  • BE BOLD: Communicate team metrics and trends to senior sales management while highlighting risks and opportunities.
  • BE INCLUSIVE: Maintain and build on the quality relationships between leadership partners in Sales, Marketing, and Operations while ensuring alignment in strategy and execution.
  • NO SHENANIGANS: Actively use tools like Salesforce to manage sales processes, and set standards for performance metrics.
  • DRAW THE OWL: Build and refine Business Development processes to maximize execution and efficiency
  • WRITE IT DOWN: Monitor key systems and processes to ensure proper operation of the business.
  • NO SHENANIGANS: Analyze campaign and marketing data to make key business decisions.
Why?

The Business Development team is central to Twilio’s continued growth. We work closely with senior leadership and support all levels of the organisation by qualifying leads and creating new opportunities that add pipeline and revenue to the broader sales organisation. You will be joining a team with people who are smart, organised, thorough, and take pride in initiating meaningful relationships with future customers.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This position will be located in Dublin. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

About Us

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

REQ ID: 66542

JOB TITLE: Assisted and Automated Driving Systems Engineer

SALARY: Competitive

LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We’re already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We’re doing more than dream, we’re creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.

What To Expect

The role will be based within the Electrical & Vehicle Engineering (EVE) Centre Of Competence, and part of the Systems team based within the Assisted & Automated Driving (AAD) Department. The Features and system team is an exciting area, designing and delivering new AAD features through definition of the customer experiences, design of the system and validation and confirmation the design meets the customer intent.

The Role is responsible to lead the definition, development and delivery of harmonized systems solutions, consisting of multiple interconnected components into Jaguar Land Rover vehicles for ADAS features.

The role includes the opportunity to design and define the way in which Assisted and Automated Driving Features can support our customers in their everyday journeys, through a combination of driving aids, driving assistance and driving automation. The role will require a customer focussed individual who can provide objective analysis of the user behaviour to support the definition of functional and performance related requirements associated with the features.

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Define, validate and cascade functional and nonfunctional requirements and targets to ensure that customer features provide an experience that customers love for life.
  • Creation of an executable Simulink model that defines the behavior required to deliver a Use Case that supports the creation of an ADAS Feature.
  • Assist and contribute to the generation of targets and verification methods that are driven by Customer, Fuction Requirements and failure modes effects analysis
  • Work with the regulation team to ensure the feature definition complies with new and existing global regulations
What You’ll Need

As the Assisted and Automated Driving (AAD) System Engineer, you will have good relevant experience of working in a Systems Engineering environment. You will have a strong knowledge of Assisted and Automated Driving Systems. Working knowledge of model-based systems engineering. You will have the ability to author and review requirements either through a model or thoughts requirements defined in a structured format such as EARS.

Essential
  • Hold a formal qualification such as degree within, Systems Engineering, Electronics, Computer Science or another relevant subject.
  • Working knowledge of MathWorks toolchain and the creation of modelling artifacts within the MathWorks tools.
  • Knowledge of customer quality process and metrics
  • The ability to log data from a vehicle network.
DESIRABLE
  • Experience in Model-based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
  • Working experience of Agile methods
  • Experience in IBM Rational DOORS
  • Experience in applying Systems Engineering and in solving complex technical issues using a structured approach
SO WHY US?

Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

IPSEN

Ipsen is a dynamic and growing global specialty-driven biopharmaceutical company focused on innovation and specialty care.

We aim to make a sustainable difference by significantly improving patients’ health and quality of life and providing them with effective therapeutic solutions for unmet medical needs through differentiated and innovative medicines in Oncology, Neurosciences and Rare Diseases.

The patient is at the heart of everything we do, and we also care for our employees because they are the ambassadors who truly make the difference. We attract and develop bold, agile, entrepreneurial individuals who take full ownership of their decisions; leaders drawn by a purpose to make a direct impact through their work in people’s lives.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The QC Microbiologist will perform the analysis of samples for API testing, environmental analysis and Water Testing in a timely manner according to approved analytical procedures. A successful candidate will ensure that the analysis is performed in accordance with the Production / Shipping plan and will validate and implement new microbiological methods as needed.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

To perform an analysis such as: API’s, water sampling, environmental monitoring, sterile water and non-routine samples. Growth promotions of media and micro-organism identification and plan work to ensure that it is completed in a timely manner and in accordance with the production and shipping schedules. Analysis is performed according to approved analytical SOPs and as per relevant specification
Result, compile and submit to the Senior Microbiologist / QC Manager in a timely manner and it is important that attention is paid to the detail of the SOP and documentation and peer review for tests such as Growth Promotions and Micro-organism Identifications
Perform and raise any Unplanned Events or Out of Specification results in a timely manner and must inform the Senior Microbiologist / QC Manager immediately of any such events, adhere to the Ipsen safety and environmental policies and participate in and drive continuous improvement projects.

To be considered for the role, you will have a science degree and relevant industry experience and have an ability to work with minimal supervision; to be able to perform under pressure to competing demands and stakeholders; strong customer focus, perform work with highest levels of confidentiality and integrity, demonstrate standard of performance with a track record for delivering results on time and to a high standard.

If you feel that this could be the right next step for you, we would be delighted to engage with your application.

IPSEN is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications, individuals are encouraged to apply regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

RSA & 123.ie
Founded in 1710, we are a 300-year-old organization that is empowering people to put the right things in place to prepare them for their future so that they can live a more fulfilled life free from worry and anxiety.

Built on resilience, expertise and human empathy, we provide insurance that makes people's lives easier. We learn from our experiences and build on our strengths every day to deliver the best products and services in the market. We are always searching for the best protection for our customers with our extensive range of Commercial and Personal Lines products driven by our network of Insurance brokers, scale partners and via our 123.ie brand.

With a global footprint, we have leading positions in Scandinavia, Canada, the UK, Ireland and Middle East. In Ireland, we have offices in Belfast, Galway and Dublin, where we empower our people work flexibly to suit their needs and those of our customers. We know that if we plan for tomorrow, we can truly make a positive impact on people's lives today.

Looking to the future
In order to be there for our customers during their greatest challenges we are looking for like-minded individuals who will embrace our strategy:

Our Vision - our ambition:
 Prepared to make the difference

Our Mission - how we will live our vision:
 Harnessing human expertise with agile technology

Our Purpose - why we go to work every day:
 To empower people

Our Values - our DNA:
 Love simplicity, Better every day, Do the right thing, Boundless ambition
We're looking for people that are open, engaged, curious and striving to make a real difference - not only in their own lives - but in the lives of those around them.


Culture and Community
Culture and community is a key priority within our organization. We strive to create a diverse and vibrant workforce where everyone feels valued and everyone's voice is heard.
In RSA and 123.ie career progression is nurtured and performance is recognized. We help people move forward in life that's why we put steps in place to encourage our colleagues to learn, adapt and grow.

We cultivate an open and transparent culture where people can be their true selves. RSA and 123.ie support a stimulated workforce where individuals feel more fulfilled in their role and more comfortable in who they are as a person. Most importantly, we care about our environment and the communities around us.

We support programmes and events that give back and enhance the lives of the vulnerable and those in need. We have a dedicated Corporate Responsibility programmes that facilitates new ways of thinking to help reduce our carbon footprint, protect our planet for future generations and give back to our communities.

Growth Marketing Manager
The Growth Marketing Manager will develop and implement a data-driven growth marketing strategy to drive growth acquisition for new business. This role will be responsible for end-to-end performance marketing across the customer lifecycle. As a key player in the organization, the Growth Marketing Manager will develop growth campaigns and promotions for Brand communications (ATL), paid media, PPC, CRM and Email. This role will predominantly drive initiatives for our direct brand, 123.ie but also, for RSA channels when required.

The role analyses our digital data through channels and customized research, to help develop offers, promotions and propositions to address opportunities to grow our customer base. We would expect the candidate to have a good attention to detail in analyzing digital data and journeys, as well as a strong creative skill to translate insights into good creative briefs. Presenting with clarity to agency partners, within the team and with stakeholders is a must.

We're looking for a mid-level, self-start who wants to take their career and development to the next level. You will be hands on and an upbeat marketing team member. You will require positive relationship building and go to market management skill. Closely working with channel leads, finance, marketing, digital, pricing as well as an upbeat sales and operations, to ensure successful delivery.

  • The campaigns will focus on generating new customer business and / or strengthening the retention of existing customer business.
  • Develop a portfolio of growth promotions and campaigns and ensure it is in a constant improvement status
  • Be informed of the propositions available for use in RSA group, their Impact and applicability to the Irish business
  • Be informed of the propositions that are used by direct and non-direct competitors in the market, the customer trends towards campaigns and their applicability to RSA channels
  • Be prepared to present professionally and work closely with business partners of RSA and third-party channels to implement the growth campaigns

  • Lead the effective development of the customer campaign, involving finance, marketing, digital, pricing sales, operations, claims and underwriting colleagues, to ensure RSA achieves the required service and performance.
  • Experience in Google Analytics and CRM experience required.
  • Experience in SEO implementation and CMS updates preferable but on the job training will be given.
  • Proactively develop customer data analysis, sales and market / business knowledge, apply standard methodology techniques and tools to improve your performance and exploit RSA's investment in your training and development.
  • Align with the required standards of sales excellence and best practice and operating effectiveness and efficiency, and Group, legal and regulatory requirements.
  • Actively handle the feedback from channel leads
  • Provide monthly reporting on the progress against plan.
  • Marketing Team representative for digital & pricing

  • Degree or master's in Marketing
  • proven track record working in a marking department
  • Effective Marketing and customer understanding
  • Translating insight into opportunity and proposition
  • Google Analytics

At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Field Marketing Manager

Job location: This is a remote position. You can work from home and be located anywhere in EMEA.

About The Team

Do you want to own the strategy for field marketing in EMEA for a global public company recognized as a leader in its market? Are you interested in a role that allows you to work on account-based marketing, demand generation, and regional events? Would you like to interact with brand-name companies? Then this job is for you. Kinaxis® is revolutionizing the supply chain planning industry with our unique SaaS cloud platform enabling organizations to drive supply chain planning and sales and operations planning (S&OP) from a single system. Some of our global customers include P&G, Ford, Unilever and Bose, to name just a few.

The Field Marketing Manager, EMEA is responsible for the strategy and execution of marketing programs and to raise awareness with, and generate leads from, our target account base in EMEA. As a member of the Worldwide Demand Generation group in Marketing, you will work closely with our EMEA sales team, Business Development, Industry and Solutions Marketing team and the Corporate Marketing teams to formulate programs and content to foster engagement and increase pipeline across Kinaxis’s prospect base.

The successful candidate will have an established track record working cross-functionally within a business-to-business environment targeting enterprises. They will tie strategy to execution by translating program requirements and goals into operational plans, while maintaining a close eye on results.

What you will do
  • Develop regional plans and programs to help identify and engage target customers in line with the regional sales strategy.
  • Manage programs from high-level ideation to execution.
  • Create regional industry-focused programs via a mix of online and offline marketing channels to generate leads and sales pipeline, including: account-based marketing, regional events, email marketing, direct mail, regional paid marketing program opportunities and program sales enablement.
  • Plan and run regional events, including webinars, roundtables, in-person events, and relationship-building engagements.
  • Collaborate with PR, Partner Marketing, and Global Marketing Programs on regional initiatives targeting EMEA.
  • Build relationships with internal and external thought leaders and influencers for contribution to programs, events and content.
  • Contribute to public relations and analyst relations for the region. Work with our media agencies to promote greater awareness of Kinaxis and our offerings.
  • Work with regional partners on co-marketing opportunities.
  • Contribute to our social media presence in EMEA. Monitor relevant social discussion about Kinaxis.
  • Use data to help challenge the status quo and solve business problems and report on program performance.
  • Be an active member of the Field Marketing group; share best practice, learn from other regions and contribute to Global Field Marketing activities.
What we are looking for
  • Proficient in English
  • 5-7 years business-to-business marketing experience, preferably in cloud-based products
  • Direct experience overseeing enterprise-level account based marketing (ABM) programs strategy and execution
  • Experience with field marketing, marketing programs and demand generation best-practices

Internal Auditor - Insurance

€60,000 - €70,000 per annum + Outstanding benefits package

Dublin 2 based


This is an excellent career opportunity to join this highly progressive team and be an important member with the aim of driving the compliance and best practice operations of the service delivery partners of this leading Insurer.

Your role requires you to be part qualified or a newly qualified accountant, with a track record in auditing as your role will involve; 

  • Auditing service delivery partners across Europe to ensure they meet the high standards of process set down by your organisation and by the Central Bank of Ireland. 
  • Work ongoing to improve the Audit process, using data analytics to identify and monitor trends, 
  • Build trustful and strong relationships with the suppliers, 
  • Show initiative and follow through on Audit findings and ensure the process is robust and fit for purpose.
  • Follow through on audit outcomes. 


This role will require some travel across Europe. However, apart from the travel the role is a 9 - 5 position. This is a company who know to get the best from their staff, and an exhausted employee is not a productive one! The initiatives in place to ensure the wellness of staff where established well before the pandemic and lead to an environment of appreciation and a great place to develop your career.


So if you are looking for a role that you can build your career in, working with a Manager who is fully committed to your development then this could be for you. 


It is essential you are Part Qualified, with the ideal person having qualified recently, with no less than 3 years Audit experience. If you had exposure to the Insurance industry as well that would be a huge advantage. 


If you have the essential requirements apply below for immediate consideration.

About PSC Biotech

 

Who we are?

 

PSC Biotech is a leading Biotech Consultancy firm founded in 1996, headquartered in Pomona, California, USA, with Global operations in Ireland, India, Singapore, Australia and the US, serving 350 clients in more than 23 countries worldwide. We provide cloud-based software solutions for Quality Management and Regulatory Inspections, pharmaceuticals contract manufacturing professionals, and metrology services to our clients.



‘Take your Career to a new Level’

 

PSC Biotech disrupts the conventional consultancy model by aligning our EVP as one of the unique selling point which includes the opportunity to work with the most talented cohort of like-minded professionals operating in the Pharma/ Biotech Industry. We offer a permanent contract of employment giving exposure of working in Top Pharmaceutical client sites in a diverse-cultural work setting.

 


Employee Value Proposition

 

Employees are the “heartbeat” of PSC Biotech, we provide unparalleled empowering career development though Learning & Development in-house training mentorship through constant guidance to facilitate career progression. We believe in creating high performing teams that can exceed our client’s expectations with regards to quality of all scalable and business unit deliverables, staying under budget and ensuring timelines for our deliverables are being met.



Job Summary and Essential Functions:


The QA Validation Manager is a crucial leadership role, that will suit someone passionate about building a managing a team of subject matter specialists. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to efficiently lead multiple, sophisticated validation programs. We are looking for someone who can proactively engage key internal clients and build collaborative partnerships across the organisation. This role represents a wonderful opportunity to demonstrate your personal expertise while mentoring and motivating your team to deliver beyond expectations.


In this role a typical day will include the following:


  • Crafting and implementing policies and procedures to validate/qualify equipment, systems, and processes in accordance with regulatory requirements and company manufacturing standards
  • Developing team member and interpersonal capabilities in the areas of cleaning validation, SIP validation and continuing validation
  • Coordinating the collective efforts of other departments or outside contractors/vendors to complete validation tasks
  • Leading comprehensive technical and quality investigations.
  • Reviewing and approving completed qualification and validation protocols, summary reports and associated data for conformance to regulations and SOPs
  • Proactively leading deviation notifications, deviation investigations, and corrective actions



Requirements


This role may be for you if:

  • You feel the need to stay current with industry trends and regulatory requirement updates, and share them frequently with your team
  • You have the innate ability to form strong working relationships and develop productive partnerships
  • You are comfortable with taking the lead on addressing quality issues and working toward successful resolution
  • You have an eye for identifying and using all relevant perspectives to craft comprehensive solutions
  • You lead with an approach that artfully blends technical expertise, passion for your work, and the willingness to go above and beyond for your team and the organization

To be considered for this role you must have:


  • BS/BA in Engineering, Chemistry, or Life Sciences.
  • With a minimum of 6 years of directly related experience which will greatly aid you to efficiently jump into our environment.
  • Previous team/people management experience is required.
  • The successful candidate will also have previous cleaning validation and steam-in-place experience as well as a strong understanding of the
  • Biopharmaceutical Drug Substance manufacturing process.

BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

Overview

Global Regulatory Reporting is one of the functions within the Global Asset Management Operations department.. While the AMO business is responsible for operational processing of funds managed by the Global Regulatory Reporting team based in Dublin, Hong Kong, and Dalian focus on the operations of various regulatory reporting activities as required by law and financial regulations in Asia, Europe, Middle East, and African jurisdictions. Our daily operations include identification, preparation and submission of position and transaction based regulatory reports on behalf of entities in compliance with various regulatory requirements, including substantial shareholder reporting, takeovers, short-selling, OTC derivatives and industry specific reporting requirements such as MiFIR, EMIR, AIFMD and MMFR. Regulatory reports and disclosure filings are required to be made in an accurate and timely fashion to individual companies, stock exchanges and regulators within Asian and European jurisdictions as required by local laws and regulations. The team is also responsible for researching legislative changes and managing operational readiness/governance which requires liaison with external and internal stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
  • For all new, change regulatory reporting change ensure full operational readiness, system access, procedural documentation and compliance review and sign off with seamless handover to BAU teams
  • Working with Regulatory reporting SME's, Compliance and Legal undertake and present analysis to determine scope and agree timeline for delivery of project in line with available resources.
  • Confirm objective, scope and timelines, produce project plans, agree key milestones, metrics and dependencies.
  • Secure resources from impacted teams - assign roles and responsibilities.
  • Facilitate solutions and ensure timely delivery of all deliverables / products.
  • Work closely with Technology delivery teams and wider business teams
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance based on knowledge from previous roles / projects.
  • Interface with other impacted parties, internal and external as required.
  • Manage and document risks, actions, assumptions, issues, decisions and dependencies and escalate if required.
  • Chair and minute project meetings.
  • Produce progress reports and other management information as appropriate.
  • Manage and maintain a central repository of project documentation
  • Complete project closure including conducting post project reviews and lessons learnt.
Experience And Qualifications Required
  • Experience managing projects from initiation through to implementation.
  • Experience and understanding of Agile methodology
  • Preferably Association of Project Management, PRINCE 2 (or similar) qualified.
  • Good understanding of the business structure, systems architecture and development cycle.
  • Experience of working within Financial Services
  • Experience of engaging / communicating with senior stakeholders.
  • Experience of chairing and presenting to Senior Stakeholders .
  • Sense of urgency and awareness of when to escalate issues.
  • Self-motivated, a proactive approach with an analytical, enquiring mind and willingness to learn.
  • Ability to work on own initiative to achieve objectives and goals, requesting support when and where required.
  • Strong sense of ownership with ability to work on challenging issues and overcome constraints and obstacles.
  • Dedication to accuracy, timeliness and high productivity while working under pressure to meet deadlines.

This is a graduate role for someone with 0-2 years experience. Testing is of email communications only.

We act as marketing consultants and brand experts across a broad range of services including digital events and email marketing, social campaigns and strategy, creative design, direct marketing campaigns, research and content strategy for our clients. This role will focus on upholding our high-standard of quality work for our clients.

You will work closely with globally dispersed teammates in development, account management and creative departments, as part of our Quality Assurance team ensuring deliverables to our clients are crisp, clean and nothing but first-class.

To be successful in this role you will need to have a very keen eye for detail, superior organisational skills and the ability to work in a very fast-paced environment while handling multiple projects at any given time.

Your day to day will look something like this:

  • Coordinating various teams and departments and reporting status updates during daily stand-ups.
  • Creating program and project checklists, finding defects and monitoring progress throughout testing lifecycles.
  • Defining various scenarios with multiple datasets and logic to perform testing.
  • Performing browser and mobile testing of dynamic, data-driven email campaigns.
  • Validating that copy, images and overall presentation follow specifications provided.
  • Validating conditional logic and workflows for campaigns and customer journeys.
  • Reporting testing results, submitting bugs and issues for correction and retesting once bugs have been resolved.
  • Identifying and refine test requirements and overall testing processes and documentation.
  • Participating in overall project review meetings.

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience managing time and shifting priorities.
  • Excellent communication (written + verbal), relationship-building, and organisational skills.
  • Consistent high standard delivery to tight deadlines and evolving requirements.
  • A motivated “improver”, self-starter and reliable team player.
  • You have an eagle eye for visual discrepancies and can document defects in clear, actionable terms.
  • Experience using email testing tools such as Litmus, Email on Acid.
  • Previous experience effectively using project / workflow management tools (Workfront, Jira, Asana, ClickUp etc).

More about you

You are comfortable with MacOS and familiar with the Google Workspace Toolset (Sheets, Docs, Slides etc). You don’t settle for “adequately complete” tasks but rather strive for perfection. Not afraid to ask “why?”. You may have some prior experience of HTML/CSS (either in webpages or email) and can easily find your way around web-based content management systems. You feel motivation in productivity and challenge yourself when you see room for improvement.

Additional Information

Great people deserve great benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly.  In addition to a fun, flexible, supportive, and engaging work environment, Hawks have access to a variety of benefits and perks including:

  • Competitive salaries, flexible working options, and opportunities for career advancement
  •  25+ days annual leave
  • Flexible working options to ensure a healthy work / life balance
  • Sports and social club, Christmas and Summer parties (when ‘normal’ returns!)
  •  Exclusive access to thought leadership, professional development, and global career opportunities via Publicis’s worldwide employee network, Marcel
  • A comprehensive learning and development program
  • Opportunities to engage, give back, and grow via our Business Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities, and mentor programme
  • Private medical, life insurance, and income protection cover
  • Employee assistance, self-care, and wellbeing support
  • Pension scheme
  • Referral bonus and new business bonus schemes
  • Cycle-to-work and season ticket loans

* We’re currently working from home, but we’ll make sure you have everything you need to get off to a successful start, including a laptop and lots of facetime with your new colleagues. We will be combining work from home with time in the office…when ‘normal’ returns :-)

Conditions of Employment 

Hawkeye is a Publicis Groupe agency and has been selected as a Drum Marketing Awards finalist for Marketing Agency of the Year and Diversity and Inclusion Company of the Year.  We provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks and verification that applicants are legally authorized to work in the country they are being hired in.

Job Description & Summary
Our collective blend of expertise and experience makes PwC a great place to work. PwC Ireland welcomes top talent from all backgrounds to join us at the start of what will be your lifelong journey of development and discovery. Let's see where your talent could take you.

The Operations Manager role will provide you with the opportunity to play a central role in managing both the commercials and the associated processes within a rapidly growing and expanding Consulting practice.
You’ll focus on sales operations, forecasting, reporting and planning. This is a critical, exciting and dynamic role that ensures our Consulting practice runs efficiently and profitably. You will manage a team of strong commercial and operations analysts and report directly to the Commercial Director.

What you’ll do

4 key areas of responsibilities
  • Sales operations
  • Forecasting and analysis
  • Reporting & monitoring
  • Planning





Sales operations
  • Provide monthly reporting, data & operational support to sector leaders
  • Track opportunities in our pipeline (Salesforce)
  • Act as key focal point for Salesforce queries and guidelines
  • Own Must WIN opportunity process
  • Target setting (in conjunction with Commercial Director) and tracking for Sectors and Priority clients
  • Drive account planning process to ensure we have clear plan each Priority Client
  • Coordinate monthly / annual reviews






Forecasting and analysis
  • Revenue and pipeline forecasting using predefined models
  • Analysis of revenue actuals - identity business units gaps to targets & data issues
  • Review available resource forecasts in conjunction with resource manager
  • Provide monthly trend analysis and insights to support partners presentation and reviews
  • Maintain and improve the revenue forecasting model covering sectors, pillars and competency
  • Support commercial analysts in driving commercial hygiene & operational excellence


Reporting & monitoring
  • Designing and overseeing commercial reporting across consulting dimensions: pillars, competency and go to market (sales function)
  • Own management information dashboard - landing page for all reporting and data
  • Prepare weekly dashboard and overseeing partner reporting
  • Track Director and Senior manager financial performance
  • Attend weekly resource availability meetings and partner with Resource manager
  • Manage offshore resource to produce all management information


Planning
  • Support annual planning process across all dimensions
  • Track and report on progress versus plan
  • Document actions for key leaders and follow up
  • Manage consulting IT budget (in conjunction with Commercial Director)


Team management
  • Work closely with our offshore team to improve efficiencies and bring in more stability to data processes
  • Manage the day to day activities of the operations team
  • Partner with Finance and HR






Digital & Process improvement
  • Bring operational efficiencies across the team through digital engagement
  • Identify recommendations for process improvements, implement, and update documentations across key areas
  • Support automation process via technology team to reduce admin






What you’ll bring to this role
  • High level of accuracy, attention to detail and experience analysing financials
  • Strong client service focus in dealing with partners and staff at all levels across the business
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Good judgment and problem solving skills
  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends
  • Flexibility - to handle changing priorities and work-loads positively. You will be a self-starter demonstrating enthusiasm & commitment to work and be highly organised
  • Relationships - ability to build trusted relationships
  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard
  • Courage and integrity - always up for a challenge, can work independently and as part of a team, have the ability to adapt to change and escalate problems as appropriate using initiative and discretion
  • Ambitious


What you'll get in return
  • Opportunity to develop your career in Operations with a real insight into how a Consulting business is managed
  • Wide exposure to the breadth of Consulting services and how we deliver these services.
  • Development of commercial analysis skills and experience in forecasting and dashboards
  • Opportunity to interact with partners and practice teams across a growing Consulting practice
  • One to one coaching and development with the Commercial Director




Whilst prior finance and operations management experience is required, what is equally important is that you have a willingness to learn, a client centric mentality, excellent communication skills and want to join a dynamic team that provides critical business support to Consulting. On the job training will be provided.


Education
  • Bachelor’s degree in operations management, business administration, or related field
  • Finance/accounting qualification/experience


Skills:
  • 2+ years’ proven experience in an operations management position
  • Experience in forecasting, reporting and management of operational processes
  • Knowledge of general business software and aptitude to learn new applications; proficiency in Microsoft in Excel/Google sheets & powerpoint
  • Ability to work with Tableau and workflows in Alteryx or other data prep tools are desirable, but not essential (training will be provided)
  • Some understanding of how professional services firms operate

You’re enamored by the way things operate, and be able determine how technology works when things go wrong. You have excellent verbal and written social skills, as well as the ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time. You can multitask across systems and applications, analyze, isolate and resolve a variety of complex technical issues, and comfortably navigate a technical environment. You effortlessly engage, explaining step by step solutions with patience and an approach tailored to each individual customer. You’re not only here to help fix technical issues, but also provide an incredible customer experience. If this sounds like you, you could be the next AppleCare Advisor. We’re committed to helping employees explore their potential. Do you think you have what it takes?


Key Qualifications
Fluent in English and Swedish

Experience supporting customers via phone, e-mail, chat, and/or in person

Real passion for customer service and ownership of the customer experience including comprehensive issue resolution

Able to effectively tailor communication and style to differing audiences

Handle own workload and work independently in a dynamic, constantly changing environment

Grows with a team where expertise is shared and feedback is inspired

Effective time management including ability to multi- task, organize and prioritize

Able to research and grasp technical information across multiple tools while talking with customers

Knowledge of one or more of the following is an advantage; iOS, Smartphone, Tablet, PC or Mac experience

Aptitude for acquiring skills in technical troubleshooting and an eagerness to learn and take on New Challenges


Description
We expect everything from an Advisor that our customers do and we want Apple to be a reflection of the world around us. As an AppleCare Advisor, you will be supporting many of our popular products, from iPhones to iPads to MacBooks to desktop Macs. As our customers’ first point of contact, you are the friendly voice of Apple, providing outstanding customer service, troubleshooting, and technical support. We’ll rely on you to listen to our customers and use your technical knowledge, creativity, and passion to meet their needs — and remind them that behind our great products are amazing people. Because we believe our individual backgrounds, perspectives, and passions help us craft the ideas that move all of us forward. You'll be trained to reach your highest potential.


This position comes with competitive pay, great benefits, eligibility to participate in our company stock plan, time off, and employee discount.


Additional Requirements
- Available to attend approximately 3-4 weeks of required training on a fixed schedule that may include weekends


- Flexible to work between the hours of 7:00 a.m. GMT and 7:00 p.m. GMT including weekends and holidays, with the possibility to flex up or down hours depending upon business needs


- Successful completion of initial training

At Apple, we are about creating great products. Part of making products great is designing products that respect consumer security and privacy. This role offers the opportunity to work directly with key members of the business, engineering and legal teams on a variety of cutting edge projects including: privacy by design reviews and projects, supporting compliance and auditing frameworks including in relation to the GDPR and advise on privacy aspects of licensing and procurement deals and corporate acquisitions, And assist with drafting of policies and procedures surrounding privacy laws.


Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish!

Description
Do you love taking on big challenges without precedent? Do you possess a deep knowledge of the legal field and a passion for innovation? As a part of our Legal group, we help uphold Apple’s high ethical and corporate standards, as well as defend our intellectual property by providing legal support for all our products and businesses globally! Working for a company that invents entire categories and industries means you’ll be challenged to creatively apply your deep legal expertise to rare and often unexplored aspects of the law.


As Privacy Counsel you will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic and experienced team on privacy issues impacting Apple’s business and products globally. You will work directly with business and engineering teams to design innovative privacy solutions for products as well as across the legal department on Apple activities and regulatory issues.

Summary
Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Together we build products and experiences people once couldn’t have envisioned - and now can’t imagine living without. Are you excited by the idea of making a real impact? Are you prepared to dream big? Then a career with Apple might be your dream job!


The Apple Product Operations team has developed a 23 month graduate programme. Our graduate programme is designed to give you exposure to the key functions of Product Operations including manufacturing engineering, quality, test engineering, software development, production and New Product Introduction.


As a participant in our programme, you will initially spend time training with us at our manufacturing centre of excellence in Cork, Ireland. Here, we will support you with a mix of on-the-job and classroom-based training in a state of the art manufacturing environment. After this period, you'll be deployed to work on Apple products and processes in different manufacturing locations in China and Europe, as well as travelling to Apple’s headquarters in California, to understand the broader aspects of Manufacturing Operations.


You will need to be flexible to travel, and relocate to other locations as part of this Programme (US/Asia). We will support you throughout these relocations as part of the Graduate Programme.


If you have strong technical skills, an educational background in engineering and love working with other people, then this could be an amazing opportunity to come and work with us. We'd love to hear from you!


This programme will commence in Summer 2022. If you are currently studying towers a Masters that is completing in September, please feel free to apply, we can accommodate a respective start date. Closing date for applications is 22nd October 2021.


Key Qualifications
Relevant Industrial/manufacturing/mechanical Engineering experience specifically relating to Lean Manufacturing, production support and quality

Should be flexible and capable of working on own initiative with a professional attitude and good communication skills

Consistently identifies, initiates and drives continuous improvement throughout the business.

Computer-literate with experience of appropriate simulation and CAD packages

Strong sense of urgency and customer orientation Experience in engineering, manufacturing operations automation

Exposure to lean manufacturing principles including 5S, WCM, Standard Work and TPM

Excellent communication and documentation skills.

Good analytical, data analysis and problem solving skills


Description
- This position provides manufacturing engineering support to production operations in Cork and at EMEA Distribution Centre locations.

- The position will provide support and leadership in achieving World Class Manufacturing, Safety, Quality, Customer Service, and Cost standards through continuous process improvement activities.

- Design, commissioning and qualification of semi-automated and automated fixturing

- Support New Product Introductions across several product lines

- Drive cycle time improvement, line balancing, line design, yield improvement and scrap reduction


Education & Experience
- B.Eng (Hons) / M.Eng in Mechanical/Industrial/Mechatronics/Biomedical Engineering or equivalent completing in 2021 or 2022

- Third level qualification in Quality management or a Six Sigma qualification would be great, but not required

As we help small and medium sized businesses grow, they tend to need more employees. But with more people at the company using HubSpot, more control and oversight becomes needed. We are looking for a designer who can help us lead the development of an experience strategy around governance. Both from the perspective of the administrator and the perspective of the person using the software for their job. We want to make sure that we are helping administrators design great experiences for their employees.

How do we design?

Design at HubSpot is both grounded in experience design fundamentals and a deep belief that small autonomous teams are the best way to get excellent work in customer's hands.
  • We value solving for the customer above all else
  • We give each designer the responsibility and ownership to chart the course for their designs throughout the product and across teams. We don't do sign-offs and burdensome documentation.
  • We respect user research and content and work cooperatively with them while designing
  • We carefully lead and maintain a high-functioning, usability-centered design system and design language with our front-end teammates.
  • We're embedded on small teams with engineers and product managers in sane sustainable ratios
  • Learn more about our Design Philosophy: Design System Article
What does a product designer at HubSpot do?

Our product designers are embedded on Product teams. Your goal will be to create simple and powerful experiences that enable our customers to be more successful. This is an important role and has serious, measurable business impact. We’re looking for UX designers excited to gain more autonomy in their work.

Responsibilities
  • Partner closely with product management and engineering leads to establish objectives, and key results for their Group(s)
  • Own responsibility for balancing speed, quality and consistency of design
  • Deep understanding of good user experience, IA, interaction and visual design
  • Deliver wireframes, system mapping, and polished visual UI designs
  • Break complex concepts into smaller, more manageable components
  • Provides thoughtful feedback to team design critiques
  • Build lasting relationships across the organization, including cross-product design teams, engineering, product management, and the broader business
  • Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced tech environment
Top Candidates Will Have
  • Ability to articulate design decisions and ask tough questions to help surface and challenge assumptions. The word “why” comes out of your mouth at least once in every conversation.
  • Open communication style that makes it easy to give and receive feedback with the goal of becoming better at what you do and helping the people around you become more successful
  • Experience working closely and collaboratively with developers and product managers in a fast-paced environment. Teamwork is central to how you get work done and you know how to build strong working relationships.
  • Experience with complex workflows for power users
We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Internal & external audit
Sarbanes-Oxley Compliance
Financial and other projects
Administrative Internal control team activities

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Maintain and formalize the matrix of delegations

Grant DOA, run DOA summary & exception reports

Communication of group Procedures and policies to process owners

Responsible for local non GxP (generic good practice) documents on GEODE+ (Geoscience Data Evaluation System) system
Reinforce the control framework in line with Group internal control manual for all sites.

Monitor Segregation of Duties and access to Systems

Responsible for NOVA system which is the gatekeeper for SoD (Segregation of Duties) for SAP CEP (Collaborative Engineering & Project Management)

Participate to the annual Control Self-Assessment & testing

Follow up on action plans with local process owner to ensure they are addressing the root cause & the correct evidence is being provided.
Update Interact. Run reports from INTERACT that show status

Conduct SOX testing at Design and effectiveness testing

Liaise and work alongside external auditors to ensure controls at addressing the risk

Participate in Sanofi internal audits

Liaise with the business on the process to be followed during internal audits by providing training and support
Follow up on local action plans & offer advise
Act as a coordinator for industrial affairs site for all internal control topics
Participate into financial projects on system changes, accounting practices, regulations, organizational changes

Key “MUST HAVE” competencies, skills & experiences

REQUIREMENTS

Master’s Degree in finance, business or accounting
First practical experience in the field of external/internal audit
Knowledge of Microsoft office & enjoy working with many systems
Attentiveness to details

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.
