#INDLP

Commercial Property Manager

Competitive Salary + Bonus + & Pension.

Flexible Remote Working Options Available.


Your new company 

Hays Recruitment have partnered with a leading Global Real Estate firm who specialise in the management of Residential and Commercial Property. Their offices are located in the heart of Dublin City Centre with easy access to public transport. They are seeking an experienced Commercial Property Manager to join their Property Management Team.




Your new role 

The selected candidate will work closely with the director of Commercial Property to maximise the value of client Real Estate Investments. You will be responsible for managing landlord and tenant interaction to ensure key lease events are managed. You will need to ensure all capital expenditure projects that arise within the portfolio are correctly managed. Liase with the accounts team and be responsible for reporting Client Statements, Service Charge budgeting and reconciliations.




What you'll need to succeed

The successful candidate must have a PSRA license and be a Chartered Surveyor (or working towards becoming chartered). You will have a proven track record within commercial property management with the ability to demonstrate strong client management skills. Ideally you will have at least 2 years commercial property management experience, along with asset management skills, a working knowledge of landlord and tenant legislation and service charge experience.




What you'll get in return 

In return for your commitment to this position you will receive a competitive salary and annual bonus. There is excellent opportunity for progression and a strong benefits package which includes healthcare and pension contribution. You will receive 25 days annual leave and will also have flexible remote working options.




What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Our client are a leading player in the IT sector, and at this time there are looking to add an billing supervisor to their team 

 

The position

The billing supervisor is a new role that will supervise the growing billing group. As an billing supervisor you are responsible for ensuring accurate and timely processing of all customer billing. This role will work across the organisation to continue to build a robust billing function in Dublin and will ensure that global processes are implemented within the wider billing team. The role requires great attention to detail, a strong team player and experienced professional with the ability to deliver results under deadlines.

 

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Manage the Dublin based billing group (currently less than 5 people).
  • Lead the billing efforts and act as first point of escalation for issues encountered by the team.
  • Support month-end, quarter end and year-end processes, including working with internal/external auditors as needed.
  • Drive high performance, identify improvements and establish best practice processes for the billing team.
  • Ensure alignment with group processes in consultation with Senior Billing management overseas.
  • Compile and analyze billing data to produce reporting for senior management.
  • Manage the onboarding of new personnel due to growth in team.
  • Participate in implementation of new software systems and manage system and process testing as required.
  • Complete other duties and special projects as assigned.

 

Key Qualifications/ Experience:

  • Degree in business related discipline or Finance/Accounting qualification.
  • Extensive billing experience within a multinational environment. (minimum five years)
  • Strong people management and leadership experience (minimum two years).
  • Detailed knowledge of Quote to Cash (Q2C) processes.
  • Proven ability to implement, document and maintain processes.
  • Continuous improvement mindset.
  • Experience of large corporate ERP systems 
  • Ability to work in multiple systems and quickly move from one system to another.
  • Experience and high level of competence in Microsoft Office and in particular Excel.
  • Well-organized with ability to prioritize and work towards tight deadlines and corporate objectives.
  • Self-motivated and goal oriented.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.

 

Please apply in confidence today to learn more about this great opportunity.

Technical Specialist is required for a global Biopharmaceutical company in Cork. The facility specialises in the fermentation, purification and sterile filling of biotech products, as well as supporting product development and clinical trials. The site has recently received significant investment to increase the onsite capabilities and has a significant European role in this global organization. The Site mission is "to be a globally competitive BioPharma site with proven capability, excellence in compliance, and flawlessly supplying products that meet customers' expectations".The team on site are focussed on excellence, innovation, quality, compliance and teamwork to support their strategy to meet the needs of their global patients.


Excellent opportunity for a Technical Specialist to work in/as part of Manufacturing Operations Team with responsibility for ensuring we keep the patient at the very heart of all that we do and strive to find solutions and treatments for some of the world's most challenging healthcare needs.If you want to work on a manufacturing site with innovative technical capabilities and with an opportunity to support a wider European team then this is the opportunity for you.


The Technical Specialist will be responsible for:

  • Working with site support groups to deliver qualified raw materials and consumables for the manufacturing process.
  • Supporting the continuous improvement process through active participation in cross functional teams
  • Authoring and contributing to manufacturing documentation associated with current process
  • Troubleshooting manufacturing issues and lead investigations through scientific problem-solving approaches.


The Technical Specialist requires experience in at least two of the following areas:

  • process operations or manufacturing.
  • Process Engineering
  • technology transfer,
  • cleaning operations,
  • process validation
  • regulatory inspections.


Call Kieran O'Sullivan in LSC on 021 4777 329 to discuss this new Technical Specialist role in more detail or apply directly via this advert.

This role requires an individual who can bring value to the company and the eCommerce web and mobile platform, as well as drive improvements to customer experience.

  • Lead a dedicated team to discover, develop and transform product activities

Good to have (but not deal breakers)

TTM Healthcare in partnership with our client is recruiting for a permanent Occupational Health Nurse for our client based in Cork.
The successful candidate will provide a comprehensive range of Occupational health services to employees. This is a specialised professional role with a strong focus on promoting employee health and wellbeing.

The role will include the following duties and responsibilities :

Employee Wellbeing
  • Leading an Employee Wellbeing Programme and develop initiatives to improve employee wellness.
Health Surveillance
  • Co-ordination of a Health Surveillance Programme including regular health assessments across sites and shops, interpreting results and compiling reports.
  • Completion of pre-employment medicals, interpretation of results and compiling reports as required by the business.
VDU Ergonomics
  • Co-ordinate the VDU Ergonomics Programme including assessment and training
Policies and Procedures
  • Review and develop Occupational Health Policies and Procedures in line with legislation, business and audit requirements.
Case Management
  • Carry out Occupational Health consultations as referred as per company policy.
  • Liase and refer to Occupational Health Physician or other professional services as and when required in managing cases.
  • Planning appropriate return to work and rehabilitation.
  • Provision of relevant metrics/reports/updates to HR function.
  • Track short term and long-term absenteeism levels within the Society.
Medical Information
  • Maintenance of medical information and records in a professional and confidential manner in line with GDPR best practice.
Health and Safety
  • Carry out and/or assist completion of risk assessments alongside the EHS team across the Society as required.
  • Assessment of reported workplace injuries and illnesses and participation in accident investigations in conjunction with the Business, where required.
First Aid
  • Support the First Aid team in conjunction with the EHS function. Monitoring the efficiency and supply of First Aid equipment across the Society.
  • Organise First Aid cover for company events where additional First Aid cover may be required or where OHA is unavailable.
Management of Occupational Health Services
  • Organise calibration of medical equipment annually.
  • Managing OHP services including scheduling appointments, forwarding referral details, maintaining records of referrals and administering invoices for payment.
Vaccination Programme
  • Coordination of Occupational, Travel, Seasonal Influenza vaccination programme.
Business Continuity Planning (Covid-19)
  • Work closely with the Pandemic Response Steering Group to provide relevant medical guidance and support to the Society in line with current guidelines.
The successful candidate should have:
  • A recognised qualification in Occupational Health with a minimum of 3-5 years work experience preferably in a Manufacturing/Retail environment.
  • Competency in Audiometry, Spirometry, Vision screening and VDU ergonomics.
  • Excellent communication skills with strong interpersonal, empathy and listening skills.
  • Strong organisational and planning skills including time management with proven track record of prioritising key tasks and delivery to a high professional standard.
  • A strong collaborative mindset with proven ability to estabilish and maintain effective working people relationships.
  • Possess high level of confidentiality and discretion.
  • Pro-active can do attitude with ability to work on own initiative, multitask and flexible to meet deadlines.
  • Resilient with collaborative mindset.
  • Proficient IT skills
  • Good understanding of Health and Safety legislation and best practice.
  • Proven track record of achievement and ability to learn quickly.
APPLY TODAY! CLOSING DATE 15TH OCTOBER 2021

TTM Healthcare is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Our Customer Success team advises and guides a wide variety of customers, ensuring they launch Slack successfully, adopt it widely and continuously gain business value from our products and services. We serve as the trusted point of contact for Slack’s strategic key customers across the customer lifecycle; on-boarding, adoption, advocacy and renewal.

Working closely with Slack’s Account Executives, our CSMs provide strategic territory coverage, coordinating with the AEs to identify areas where existing customers could improve their use of Slack or uncover new uses for Slack. From time to time, our CSMs will work with Account Executives on pre-sales activities like pilot engagements to set up a customer for long term success.

Part coach, project manager, consultant and product specialist, our Slack Customer Success Managers are continually focused on helping our customers improve their team communication and be successful with Slack.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

What You Will Be Doing
  • You will evangelize our belief that the fastest way to achieve organisational agility is to change how people work -- and we believe that requires established enterprises to rapidly evolve culture, process and technology at scale!
  • You will work closely with our largest enterprise customers to understand how they work, their business challenges, paint the art of the possible through Slack, and mentor them on how to personalise Slack to communicate, collaborate and work more effectively.
  • Understand the motivation, business drivers, strategic goals and desired business outcomes for your portfolio of large enterprise customers.
  • You will lead a cross-functional partnership across your named customer(s) and Slack and identify new ways our platform can differentiate them in the market.
  • You will craft joint customer success plans that include agreed upon scope, shared metrics, user engagement, sophistication of usage, adoption plans, timelines, communication, and eliminates barriers to customer advocacy and expansion.
  • Facilitate workshops with customers on best known practices, including sponsorship, governance, operating model, adoption, internal Champions network, platform maturity, and adoption techniques.
  • Facilitate Executive Business Reviews with economic decision makers and Slack executive sponsors, where we celebrate shared successes, and course correct where necessary.
  • Maintain high levels of engagement across a broad group of customers, with an emphasis on customer appreciation and advocacy
  • Serve as a mentor and coach to others on the Customer Success Team
  • Contribute to the library of customer success assets (customer references, case studies) and thought leadership (methodology, point of view, white papers)
What You Should Have
  • 8+ years relevant work experience in customer-facing customer success, account management or strategic consulting roles. SaaS experience preferred
  • You are passionate about the future of work, and positively impacting the working lives of people in large organisations
  • This is a demanding role that requires strong leadership, committed priority management and high emotional intelligence.
  • You are an excellent teammate who has a consistent record of excelling in fast-growing environments and taking initiative!
  • Experience implementing and supporting large scale technology solutions at Fortune 500 companies
  • Consider program management a strength and have experience using joint sponsorship to execute against deadlines within a complex organisation
  • You have a passion for building trust and communicating with a broad range of partners: C-Suite, senior executives, business owners, Slack administrators, developers, and day-to-day users of the software
  • Experience in an enterprise solution sales environment and ability to partner with account executives in development and closure of sales opportunities is preferred
  • Fluent Dutch & English speaker

Job Summary

BACKGROUND

Established in 2013 and now based in Blackrock, the Dublin Technology Center delivers best in industry infrastructure and security services across the Zurich Insurance Group. Whether it's with one of our core capabilities such as Cyber Security, or working with our Cloud or Crowdsourcing teams, our customers are our priority. We work hard to deliver our services excellently with our unique talent. We are committed to working with the best and brightest people from the broadest talent pool possible. We believe a diversity of ideas fosters innovation and engagement, allows us to attract the best people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. Qualified individuals from all walks of life are encouraged to apply.

Key Accountabilities

The Scrum Master will be responsible for enabling and maximizing our ability to exploit Cloud for business benefits, while ensuring team’s good performance, customer satisfaction, cost effectiveness, operational integrity and adherence to relevant industry best practices. It is expected that the Scrum Master will undertake a wide variety of roles related to the strategic development of Cloud platforms, Cloud product management, project and life support.

The role of Scrum Master is part of the leadership team in our Cloud Centre of Excellence. The Cloud Centre of Excellence (CCoE) is a cross-functional team responsible for developing and managing the cloud strategy, governance, and best practices that the rest of the organization can leverage to transform the business using the cloud. The CCoE helps lead the organization in cloud adoption, migration, and operations.

In this role, you join a team of highly skilled platform engineers responsible for the end-to-end ownership and delivery of public cloud services. You will be provided with guidance and training to facilitate your development within this role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Leading at least one Scrum Team implementing services and environments using infrastructure as code.
  • Guiding the team(s) and organisation on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values
  • Preparing reports and reporting regularly to project sponsor and stakeholders, improving transparency to allow the product and projects to be governed based on the organisations governance requirements.
  • Supporting and developing Agile environment with the Product Manager
  • Removing impediments ensuring the team(s) deliver the business outcomes agreed to.
  • Facilitating discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution.
  • Facilitating the Scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand up, sprint retrospectives and release planning.
  • Ensuring that the team(s) delivers high-quality software on time meeting the business goals.
  • Provide input to the Management team to drive improvements in delivery, technology and structure.

Job Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Be a certified Scrum Master
  • Have experience in playing the Scrum Master role for at least one year with a software development team.
  • Have knowledge of various patterns, anti-patterns and techniques to ensure that Scrum can be applied effectively to this organisation.
  • Relevant degree or diploma programme of study.
  • Experience of working with the latest automation tools in a DevOps and Agile environment.
  • Familiarity with version control platforms e.g. Git, Perforce, SVN, TFVC.
  • Proven ability to succeed in collaborative work environments using Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  • Have experience of Software Engineering.
  • Have experience in working in a continuous delivery software production environment.
  • Managing relationships with third party vendors.
  • Experience of developing test plans and delivering results to schedule.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Expert level knowledge of Azure or AWS with associated certifications.
  • Expert knowledge of Atlassian toolset.
  • Experienced in the delivery of Infrastrcture as Code (IaC) in an Agile environment.
  • Working knowledge of configuration management tools e.g. Cloud formation, Ansible, Terraform, Powershell.

Short Description

Additional Information

Primary work location is Blackrock based but occasional travel may be required to other Zurich locations typically within Europe. Hybrid working supported.

If you value an exciting and varied working environment and meet the above requirements, then our recruiter Marie Byrne is looking forward to receiving your application by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Zurich is one of Ireland's leading insurance companies providing a wide range of general insurance and life insurance products and services. The company employs over 1,000 people across its locations in Dublin and Wexford.

Zurich is a strong brand. Zurich in Ireland is part of Zurich Insurance Group, a leading multi-line insurer that serves its customers in global and local markets. Our 55,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, helping our customers in 210 countries and territories to understand and protect themselves from risk. In order to deliver our services, we offer a competitive compensation package and interesting opportunities for further training & development. As a Zurich employee you benefit from a multitude of advantages as well as a strong culture, characterized by acceptance, diversity and team spirit.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Description

Our client is a fin-tech start-up company that has recently secured significant funding and will experience exponential growth in the next 12 months. 

They have created a new role within the Marketing and Growth team, focusing on creating and implementing outbound, digital marketing and customer relationship management solutions. 

This role is crucial to the success of the team, as the Senior IT Marketing Product Manager will help to define and create the tools and strategies needed to drive results.

Experience
  • 5+ years of Product Management experience working with marketing technology solutions
    • Digital, CRM and Marketing Automation and the associated data systems such as DMP, CDP, etc.
  • Experience building marketing data platforms is crutial
  • Experience developing marketing strategies for a company
  • Technical background is imperative
  • Coordinating data signals to enable personalized experiences
  • Integrating third party solutions to deliver sophisticated marketing capabilities
  • An understanding of how regulations (GDPR, CCPA) impact communication with stakeholders
 Skills
  • Ability to design marketing tools and strategies
  • Ability to artfully approach ambiguity
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with other departments
    • Sales, finance, design, engineering, DevOps etc
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Team player

About the Role
  • Orchestrate the marketing solutions strategy and the delivery (roadmap)
  • Make prioritisation decisions based on monitored KPIs
  • Remaster processes and execution to align with the company’s GTM strategy based on KPIs performance
  • Assess and operationalise 3rd party solutions
  • Ensure the successful launch of new capabilities and evolutions of the platform
    • Testing, post-launch monitoring, ongoing metric analysis, etc.
  • Achieve engagement, activation and loyalty across the end-to-end digital journey
  • Overseeing the data flow between Marketing Technology tools
  • Match intended marketing goals by working closely with engineering, BI, and analytics teams to guarantee consistency and accuracy of events/attributes.

Entain is one of the world’s largest sports betting and gaming groups, operating both online and in the retail sector. With offices across five continents and licences in more than 20 countries, we operate some of the most well-known and iconic brands in the industry with more than 250 years of combined history - names such as Ladbrokes, partypoker, bwin and Coral.

Purpose

To ensure the shop environment is kept clean and tidy at all times to help create the best customer experience and maintain a good working environment for all colleagues.

  • Maintain a clean and tidy shop floor, paying attention to all fittings, fixtures and signage.

  • Ensure the entrance to the shop is clean and accessible.
  • Ensure both customer and colleagues toilets are in a clean and usable condition.
  • Vacuum and mop as required.
Our shop opening hours are between 9am to 9.30pm Monday to Saturday and 10am to 6.30pm on a Sunday.

We’re Entain. Our vision is to be the world leader in sports betting and gaming entertainment by creating the most exciting and trusted experiences for our customers, revolutionising the space as we go. We’re specialists in safer gambling and the company that is at the forefront of responsibility.

Combining technology and entertainment to build products that push the boundaries, Entain is home to a global family of more than 25 well-known brands - names such as bwin, Ladbrokes, Coral, Gala, Betdaq, and many more. With a focus on sustainability and growth, we will transform our sector for our players, for ourselves and for the good of entertainment.

Diversity and inclusion at Entain

As a global employer, Entain is committed to providing a safe, fun, and inclusive culture where our people feel like they truly belong. We are a multicultural business that values, celebrates and respects individual differences, so whatever your sexuality, gender, gender identity, ability, age, race, religion or belief, you will have a voice here, and the space to do your best work. Wellbeing at Entain

Position:


Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)


About our Client:


Our client services two types of customers: (i) those who arrange to have waste collected (bins, skips, skip bags or junk removal) via the clients online booking engine and (ii) those who drop off their waste using the client’s smart compactor bins.

 

The services include domestic door-to-door bin collection, commercial bin collection, skip and skip bag hire, and junk removal such as furniture and other large objects.

 

Reporting to:

 

CEO

 

Location:

 

HQ in Waterford City / Remote option available

 

Job Description:

 

A newly created role, the CMO will join the client’s executive management team focused on delivering a first-class service to our customers. The CMO will primarily support the CEO and will oversee the marketing function of a listed company.

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Develop and own the Marketing Strategy for the Group for the next 3 years (both digital and traditional marketing)
  • Determine KPIs for marketing department, track KPIs on a regular basis and input into monthly Board reports
  • Manage the marketing budget and ensure there are no overruns
  • Review our brand designs and develop a new corporate Identity Document including creating and propagating an enthusiastic brand message that will resonate with our target market
  • Design and improve upon marketing campaigns for each Group business and vertical
  • Major focus on ‘earned’ and ‘owned’ marketing channels
  • Develop nationwide brand building campaign including advertising and sponsorships
  • Set and achieve strategic goals related to social media metrics, traditional advertising, and marketing campaign initiatives
  • Support Investor Relations and corporate communications strategy
  • Help negotiate fee proposals and project details with outside contractors related to marketing and promotions
  • Review and manage content marketing campaigns
  • Work with junk franchisees on local social media strategies and other components of the marketing program
  • Take ownership of and manage the customer service/ success team ensuring that the Group maintains high social validation (though ratings and reviews) and net promoter scores

 

Requirements:

 

The CMO must have the following:

 

Professional experience:

 

  • 15+ years' experience in marketing and/or advertising
  • 5+ years' experience in a managerial role
  • Familiarity with strategic marketing campaigns
  • Familiarity with on demand/gig economy a plus
  • Solid knowledge of website analytics

 

Personal skills:

 

  • Ability to conduct technological analyses and research
  • Excellent communication skills up to board level
  • Leadership and organizational abilities
  • Strategic thinking
  • Problem-solving aptitude

 

 

Education:

 

  • BSc/BA in marketing or similar; MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus

 

Technology:

 

  • Knowledge of technological trends to build strategy; and
  • Comfort with a multitude of software packages including CRM and SEO tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, HubSpot and Facebook

Salary:


Basic Salary: €100,000 + Benefits DOE

Description

Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
  • Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
  • Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
  • Interact with leading engineers around the world.
  • Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
  • Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services.
  • Drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
  • Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
  • Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.
WHY AWS SUPPORT?
  • First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
  • On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
  • Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives.
  • Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
  • Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.
We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
  • Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
"As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, working hours and days are based on customer demand and may include weekends (on a rotational basis).”

Description

Amazon Web Services is seeking an Electrical Engineer to become part of a global engineering team, responsible for the design and continuous innovation of our rapidly expanding data center foot print.

What We Offer

Amazon offers a fast paced, fun, and exciting work environment. We continue to grow at exponential rates and are looking for individuals that can support our speed to market, enjoy a challenge, and have a desire for professional growth and continuous learning experiences. Amazon’s work environment is unique in every aspect and offers an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate.

We are the leaders in our industry. We always strive to improve in every aspect of our business. Continuous improvement through Lean Engineering practices is fundamental to our business. As an engineer within our team you will spend a regular part of your time analyzing and improving every aspect of our value stream.

Our Engineers

Engineers at Amazon work to design resilient, cost effective electrical distribution systems. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make to Sr. Management and work hard to drive continuous advancements and improvements with our designs. In this role, you have the ability to drive change and define/design the systems our customers rely on.

Working on multi-million dollar designs that support our array of businesses and wide variety of customers. Great ideas are encouraged and supported. Ingenuity is the main mechanism which supports our focus on quality, speed, and cost.

You will be responsible for taking designs from concept to the permit and construction document set. Defining critical equipment specifications and approving equipment submittals you will indirectly support construction and be a part of the process from site selection review through commissioning and ultimately turnover. Being relied on as a subject matter expert in the electrical engineering field, we highly support continued learning opportunities and focus on continued employee development.

Amazon has a global presence. 25% travel will be expected as part of this role. International support will be part of the job, and some international travel may be necessary. Support could consist of working on international teams and could require developing schematic and design document packages

What You Will Be Doing
  • Data center electrical designs and collaboration with other disciplines to create a construction document set.
  • HV/MV substations design
  • Participating in site selection reviews and site planning activities
  • Critical electrical substation equipment design
  • Design and collaborate with other disciplines to create a construction document set.
  • Creating of designs which meet or exceed our quality requirements and fall within our budgetary requirements.
  • Working with regional vendors and manufacturers to specify the appropriate electrical equipment.
  • Working with local utilities to understand and define site utility requirements.
  • Working with local agencies having jurisdiction to ensure compliance with IEC, EU requirements and building codes.
  • Reviewing and approval of equipment submittals.
  • Defining project scope and provide technical support for information requests prior to, and during construction phases.
  • Working with commissioning teams to properly test and validate installation, operation, and performance of electrical systems.
  • Ability to work on concurrent projects in multiple geographical regions.
  • Travelling to sites for site review and work with onsite field engineers, as well as provide engineering evaluations, electrical systems audits, and startup as needed.
  • Being a leader within the global group as well as within internal and external teams that support Amazon’s data centers.
  • Having fun and offering creative, out of the box solutions.

Basic Qualifications

WE LOVE DATA so please apply with your detailed CV which demonstrates the specific tasks you carry out as part of your current and previous roles!
  • Degree in an Electrical Engineering.
  • Cumulative 4+ years of experience with power systems and mission critical electrical design.
  • Excellent understanding of the European Electrical Codes
  • Detailed understanding of critical LV, MV and HV electrical equipment.
  • Detailed understanding of relays, protections schemes, high-voltage circuit breakers, power and distribution transformers electrical switchgear, grounding and earthing.
  • Ability to research new designs, technologies, and construction methods of data center equipment and facilities.
  • Ability to carry new design concepts through exploration, development, and into deployment/construction.
  • The ability to perform complex business case analysis to justify technical decisions and present the justification to management in a high level review.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Chartered Engineer
  • Master’s degree in an Electrical Engineering.
  • 3 years of experience directly related to data center or mission critical facility design.
  • Previous consultant negotiation and management skills associated with design, construction and project execution.
  • Experience with fast track design/build projects and or multiple significant upgrade projects.
  • Experience with large scale technical operations or large-scale compute farms.
  • Knowledge of building codes and regulations.
  • An ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality, reliability, or maintainability.
  • Possess leadership and problem solving skills.
  • Be a motivated, highly dependable individual.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

Description

Enterprise Service Manager

Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers architect and implement their workloads onto AWS?

Do you like to work on a variety of projects, leading customer and partner teams to achieve AWS best practices?

The Amazon Web Services Professional Services team is looking for Enterprise Service Managers (ESM) that can manage the working relationship with Enterprise organisations across all industries, develop a long-term Professional Services strategy and execute that strategy with those accounts.

The ESM is a trusted advisor for our largest and most committed customers. The role includes all aspects of business development, relationship development, delivery oversight and program management in those accounts.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organisation to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

We Are Looking For Someone Who Is Passionate About

Long term development of Enterprise organisations

Engaging with customers to understand their business drivers and application portfolio

Development of long term Cloud Strategy for customers

Identifying & developing specific opportunities and supporting business cases

Deal shaping, including estimations and deal pricing

Contract negotiations & closing

Planning and implementation of a portfolio of projects, including budget & deliverable responsibilities

Mitigation of delivery risks & issues

Overseeing delivery of projects in account, ensuring high quality delivery

Acting as single person of contact for Customer executives, developing deep, trustful relations

Educate customers on AWS services and translate those into a clear business value proposition

Envisioning and inspiring customers

Coaching Customer and Partner teams to be self-sufficient.

Is passionate and curious about technology.

This is a customer facing role and you be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth.

About Us

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products, arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.

Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications, servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?

If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
  • Learn and use groundbreaking technologies.
  • Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs.
  • Interact with leading engineers around the world.
  • Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues.
  • Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services.
  • Drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience.
  • Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the developer community.
  • Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services.
WHY AWS SUPPORT?
  • First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud.
  • On a typical day, a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone, email, and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue.
  • Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues, an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires, develop & present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in new hiring, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives.
  • Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals.
  • Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role. We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.
  • Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events.
  • As we operate on a follow-the-sun model, with Premium Support sites located globally, there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role.

Basic Qualifications
  • Fluency in Mandarin Language
  • Bachelor’s degree or at least four years of experience in a Technical Customer Service role
  • Monitoring and/or Troubleshooting of:
  • OS Administration (Linux/Windows)
  • Network Essentials (TCP/IP)
  • Knowledge of Internet Fundamentals
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong customer focus
  • Ability to juggle many tasks in a fast-moving environment
  • Self-starter
  • Excited about technology
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in Cloud computing (AWS, Azure, OpenStack).
  • Experience with programming/scripting (Batch, Perl, Ruby, VB, PowerShell, Java, C# and/or PHP).
  • Experience managing full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications.
  • Experience with System Administration
  • Experience with Network troubleshooting tools
  • Experience with Cloud services and Cloud deployments.

Job ID: A1395426

Validation Engineer, Equipment and Computer Systems


Role Summary:

Validation engineer is responsible for the qualification of laboratory equipment and associated software by understanding the pharmaceutical manufacturing and quality processes. This person is responsible to carry out thorough system checks to ensure all the different functions of a device or machine are tested to a predetermined specification before any process or piece of equipment is used in the pharmaceutical laboratory or manufacturing environment.

 

Role Responsibilities:

  • The engineer inspects, measures, analyzes, audits, calibrates and tests the instrumentation, equipment, software and writes procedures per FDA guidance for process validation. Installation qualification should be conducted for equipment and software used in a validated process.
  • Develops and executes all validation deliverables including execution for: qualification of equipment and associated software in support of a QC, research or biologics laboratory
  • Authoring & reviewing validation documentation e.g. URS, Validation Plans, IQ/OQ/PQs, RTM, GxP & Annex 11 Assessments, VSR.
  • Capable of generating test scripts to meet the user requirements.
  • Reviewing vendor protocols, test scripts, and traceability matrix.
  • Execution of protocols/ test scripts and SOP updates.
  • Interacts directly with project teams and the associated vendors.
  • Responsible for assessing the validation impact of changes made to qualified instruments.
  • Capable of owning issues/deviations and driving them to resolution. 

Skills & Experience Required:

  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
  • 5+ years’ experience in the regulated pharmaceutical industry.
  • Must have good interpersonal skills. Position will require a good deal of interdepartmental interaction and coordination. 
  • Must possess a thorough understanding of GxPs, in addition to FDA and International requirements for computer validation and EU Part 11 / FDA 21 CFR Annex 11 requirements. Must possess a thorough understanding of current industry guidance, including GAMP 5
  • Experience/Knowledge in qualifying Laboratory and manufacturing applications LIMS, SAP, MES, DeltaV, OSI PI.
  • Must have ability to comprehend technical information related to computer software, computer and network hardware, and the associated regulatory requirements relating to them.
  • Must have direct experience with equipment, process and computer validation and determining validation approach.

 

Education and skills Required:

  • Engineering, Pharmaceutical Science or Computer Science Degree is preferred.
  • Proficiency with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Visio, Access, Project, Power Point).
  • Experience with HP ALM or equivalent software testing/requirements tools.

The client is an award winning Irish company that has been in operation since 1992. Since their launch they have consistently grown having developed their product from scratch to serve the needs of their customers. They are now entering another expansion phase and are actively seeking to hire a professional Services Project Manager.

The role of the Professional Services Project Manager is to manage the delivery of projects with a team of Professional consultants and trainers. It incorporates the day to day management of multiple projects and individual tasks to ensure projects are delivered on schedule and on budget in line with customer expectations. The role will involve both, working from the office and on site with multiple projects and multiple customers.

The Key Duties and Responsibilities are the creation and implementation of a suitable project SOW, project plan, project execution pipeline and other associated documentation and processes for the professional services team. The role is responsibility for the creation and agreement of Project schedules, the control the Change management process enabling the effective resource planning, forecasting and budgeting. Manage processes for project handovers from sales and to support including milestone definition within the project plan. Ensure projects are sufficiently closed out to enable better resource utilization and handover to the support team. Ensure that all required documentation and tools are available and accessible to the project implementation team as necessary. Managing Customer expectation is paramount to the successful delivery of projects and essential for overall customer satisfaction. Managing scope creep and ‘doing what we need to do’ is critical for the success of this role. Finally collaborate with the other team leaders (Development, Sales, Hardware) to allocate resources to projects when required.

The role requires a person with strong experience of ERP project implementations at Enterprise level with at least 3 years’ experience working as a Project Manager. You will be familiar with the concepts of LEAN and Agile methodologies with exposure or a qualification in PMP or other recognised project methodology. The role needs someone with a strong commercial acumen combined with the ability to manage the blend of people, priorities and constraints presented in all projects. You will need excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate across all stakeholder groups.

About Origina

Recognising a significant market opportunity, Origina has created a ground-breaking business that delivers world-class, customer-centric independent software support services to a global clientele. And Origina can provide its services more effectively and at a significantly reduced cost than any other support provider.


By harnessing both extensive internal technical expertise and a vast (and growing) support ecosystem, Origina has expanded to become the only credible independent provider of software maintenance for IBM® and HCL® software products. Headquartered in Dublin and US headquarters in Dallas, Texas, Origina delivers value-based and cost-effective services to a broad base spectrum of international customers.


Origina is seeking an experienced Security Operations Manager in our Dublin office, to help us in the continued success and development of the company by understanding our customers’ security challenges and deliver the unique Origina security value proposition. 


The Role

At Origina we do one thing, and one thing very well; third party support & maintenance for IBM software solutions. We provide support for 800+ IBM products, all those that fall under the IBM Passport Advantage portfolio. This includes products such as DB2, Websphere Application Server, MQ etc.

 

We have a defined service philosophy which puts the customer first and is based upon three key fundamental principles:

 

  • Extend the longevity and lifecycle 
  • Protect the security and stability 
  • Enhance the performance and functionality 

 

To fulfil our mission we need to ensure a world class service based on this service philosophy, not only in terms of quality technical support for complex and challenging issues, by mitigating and overcoming security risks that are caused by defects in the IBM software products we support and the environment they integrate with. 


This position requires an analytical, highly motivated, self-starting, mindset and work ethic. Collaboration and the ability to adaptively implement your skills across variety clients, industries and verticals is key to success. The successful incumbent needs to possess a strong technical acumen and mature written and verbal communication skills. Broad security and operational experience are required; Security Operations | Security Managed Services | Security Consulting.


Responsibilities

The core responsibility will be to ensure the scalability of security services; supporting achievement of Origina’s operational and business targets, maintenance and enhancement of security service quality / customer experience, and timely resolution of security tickets.


  • Daily management and conduct of Origina’s vulnerability report process:
  • Co-ordinate the collation of threat intelligence.
  • Co-ordinate the collation of product knowledge from our Global IBM Experts.
  • Apply own security knowledge on best practice and experience to security risk mitigation, regulatory compliance, threat environment and implementation.
  • Own security tickets from initial triage through to closure:
  • Security ticket triage and analysis
  • Stakeholder engagement; customer, internal and Global IBM Experts
  • Aligned with Origina security methodologies, develop appropriate mitigating actions to appropriately address captured customer security risks &/or issues within captured business, operational and financial constraints
  • Capture of lessons learnt
  • Contribute to the development, input and maintenance of a security knowledge base
  • Contribute to security service development
  • Remain up to date on security trends in threats, tooling, methodologies, and regulations
  • Collaborate with internal departments, Customer Support, Account Management, Service Innovation, Industry experts


Skills, Experience and Qualifications

  • A minimum of 4+ years in a similar role
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, teamwork, and customer interaction skills
  • Tech savvy with security and systems experience supporting an ability to conduct root cause analysis via technical, business and operational engagement to formulate and coordinate the delivery of an appropriate course of action
  • Strong analytical/problem solving skills and a flair for developing creative solutions in overcoming complex technical challenges
  • Resilient and flexible mindset and comfort with ambiguity in a high-growth environment
  • Ability to build and manage relationships internally and externally with trust and integrity
  • Operations experience; delivery of operational capability &/or service
  • Strong focus on quality and risk management; situational analysis to identify, measure and record risks
  • Possess experienced of the collation of and/or utilisation of threat intelligence analysis and reporting
  • Good working knowledge and experience in the assessment and/or implementation of ISO27001, NIST framework and Cyber Assessment Framework
  • A sound working knowledge of, Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) project; Common Vulnerability Exposures (CVE), Common Weakness Scoring System (CWSS)
  • IBM product experience is advantageous 


Behavioural Competencies

  • Client focused
  • Unquestionable integrity, credibility, and character
  • High personal drive and energy
  • A flair for attention to detail
  • Entrepreneurial, innovative, comfortable with ambiguity and risk taking
  • Strong team player who is able to work effectively across a matrix organization
  • Resilient
  • Strong Leadership Skills

Due to our continued growth and expansion, Hartley People Ltd is now seeking to appoint a General Manager to head up operations at it’s highly successful Recruitment business, headquartered in the Cleaboy Business Park in Waterford city.

The business is dynamic, complex and multi-layered, with a range of service offerings to meet the varied needs of our customer base. We are not a ‘Recruitment Agency’, but a Professional Talent Acquisition company – and there is a huge difference.

What is involved?

In short, lots! Like any GM role, you can and will be involved in everything that happens within the business. The following is just a snap shot of some of what you will do!

Manage the day-to-day operations and the monthly/annual P&L of the Hartley People Recruitment Business, including the permanent placement business and the temporary agency worker business, Hartley People 3Sixty. Ensure that the customer experience and delivery quality is best in class, while maintaining budgets across all profit centres.
Provide strong leadership, ensuring that the company mission and strategic goals are delivered and ensuring that the ethos and values of the business are at the core of decision making at all levels.
Build strong relationships with all stakeholders within the business and work closely with same to manage the strategic business growth and commercial development of the recruitment business.
Work closely with the company’s key client base, and act as the ‘front face’ of the business where appropriate.
Business development through the ‘land and expand’ approach, building key contacts, and by ensuring our offering is unique, professional and better.
Oversee the delivery of our executive search and premium search offerings.
Continuously seek out improvements that will streamline the business operations, ensuring that it is increasingly lean, competitive, responsive and cost effective.
Drive a culture of innovation and Continuous Improvement, while continuously reviewing and improving the company’s suite of recruitment and related services.
Manage internal recruitment, Learning, Development and HR. Coaching of staff.

Key Experience, Attributes & Qualifications

A significant and demonstrable track record of operating and delivering financial and business results.
At least 7-8 years of progressive post graduate experience, including for a period of not less than 5 years, satisfactory work experience at a senior leadership level within a commercial SME.
Minimum of level 8 qualification from a recognised 3rd level institute in a related discipline. Evidence of further professional growth throughout career would be preferred.
Strong financial acumen, highly numerate with the ability to use financial information as a key driver of business decisions and strategy development.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships and strategic partnerships, combined with exceptional communications, networking and influencing skills.
Strong commercial acumen, with entrepreneurial style and the ability to build and maintain mutually beneficial business relationships with customers and partners, coupled with sound decision making capabilities.
Highly motivated and results oriented with the energy, passion and drive to succeed in a competitive environment.
A high level of proficiency in IT applications

In short, we are looking for people with passion, ambition and energy, and willing to go the extra mile to take the Hartley People Recruitment and Hartley People 3Sixty Businesses to the next level. We believe this is a really exciting opportunity for the right person, and for the business.

If this sound like you, we would love to hear from you. If you would like to talk, please send your CV (in full confidence) to Fergal Hartley @ fhartley@hartleypeople.com

Musgrave is one of the Europe’s most successful family-owned businesses with a 140-year heritage in food and brand innovation, supporting communities across the island of Ireland and Spain.

Every day we feed one in three people in Ireland through 11 market leading food and beverage brands that include SuperValu, Centra, Frank and Honest and Musgrave MarketPlace.

We support thousands of retail and foodservice family businesses who live and work in the heart of the communities they serve.

We are committed to becoming the most trusted and sustainable business in Ireland and we are making changes across the company to make sure that happens. We want to make a positive impact on the world and we will support our suppliers and customers to make a difference too.

Our people are the heart of our business. As our greatest asset, they make Musgrave a great place to work and in return we aim to be the very best place to work, grow and thrive. We have an opportunity for a Compliance Manager to join our MarketPlace Operations team.

Responsibilities

The purpose of the role is to protect the company resources (stock, cash etc) by achieving full compliance with all standard operating procedures, HACCP, H&S and other external/legal compliance requirements, responsibilities of the role include but not limited to

General Compliance Management
  • Lead the Branch team to consistently achieve Wholesale Excellence standards by ensuring the site is fully compliant with both internal and external compliance requirements including SOPs, SELs, QA, H&S.
  • Design and implement audit processes to ensure full compliance across the site.
  • Preparation, co-ordination, and execution of a set of audits across the site on an agreed frequency.
  • Oral and written reporting of issues arising during audit work with full corrective action plan put in place.
  • Drive the implementation of specific control improvements required to achieve full compliance.
  • Review, monitor and report results of quarterly self-certification checklist versus audit result.
  • Site business expert on standard operating controls.
  • Promote good corporate governance and internal control practices across the site.
  • Control adherence point of contact for both external and internal auditors regarding operational procedures.
  • Work with the site to simplify business processes, help to reduce cost and improve performance.
  • Ensure all colleagues are fully trained in all areas of compliance and accurate, up to date records maintained.
  • Ensure the site is legally compliant in all areas of food safety.
  • To manage, co-ordinate and implement the safety health & welfare management system and associated processes within the site to ensure compliance with all current Health & Safety legislative requirements.
  • Be available to work evenings and weekends when needed
People Engagement
  • Build and sustain a high performing engaged team by providing clear direction, stretch targets, regular reviews to manage all levels of performance (proactively manage under performance and recognise and encourage high performance)
  • Demonstrate the Musgrave leadership skills and values holding self and others accountable for meeting and exceeding objectives. Maximise the potential of team members to encourage and sponsor talent to ensure succession within the branch and across the Group
  • Ensure departments are appropriately resourced to achieve maximum efficiencies and productivity in most cost effective manner
  • Ongoing training and development of all colleagues
  • Communicate clearly and positively to engage all colleagues to ensure they understand their role in delivering the brand (business/branch objectives)
The Ideal Candidate Will Have/be
  • Audit/compliance experience in a wholesale/retail environment
  • Logical, thorough and tenacious in approach to work with excellent attention to detail
  • Solid organisation and multi-tasking skills
  • A proven ability to influence colleagues at all levels
  • Ability to analyse, decipher and report on data in a concise and timely manner.
  • A passion for driving standards and achieving targets.
  • Excellent written and communication skills with strong report writing skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft office suite
Desirable
  • Operations experience within the wholesale/retail industry
  • Business related diploma or degree
